author: {'steamid': '76561198046434913', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 771, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1711549555}
review:
Pathway is a neatly implemented Strategy RPG set in an "Indiana Jones" themed world. It uses roguelite elements as well as an old-school turn-based combat system. You'll embark in different scenarios varying in length (30-60min), atmosphere (desert, ruins & more) and dangerosity (base level is pretty well balanced).

Each game has you navigating a node-based map (similar to Slay the Spire's or FTL's) and alternates between battle encounters, choice encounters, trade caravans and campfires. So far they've all been fairly varied and story-rich.

When embarking into your journey, you are invited to constitute a team by picking adventurers with unique traits and gear. You can also equip new weapons and tools acquired during previous missions, which further entails you to loot & upgrade as you go.

The gameplay loop simply feels amazing. Missions have you make decisions while on the edge of your ressources (ammo, fuel, supplies), you're always tempted to maximize the number of locations you'll end up exploring: for looting purpose but to be honest just by shear curiosity for such a well-thought experience.

Highly recommended for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561199164674592', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1711129667}
review:
Questo gioco mi piace molto, pur riconoscendo alcune sue pecche. Nel complesso, lo consiglio se in sconto ad altri giocatori a cui piacciono i combattimenti tattici a turni (stile XCOM, anche se a quello ci ho giocato poco) e un "scegli il tuo percorso e sfida la sorte per vedere cosa ti capita ad ogni passo".

Mi piace l'aggiunta di "cutscenes" di fianco della narrazione, aggiungono descrizione e un po' di personalizzazione (visto che i team li decidi tu prima di ogni avventura) senza appesantire la trama che si districa. Mi piace il fatto che ogni personaggio ha delle sue abilità che sono usate sia dentro che fuori il combattimento. Mi piacciono la gestione della spedizione e la possibilità di aggiustare la difficoltà sotto diversi aspetti (numero di nemici, mancanza di risorse...).

Il combattimento. Le prime ore era nuovo e interessante, da valutare le posizioni dei membri della squadra, le coperture, le azioni disponibili, le munizioni. Ci sono due grandi gruppi di nemici, e dopo aver imparato vagamente le particolarità delle unità più ostiche il gioco... può diventare un po' ripetitivo. La novità è mantenuta dalla variabilità dei singoli componenti della squadra e dalle loro sinergie, però a lungo andare posso capire che può stancare.

In futuro sarebbe molto interessante se venisse aggiunto un altro "gruppo" di nemici, o nuove combinazioni o unità che rendano un po' più diverso il combattimento. Nel complesso, come ho scritto prima, Pathway è un gioco che mi piace molto e ci giocherò ancora, lo consiglio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128957404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1709330326}
review:
TL:DR- Play The Curious Expedition, XCOM, or FTL instead.

Pros:
-Great Artwork
-Good Sound Design

Cons:
-Repetitive Enemies
-Lack of Depth
-Lack of Meaningful Choices
-No Narrative
-No Unique Bosses 
-Wildly Unsatisfying Conclusion

Pathway is a game is that it doesn’t know what it wants to be. It is technically an Indiana Jones-style turn-based roguelite, but does it want to tell a cohesive narrative or does it want to be a modular adventure? It doesn’t know. Because the game is split into 5 missions, some of them lengthy and involving multiple map boards full of travel points, I expected some sort of overarching story, but there isn’t one. Pathway basically runs on vibes. The visuals and sound design are great, but there’s so little under the surface that it doesn’t matter. It's a game that consistently acts like it’s more interesting than it actually is. Your choices don’t make meaningful differences in gameplay: each point along the map is insular, so a decision at one point doesn’t affect events in other points (unlike similar games FTL, Slay the Spire, or The Curious Expedition). The map highlights points of interest, but they don’t mean anything except “hey, something is here,” so you know it’s not just -1 fuel and on to the next stop. At the end of each mission, you’d expect to get a cool boss fight, a puzzle to solve, or some otherwise interesting encounter, right? Wrong. You get an encounter that isn’t substantially different from any other on the map, except it’s a guaranteed combat situation and there’s either a Nazi General or a Priestess on the field (essentially the same unit with a different flavor). 

This lack of depth applies to enemies as well. Technically there are about 10 enemy types in the game, many with multiple levels (Nazi Soldier I, Nazi Soldier III, etc.), but functionally there are more like 3: melee attack, ranged attack, and area of effect attack. These enemies don’t get any cooler as you progress, either: Mission 1 has Nazis, Mission 2 introduces cultists and zombies, and Missions 3-5 continue with Nazis and cultists/zombies. Aliens are a plot point, but you never actually encounter any. The villains are always doing something bad, but they have no motive past “bad guys do bad things, stop them.” There is no villain, no nemesis or antagonist- just nameless hordes of Nazis and cultists.

There is also never any meaningful interaction with the native people of the region. The Curious Expedition may not have the greatest portrayal of native peoples, but at least you get to talk and trade with them, add them to your party, and complete quests for them. In Pathway the occasional interactions you do have with native people are just flavor text, nothing more. 

If you’re someone who just loves the treasure-hunting, tomb-raiding, adventure vibe of Pathway, and you feel fine basically making up a narrative as you go…no, I still can’t recommend Pathway. Go play XCOM or The Curious Expedition instead, FTL, or maybe even Strange Brigade instead. Pathway will disappoint you, and there are better ways to spend your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018288692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1705702915}
review:
━━━━━ GENERE ━━━━━
Clone di Fire Emblem

━━━━━ TOTALE: 6/11 ━━━━━

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ STILE GRAFICO ━━━━━
☐ Stile unico e originale, crea un nuovo stile da zero o amalgamando alla perfezione più titoli
☑ Stile già visto, comunque bello o apprezzabile
☐ Disegni, stile grafico o grafica non all'altezza delle produzioni odierne

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ INNOVAZIONE NEL GAMEPLAY ━━━━━
☐ Introduce molte nuove meccaniche mai viste prime o unisce alla perfezione gameplay da generi differenti
☑ Prende spunto da altri titoli e ne migliora alcuni aspetti
☐ Non riesce ad innovare quasi nulla o nulla

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ AUDIO ━━━━━
☐ Orchestrale, immersivo e curato nei dettagli
☑ Di qualità buona anche se non eccezionale o non troppo vasta
☐ Jingle scadenti o ripetitivi

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ DURATA ━━━━━
☐ Giocabile per anni
☑ Longevo o end-game completo, supportato da sviluppatori e community
☐ Breve o molto breve

▶ [1/2]
━━━━━ IA, LEVEL DESIGN, SETTING E/O PLOT ━━━━━
☐ Il suo punto di forza è almeno uno tra IA innovativa, Fisica realistica e simulativa, Level Desgin sorprendente o Plot con esperienza unica ed indimenticabile
☑ Gli aspetti tecnologici e narrativi sono buoni ma non rivoluzionari
☐ Nessun aspetto tecnico e nessun aspetto narrativo riesce a sorprendere

▶ [1/1]
━━━━━ BUG ━━━━━
☑ Assenti, divertenti o relativamente trascurabili
☐ Compromettono il prosieguo di alcune missioni

author: {'steamid': '76561198007798529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1704311600}
review:
Un vrai régal, joué à la manette (préférence personnelle), mapping au poil. Plutôt court en soit, 5 Aventures au total, prenant chacune plus ou moins 1h30 à réaliser en mode "Je survie cette fois, j'avance, on va y arriver !". Idéal pour des sessions de jeu courtes. La difficulté est présente et pas injustifiée. 

Obtenu pour un prix imbattable sur Instant Gaming. Au prix où je l'ai eu, je n'en attendais pas plus.
Je ne regrette vraiment pas mon achat probablement de 1 ou 2€. (il fût un temps...)
Ce jeu reste vraiment bon. Rien à redire. 

Merci aux devs !

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2324, 'last_played': 1705775962}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237843068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1702833167}

author: {'steamid': '76561199152185036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1702280021}
review:
While some elements of the game drag on and feel repetitive, the game itself is an enjoyable tactical turn-based rouge-like.
Many other reviews have said the same thing better but the game, especially in combat, drags on for a long time. It takes ages to position your characters and kill enemies and it doesn't feel particularly satisfying or interesting to do anything other that fight every time and straight-line for the objective.
Adding some various combat encounters where your goal is to run, hide or take out specific targets while avoiding others could break up the monotony a lot. Adding some way for different characters to just talk and improve/decrease in stats from affinities/rivalries at random times or at "dead end" encounters could be interesting.
A kind of three-way battle where the Nazis and Cultists are battling and you get to choose a side, or kill both, could also be interesting.

As the game stands now, it is an enjoyable rougelike with an element of Nazi-killing adventure and a cast of various interesting characters in a unique blend of choice, combat and story that is very enjoyable. I would reccomend people who enjoy fire emblem or Valkyria chronicals to play this, as it follows a similar style of battle. The art and narration are both enjoyable, but the repeditive situations and areas do make the game boring and the combats are hardly fast-pased. Ultimately an enjoyable, yet improvable game.

review: Wonderful game.  There's a wealth of information to set you on the path to success.  I was hooked by the whole Egypt and exploration theme, plus there's strategy and tactics thrown in for good measure.  I've just finished the first 'Adventure" so I'm still getting into the meat of the game, but there is a ton of replayability as each path in a given "Adventure" is randomly generated when started.  There are 5 Adventures, 5 difficulties, and 16 characters, each with their own stats and abilities.  For what it's worth, I recommend this game as an enjoyable Indiana Jones-esque Tactics game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1698226749}
review:
Pathway is a console (Switch) ported 2D retro pixel turn based tactical strategy game.  Squad based combat is sandwiched between Slay The Spire RNG/Procgen node grid maps as you blip from encounter to encounter.  I didn't know it would be possible to make a turn based tactical game into a shallow, plodding, boring affair, but then when developers don't know how to do video game graphics properly and resort to pixelcrap, you just know the rest of the game is going to be built with the same lack of professionalism and quality. 

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

A choice was made to use obsolete, decades old retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.

While there are options to change the resolution for the game, all this does is scale up the simplistic 2D art assets used to make the game, which makes little or no difference to the graphics quality.  Without any other substantial graphics tweaks, it's not possible for gamers to improve the lacklustre 2D visuals.

Because this is designed for consoles, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the inferior console gaming appliances that the game was designed for.  These are unfortunate compromises and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was a second thought for the console-centric developers.  The game is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for consoles forces upon a game.  Once more, console peasants have made gaming worse for everyone.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Pathway has the laughable price of $16 USD, for which you could easily get any number of older AAA games.  That's right, $16 USD for pixelcrap that looks more like a mobile app than a PC game.  What a joke.  The Witcher 3 is cheaper! This is also competing with over 9,000 free games available on Steam, many of them far better than this paid product.  Given the defects and quality issues with the game, coupled with the unrealistic price, this is impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059123570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1698606886}
review:
This game is a gem, and actually a hidden gem. It surely deserves more popularity than it really has.

It is a tactical, turn based shooter game with RPG layer mixed with roguelike climate. Game is bit small'ish - I guess finishing it is possible within 10 or 12 hours, but in the same time it does have a lot of replayability. From what I see so far playing it is not about finishing the story, but rather taking multiple attempts, replaying and generally having fun.

And believe me, this game is fun. It has strong Indiana Jones vibes, very nice sounds and cute pixel deco. Most important part of Pathway - that is: a combat - is bit simplified, easy to learn, though bit more difficult to master. We have limited number of characters to use, each one has its own speciality: one can use sniper riffles, other one small guns. Some use knives, some not. Some can heal or repair equipment, some not. We can use up to four characters in our team - proper configuration is a key to victory, as well as smart tactics, since in almost all cases enemy will come in bigger numbers, and sometimes will be generally stronger from  any perspective.

With permadeath implemented into a game our losses are permanent, but in the same time, whatever we do does some sort of meta progress - we gather better weapons, parts of equipment ect, and all these items remain with us even after loosing (or winning) a game. Loosing early on is not a problem, we just start again. And again. This is the element of roguelike - loosing progress is not the end of the world, but rather an option for better start.

Having said all this: I dont think Pathway is solid enough to deliver 100+ hours (though some people here soaked much more than that into this game) but it is really worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334858722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1334, 'last_played': 1697713508}

review:
i like it so far... its fun...

reminds me alot of XCOM from 1994... but with modern charm and optimisations... love the 32-bit pixel graphics... the early 1940s Indianna Jones Last Crusade vibes are are strong... plays really nicely... definitely a game i will play again and again... logged 230+ hours so far...

author: {'steamid': '76561198119366640', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1654328129}
review:
It was an okay experience, I think the overall atmosphere, music and setting is where this game plays out the most, I think the story was fun, but it did not keep me really engaged. 
The part I didn't like that much about this game is it's XCOM-like turn-based combat during missions, I think planning out where you are driving and those moments were more fun in the game as it was just a relaxing "car ride" aesthetic with good relaxing music, reminding me of Minecraft somehow. But as not of a big fan of these types of turn-based combat games, I can't say I liked those parts as much. 
But I do have to recommend this game as I do know it's only me not liking turn-based combat, as well as the atmosphere and other parts of the game being fun and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286098391', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1697233949}

review: Fun little game, if a little on the easy side and not the deepest in terms of gameplay. Still, the art style and the setting are right up my alley. Got it on sale, which is what I'd probably recommend if you're at all unsure about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962971695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1696715417}
review: I can't put my finger on it, but it just seems slow. The UI is unresponsive, and almost feels laggy. It's just hard on the player to play, and when every fight is 3 vs 10 it becomes a chore very quickly. The setting had me, but when the video says it's "fast and exciting" I would suggest that sadly, this isn't the case for me at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036104607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1696278920}
review: I bought this game as I enjoy the setting and I thought it had an appealing aesthetic. However, I soon realised that gameplay is limited and the whole thing is rather dull. I turned it off after having played enough, regretting my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947433499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1656135801}
review: Fortune and Glory, Doctor Jones. Fortune and Glory

author: {'steamid': '76561197972904637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1696132898}
review: This is a very soft "not recommended from me".  Bluntly, this gets the vibes of old "foreign land adventure" movies and books like Indiana Jones correct, and if you're just looking for the vibes, this is a great game.  But the tactical and strategic depth simply isn't there, for experience turn-based combat fans, this doesn't offer anything particularly new or interesting and it definitely doesn't offer a challenge.  The only time I failed any missions was the very last (and hardest mission), with an under-leveled team and what I think is the worst character in the game on my team.  There are better turn-based games out there, would be great to see a Pathway 2 with some more challenge and complexity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336238048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 456, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1704357173}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002662508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1706501231}
review: Excellent tactical RPG with pixel graphics. The story line is pretty short - you'll finish the game in only a few hours. You can go back and replay all of the campaigns with different difficulty settings. If you like to grind for better weapons, armor, and to unlock all of the characters, you'll enjoy replaying it. Unlocking all of the achievements will be a bit of a chore. I'm at about 18 hours of game play and I'm wrapping it up, with the exception of those grindy achievements. If you're a completionist, I would estimate 30-40 hours total.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071888617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1694121650}
review:
Zpocatku jsem byl trochu rozpacity, no hru mohu jen doporucit.
Sice to nejsou zadne takticke orgie, ale rozmanitost charakteru a zbrani tomu dava stavu. Mam rad, kdyz pixel-art je skutecne art, a to tu rozhodne je.
Neuspech tu neznamena zadnou katastrofu. Je to proste takova pohodova hra, kde neni potreba zhavit mozek na plno. Ale vypnout ho uplne nemuzete :)
Zpocatku me stvala neprehlednost nekterych map a nemoznost odzoomovat, ale to se da prekousnout. Obcas se vyskytne i lehky nevtiravy humor...
Ja jsem tedy spokojen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136859956', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1693775575}
review: Es un juego simple rápido y conciso, se entiende relativamente rápido no es complicado y la verdad esta entretenido, el único fallo que le puedo recalcar es la poca variedad de campañas son muy pocas, lo arreglan con el modo extremo por si quieres reventarte el ojo izquierdo de ticks, si lo consigues en rebajas vale totalmente la pena

author: {'steamid': '76561198072268725', 'num_games_owned': 2191, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1692361038}
review:
积极：
像素风的场景和过场，呈现印第安纳琼斯式的冒险
差异化的角色与解锁方式
各种武器有鲜明定位
纳粹线转邪教线后挑战明显提升，前中期趣味性还算抓人

消极：
剧情支线不少，但基本随机刷新，因此很难遇到
极其糟糕的装备刷新系统（通关了狙击枪都没毕业）
有一定装备积累后陷入乏味疲劳的跑图打怪循环
大地图上位移实在太慢、动画多余
怪的种类太少，容易乏味。难度提升基本靠堆怪、以多欺少

author: {'steamid': '76561198237059164', 'num_games_owned': 1450, 'num_reviews': 745, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1691139372}
review: 像素美术佳，随机事件/角色招募/武器升级等元素一定程度上增添了游戏的趣味性和重复游玩价值，但本身的战斗机制较为单一且缺乏深度，故事情节又很薄弱，让人很难提起劲刷一些设计重复的任务/地图。

author: {'steamid': '76561198992904126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1690819443}
review: Peu coutumier de l'exercice, je vais être bref. Le jeu est très agréable. Il est beau (vraiment très beau) ; la musique est très bien ; contrairement à ce que j'ai lu, l'histoire est certes clichée mais l'univers est attachant (aventure première moitié du XXème siècle avec du fantastique, des nazis, des savants fous, des cultes diaboliques etc.) et il y a beaucoup de contenu. Le principal problème tient au manque de profondeur du gameplay. Le jeu est assez facile et les scénarios assez longs. Cela peut parfois susciter un sentiment de lassitude chez le joueur habitué au format stratégie/tactique tour par tour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063797852', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1692622040}
review:
Sor far, this is a pretty good game! I think it's a newly developed retro-game. I have since learned how to heal my people and fix my armor outside of combat. You start with 3 people, and might find the possibility to recruit more. You can only have a maximum of 4 people.

You pick a mission, and can tweak the difficulty somewhat. You have to navigate a map to get to your destination, BUT there are some interesting side-stops; some that seem important to me. Although the encounters are randomized on the board, they appear over and over again. Each character, however, has a different skill set, unlocking different options in the encounters, keeping the game fresher. 

I was sad to see that only a little over 5% of players have finished 10 adventures. I think people are expecting the wrong kind of game, or not really getting into the game. I'm still enjoying this immensely.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974919522', 'num_games_owned': 1454, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1689436697}
review: It's nice that games like this still exist. Kind of takes me back to my childhood and the Lucasfilm games like Indiana Jones from the feeling. It's that look and feel. It picks me up again and again, whether it's an adventure or a strategy like here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993738746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1688571352}
review: Good on Deck. It's relatively easy until the last fight, which feels like two or three battles from before put into one. Apart from that weird spike, it's a great jog through the desert. The rogue-like elements are light so I don't see it being that replayable - as long as you're okay with a 10 hours-ish experience, I'd say go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963614357', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1689268661}
review: If FTL and Indiana Jones had a lil' baby, you'd get pathway. It's fun, it's cheap, and I feel like I will be playing this for a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245222924', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1689017766}
review: Dobra gra turowa, w której poczujemy się niczym Indiana Jones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243867594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1688966244}
review:
Una curiosa mezcla que va desde un juego de mesa (con tablero incluido), el rol combate por turnos + el clásico de la vieja escuela (con dados y toma de decisiones) e, incluso, un desarrollo que trae al recuerdo los libros de "elige tu propia aventura" (ups, se me cayo el DNI)

Su otro punto fuerte es la ambientación y el mundo donde transcurren sus episodios/niveles (que remite lo mejor y al mas puro Indiana Jones)

Si tuviera que encontrarle un "pero" este seria que (por un lado) con lo atractivo de sus gráficos y su mundo es una lástima que no ofrezca una jugabilidad mas propia de un "stoneshard" dejándonos cierta "libertad" para poder movernos a piachere. 

Y por el otro, al estar únicamente en ingles podemos perdernos o darle al "skip" en los diálogos, perdiéndonos de seguro información/historia importante. Aunque, esto último puede que, tarde o temprano, algún simpatizante y conocedor del tema y el juego, se ponga la "10" y nos traiga una traducción al español (lo que se agradecería de sobremanera)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991442521', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1530, 'last_played': 1688841934}

author: {'steamid': '76561198218013884', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1708416133}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066721049', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 325, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1707297852}
review:
Игра напоминает Curious Expedition 1 или мою любимую Renowned Explorers, но с боями в стиле новой Х-Сои. Графически ближе к первой. Текста много, знание языка обязательно. Сеттинг можно сравнить с "Индиана Джонс и последний крестовый поход", как, впрочем, и музыку.

Прошёл 3 карты и понял, что на этом и закончу. Как-то всё простенько и однообразно. Событий видов крайне мало, бои утомляют и Вы очень быстро начнёте пропускать необязательные стычки, по причине отсутствия разнообразия вражин - всего с десяток видов! И от карты к карте новые почти не появляются, в отличие от Renowned Explorers, где на каждой из 15 карт был свой вид врагов и ещё и по 3 босса, 2 из которых были необязательны. Тактикой и уникальностью бои тоже похвастсться не могут - все одинаковые, без изюминки.
 
Мои герои тоже не блещут разнообразием, скиллы повторяются и на 16 героев уникальных штук 6, что снова идёт вразрез с парадигомй  Renowned Explorers, где у каждого даже своя история была. 

Карты одни и те же каждый раз, не генерируются. Сайд-квестов на картах нет. Свободный режим остутствует, то есть просто кампания, которую пройдёшь и забудешь. Опять-таки, в  Renowned Explorer интересно играть и открывать новое даже спустя 100 часов! Ну и главная проблема в том, что нет мотивации у сюжето - скучно :( Видно, что разработчики выдавливали из себя игру насильно, то есть лишь бы выпустить и, если повезёт, то заработать на ностальгируюших.


Отдельный котёл в аду для тех уникалов, которые не делают в TBS отмену движения - промазал мимо клетки - проиграл бой, проиграл карту, просрал 50 минут времени, давай всё по новой, Миша, но в этот раз другими героями, потому что те лечатся.

В общем, последние 2 часа играть себя заставлял насильно. Да и заставлял просто потому, что стагнация в жанре и нового ничего больше нет. + надеялся на то, что появятся новые виды врагов и интересные тактики. Потратил 4$, но даже их жалко, цена ей - 1,5-2...

author: {'steamid': '76561199160290494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1687546625}
review:
I would've prefered to leave a positive review, but certain things bug me that I could not. But more about that later.

Pathway is a squadbased turnbased tactics game in the same vein of games from the handheld era. Its artwork is reminiscent of that as character models and the world are all displayed in a pixelated style. the theme of this game is very Indiana Jones inspired as you drive through the desert searching for ancient artifacts while fighting nazi predominantly, and some zombies.
The overall execution of pathway is well done. the characters have different abilities and different ways of clearing the game making teamcompositions fun to experiment with. Since it's more of a small production, the game itself offers a fair bit of variety but not too much. Its solid fun for a good 20hours before it becomes repetitive.

the real issues with Pathway are that the UI is still buggy when using a controller. and the game also sometime freezes, making me waste time fighting the same battle again. this game is done getting updates since devs are already working on new projects so issues will persist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336783768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1687478305}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146265460', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1740, 'last_played': 1709955166}
review: This is one of my favorite games ever. It takes a minute to get it right. You really have to read how the game works all the way through. But its insanely fun once you get the hang of it and understand what the developers were trying to do here. the art is beautiful, It could've used a little more diversity within the enemy characters and maybe some deeper writing. I hope they make a second one, I'm sure it would be kick -*ass. I am always coming back to this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198259089453', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1687355460}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029242857', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1686597505}
review:
Pathway: My "cheezy" review.

What is it about (in short)?

Well, it's a rather "simplified" Xcom-esque type of game, because you'll have noticed this from the get go (or by simply looking at the given footage).
Simplified you say, well that's exactly what it is (because you can easily cheeze yourself through this game) even though after clearing a mission (easy to begin with), you'll be able to add some difficulty (with added rewards to boot) in order to replay them (hence cheezing) over and over again (and buffing or even unlocking characters in the process).. Look Ma, i'm swolle!! Note: Your characters are mostly set or fixed as they start out to be.
But, but, is this still fun to play or does it get boring?
Well, that's up to the player to decide... For instance, it felt a bit boring to me personally (the first 6 hours or so), because i wasn't that skilled or ill equiped for the task at hand. (You see, CHEEZE is Key) Notably, that changes as soon as all the shooting and looting starts paying off (which is hella fun). 
Of course you'll make mistakes because, albeit being simplified, the game doesn't tell you everything from the start (a learning curve if you will). (Tip: Mind your expendable resourses and character abilities because they can be used in more ways than one may think)

So, a quick summary: 

You start out as a feeble flake, but you'll get all buff from cheezing.. (Check)
You will start out having crap gear, but you'll quickly improve and upgrade gear and skills with some added cheeze.. (Check)
You'll start playing as a 3-some of tw@ts, and by following ZE RULES, you'll cheeze out the better characters in a jiffy. (Check)

To conclude: If you don't like to Cheeze, then this game likely isn't for you. 
On the other hand, if you love to Cheeze Nazis, zombies or Nazi-Zombies then you'll love it!
Don't forget, ZE CHEEZE iZ KEY!! (Frenchy)

It's fun, nothing special but fun. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198129731923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1686087423}
review:
The binary rating system applied to Steam game reviews is hardly but an inadequate estimate of the overall weight that each player applies to each positive and negative impression a game inflicts on him. 
Overall, this game has been an enjoyable journey for me, but I cannot see myself playing further after the 6 hours it took me to finish the campaign.
The art is beautiful, maybe even the strongest element of Pathway. The landscapes and the combat areas are well drawn, somewhat calming and certainly convicing. I was pleasantly impressed when I saw the jeep moving in the map and the characters interacting with the environment in each event. The music perfectly serves her purpose as a memorable theme and an immersive background for the desert world. The animations were somewhat cartoonish but well made.
The game mechanics left a neutral impression on me. I played the game on average difficulty and it was well balanced, but increasingly repetitive. The combat system was satisfying and rich enough to create interesting tactical situations, some of them requiring intense concentration on my part in order to adequately solve, yet the AI could have been made smarter and more enemy types could have been added ,in order to enhance each encounter's uniqueness. There were some things I didn't quite understand, like some attacking positions that resulted in counter-intuitive debuffs, that caused very few trouble. As for the resource management part of the campaign, I found it easy to manipulate and after the first  mission it had become an almost irrelevant game element. In similar fashion, I found the travel routes -which seemed like a call for adventure at first- optimally traversed in an almost linear way and the weapons I unlocked in every mission mostly as a linear upgrade for a character's previous weapon (meaning, there were not many dilemmas as for wich weapon type suits a player's particular strategic style best).
The story is Pathway's most dissatisfying aspect by far. A typical parody of the Nazis and an unimaginative version of zombies and tribesmen, in combination with a shallow and predictable storyline and simplistically described events forced me to concentrate on the game technical aspects. This, I think, is was a great and lost opportunity to make the game completely persuading and enjoyable. I feel as if a well-writen, creative and bold story would effortlessly double my playing hours.
All in all, I sincerely recommend the game to anyone looking for a  tactical challenge in a beatifully crafted environment. The game's flaws merely limit its length and replayability. Pathway has great potential, and the work that went into it elevates the game past them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992142036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1686040772}
review:
Pros:
-Great pixel art (subjective)
-Immersive mechanics (manage resources like gas and supplies, exploring locations, much like FTL!)
-Fun tactical problem solving when under powered
-Good tutorial (uses a "teach as you go" approach)

Cons:
-Forced difficulty (no way to get more challenge early on, you are forced to go at the game's slow pace since the difficulty slider is only unlocked at the end of the campaign)
-Uninspiring level up tree (some levels give you added mechanics, which is AWESOME. Others, +5% damage for a particular weapon, which is god-awful and lazy).
-Randomly generated shenanigans (you will find legendary loot that will allow you to exploit the game. I am at the fourth scenario, carrying the same pistol that I found earlier which is still inta-killing unarmoured enemies with every shot)
-Small looping soundtrack (you like the music? Lets talk about it two scenarios later, where you keep hearing when it loops)
-Lackluster story (yes, nazis and ancient relics, pretty cool! But the relics are only seen in the story, nothing is being used in the gameplay so far.)

I am reviewing this based on the price-point. This is not a $20 immersive experience, it's a bag of chips and a dip. Grab Katana Zero at the same price for a five course meal experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088407239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1686683574}
review:
I really enjoyed this lttle Rougelite. The Indiana Jones athmosphere is great and the combat and exploration works well and stays interesting till the end.
It took me 27h for a first completion - and the achievements and the fun of trying out other characters is enough motivation for a second run.
But the whole package is a bit to thin to provide unlimited repetition motivation. But targeting 50h of fun is very well worth the investment - I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042225625', 'num_games_owned': 6556, 'num_reviews': 448, 'playtime_forever': 2361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1550, 'last_played': 1686260671}
review: Pleasant mini-squad-based TBS - not too complex, not too shallow - with 'Indiana Jones-ey' story-generation as we choose our path on FTL-like nods grid. There are 5 major plots to survive through, some randomization makes possible to replay adventures with different sets of characters (up to 4), upbringing them to level 6 - there's a whole roster (like in Jagged Alliance) and lots of weapons/items to collect & equip (color-tiers Borderlands style).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049270866', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1693100433}
review: This game is hype. Simple gameplay loop, love the quick pace of the turn-based tactics. Graphics and sound design are wonderful. Can easily sit down and try to speedrun a map, then try a different loadout. Get this one and Halfway to maximize your utility.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009549484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1689769689}
review:
Un juego divertido, no muy complicado pero que si te van los juegos con combate táctico y eventos aleatorios te va a gustar. El que cada personaje tenga diferentes habilidades que pueden afectar a los eventos mola, y el combate, sin llegar a ser profundo como puede ser el de X-Com, es entretenido. Si te van este tipo de juegos y lo ves en oferta, cómpralo sin dudar, que merece la pena.

EDIT: tras pasarme el juego, tengo que señalar un punto negativo, tiene pocas campañas. Pensaba que el juego me daría para muchas horas y que las cinco primeras aventuras luego abrirían un segundo episodio o algo, pero no. Son cinco mapas y se acabó. Es una pena, porque apuntan a una historia mayor, con sus nazis persiguiendo objetos y sus cultos religiosos, pero nada, al final se queda cojo. Es verdad que puedes jugar más cambiando la dificultad, con el modo hardcore... Pero la gracia de un juego como este es ir desentrañando la historia, los distintos eventos...

Aun así lo recomiendo porque es un juego con encanto y divertido, pero sólo si lo ves en oferta o si ves que han creado DLC con nuevas campañas.

review:
If you like Indiana Jones, The Mummy, Faster than Light, Into the Breach, and any tactics RPG, you'll like this game.

The random events tend to get repeated, so be warned if that kind of mechanic annoys you. Also, the writing is alright. I wasn't able to finish the last level because of it's difficulty during the final encounter. Overall, I'd recommend this game because it has solid mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155979455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2506, 'last_played': 1684881009}
review:
An excellent and unique experience that feels vaguely like FTL, XCOM, Dungeon of the Endless, Expeditions: Conquistador, and several other titles without copying any of them.

Creative, replayable, fun. 

Please note that several of the negative reviews were written before the free patch(es) that added lots of new stuff, including hardcore mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055091370', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1684514623}
review:
Jeżeli chodzi o pixelartowe gry, to na tym etapie zaznajomienia z gatunkiem naprawdę potrzebuję jakichś niezwykle pozytywnych niespodzianek, aby z miejsca nie spojrzeć krzywo na jakąś produkcję. Tutaj pierwsze zaskoczenie przyszło w tym niezwykle szybko, bowiem nie zdążyłem jeszcze nawet przeklikać się przez menu, a tutaj niespodziewanie przywitał mnie... język niemiecki. Nie ukrywam, zbiło mnie to trochę z tropu, ale na szczęście przebicie się przez nazwę użytkownika i opcjonalny tryb hardkorowy(którego zasad oczywiście za bardzo nie zrozumiałem) nie były szczególnie trudne i po chwili mogłem zawitać w "optionen" zmieniając wszystkie podpisy na angielski. Niezrażony wszedłem więc dalej w kolejny do kolekcji świat pikselowego stylu, nie będąc do końca pewnym jakiej rozgrywki się właściwie spodziewać i w jaki niby sposób miałoby mi to zaoferować cokolwiek odświeżającego. A czy zaoferowało?

Kurczę flak, no chyba trochę tak, chociaż pomimo początkowego zachwytu raczej trudno będzie nazwać ten tytuł przełomowym. No bo spójrzcie sami: losowo generowane zdarzenia na jednej z kilku wypraw, do których werbujemy ekipę złożoną z różnych osobowości różniących się od siebie umiejętnościami, ekwipunkiem oraz zdolnościami specjalnymi, celem przebicia się przez napotkane postacie, kupców, przeciwników z którymi mierzymy się w turowej walce czy chociażby kończące się zapasy paliwa. Nie wiem jak dla Was, ale dla mnie to brzmiało jak potencjał na roguelike doskonały, pod warunkiem, że dostanę złożone, kompleksowe charaktery, system rywalizacji z wysokim repeat value oraz generalnie mnóstwo dodatkowych rzeczy do odkrywania, aby móc cieszyć się rozgrywką przez długie, długie godziny. A dostałem... cóż, wersję light tego, na co po cichu liczyłem.

Może zacznijmy od walki, bo tutaj coś zdecydowanie poszło nie tak. Do pewnego momentu wydawało się, że ktoś to wszystko doskonale przemyślał - zróżnicowane skille, procentowa szansa na trafienie, mechaniki oparte na chowaniu się za osłonami czy wykorzystywaniu wybuchających beczek... no fajnie, nawet bardzo. Problem w tym, że choć pozornie może się to wydawać złożone, dosłownie po pierwszej potyczce znamy już WSZYSTKO, serio. Obliczanie trudności strzału? Praktycznie dwie wartości: ta dotycząca wystrzału z bliska licząca sobie niemal sto procent oraz ta z daleka, niemal zawsze dająca przynajmniej 40%. Co za tym idzie, jesteśmy świadkami albo ciągłych losowych strzelanin z dystansu, albo partyzanckich szturmów z wbieganiem prosto na przeciwnika, bowiem nie zawarto tutaj żadnego systemu przerywania akcji poza umiejętnością "zasadzki", a to w praktyce oznacza, że możemy śmiało podbiec do żołnierza trójką naszych bohaterów i zasztyletować go na śmierć bez większych problemów lub strzelać do siebie nawzajem z dość niepoważnych odległości przy dużej szansie trafienia - co kto woli.

Poświęcę temu elementowi aż dwa akapity, ponieważ to nie koniec marnowania potencjału walk, które jakby na to nie patrzeć, stanowią właściwie trzon rozgrywki. Plansze nie wprowadzają praktycznie nic, poza wątpliwymi w zastosowaniu zasłonami oraz wspomnianymi przedmiotami możliwymi do wysadzenia, jednak szybko z rozwojem postaci odkryjecie, że bardziej opłaca się celować bezpośrednio w przeciwnika, zamiast niepotrzebnie kombinować. Przeciwnicy też nie grzeszą intelektem, więc takie proste zagrania jak ustawienie się w rogu mapy aby sami weszli pod celownik lub ganianie się po całej dostępnej przestrzeni aby przypadkiem nie ranili postaci na końcówce życia... No trochę cyrk. A dla tych gotowych napisać, że to działa tylko na początku - bez obaw, ukończyłem tak wszystkie dostępne wyprawy.

Znacznie lepiej natomiast prezentuje się eksploracja świata podzielona na segmenty, z których sami wybieramy trasę jaką finalnie pokonamy. Atmosfera jak na tego typu rozwiązanie graficzne jest zadziwiająco wiarygodna i zgrabnie korzysta z ukazywania otwartych, ciekawych przestrzeni wymieszanych z mrocznymi, tajemniczymi obiektami czy bunkrami. W grze występuje bowiem silny motyw mistyczno-kulturowy, oparty w głównej mierze na odkrywaniu pradawnych artefaktów, w który dodatkowo wplątani zostali żołnierze rzeszy z czasów wojny, a to finalnie zaowocowało naprawdę ciekawym klimatem. Trochę gorzej przedstawiają się natomiast same dialogi, które są raczej mało angażującymi ściankami tekstu, jednak sporadyczne pojawianie się opcji wyboru zależnych od dobranego składu miło to uzupełnia i sprawia, że warto czytać co nasza drużyna robi w danej lokalizacji. Na dokładkę dostaniemy do tego wszystkiego jeszcze możliwe do znalezienia przedmioty oraz bronie różnej rzadkości, drzewka umiejętności rozwijane wraz z postępem fabularnym czy chociażby dodatkowe zdarzenia jak na przykład obozowiska. Nienajgorzej.

Sama grafika to taka słodko-gorzka mieszanka, bowiem o ile przy wszystkich cutscenkach, zwiedzaniu mapy czy przeglądaniu okien wszystko prezentuje się nienagannie, estetycznie oraz płynnie, o tyle przy samych strzelaninach powtarzalne animacje podparte kiepską pracą kamery szybko zaczynają nudzić, a przy tym wydają się niezwykle ociężałe, toporne i sztuczne. Finalnie jest to dość zabawny efekt, bo trochę mamy wrażenie jakbyśmy grali w dwie gry - w spokojnych momentach dostajemy dynamiczne zbliżenia, bohaterów goniących za akcją albo przeplatające się dynamicznie kadry, tylko po to by wejść w "turówkę" prezentującą się trochę jak wojny androidów, w dodatku takich naprawdę średnio zaprogramowanych. Finalnie szala przechyla się chyba jednak na tę pozytywną stronę, bowiem koniec końców każda nasza wyprawa to przede wszystkim ukazanie odkryć oraz realizacji głównego zadania, a element potyczek to jedynie uzupełnienie całego przedsięwzięcia.

No cóż, chyba trochę szkoda projektu, bo ewidentnie był tutaj potencjał na wyjątkowo wciągający i angażujący twór, a dostaliśmy bardziej grową ciekawostkę, którą docenią chyba przede wszystkim ci bardziej obeznani ze standardami w branży, widząc czym ta pozycja wyróżnia się na tle konkurencji. Bo pomysł jak i do pewnego stopnia wykonania stoją na naprawdę nienagannym poziomie, zabrakło jednak kompleksowości oraz jakiegoś takiego elementu zamieszania, który sprawiłby, że z wypiekami na twarzy będziemy czekać na każdą kolejną batalię. Mimo tego chyba można to polecić fanom "rogalików", taktycznych shooterów czy turowych strategii, bo choć sama walka trochę niedomaga, to jednak otoczka którą udało się zbudować zdaje się w niemałym stopniu to rekompensować. Jeśli jednak nie cenicie sobie za bardzo płynnego pixelartu, zróżnicowanych scenariuszy czy bardziej taktycznego podejścia do rozgrywki, nie liczcie że ten tytuł jakoś Was zaskoczy - sporo tu niuansów, ale niestety nie dla Was. Na pewno warte przyjrzenia się, nie powinna to dla nikogo być szczególna droga przez mękę.

review: เกมส์ล่าสมบัติ ที่ไม่ได้อยากให้เราล่าสมบัติ เงินตันแค่ 9999 OMG นึกว่ามาธุดง มีสเตตัสให้อัพ แต่เอาจริงๆ เล่นได้จริงไม่กี่สาย ตัวอ่อนก็อ่อนเกินไป ตัวเก่งก็เก่งเวอร์ อวยไม่ลืมหูลืมตา ผจญภัยมาตั้งต้น chapter ยันจบเกมส์ มีแค่ 5 Chapter ที่มีแต่ monster recycle ซ้ำๆ เพิ่มแค่ เลือดกับเกราะ อัพสายหลบหลีก สุดทาง+อยู่ใน cover ก็ยังโดนยิงเน้นๆทุกนัด สายสไนอัพแม่นจนตันก็ยิงวืด ทั้งๆที่ อัตราความแม่นยำ 90% ติดต่อกัน 4 ครั้งรวด จัดทีมได้ 3 รวมรับมาระหว่างผจญภัยอีก 1 เป็น 4 คน ไม่เคยมีรูปแบบทีมที่พอดี จำเป็นต้องจัดทีมตัวละครโง่ๆ สำหรับเอาไว้สู้ กับทีมฉลาดๆเวลไวๆ เอาไว้ปั้มของ เหมือนเกมส์ทำมาเพื่อให้เล่นเป็นสูตรสำเร็จ ระเบิดขว้างขั้นสูงสุด Damage น้อยจนน่าตกใจ  อยากชนะไม่ยาก อย่าให้เกราะหมดเป็นพอ สรุป 2/10 เล่นเพื่อลบแท้ๆ ผู้พัฒนาเลิกอัพเดทเกมส์ไปแล้ว แต่ก็ไม่กระตุ้น Community ให้ทำ Mod สนุกๆออกมาเล่น อุส่าเล่นจนจบเพื่อจะมาคอมเม้นให้เลยว่าไม่สนุกสมราคา อยากซื้อไปเล่นก็รับความเสี่ยงเอาเองละกันพี่น้องคะ

author: {'steamid': '76561197990347433', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1680676617}
review:
This game seems to basically re-skin FTL, keeping pretty much everything that aggravated me about it. There are some nice improvements, but it seems to keep at its core everything that made playing FTL a trivial exercise until it became an impossible task. Pathway does have lots of charm, the pixel graphics are very well done, the interface is easy to understand (although I did remap the keys for next/previous unit, as they were on the other side of the keyboard from every other keybind) and I do very much like the India Jones/Call of Cthulhu aesthetic. 

Playing this game felt like a hot sauce challenge where I had to eat four gummy bears, then a California Reaper pepper. I'll not be going back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026335621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1679246427}
review: Probably the worst font I have ever seen in any game. It is a terrible, terrible font and makes it hard to read regardless of the resolution you play in. Really atrocious...other than that, the game is in general very clunky and repetitive/boring. Interface is too convoluted and small. Uncomfortable to play on Steam Deck as well. Has a lot of potential, the gameplay design is interesting - adventures with choosing your path and getting random events similar to FTL, and a turn based strategic combat inspired by XCOM. These are good pieces to mix together, but the execution is not good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025004667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1681372332}
review:
I have only just started playing it, but it's great so far! The combat is tactics, like X-COM. The progression is like FTL, with randomized map locations. The setting is Indiana Jones. I love it so far! The only thing I wish at this point is that when you select an attack, it would highlight the attack on the bottom menu so you know which attack you're targeting with, since the range of multiple attacks are often the exact same, and thus it's impossible to tell which one you have selected.
Update: about 11 hours in, I feel like there's some more UI issues. The exploding zombies look identical the regular zombies, and there's no way to access information about units on the map, so it can get confusing as to which units can do what. This has led me to some accidental deaths that felt like it was the game's fault not mine. 
Another problem was the healing system, which is overly complicated and I didn't realize I could heal out of battle with an un-equipped medkit. 
Lastly, I would often accidentally click a space next to my unit when trying to select my unit, which would move the unit one space and waste my turn. The fiddly controls makes it needlessly cumbersome to navigate basic mechanics.
I get games being oblique and having minimal tutorials, but I feel that the visual design and user interface could have used another iteration that would smooth the game over, so it would be clearer who could do what.
Overall it's still quite fun, and I really like the aesthetic, and I'm a fan of tactics games. I got it on sale, but maybe if you're not a very patient person consider these things if you are going to pay full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980530446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5015, 'last_played': 1677710089}
review:
Indiana Jones, The Mummy, and League of Extraordinary Gentlemen had a baby.  I really enjoyed it overall.  There are some questionable design choices, but it scratches the short adventure itch.  There are settings for everything so you can decide how hard/easy you want to play.

There are many skills for your heroes but with the two action system (a la X-COM) you are just moving and attacking 99% of the time.  Likewise, I felt like I was always choosing +AGI when given a stat boost choice, ignoring all other stats.  Mobility is king.  The flip-side of this coin is that flanking an enemy is 100% hit.

The standard mode on default settings became too easy once I had a few levels and/or purple/gold items.  The trip between struggling rookie and yawning professional was too short.  Yes, there are settings to make things harder for you like: more enemies, more HP for enemies, more damage, less supplies which does help some.

I found the hardcore mode to be the best way to play the game.  Team composition and their inherenet skills have much more impact when you start with nothing.  I've had some real nail-biters in this mode.  I've also had some total wipe-outs like that time I lost in the first fight due to NOBODY with decent armor shredding (whoops).  I feel like the game really shines in hardcore.

This game did keep me busy for a while but I would like more than 5 adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995667331', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1676214433}
review:
Basically Indiana Jones as a casual turn-based-strategy game.

Explore a map in your jeep going from point to point, randomly encountering different sites & scenarios. You manage resources in the form of fuel, ammo, supply kits. Form a party, upgrade items, level with XP, nothing too deep but enough for a light game like this.

Combat has basic cover mechanisms, armor, skills that let you monitor for enemy movement & shoot on sight during your off-turn, hide, dig in (heavy armor) etc.

In short, an easy buy for anyone who enjoys both TBS games and Indiana Jones-style narratives, and isn't looking for anything too deep on either the RPG or tactical combat side of things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024643245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1677077766}
review:
Pathway feels so close to being great, but actually just ends up being mediocre. Good fun for a bit, but nothing spectacular. It's essentially blend of Faster than Light exploration with a simplified XCOM style combat.

Pros:
 - Good artwork, managed to make the environments look pretty with pixel graphics.
 - Thematically on point. I really do feel like I'm a crew of adventurers struggling through the desert. Definite Indiana Jones vibes.
 - Variety of different playable characters.
 - Combat is fun (for a while).
 - Fairly priced.

Negatives:
 - Combat gets repetitive very quickly. This is the game's biggest downfall. Combat at level 1 feels more or less the same as combat at max level. Leveling up really doesn't have much impact and is mostly minor stat boosts.
 - Events quickly become repetitive. Most events feel more or less the same. Fight/Flee/Trade.
 - Somehow lacks any proper identity: 
            - Is this a story driven choices matter game? Not really. You are given decisions to make but most of the time they don't really matter and it just boils down to fight/flee. It fails to actually fulfill any narrative driven adventure. I want to be invested in the story, but it's just not there.
            - Is this a roguelite game? Again not really. Runs are fairly easy and there's not really enough meta progression to feel like I want to come back to it. You can upgrade your Jeep to have more supplies/ammo/fuel for future runs but it feels like such a minor progression that I don't feel like it adds much to the game. It just doesn't have the same replay-ability to it that games like Faster than Light or Into the Breach does, nor does it have a long enough campaign such as Phoenix Point/XCOM to keep me invested.
            - Is this a Role Playing Game? Hardly. Your characters have their own traits and skills but I never really feel like I care who's on my team. There's no depth to them, nothing that makes me feel like each character is unique. I can't choose to play a pacifist nurse, I can't choose to play a bloodthirsty assassin. Everyone is more or less the same. 

Overall though I enjoyed the game for what it was, and due to it's relatively cheap price (14 euros) I'm happy to have purchased it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139361623', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1675850844}

author: {'steamid': '76561198176626650', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4630, 'last_played': 1707018561}
review:
Yes, it is a realy good turn based game and yes, it may be "boring" sometimes.
I confess I'm too suspicious to talk about that game, because I love those pixelart style games and "Indiana Jones" genre. Actually, it was a good experience in most of the time playing this adventure game.


[h1][b] - Pros - [/b][/h1]
• Realy good pixelart, but it would be more interesting if had a few more animations

• Now talking about the combat, I don't realy know what people expected from it. It's a simple turn-based combat where you use two actions for each character in your party, then it's the enemy's turn.
Depending the difficult of your adventure, you need to use more or less from your brain and I like it.

• The items are nice and varied. It has a lot of shields, weapons, supplies, some random items that we just use for selling, etc. Could it be cool if it had more items? Yeah, but that's okay.

[h1][b] - Neutral - [/b][/h1]
• It could have many more types of enemies. For me, there are two types of opponents: the n@zis and the zombies.
I know that each of these 2 groups has its own enemies and its own abilities, but, for me, speaking of the n@zis, they're very similar.
I can imagine several examples of different enemies they could put in, but I don't think the developers will put them.

• Some achievements are harder to get and that's not a problem. There are achievements which don't have any tip or text guiding to get them, and that's not a problem if you like to explore and replay all adventures over and over again, but the problem is that this game has 5 adventures with over 400 events and 16 characters with "perks" or "skills". What is the probability that we find the exact event, in the exact adventure and are playing the character with the exact perk to get the achievement? 

[h1][b] - Cons - [/b][/h1]
• Some adventures are too long and can be very annoying some times. If your entire party die, you'll have to do the whole adventure again, causing a huge frustration. I mean, if you're a "veteran" in the game and know how it works, you won't have this problem. Otherwise, if you are playing for the first time, be careful. 
There are some settings that can make the adventure easier or harder.

• Biomes or map styles are limited in my opinion. It gets frustrating having to battle in bunkers, caves and deserts every time. Occasionally it happened in some villages but nothing very impressive.

[h1][u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u][/h1]
Anyway, it's a great game and you'll spend many hours on it if you give it a chance or if you want to do 100% of the achievements.
By the way, I published a guide on how to get the achievements of random events with all the adventures and perks needed for each one of them. Feel free to take a look.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2904583617

review:
This game is really fun. 
The story line is semi-random, which makes every play-through different. Plus you can use different characters that do different things. The soundtrack is really good and the game play is very fun.
If you like a kind of "Indiana Jones" feel and just want a casual game, this is the one.
Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002477296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1692396299}
review:
As a basis entry into a strategic roll play adventure it's enjoyable. 

It could do with a slightly better tutorial about how the actions work and the difference in the weapon systems, but once you've got it it's easy going and the wiki isn't bad. Pity development stopped pretty quickly so you'll find a few faults and for some it might seem repetitive, though I'm still enjoying it 20+ hours in. 

Certainly not the best for long term strategy fans, but for those who want to pick up and play for an unknown time I'd suggest it's a good option. Probably not worth the full price with what's available today, but worth picking up at a discount

author: {'steamid': '76561198053783918', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1648974568}
review:
Pathway to jest taktyczna gra RPG, która łączy elementy strategii i przygody. Gra polega na przemierzaniu pustyni i walkach z różnymi wrogami, zbieraniu zasobów i rozwijaniu postaci.

Plusy:
[list]
[*]Interesująca historia i fabuła
[*]Duża ilość rozmaitych przeciwników
[*]Różnorodne opcje rozwoju postaci
[*]Ładna grafika
[*]Przyjemne i absorbujące rozgrywka
[/list]
Minusy:
[list]
[*]Niektóre walki mogą być trudne
[*]Interfejs może być nieco skomplikowany
[*]Ograniczona ilość poziomów
[/list]
Podsumowanie: Pathway to świetna gra dla miłośników taktycznych RPG. Posiada interesującą fabułę i różnorodne opcje rozwoju postaci. Grafika jest ładna, a rozgrywka przyjemna i absorbująca. Minusy to niektóre trudne walki oraz skomplikowany interfejs. Ogólnie rzecz biorąc, to dobra pozycja dla fanów gatunku.

[h1]Dziękuje za przeczytanie mojej recenzji na temat gry Pathway, jeżeli ta recenzja ci się spodobała, przydała podczas zakupu lub poprawiła ci humor - zapraszam do rozdania nagrody lub pozostawienia oceny pod recenzją.
Zapraszam również do przeczytania [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/HyperSonic0/reviews]moich recenzji na temat innych gier[/url].[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035532559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1672577136}
review:
Positive:
- The concept is not bad (map with decision events; then some combat).
- The 2D art in general is nice.

Negative:
- The terrain in combat is not clear enough. Some maps are completely dull with huge unpassable obstacles taking most of them.
- The combat mechanics are rather boring.

Conclusion:
The story and the events seemed promising, but the combat, which is large part of the gameplay, is simply not fun enough for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202174298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1671404795}
review:
It's okay, but could've been better. 

Pathway is a roguelite TBS with two modes of play: normal and hardcore. Of these two modes, normal is an enjoyable experience, even if it's really, REALLY easy. Meanwhile, hardcore is far more challenging, but it's challenging in stupid ways, which makes it a shaky recommendation.

In both modes, you'll go through 5 campaigns total. Each campaign features anywhere from 1-3 randomly-generated locations, where you can do things like rest, shop, exchange commodities, ambush enemies, or get ambushed by enemies. I particularly like the way that Pathway handled resource management; you'll need to stockpile fuel because that's how you get from point A to point B, you'll need "supplies" in order to throw grenades in battle or heal your characters, and you'll need ammo to keep your weapons reloaded. 

What makes normal mode outrageously easy is the fact that your progress (e.g. inventory and character upgrades) is retained across multiple campaigns. Thus, once you find some very powerful items, it's incredibly easy to roflstomp everything the game throws at you, even if you tweak the difficulty setting to max. I think if not for the meta-progression of inventory/character retention, normal mode would be a fairly interesting experience. However, the retention is what ruins any strategic potential that normal mode has. 

On the other hand, hardcore mode went too far in the other direction. Enemy spawns are at least twice as dense as they are on normal, enemies are twice as strong as they are on normal, and the game is way more unforgiving with its resources like fuel, supplies, and equipment. In hardcore mode, you will be completely outnumbered, outclassed, and outmoded. It's simply not fair. Oh, and hardcore has permadeath, as if the game weren't unforgiving enough. 

Another thing which hinders the strategic potential of Pathway is the XCOM-like reliance upon luck. Not only can hitrates screw you over, but all attacks have a damage range, such as 16-22 for a knife slice. If I had a dollar for every time I failed to kill an enemy because of rolling the lowest possible value... well, suffice it to say I'd have enough to buy Pathway a few times over. Stuff like this creates a more dynamic experience, sure, but the tradeoff is that it's far more difficult to actually... you know... strategize. 

To recap: I'd recommend Pathway's normal mode as an entry-level strategy game. At the same time, its hardcore mode is unfair and luck-reliant in a lot of ways, which holds back the legitimate potential it could've had. I enjoyed the game and don't regret playing it, but there are definitely better-designed strategy games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134159054', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2735, 'last_played': 1670960261}
review:
Cóż... Nie wiem od czego zacząć... A! Już wiem.
W grę się bardzo wciągnąłem, przez pierwsze kilkanaście godzin czytałem wszystkie dialogi, które wyświetlały mi się po raz pierwszy. Jest ich sporo, a rozgrywka głównie opiera się na tego rodzaju narracji i turowej, nieco strategicznej rozgrywce.

[h1]Rozgrywka[/h1]

Tak jak na początku wspomniałem gra oparta jest na tury, podczas których staramy się wyeliminować przeciwnika, których w samej grze jest kilka rodzai- od nazistów, po kultystów. 

[u]Przed wyruszeniem w drogę należy zebrać drużynę.[/u]
To kogo dobierzemy do naszej początkowej drużyny ma ogromne znaczenie na walkę jak i fabułę. Każda z postaci posiada określone cechy i umiejętności, które pozwalają na odblokowanie pewnych rozwiązań podczas podejmowania wyborów, a te mają wpływ na nasze dalsze losy. 
To od nas zależy, czy będziemy korzystać ze zbalansowanej drużyny, w której mamy swego rodzaju medyka, snajpera i tanka, czy będziemy korzystać z postaci, których archetyp jest bardzo podobny i są to np sami snajperzy. 
Podczas podróży na swojej drodze napotykamy kupców, zasadzki, jak i dawnych przyjaciół, którym warto pomóc, by do nas dołączyli. 
Nie chcę się zbytnio rozpisywać, aby zdradzić jak najmniej.

[h2]Na ile czasu wystarczy nam rozgrywka?[/h2]
Według serwisu #howlongtobeat jest to od 10,5h do 24h... 
W moim przypadku pierwsze przejście gry (bo nie wszystko szło idealnie) trwało około 12-14h.
Później skupiłem się na testowaniu i poszukiwaniu wyzwań, których wcześniej nie napotkałem. 
Skusiłem się też na tryb hardcore, który posiada perm-death. Niestety byłem już w trakcie maksowania osiągnieć, więc rozgrywkę i wszystkie mechaniki miałem opanowane w bardzo dużym stopniu- więc ten tryb nie spowodował dodatkowego wyzwania. 

Po 45,6h posiadam w grze 100%, spokojnie można było zrobić to sporo szybciej, ale do gier które mi się podobają podchodzę w sposób, by bawić się w nich jak najdłużej i jak najlepiej.

[h3]Co głównie mnie do tej gry przyciągnęło? [/h3]
[list]
[*] taktyczna walka,
[*] przyjemna oprawa graficzna,
[*] nieco powolna rozgrywka, nie pchająca nas za wszelką cenę do przodu,
[*] cena podczas wyprzedaży to jedynie 20 kilka zł i jest to niewygórowana stawka

[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198054977435', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1670367425}
review:
I'm in the same boat as to what others say after finishing all of the adventures at least once. Repetitive/grindy. I'd still recommend it because I did enjoy the adventures. The last adventure was a bit lacking though.

There are a variety of characters to play from and unlock. They have unique traits that you can choose in random encounters and could change how those encounters go. I do not know if they actually have a big impact - if an adventure's ending changes depending on what happened before... I never checked but if they did that could be something to make the game up its replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561199192009840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1670249413}
review:
玩起来很累，仔细想了想原因，跟制作组另一部作品HALFWAY作了比较，得出了一些结论。（HALFWAY很推荐，比这一部好玩多了）
首先是最主要的[b]战斗[/b]环节。战斗几乎必打，不管是要刷装备还是挣车油都要打。

[h1]随机到松散的无趣战斗[/h1]
最直观的一点，这一部是一个[b]很开阔的大地图[/b]，敌人的[b]站位都是随机的[/b]，活动的空间很大。halfway是啥样的呢？狭小的室内空间，大量的掩体，精心设计的路线和敌人初始站位。说玄点叫有灵魂，说具体点就是玩家自己真的有在设计有意义、成体系的战术。我在这一部里感受到的不过是[b]敌人随便换了个位置站[/b]，我要做的就是看哪个人比较好处理先上去把他解决了，敌人通常都是[b]孤立无序[/b]的。每一局都是这样，见人就打，不用怎么思考的，顶多看看掩体自己能不能够到。不存在太多的阵型对抗。每一局都这样平淡，没有差异，没有乐趣。

[h1]偷懒而奇怪的掩体与命中率设定[/h1]
这里面[b]命中[/b]与否[b]跟距离完全没关系[/b]，只要在射程内，该方向掩体不变的情况下距离多远命中率都是一样的。想要去掉掩体的影响？好，至少走到敌人没有掩体保护的那个[b] 正方向[/b]，只要没有掩体，直接给你[b]100% hit chance[/b]。这么一来我要做的事情就变成了[b]想方设法跑到敌人的某个方位去射击[/b]，就算这个角色是个狙击手，他也可以冲锋在前。没有代入感。halfway是啥样的？各种枪型都有自己的命中概率曲线，狙击手老老实实待在后方，没有往前冲的道理。这才叫狙击啊。

然后是[b]掩体[/b]，为什么一定要走到[b]正方位才能不受掩体影响[/b]？我和你离着十米远，你背靠着掩体末端蹲着，我在你左面偏后面一点点，但是我往左走一米就能穿过掩体墙面的延伸面，与你位于掩体的同一侧，于是我的命中率就从50%变成了100%。十米远诶，这么一点点角度的变化有那么大影响吗？注意掩体并不需要向我这边延伸，只要有那么[b]孤立的一格掩体[/b]就能提供[b]整个180°的命中率减免[/b]。halfway的掩体只能保90°，玩起来正常点，为什么这部就变成了180°护你周全呢？这部其实也有一条自由延伸而不受限于上下左右正方向的[b]真实的视射线[/b]，但是掩体不需要向攻击者那边延伸就能直接提供180°范围的命中减免还是硬指标啊。对方贴着墙站，我根据真实的视射线演算，能够射中但是依然受到墙的减免，这也太离谱了。我能看见他说明我跟他之间没有别的东西，他没掩体我就必中，他有一个几乎毫无作用的掩体我就不能必中，我无法理解。为什么命中减免不能也参考一下视射线呢？明明有计算出来的。

说到墙的问题，还想到一个射击范围的设定，我靠着墙要射击拐角后的敌人，我得先探到墙外面没问题，可是为什么我这么探身出去就[b]只能贴着墙射[/b]，敌人只要不贴着墙站我就射不到呢？这太奇怪了，枪是被墙面给吸住了吗？halfway没这问题啊，探身出去整个世界都是你的，想射谁就射谁，关他贴不贴墙屁事。

[h1]简单但僵化的行动点分配[/h1]
这部一样还是2点AP，但是能干的事变成了走路、开枪、其他动作三选二来做，简单但是僵化死板，能干的事变多了，但是玩家对战斗的掌控力减弱了。走路就是走路，开枪就是开枪，没有一点变化。看看halfway吧，射击可以多花1点AP提高精度，走路可以多花1点AP延长距离，2点AP怎么分配多么自由。

[h1]恶心的敌人[/h1]
[b]敌人兵种[/b]不多，前两章军队士兵和狗很好打，后面一帮连护甲都没有的迷信者，居然有那么厚的血条，人均带雷投掷必中，扔把飞刀比子弹还疼，你们真的受到了神的加护？什么神这么牛，我也要信。跟他们打几乎必掉血，因为会丢雷还手长，他们四面八方分布，地图上掩体很少，还有僵尸逼走位和吸引火力，非常的烦。

[h1]物资过于随机缺乏保障[/h1]
容易受伤，有物资来治疗还好，没物资就很蛋疼。[b]地图太随机了，已知地点太少[/b]，商店分布在什么犄角旮旯里面，走过去买五桶油再走回来，油量还亏了。有可能走过大半个地图一滴油没见到，太折磨了。补给品也是，有时多到拿不动，有时少到每走一步都受到很大的精神压力。

[h1]单调的地图事件[/h1]
嗯，地图上走的[b]事件也很单调[/b]，经常啥都没有，或者遇到个建筑，可能会打一架，赚点钱和资源，运气好拿到新武器，至于人物的属性加成或者减低的事件那是屈指可数，真正的可遇不可求。何不多搞点神秘的花样，再提一提概率呢？让旅途轻松有趣一些不也挺好，别又给大压力又鲜有好的奖励。

[h1]音乐单调[/h1]
音乐总是那几首，给我听腻了。halfway的音乐氛围感强，存在感弱，循环几小时不会腻。这一作音乐没那么优秀了。敌人的惨叫也挺刺耳的。

[h1]总结一下：[/h1]
战斗部分你说为了服务随机元素放弃了设计好的固定关卡，没有问题。但是其他的部分为何不借鉴halfway呢？那边的大家只是嫌命中率低太折磨，没说要直接取消距离-命中曲线啊……掩体、AP啥的设计，你照搬都行嘛。是不是太偷懒了？或者简化过了头，把灵魂也给简没了？血量的问题老生常谈了，这种问题我也想不出啥好建议，吐吐槽罢了。
地图上内容填充不够丰富、精彩，看看开发组有没有意愿继续堆料吧。
本作游戏体验不如前作，只有疲劳，没有乐趣，我选择不推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054048424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1669370722}
review:
Very solid and fancy-looking roguelike turn based game.

Consistent and cute art style, amazing story, slightly rough and hardcore resource management (however can be overriden in the game settings to better fit your playstyle). Different characters are really different, and each of them have unique traits that may change the game experience.

And yes: the feel of exploring and adventure from the old-scool action movies is definitelly here.

A little disadvantage to my mind is the last chapter: the game becomes little repetative and predictable, feel the lack of new enemies or decorations at least. No bossfights at all, despite the mystical entourage, that allow player to expect some more unusual things in the end.

But, in general, it's a great piece of game and it's definitelly worth to be played. Strongly recommend this stuff if you're looking for high quality roguelike and turn-based tactic.
