review: It's current positive rating, 75%, seems about right for this game. It's a rogue-lite tactics-style strategy game. It's probably exactly what you think it is after reading that. It's not a bad game, but it's pretty generic. It's fun if you like this style of game. If the setting or genre speaks to you, it might be worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071050068', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1668983323}
review:
The reviews are pretty consistent here and I agree with them: an absolutely gorgeous game, incredible soundtrack, and you can finish it in a single go and won't feel very compelled to replay. I went back to unlock a few more characters, but the combat is lacking in difficulty and in nuance. A game like this needs a ton of micro to feel really engaging and to keep you learning and optimizing, and this just doesn't have that. I think a few improvements that would really make this game one of my favorites would be:
-more campaigns
-additional combat objectives (destroy this, protect the hostages, grab all the objectives in X turns or the elder god will be resurrected, etc.)
-more granularity in the accuracy system so that you really have to plan out your spots
-different types of damage, shields, etc.
-a more in-depth skill tree, maybe classes?
You should play this game, 1000%, and if there were a DLC that added any of this in I would probably put hundreds of hours into this game, but it's probably not going to be one that you play over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367346998', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1668691133}
review:
通关了，说说感受。

优点：游戏美工很不错，不同的场景画面转换、人物的动作很细致；
          制作组后期更新了中文也算良心，作为一个战旗小游戏在玩法上还是合格的；

不足：游戏中只有5个小关，内容不算很多，而且重复度较高；
          某些人物解锁条件过高，而且刚解锁的人物技能很少，还不如升级后的初始人物好用；

游玩建议：前面两关可以正常玩，但是到了后面建议调低难度玩，这样会有更好的体验；

author: {'steamid': '76561199080447825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1666065433}
review:
This little game may do the trick if you're looking for a somewhat challenging, tactical turn-based RPG kind of game, that won't drain your time and brain. It's like Xcom treasure hunter edition, with a bit of rogue-like, and without the existential grind.

It can become repetitive, but can still be fun. There are 5 little stories/missions and I like that narrative decision, although there aren't really bosses, more like narrative events that are nothing special really. It's also a shame that the characters are rather generic. Even the ones you go unlocking are all pretty much the same. These are missed opportunities to give the game more depth and replay value. And there are minor inconveniences in the gameplay, but nothing too bad. 

The music is epic. A little too epic for the game at times, but it's great. Overall it's a fun game if you come with the right expectations. Now I may even give a shot to Halfway, another similar game from these devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094803808', 'num_games_owned': 4070, 'num_reviews': 5384, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1661716917}
review:
4/10
80.8% have
First Blood
Kill a Nazi.
57.9%
An Ending and a New Beginning I
Finish an adventure.
this comes from losing or winning a campaign, but mostly losing
to have that many people install the game and give up before even losing once should tell you how bad this game is
some of the maps are HUGE, no reason to be that big
Cant undo movements, ooops moved 1 step short, cant reach them, and lose the hour campaign you were on…..
- most of the time your just gunning down dogs
- you only get 3 equip slots 
2 weapons and one clothing
you need 1 weapon so that slot is always used and that leave 1 slot for items or melee weps
- doesnt auto heal you or reload guns at the end of levels….why?
- Every run im doing fine and get crushed on the last map because i only have 3 guys and they all rush me. 
now i need to revive all my used players that just got 1 level each but the bonus is so small it doest really do anything, but i dont have the $$$
this game starts you off on the easiest setting and i still cant finish the last level even going in with max stats. i guess i could reduce the enemy spawn or give myself more resources as well, but i dont want to
this type of game style is really killed by adding guns, fire emblem did it right and very few games have followed that formula
took me a decent amount of time but i found out how to win, bypass and sneak away from every single fight. cause thats how this type of game should work...

author: {'steamid': '76561198108040263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1663258838}
review:
So I will say, for this, you'll need to make your own fun. This game isn't "haha, funny, haha, Indian Jones, haha, nazis", it's pretty heavy on turn based combat, dice rolls and preparing your characters for battle. It can be draining at times, especially when you spend time unlocking a new character who, after the amount of time you put it must SURELY be better, only for them to have less talents and no combat use than the base unlocked-at-start character (Annabelle, looking at you, ya feeble plane loving wimp). Loot is sometimes underpowered and getting rid of old junk is hard as you can only sell mid-adventure, which means slogging it to a merchant, using fuel and getting into more fights and getting more loot you maybe can't pick up, just to sell it. It's not exactly fun if you look at the mechanics.

But I made Jackson a woman beater Indian Jones ("I'll smack you, Nazi! And then I'll smack your wife!") and BrunHilda is just a Hulk like brute after she LITERALLY smashed through a wall in a random event, so I'm enjoying myself as I watch my team scream "BRUNHILDA! NOOOO!" before she punches a nazi through barbwire and minces him into German steak. XD I even put her in nazi power armour, so now I have a Hulk in a Hulk Buster.

The comedy just writes itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193398570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2039, 'last_played': 1710209206}
review:
This thematic, turn based RPG is pretty good. It has a well developed story, good assortment of characters with different strengths and weaknesses, great pixel art, good game mechanics, and great fun in stored for the Indiana Jones wannabe.
On the down side, it may become a bit repetitive, would benefit from more enemy variety and map is at times not clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160251611', 'num_games_owned': 1298, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1661532616}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024191569', 'num_games_owned': 4949, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1661219925}
review:
寡淡的游戏，不过默认难度能一次通关没啥垃圾时间还是给推荐吧。
RL+战棋：
RL方面本作三个限制：油料，弹药，补给。油料决定能走多远，弹药决定能开几枪，补给补血补护甲扔手榴弹。看起来还行，实际的话由于油料耗尽撤退能保留全部物资，这又是个刷装备游戏，所以也没啥存在感。弹药本作的类XCOM性质极端鼓励一回合内处理掉射程内全部敌人，所以也用不完。，唯一有点用的是补给，后期无伤还是很难。
但问题在于，本作是有现金设定的（卖武器装备和垃圾），而且能够继承，所以你大可开局兜里揣几千块去商人那里买上面三种资源（而且本作来钱过于容易），相比较RL的一线生机，本作的RL四平八稳，就是个添头。
战棋方面本作的装备设定和XCOM机制完全冲突，本作装备六个等级，下一个等级的白板也比上一个等级的金皮基础数据好。而关键在于后期即便是顶级枪除了霰弹之外的武器都无法一枪干掉普通敌人（除了最底层的僵尸），加上地图小，敌人多。局部优势也不太容易发挥。所以总要挨几枪（不过用不着住院）。技能本来是个扭转乾坤的东西，但本作只有攻击敌人和一个技能能恢复技能点，所以也就是个一次性道具（唯一能和技能完美搭配的是狙击手，伏击不仅能取消敌人行动还能造成伤害，比单纯攻击赚的多，狙击手还有恢复一点技能点的技能）。想了想也没啥好研究的，算个半吊子。
于是这俩凑一块也就只能凑合玩玩了。

最后扯一下剧情，本作德三也是个添头，让当地邪教徒各种图图，一共五个剧本，两个都是邪教徒，最终BOSS也是邪教徒。德三？抵挡不住诱惑进池子被融的屑罢了，本质旅游团。邪教徒刻画反而多，支部全世界都是（还专门提了下苏联支部让钢铁图图了，乐）。怎么说呢，虽然这俩都是B级片专属，但我还是想图图纳粹。邪教徒真的腻了（还比纳粹难搞）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198377465353', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1660815012}
review:
Pathway is a strategy RPG turn based game where you and your team explore the wilderness of the 1930's as you battle Nazi's and other enemies where you need to outsmart your opponents to gain victory is turn based team combat. You also get to explore tombs and raid camp to unlock iteams to assist your squad. 
Graphics- Good pixel style 
Soundtrack- Alright
Audience- Teenagers or Adults
Difficulty- Not too hard but requires some tactical thinking 
Story- Alright story 
Game time- Descent length for each missions with 5 in total  
Price- Not the cheapest but isn't too expensive 
6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198094576726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1681944747}
review:
This game was a very pleasant discovery that has some minor problems, but deserves so much praise in a lot of aspects. 
First of all it's important to clarify that many describe it as a roguelike, but I think that may be misleading, because the game structure is not that of the genre.
You control a small party of adventurers, each with their own set of equipment and skills. The variety of characters is enough to make you want to try various combinations to explore new strategies and events. 
You have some resource management to do to travel from one point of interest to the other on a map, where the game presents a surprising variety of events, which may lead to choices to make using the characters' skills and sometimes to combat. 

Every scenario you encounter, even a simple goat crossing the road is always rendered in an outstanding pixel-art and all is accompanied by a simple yet beautiful thematic music. Combat is played as a turn based XCOM like strategy game, but with much more simpler mechanics, so if you are not a fan of the genre you won't have much trouble anyway, but if you are you'll probably find it too easy.

The management component is a bit tricky and I think deserves some words:
 you have Fuel, Money, Ammo and Supplies. Money and Supplies are ok, but I believe Ammo and Fuel have opposite problems. I never finished ammo, to the point that every time I had the chance to exchange it for fuel I did. Fuel can be a bit frustrating, because it forces you to explore less and when you finish it you get punished with very high damage for each movement you make on the map. You can modify the quantity of the resources when you replay the adventures and have more fuel, but that means you will have more Ammo, which is already overabundant, and more Supplies, which makes the game a lot easier.

TL/DR
I strongly recommend it to fans of adventure movies and stories 
Do not consider it as a roguelike because all of the adventures can be finished in the first go and there is replayability and variety, but not that much of that genre.

PROS: 
-Amazing pixel art
-Mood of the 1930s archeological Indiana Jones-like adventure perfectly captured
-Huge variety of events
-Nice and suited music

SUBJECTIVE:
-Combat may be too easy for a fan of strategic combat, but if you just want the adventure experience it's ok

CONS:
-Resource management could have needed some more polish (Too much ammo, too few fuel)
-Small variety of enemies 
-Combat may become repetitive after some hours

review:

[code][h2][u]RESEÑA:[/u][/h2]
[b]Un grupo de aventureros viaja por un mundo lleno de misterios, tesoros y peligros. Los nazis emprenden un viaje a Egipto, Marruecos y Africa en busca de un artefacto que les dotara de un poder para controlar el mundo. A medida que te adentras en los diversos mapas que van desde desiertos, islas, cuevas, pirámides y catacumbas que ofrece Pathway, desentrañarás la misión del Tercer Reich y pondrás fin a sus objetivos de obtener el poder que podría cambiar el destino del mundo.[/b][/code]
[code][h2][u]ASPECTOS GENERALES:[/u][/h2]
[b]El juego se basa en un sistema de progresión bastante sencillo. Cada personaje que obtienes a medida que avanzas por su vasto mapa tendrá cualidades únicas que mejorarán tu estrategia en la aventura. El mapa tiene opciones de exploración, por lo que tú decidirás la ruta de tu aventura. Habrá situaciones en las que tendrás que tomar decisiones en los diálogos (sencillos) que te afectarán de manera positiva o negativa.[/b][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197998817967', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1659899505}
review:
A tactical kinda-roguelite which I wish I could love more, alas similarly to Robotality's previous game it suffers from being puddle deep where it matters.

General premise is pretty charming: You're in command of some adventurers in 1930s trying to uncover ancient secrets and prevent them from falling into wrong hands. Pulpy fun, think Indiana Jones but there's a whole crew of equally important characters - three to four. The whole setting is limited to North Africa and Middle East, it's all deserts, yet spritework is plain gorgeous and impressive for seemingly 2D lighting keep environments surprisingly varied. The music also feels like something from a pulpy adventure movie, think Indiana Jones, which is wonderful. It all comes together very well.

What doesn't come together well is the gameplay, just like Robotality's previous title Halfway it's a turn-based squad tactics game, except now also trying to be a roguelike with overworld where you roam looking for trouble and resources. It also sticks to modern turn based squad game conventions of giving you a single move and single whatever else action, more or less, and making you and enemy AI take turns. Which is fine and good, what sucks is... the enemy varieties and behaviors are limited - while the player character options are way nicer than Halfway's, I actually found a couple really cool tactics messing with different characters, plus you can use their abilities more than once in a bunch of turns - the enemies lack in variety and behaviors, like the Wehrmacht bozos, apart from like three specialists only differ in stats, it feels. And the cult faction got even smaller variety, but are blessed with more annoying and challenging enemy types.

The lack of variety is one, but also feels like the overworld roguelite aspect wasn't taken to the level it should be, it's repetitive and resource management makes me feel like the devs didn't polish that trough, over all playtroughs I would suffer overabundance of ammo, money also was never an issue so I could always pay for everything I need. And to top it off there's always a sense something is missing, like all systems and storylines build up a bigger world with more adventures and greater progression, and adventure conclusions imply things aren't over, but this never got an expansion or major content so not sure where they were going with this...

Overall, it's in a weird spot, I want to like it, but feels like majority of it's potential gets squandered on repetitive battles. Consider if you want a short turn based tactics game, otherwise? Feel free to pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1658875267}
review:
Pathway is just an ok adventure/tactical game. first off looking at other reviewers their main complaint is how the fights get samie real fast. this is because all enemies act the same. they all run at you and melee or shoot you and late game they lob stuff at you, or hide in a corner, sometimes they will back off a bit at random or when hurt but there is no variation in how the ai acts out side medics that will move to heal allies. this leads to fights all feeling the same. you also only start with 3 people but you can find a forth (they will be random from your unlocked characters) where the enemies can have up to 13 so it's a good thing the dev lets you remove 2 enemies from every fight when you select the level (USE IT). fighting isn't to bad until the later levels where there are more enemies and zombies get a ranged attack. you'll also use the exact same strategy every time unless you are chasing someone down and that is pick a spot and defend it. sometimes you'll retreat to a better spot to defend and when there's 2-3 enemies left you'll move in and kill.

gameplay
in all there are 16 characters and 5 missions. missions can be customized by making enemies 1-2 levels higher, removing/adding 1or2 enemies from every fight and adding or removing how many supplies you start with. missions start by you pick 3 people to go exploring. who you take matters as each has some perks that will help you clear events easier or with better results.then you're placed on a map with nodes and you may have to complete up to 3 map (count the dots on the map). some nodes will tell you what is there but most will not most will give you a random event. they could be nothing, to items, or a forth character, or maybe just kill one of your people, who knows but most people tend to skip the fighting if they can. the last space is almost always a fight. you'll also have to manage resources: fuel that you'll lose 1 for each node you go to, ammo that you'll lose during fights, and supplies that is mainly used for abilities. character will get levels that can be reset for 2k gold (your max is 9999) and each level lets you pick 1 ability from that levels row. you can not use higher levels to pick lower level abilities. there is also armor that will block some damage but this helps the ai more than you because after the first fight your armor will be 0 and it does not go back up unless you can find new armor or you finish the mission. there is an ability to fix it but it just feels like a bad heal. finally if you end up wiping on a run all 3-4 characters will need to be revived for 500gold each to be used again. 

the games not total trash but it can get boring. this would be a neutral but i'll go with a positive since this is more of an adventure game. maybe the fights are a punishment for not bringing the perk that would have let you avoid it or because you let your resources run low.
5/10 - Renowned Explorers is better

author: {'steamid': '76561198256129392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2377, 'last_played': 1658133409}
review:
这是个及格的游戏。能带给你十小时以上的快乐。
它的战斗系统是战棋，但由于使用大移动范围和远射程的设计，所以“棋味”很弱，我觉得把它归入回合制会更合适。总体难度偏低，并不烧脑，可以轻松通关。虽然游戏过程有很多随机元素，但它们并不改变当前一局的体验，所以肉鸽感很弱，重复可玩性不高。我把所有角色都解锁后，尝试了几个比较有特色的组合通关，然后就放下了。
不完美，但还是可以的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198356948388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1658532745}
review:
8/10 既然德意志科技世界第一,那用用魔法也很合理吧! 
指挥小队开吉普车在沙漠里愉快暴(偷)打(袭)德军的游戏.
众所周知僵尸是德军制造的(不, 德军还召唤了邪神(不

美术和剧本都还蛮不错的. 特别是地图的像素做的很细致了
美中不足是大地图小地图都不能总览. 指针靠近外侧的时候会自动拖拽地图...也不是不行但是还是太麻烦,而且战斗时有时会自动跑偏. 要是能做个右键拖拽地图就更好了.
另外切换场景和载入还是有点慢

战斗系统是带小队养成的战棋, 武器分为远程和近程还有辅助道具.
即使人打没了也可以复活,经验还是多少继承的. 刷起来也还算爽的
遇事不决就正义的多打一, 瞄不准就冲到敌人面前开枪!
战斗上设定有障碍物或掩体时瞄准会下降.白刃虽然设定只能在近身一圈使用,但枪械是只数格子决定的
于是打不中的时候就可以冲到敌人面前贴脸狙击枪(笑......
此外设定是有友军伤害的_(:з」∠)_范围攻击如果自己在范围内,甚至会自己对自己开枪...这也很合理嘛!

总的来说就很休闲的打一遍就好.如果很追求装备的话就会沦为无限刷关游戏了...因为装备要靠一遍一遍刷地图刷怪来获得.而总体上剧情事件又并没有多到可以刷五遍十遍. 
设定可以调整初始补给,敌人数量和难度.简单凑一队刷个大结局还是不难的.

不知道制作组经历了什么,游戏设定里甚至可以关闭狗狗暴毙时的嗷呜声...可谓是非常谨慎了

author: {'steamid': '76561198072583498', 'num_games_owned': 3290, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1656613773}
review:
テキストの日本語化は非常に出来がいいです
ゲームブックのような豊富なテキスト、イベントも冒険感を盛り上げてくれるもので、雰囲気は抜群と言えます。
ただ、肝心の戦闘部分の多様性が乏しく、冒険あたりの戦闘数も多いためどうしてもマンネリ気味になるのが残念なところ

author: {'steamid': '76561198868540220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1657831282}
review:
I liked the nice pixel art, the feel of being on an adventure all the way to the end of the game and the progression around the characters, unlocking them, gearing them up, leveling them...

But the fights got repetitive pretty fast since there isn't much of a reason to fight either for, I kept taking most fights cause of the achievements and I really wanted to unlock every character.

I didn't care much anymore past that and tried to rush the end with some new, low level characters... I lost the very last fight of the game, I bet I missed out on some of its ending scenario lines but I can't be bothered to redo the last part again.

Still a nice little game IMO.

The hour count is high cause of being AFK a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082023389', 'num_games_owned': 2074, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1654422323}
review:
This is just reviewing the experience of playing it exclusively on a steam deck - it ain't good chief. The controller functionality is clearly half baked where they don't make it cohesive. RT+LT navigates the option menu, RB+LB navigates other things. The pause menu can only be navigated with the analog stick. But the main menu is navigated by the directional buttons (maybe analog but I don't want to use it). The navigating around the turn based part of the game is again, done with the analog stick. Why. You can hold x to see the tooltip for some stuff but not other. Getting to nit picky territory but when you recruit a team and you're on the skill section and then you press RB+LB to go to the next adventure (even though it's in a grid, to go below you, you have to RB over until it goes to the next line which is, again, half assed.), your selection seems to just disappear and you have to press up and then down or what not to be able to go back to the skills section. Everything is just so convoluted and it is possible to play this on the steam deck but it just seems like it'll be a pain. It's a big wall to cross over imo to try to enjoy this game, 

Also like it says in the controller update, you have to use the mouse to be able to navigate to the controller options at the start and, again, makes it more of a headache than it should be. I wouldn't be so hard on the controller functionality if they weren't going around tauting it like it's an amazing new feature that is thought out. They updating it for steam deck support and putting this on the switch makes this actually kind of a selling point on the game. With these controller issues and just the gameplay issues in general, I wouldn't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026499954', 'num_games_owned': 3071, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1653832408}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1] 
[b]Pathway[/b] is a turn-based strategy mixed with a rogue-like set in the world of adventures and ancient treasures.

[h1]Pros & Cons[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Amazing pixel art
+ Great soundtrack and feeling of adventure
+ Good variety of characters and abilities

[b]Cons:[/b]
- The game starts to repeat itself too fast
- Too easy for rogue-like, can be completed in a single go
- No special objectives makes fighting very monotonous

[h1]Story[/h1] 
The game features five loosely connected stories. They're all about finding some ancient treasure or sacred place. The story is delivered by text before you start and adventure. While proceeding towards the goal, you might also find a bit more story-related information. Stories themselves feel very shallow and uninteresting, you've probably seen all that in movies with much better execution. What's more disappointing is that the story doesn't provide anything useful for gameplay. It would have been way more fun if there were some puzzles that would test your knowledge a little, like in the [b]Uncharted[/b] or [b]Tomb Raider[/b] series. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
You start the adventure by picking three characters from the roster. Each of them has unique combat skills and special abilities. After you start the adventure, you will find yourself looking at a map with a bunch of dots and lines connecting them. Your goal is to move your party from point A to point B. When moving between dots special events occur, where you can choose the outcome, some of which can only be triggered if you have a character with a certain special ability in your party. Some outcomes will result in a battle. That's when the turn based tactics part of the game starts.  If you've played [b]X COM[/b] you probably know how it goes.  You position your troops behind cover and shoot at the enemy, praying that random is on your side. There's a variety of enemies, some will shoot you back, some will come close to punch you in the face. Your characters also have different abilities like healing or shooting back at the first enemy that shot you. It's pretty standard gameplay for turn-based tactics, without anything new worth explaining.

Now to the criticism, the game has a lot of balancing issues that discourage exploration and make the game tedious. At the start of an adventure you always have the same fixed amount of fuel, it is used whenever you travel between dots. When you spend all of it, each move will damage your characters, so it's basically a game over if the luck is not on your side. This system practically kills the exploration and makes choosing the shortest path to the goal the most viable approach. The other problem with fuel is that some options in those events can help you avoid combat, but fighting gives you rewards, which include fuel. So, it feels like you should always choose the option to fight, no matter how many choices the game provides. The fighting also feels a bit flawed, there aren't any special missions (e.g. protect a target for X turns, move from bottom of the screen to the top), so it feels very monotonous. Not to mention that it's way too easy on standard difficulty, you can easily complete all the adventures in one go without dying once. There's also a lack of content, after beating the first two adventures you will have seen most of what the game has to offer. So the rogue-like mechanic feels heavily undercooked.

[h1]Graphics & Audio[/h1]
The outstanding pixel art visuals are the main reason why I've picked up this game. Environments are varied, and they have lots of little details to them, and the lighting makes every location feel alive.  Combat animations look smooth and a carefully landed shot on the enemy feels very satisfying. The sound design is almost of the same quality. The music will make you nostalgic for adventure movies, but it won't distract you from the action. 

[h1]Performance[/h1]
Specs: AMD Ryzen 9 5900HX, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Laptop GPU 8GB, 32GB RAM.

The game runs at 60 FPS at 1080p resolution without any problems. The only glitch I've experienced during 10 hours of gameplay, was frozen animation on one of the enemies, who was shot, but his dying animation didn't start up, so he was standing like nothing happened through the whole battle. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[b]Pathway[/b] is a beautifully looking game, but underneath it all a very repetitive and dull experience that leaves a sour taste of disappointment. I can see a lot of love poured into this game, and it's a real shame that I can't recommend it. Hopefully, the devs will release a sequel or a DLC that will make it all better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041983381', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1653770332}
review: This game is fun and charming, but the cover system is extremely hard to parse. I'm never quite sure when I'll have a clear line of sight to an enemy, which is really, really bad in a game like this. The cover system might actually be extremely simple, but guessing what directions an enemy has cover in is impossible regardless. One can sometimes have a direct line of sight visually to an enemy, but the enemy will still receive full cover penalty for your character being slightly too far in a direction the enemy does have cover in. Truth be told, I'm just kinda angry that I can't determine line of sight by simply drawing a line from any part of my square to  the enemies body. If there's a reason for that, make it obvious visually, because it's frustrating otherwise. Walking into a position and realizing one doesn't have clear line of sight is perhaps the most frustrating things that can happen in games like these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054494423', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1652269402}
review:
Recommandation positive, mais j'aurais mis une moyenne si ça existait, la note négative me paraît trop dure.

Le jeu est agréable, très joli, assez chill et j'ai adoré le gameplay proposé, surtout les événements, avec différents choix. Les petites histoires proposées sont intéressantes, et j'aime bien découvrir quelques secrets durant mon exploration. Alors qu'en est-il des points négatifs ?

Le jeu n'a aucun vrai scénario, juste des courtes aventures. Les combats sont vite répétitifs et ennuyants, le jeu pêche sur le contenu proposé. Les succès sont bien intégrés, mais c'est honnêtement la seule chose qui m'a fait resté un peu plus longtemps sur le jeu, sans pour autant en avoir fait trop (47/75).

Un jeu "sympa", offert dans un bundle, qui m'a donc coûté peu, mais difficilement recommandable au vu du résultat global.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977467006', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1654718934}
review:
**THIS GAME REVIEWED AND TESTED ON STEAM DECK**

[b][u]Steam deck compatibility[/u][/b]
The game plays great through Proton, with no obvious issues. This game is a great candidate for setting 40hz refresh rate, and even comfortable at 20fps. This means you should get great battery life with this game, as it’s not very fast or action-heavy where you would need 60fps. The default gamepad controls work great, as the game is designed with gamepads in mind. Once again, runs great on Deck

[b][u] Game overview [/u][/b]
    Pathway is a great tactics game that I believe is geared for short bursts. I didn’t know anything about this game until I got it in a bundle, and it looked interesting. On my first play, I immediately recognized a similarity to FTL in the style of travel in the game. You have fuel as a resource that is used up on each point traveled on the map. Each one has different scenarios that could affect you on your journey positively or negatively.

    The correlation between FTL and Pathway ends when you get to the battle sequences however. The combat is very much in the style of X-Com, with turn based tactics. You have your squad, and each one has special abilities and has a skill tree to add customization. There are multiple different weapons that can be acquired after encounters, or randomly on the road. There is a lot to like here, with the amount of depth in customization as there are many different characters to be unlocked for future runs. 

[b][u]Wrap up and score[/u][/b]
   Pathway is great for a gamer with not a lot of time to sit down and play for long periods of time. An adventure run can last 30-40 minutes, and it’s very easy to put down and pick back up in the middle of a run if needed. Tons of replayability with the unlockables and variety of runs. 

[b]8.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030893104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1650597967}
review:
This is more in the middle reviews leaning more on the side of non recommendation.  

There's only a few missions but within those missions will be branching paths that you can take.  It's all random on what event happens which gives the game some replayability.  Also depending on which characters you have brought to the mission, they may satisfy some personality trait which will give you more unique outcomes to these events.  

The battles is a turn based cover system.  Depending on which cover you're behind will give you different chances of getting hit.  With different characters having different traits and guns, they will all play slightly differently from another.  

Unfortunately, unless you bring someone that has the medical ability, this game will be very difficult to play.  Certainly if you're very good at the game then you will last through several battles, but if not you will be grounded down until you fail the mission.  I don't understand why everybody can't heal at least a little bit.  Having a dedicated healer in a group seems silly and outdated IMHO.  Perhaps it's not even about healing, but also about reviving a character - which needs somebody with first aid to do!!  Again, if you have not brought that person than you might as well just forget about it if you're getting shot or bit by dogs.

In the end, this is a good game.  I'm just baffled by the need to have somebody with a medical ability around.
developer_response:
Hey!

Thanks for your feedback & review. One quick note in case you see this: You can indeed heal your people outside of combat by using a medkit/repairkit in the team journal/inventory. However, using them during combat is restricted to characters with the medkit ability.

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198185995181', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 900, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1685357978}
review:

review:
A fantastic time waster. Very nice atmosphere and great music. The fights are quite same-ish, but if you like turn based combat, they are still fun.
My main gripe with the game is - it's too short! You unlock the characters quite fast, level them up and there are only 5 missions, which are soon completed. The end is also rather anti climactic.
So, as a short, relaxing, fun distraction from real life, this is perfectly fine. If you look for a turn based combat sim you can pump hundreds of hours in, look somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088036738', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1654934489}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031249189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1649623121}
review:
Surprisingly good game! Graphical style and setting is classic and well executed. Missions, scenarios, and storyline well-written and with good enough variety of random events. The tactical combat system is simple, but turns out to work very well. There are a number of different approaches and strategies that can be used with success, which along with the number of different characters increase replayability. 

The only thing I really find lacking in this game is the amount of content. Even if the story-based missions contain a number of maps and encounters, there are only a few of them. As an experienced gamer, playing through the game casually and then again on Hardcore mode would net you some 20-40 hours of game-time. After that there is a certain amount of replayability, especially considering steam achievements. 

But there could have been so much more! More and longer missions, more adventure, more story! 

I guess finding the only downside is "I want more" is a really good rating for a game. This is a really good one. Lets hope for a sequel or a DLC or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030510889', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2418, 'last_played': 1684679863}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005918420', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1649554118}
review:
This is one of those games that you wish had a 'meh' recommendation option. Atmospherically, it does a great job of feeling like Indiana Jones. The problem is that the combat is just a fairly shallow X-Com clone. It starts to wear out is welcome after a few hours. It probably could last longer if it weren't for the fact that combat is basically the entirety of the game. Everything else is quite perfunctory. It would be great if there were some real exploration or something to make the game feel less monotonous.

I wish I liked it more. Then again, I wish there was more to it to like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025124478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1649510424}
review:
스토리도, 모험도, 전투도... 게임의 깊이가 너무 얕다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117345802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1650302654}
review:
Great Tactical RPG, but not for everyone.

Pathway is a great little game that I would love to play more... on my phone. A playthrough has a good lenght, and the combat is exciting, if a bit repetitive (mostly the stages). However, the random loot and the quantity of characters increase the "need" to play it, the "just one more mission" feeling. The technical aspects of the game are ok, but not spectacular. I would have love to see a more detailed image of the characters, as well as a long biography.

My final comment is: Germans made a game about killing Nazis? Why not!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079732032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1648979757}
review:
Decently fun, got this game in a bundle but I reckon I might have bought it in any case. The overworld rpg elements are quite fun, but I found the combat to lack a certain punch. Quite generic tile turn based combat, it serves its purpose, but I find myself finding combat annoying, as it takes me away from the overworld stuff.

Overall, I'd mostly recommend this if you're looking for some simple adventuring fun, but maybe wait until it's on sale or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057925551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1653091050}
review: Really charming and relaxing game. Great sound, great art, and a good save feature that makes it easy to drop out / jump back in at any time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038697010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1649267270}
review:
Langsame, wenig taktische Kämpfe treffen auf ein undurchdachtes Levelingsystem der spielbaren und freischaltbaren Charaktere. 'Into the Breach' hat gezeigt, wie man es spannender machen kann.

Dabei ist die Kampagne und die Ästhetik des Spiels, sowie die Overworld Map so schön, dass ich das Spiel trotz seiner großen Mängel einmal durchspielen musste.

Im Sale kann man es durchaus mal probieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966877172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1649535002}
review:
I was excited about Pathway, but it's turned out to be pretty dull. This is a perfect example of what happens when a game is made by a team of artists with no game design experience. They've made a beautiful game, but the beauty is only skin deep. They've copied features from better games, but without understanding why those features worked in their source games; as a result, the features don't work well in Pathway.

[b]TL;DR[/b]
- All the gun stats, enemy HP bars, and enemy armor are pointless window dressing. Basically, every gun does 1 damage and every enemy has 2 health.
- The only objective in every combat is "kill all enemies". 
- Your special abilities are all pointless and you'll never need to do anything besides regular attacks.
- There's no tactical depth at all and usually no need to even move your units.
- Everyone is always behind cover from everyone else, so the cover mechanics are pointless.

[b]Full Review[/b]

As other reviewers have noted, there's almost no tactical depth. You've got a team of 3 - 4 units with special abilities you'll never use, and weapons with stats that don't matter. There are different types of guns with different quality levels and different stats, but  The combat never has any objectives besides "kill all of the enemies".

[b]There's usually no tactical advantage to moving[/b], and in fact I almost never move my units after the first turn. The enemy is usually behind cover, and usually distributed in a way where you can't flank them without exposing your own units. The enemies will almost always move into attack range so they can attack you, meaning there's usually no need to hunt them down. So every turn, I have each character do a regular attack on the nearest enemy with my first action, and reload with my second action. Very rarely, I'll use an ability like Hunker Down (or whatever it's called) or use the medkit if someone's accrued enough damage. The only tactical decision you'll ever make isn't even really a decision - shoot the enemy medic before shooting the other soldiers.

[b]Cover doesn't really matter.[/b] Cover gives a roughly 50% chance to dodge incoming fire. In XCOM, cover matters because it's limited and because there are actual mission objectives and you actually have to move. In Pathway, if there's cover anywhere in a straight line from one unit to another, they have cover from each other. This means that everyone is pretty much always behind cover from everyone else. Since everyone is always behind cover and flanking isn't practical, all that cover really means is that combat takes roughly twice as long because roughly half of the shots are missing their targets.

In the rare cases where there is high cover, you can hide behind high cover and your characters will step out to take a shot. They won't do this with partial cover, so the same object that's giving you partial cover also gives your targets partial cover from you. Stupid!

[b]Your weapon stats don't really matter[/b]. You'll find weapons with more damage, more range, more accuracy, a bigger magazine, or better crit rates, but none of that really makes any difference because of the way the game is balanced. Range doesn't matter because there are always enemies in range. Damage doesn't matter because it nearly always takes 2 shots to kill an enemy, regardless of what weapon(s) you're using. Magazine size doesn't matter because you (almost) never need to move and can (almost) always use your second action to reload. I've never noticed any of my attacks to crit, so my impression is that crit rate doesn't matter either. Accuracy actually matters, but not enough to make a big difference.

The only type of weapon where stats matter is shotguns; a default shotgun has so little range that it's essentially useless compared to other weapons. However, there are upgraded shotguns which can actually kill an enemy in one hit. Magazine size does actually matter for the shotguns, because you have to spend actions to move in order to be able to shoot anyone, so you don't end every turn with an extra action left over for reloading.

[b]Your abilities don't really matter[/b], because they're poorly designed and don't fit the game balance. The enemies don't clump together, so AOE attacks are useless. Enemies pretty much always die in two hits, so anything that debuffs the enemy is a waste of time. Reaction shots are underpowered - you give up attacking during your turn for a chance to attack during the enemy turn, but unlike XCOM you never need to do this because there are always enemy units in range.

[b]Your armor is useless[/b] in missions with cultists, because no matter how much armor you have, a single attack from any cultist or their undead allies will completely erode all armor.

In between combats, you move around on a world map that is functionally almost identical to the sector map in FTL. The developers apparently didn't realize that what makes this work in FTL is the rebel fleet chasing you across the sector. In Pathway, there's no time pressure, and the map is really just a time-wasting mechanic. The flavor text is never interesting, and the loot you find doesn't really matter per the above gameplay flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002569726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1649929686}
review:
I guess it's a thumbs up for me.  I'd give it a 6/10.  Gameplay is fun for what it is, and the graphics are I guess what one would expect from a 16-bit-wannabe game.  In game, most character abilities are useless, which makes combat feel really repetitive after a while.  There's also essentially no replayability.
Also, that narrator, Jesus Christ.  The game is quite literally voiced by a neckbeard.

From best to worst for games I've played in this genre:
FTL
Crying Suns
Convoy
Pathway
Into The Breach

author: {'steamid': '76561198813065278', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1652088884}
review:
Avant toute chose, j'y ai joué hors-ligne donc mon temps de jeu sur steam ne reflète pas le temps passé sur le jeu.

C'est inintéressant à souhait. J'ai lu que le studio avait mis plus d'un an pour finaliser la techno d'éclairage grâce à du voxel, et j'espère qu'ils sauront la réutiliser au mieux parce que c'est malheureusement le seul intérêt du jeu.

Tout est lent, les actions ne sont pas très claires, tous les choix s'avèrent vides et on finit par les faire parce qu'il faut cliquer, et rien d'autre.

Je ne vais pas plus descendre le jeu parce que rien ne sert de s'acharner, mais je pense que l'on m'a compris.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971987416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1649005224}
review:
I like it.  I won't pretend that this is an amazing game, but I like it.  The theme is fun and the gameplay fits the narative well.  

This is your standard branching path/choose your own adventure type of game.  Each of the characters has an ability that may allow you to skip the dice rolls for a more favorable outcome.  The events are a bit of all over the place, but capture the theme well.

Combat is turn based strategy.  It's a bit bare bones, but that's part of the appeal for me.  I don't want to have to get super involved with character builds and placement.  A typical combat encounter takes less than 5 minutes to play out which I enjoy as longer combats would feel grindy.

All in all, I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a light game to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027332288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1649691933}
review: A fun turn-based skirmish combat game with excellent pixel graphics. The game mechanics can be a little opaque and there are only 5 missions, but the randomised elements and the depth of mechanics and breadth of characters to use makes up for it. Good for 20 - 30 hours if you aren't a completionist and well worth it for the pulp Indiana Jones style setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126585472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1648741952}
review:
We're doing one thing, and one thing only, killing Nazis. 

Very fun game. It's like x-com and Indiana Jones had a baby. The retro presentation is nice and has decent replay value. I keep coming back to it every few months. Did I mention you get to kill Nazis?

author: {'steamid': '76561197966661134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1649382430}
review:
I've gone through three runs to end of the first section and not survived once. Not sure what I need to be doing differently, and that just adds to the frustration. I'm sure there's a reason the bad guys can shoot through walls when I can't, why they can shoot farther than I can, and on and on. To be fair, the game has given me plenty of loot that sounds like it would help, like bulletproof vests and such, but it won't let me equip any of it. In the end it looks like its encouraging me to skip fights.
Most reviews are positive, and the game looks nifty, but I'm not willing to spend more time on another run trying to figure out why this is supposed to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031122155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1648680869}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110916310', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1648571216}
review:
[h1]XCOMとFTLを足して4で割った、薄いカルピスみたいなゲーム[/h1]
　XCOM風の戦闘がメインのゲームなのですが、そこがつまらないという哀しみを背負っています。
　キャラ育成にあまり幅がないという点も、戦闘のつまらなさに拍車をかけています。
　ゲーム性部分のうち装備収集要素だけはそこそこ楽しい気はするのですが、いい装備を集めたところでキャラ育成と戦闘はつまらないままです。
　もちろん欠点ばかりではなく、他の方がレビューで書かれているように、インディー・ジョーンズっぽい雰囲気は評価すべき点だとは思います。
　しかし、それゆえにストーリーがシンプルすぎるという問題点もあって、全5面のうち3面ぐらいまでクリアすれば、ストーリーのパターンを覚えて食傷気味になってしまいます。
　逆に言えば3面クリアまではストーリーを楽しめるので、3面で止めるのであれば楽しめると思います。
　オススメはしません。

　ちなみにインディー・ジョーンズっぽい探検がしたいのなら、Curious expeditionっていうゲームがオススメです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054420220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1657794911}
review:
A fantastic game that I wish had more content. The gameplay is enjoyable, but sadly starts to feel repetitive incredibly quickly. Combat is fun and feels fairly balanced overall, it's just that most encounters tend to play out in roughly the same way. More variety in combat objectives, non-lethal options, more skills, mod support, and a bigger campaign -- these are all things that could've elevated Pathway into a timeless classic of its genre.

Sadly, what we got instead was a solid game that's best enjoyed in 60 minute increments; play any longer than that, and the repetitive nature of combat will surely get on your nerves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985162819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1648584179}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034379048', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1648478673}
review:
A reluctant thumbs down for me. Pathway is charming and fun, but simply too shallow. By the second adventure, you'll have seen everything it has to offer, and continuing to play will only reward you with more experience and loot (the latter at a frustratingly slow pace).

The tactical battles are sorely lacking. Combat is a contest of how well you can flank or kite enemies, with very little synergy between party members. Only a handful of abilities are actually useful. (Headshot, an ability that can instantly finish off a wounded enemy, is comically useless, as its only utility is fighting enemies that take 3+ hits to kill. Unless you are extremely underequipped, every enemy can be killed in 1-2 hits anyway.)

The larger travel map is reminiscent of FTL, and works pretty well. No complaints there.

The story mostly consists of gestures and homages at pulp adventure films like Indiana Jones, and has some subtle sci-fi elements that work really well at setting up mysteries. However, there's rarely any payoff, Hilariously, almost all of the adventures' final fights resolve the main conflict in cutscenes, and the fight itself is simply you mopping up the surviving enemies.

The game has an adjustable difficulty, but is overall incredibly easy. Even on the highest difficulty setting, I ended most adventures with maxed out supplies (which includes healing and repair items), nearly full health, and plenty of ammo. The only resource I ever ran low on was gas. You'll quickly learn how to either overwhelm foes in 1-2 combat rounds, or easily kite them, negating most of their attacks.

Overall, a lot of good ideas here, but they're spread too thin, with too little variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049068041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1590168529}
review: Chucklefish has earned a reputation for greenlighting any game with pretty pixelated graphics and good music, and Pathway is no exception. Pathway takes some of the decision-based components of FTL and combines them with the turn-based gameplay seen in XCOM to make an incredible take on the Action Movie genre. The game is clearly taking a satirical rip on Indiana Jones that comes across well without being too hackney. Overall the gameplay is fun if a little punishing. The graphics are gorgeous, easily some of the best I've seen from an indie game in this style. Definitely a nice game to pick up if you are into XCOM styled games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042025802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1674235029}
review:
For some reason the game is not showing my gameplay time while offline, which is most of it as this is my go-to game for train and plane trips, and has been for years. 

If you like turn based strategy games XCOM style, Indiana Jones, beautiful 2D art and generally a relaxing game you can play over and over, this is the game for you,

author: {'steamid': '76561198389047701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4037, 'last_played': 1639702462}
review: Pathway quickly became samey, I often found myself in similar situations. The combat was quickly bogged down with increased health and the isometric angle does not go well with the turn based combat. There are vastly superior turn based strategy games, and vastly superior rouge like games. There are even vastly superior turn based strategy rouge like games. The only unique thing this game has going for it is the aesthetic, which to its credit is beautiful and expressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037464181', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1673119342}
review:
Неплохая история выполненная в отличном пиксельном стиле. Путешествуя по разным теплым странам мы катаемся на джипе и убиваем нациков. Понравилось что персонажи сохраняют снаряжение, а чтобы открыть еще персонажей нужно выполнять условия. Цели миссии разняться в зависимости от главы. Да довольно незамысловато но игра не плохая. Повествование подогревает интерес. Здесь есть некий дух приключений в стиле Индианы Джонса)) по скидке можна брать, особенно кому нравиться такая графика.

PS. Русский язик есть, его можно найти в группе в комюнити или на сайте ZoG

It's X-Com x FTL x Indiana Jones

author: {'steamid': '76561198277519118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 4818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1646503811}
review:
Pathway is an interesting marriage between a board game and tactical turn-based gun battles. The style of the game is similar to Jagged Alliance, but with an Indiana Jones background. You don't play any single story, but rather select single adventures, split into 1 to 3 travel boards. Completing an adventure brings you back to the main menu where you can select another adventure to explore. There are only 5 adventures available. This game is extremely short on content and suffers from many design flaws.

The lack of solid continuation is annoying, but it's not completely brain dead. You get to keep characters who can be unlocked on the boards or through achievement hunting. You also keep a pool of equipment which can be upgraded, but this is not necessary to finish all the content. A lot of the features in Pathway are overkill for what the tactical battles bring. 

The very first thing you notice when you start playing the tactical battles is the mismatch between the engine and the actual strategies employed. It's very difficult to figure out lines of sight from the tactical rounds. Even when using range indicators on the bad guys or your mercenaries. It was also difficult to figure out what kind of action and in which order the characters can take them. There is a codex available describing the mechanic, but it's out of context and you typically don't see it before getting it wrong. Figuring how to gain Bravery for instance is buried inside the codex on a page button.

As you gain skills and equipment, the game becomes more difficult. The increase in difficulty however is applied with the RNG on your mercenaries gun skills. The handicap is applied only on gun skills, not on melee. As I progressed through the adventures, increasing the difficulty, I found that using melee all the time was simply more effective. I stopped using guns towards the end, the game was just crippling everything piloted by the RNG.

Characters can be healed and their armor can be repaired, but you have a limited amount of supplies on the travel board with which this can be done. This gets exploited by the engine as if it was an obsession. The engine seems to be choosing damaging armor or damaging health over killing your group. Aside from supplies, you also have to make sure you don't run dry on fuel. That never happened to me. Most of the random events on the travel board are just too kind and don't stress the game play enough to bother.

Overall, Pathway is an interesting game even with those flaws, but it lasts barely more than a weekend if you don't care about grinding for achievements. On a good sale, more than 50%, it may be worth the time. At roughly 15 hours played with only 5 adventures, I can't recommend this at its regular price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122410506', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1679781912}
review:
A fairly fun Xcom + Indiana Jones lite.
The adventures stories are cool but not too engaging. The paths you take is a good idea but due to unnecessary gas wasting it is usually best to take the most direct route. And the combat is good enough. Lacks the depth you would like when the gameplay is mostly the combat.

Scratches the itch for a more casual XCOM like game but starts to feel repetitive.
I still enjoyed playing it and it's worth picking up on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197980128363', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1660206617}
review:
It was a really hard decision for me weather to recommend this game or not. I vote yes, cause i played ~10h, so it's takes my time and it wasn't bad time, but may be i must spend time in another game.

So, what do we have? 
Tactical game with primitive tactical gameplay, Indiana Jones setting, and some campaigns with common equipment and characters (you finish chapter 1 with rare pistol and lvl up your hero - you can use them in next chapters also)

Interesting:
- You have different events on map (but, it's not really a lot of choise - if you want to win you need to find shorter way to finish with as many encounter as possible, or your gasoline will finish and you can die )
- I like this setting - bright and fresh.
- Stylish this pixel art - awesome!

Boring: 
- Tactical gameplay very simple and the same for all time that you will spend on this game
- Just 2 enemy fractions  (every have 4-5 types of enemies) - not so much. 
- Character lvl up system too simple, without interesting skills (just choose between +1 to Vitality or Agility, or choose between 2 non-usable skills)
- Fuel system - why so many points of interest, which you can't go because you will die in the desert if fuel is gone? (I think the developers could have made this feature better)

So, i spent time because I hoped to find more interesting things in late gameplay, but this game can't give something new to you. But it's not worst spending of your time, if you looking for something tactic game with pixel art.

Buy it on sale for some bucks - it's worth price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024130503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1644314582}
review:
TLDR; Worth getting on sale for about $5 to $7, if you're looking for a quick cross between FTL and X-COM set inside an Indiana Jones movie. 

I really wish Steam had a neutral rating. I came very close to asking for a refund on this game because there are a couple of very sloppy UI features that make the game difficult to enjoy. The map scrolling is terrible and the amount of the map you can see on screen is dictated by your screen resolution. This is especially annoying because it also affects aiming. You may have a sniper rifle that can fire up to 11 spaces away, but only 8 fit on the screen. You can cheat by running the game in a lower resolution on your 1920 x 1080 monitor, but still.... why the hell isn't there a zoom function or the ability to scroll and target/preview hit percentage at the same time? 

As for the gameplay itself, let me say that the music and artwork are gorgeous and I love the style and premise of the game, but combat is repetitive and way too frequent. the balance of combat and random events are about 75% / 25%, when it should be the other way around. (Or the combat should be spiced up with a wider variety of enemies, attacks, or other tactical elements)

Also, by default, if you hit the end turn button and still have actions left, it'll skip directly to the next round rather than warning you. (Luckily you can turn this on in the options, but I feel like this probably should have been switched on be default, since the game isn't great about telling you how many actions you have left)

All these complaints aside, if you're looking for a light-weight pick it up/put it down again turn-based tactics game, this certainly scratches that itch... at least until the novelty wears off.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198061908784', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1642798759}
review:
This had great potential, but was unfortunately a disappointment.  
The good- Great strategy game that has some really nice art work and sounds to enhance game play.  I like the opportunity that allows players to change the difficulty.  Seems like a good storyline and engaging game play.

The bad- A major problem is this is a random luck game.  These types of games depend on having enough of one supply (fuel) to finish the map.  Once you run out of fuel, you hope that you will 'luckily' come across some and get it back to your vehicle before your HP is 0.  I'm not into replaying levels over and over in the hope this time I will be lucky to hit scenarios to give me fuel.  For me, I'd rather wage money than waste my time doing a level a 4th freakin' time in hopes things will go my way.  With this handicap, don't bother exploring other parts of the map.  I'm unsure why this game required an 8G video card.  Graphics are nice, but not exceptional.  Oh well, guess I'll play poker....

author: {'steamid': '76561198306830769', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1642737377}
review:
Great indie game, stylish and with a great indiana jones feel.
Solid 5/7, could have had a couple more music tracks in the main menu loop.

Co-op for next patch/dlc/installment please

-- /TLDR --

The campaign is short but has plenty of replayability, mainly for exploration and combat.
Combat is nice and fun but it got a little stale for my taste one you played the 50th encounter.

Would have been great to have other types of interactive encounters aside combat to break up the repetitiveness, I found myself skipping some combat scenarios bc I was done with it at times.

You could try to make runs avoiding combats but being that it is kinda central to the game it doesn't make much sense, but there are ways to avoid it if you have the right characters, a nice RPG detail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211990992', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 5171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5017, 'last_played': 1642740781}
review: 这游戏怎么说呢，心思都花在没用的地方了，恰如鸡肋，食之无味，弃之可惜。游戏的美工确实很棒，包括甚至每次进游戏的片头都会根据你上次退出的地点而变化，可这有嘛用呢？还是不好玩啊！本质上本作就是个肉鸽游戏，战略性很小，想体验RSLG的还是洗洗睡吧。地图虽大，但是地点基本无法一次逛遍，况且地点事件又是随机的，那你做那么大地图有意义吗？游戏的主要玩法还是选择路线与有限资源之间的取舍，很无聊，真的可惜了这么好的美工了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040333562', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1803, 'last_played': 1636992869}
review: 有趣的小遊戲，殺時間不錯。但是每次跳點都慢吞吞的。商人太少道具買，武器工具等多數是升級版，人物格子如果多一個飾物/工具位會更好。技能好像不太實用，能用的就幾個。

author: {'steamid': '76561198407740230', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1632791069}
review:
Este jogo contém muitas coisas que adoro, como os elementos de RPG, o estilo visual, a trilha sonora e a jogabilidade (apesar da mesma enjoar um pouco rápido). 
Tenho me divertido bastante com este título, como eu disse, o mesmo possui um certo fator enjoativo, pois as batalhas são repetitivas, mas talvez seja apenas o meu gosto, talvez um dos poucos defeitos do jogo seja a falta de tradução em português, ao menos por enquanto. Existem muitos textos e diálogos interessantes, e até mesmo escolhas, que mudam fatores no gameplay, mas que por estarem em inglês ou outras línguas, acabam se perdendo para os jogadores que não dominam tais idiomas.
No geral é um jogo excelente, muito divertido e mais complexo do que parece, muito bom para se divertir e explorar diferentes combinações e tipos de estratégias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054975471', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1642183082}

author: {'steamid': '76561198300127659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1642180442}
review:
I'm going to recommend this game but just barely.
It feels like a mobile game, many have gone over the game play so I won't take a ton of time there.
Basically for combat you hide behind walls and shoot Nazis and other things. (Think super simplified tactics types)
The overworld map reminds me of Oregon Trail, but this is not a bad thing. I enjoy the randomized events; however I either have really bad RNG or this game likes to make you run battles. The events seemed to mostly be fights.
The part I enjoy about this game is the plot, but unfortunately it could only hold my attention for 3 hours, as the combat portion bores the hell out of me and happened so often.
I also really enjoy the aesthetic, the graphics are well done and fit the tone of the overall game very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011160772', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1703780323}
review: Very entertaining game. Game play is like U.F.O. Enemy Unknown combined with Orion Trail, nice way of working. The different missions are nice and have good stories. The missions get really difficult with each newer mission but can be tweaked, start off with the first mission and play slightly easier and gain loot and upgrade your team. Replaying mission do not get boring or feel like grinding as each pathway in the mission is randomized and the encounters as well. Plus changing your team also changes the options in the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198212756349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1611699581}

review:
Pathway is one the best strategy games I've ever played. Heck, Maybe even thee best. In Pathway you command a small team of treasure hunters and adventurers as you fight against Germans, Zombies and many other abominations On your quest too foil the Germans plans and Seek wealth with value beyond your wildest dreams.

If you like Other strategy games Then you'll love pathways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098699298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1640628165}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058179912', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1640531834}
review: 這款遊戲美術風格雖然走點陣圖風格，但是他的字體也非常復古，復古到中文字體都糊成一團的程度，根本難以閱讀，我喜歡點陣風格的遊戲，但不代表遊戲一定要使用30年前的字體，現在大部分玩家都使用2k跟1080p的螢幕，如果使用了平滑ui的選項，字體會好看很多，但因為是用12px或14px大小的文字，字體會小到讓人受不了，這是要我全程拿放大鏡玩遊戲嗎？

author: {'steamid': '76561199042820372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1638892605}
review:
Ok, it was a hard decision for me weather to recommend this game or not. I vote yes, but I really hope that devs read my review (as well as some others already posted before) and work to improve their game design to make their good game a great one!

Why Yes:
- turn-based tactics are rare these days so fans of the genre have to support devs who dare.
- really loved their previous game (Halfway). Remember thinking that if they successed it would be great if they develop a bigger game. They did (in a way).
- if you're into Indiana Jones you'll love the setting of Pathway (not my cup of tea, but still).
- once you get used to some game design flaws you can get lots of fun from the game!

Why it was hard to vote Yes:
- repeatative encounters. You have to pass a lot so pretty soon you'll stop reading and just click 'em through to get results. This kind of kills the exploration part of the game.
- if you want to be successful you have to fight. Technically you can avoid combat, but that'll leave you without loot, supplies and gas. So a dominant strategy is to fight every time you can.
- a SLOW combat. God! It's so frustrating: slow animations, only single move action per character per turn, no auto-end turn! I believe this part of the game has a great untapped potential.

What to improve:
STORY:
- have an overarching general plot that connects all five adventures
- have a classic "The End" after the fifth adventure, rewarding people who made it this far (I've beaten all five and feel a bit sad that they were a bit generic without the grand final)

EXPLORATION:
- hide the final location! Starting from the second adventure if you hide the exit the exploration will have so much sense. Player will have to search for clues (maybe finding a map shows where their destination is)? Players will have to spend more time exploring!
- hide the key to final destination somewhere on the map! Give reason to explore more!

COMBAT:
- allow double move action (zombies will really sworm players, there will be much more tactical choices, combat will  become so much fater)
- add auto-end turn checkbox. Once all characters spent all their actions let their turn end automatically!
- speed up basic animations in combat

Hope this helps, really looking forward to game updates and your next project. Meanwhile it probably makes sense to buy and complete Halfway on this account as well...

author: {'steamid': '76561198054421878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1639533675}
review: The game has a retro feel with some newer mechanics. Upgrading and replayability are a plus, particularly due to randomly generated levels. Some abilities are a bit wonky, as enemies will go out of their way to completely avoid them. Enemy AI needs to be re-worked a little bit. Dogs and zombies act as you might expect. My favourite character is the Baron due to the early game sniper. Unfortunately, some of the unlockable characters have more or less the same abilities of the others, shuffled around a bit. I understand the need for team balance, but I was hoping for something a little more intriguing. After unlocking eight of the characters, there isn't any need to go for the remainder, since they can be subbed by the other characters' abilities. Overall, I have a positive experience with this game, and would recommend it for play if you like turn-based combat that isn't too challenging. The lore is reminiscent of Indiana Jones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981695458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1639181413}
review: A choose your own adventure game, with some light tactics, which the majority of can be avoided. Light exploration and lots of discovery are this games bread and butter, with the rpg/tactics elements there to keep things interesting. Lots of potential for this style of game, 7/10 because of a few nit picks, game mechanic issues, and it just didn't blow me away but it's a solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067369504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1642937050}
review: A fun little adventure with definite Indiana Jones atmosphere. Only issue is, it's getting a bit repetitive after a while, especially the combat (which is to frequent for my taste, I would have liked it to be even more story driven). Also VERY frequent crashes, at least >3 per journey. Thumbs up rating since there is no neutral rating which would have been more appropriate. I hope more adventures will be added at some point.

review: It's a small, X-COMish game with adventures straight out of an Indiana Jones movie. Travel the Middle East, shoot nazis and cultists, find treasure, loot better weapons, and move on. It's not the biggest game of the genre, but it has a fun atmosphere and it's a cute little project. Don't buy it at full price, but definitely check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027043293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1638086288}
review:
I wish I liked this game more than I do. It absolutely the nails its Indiana Jones-ish, pulpy tone. The pixel graphics are gorgeous, the presentation is spot-on. Even the music sounds like the composer's been listening to the Raiders of the Lost Ark soundtrack on repeat.

The problem is, the game itself isn't terribly deep. The campaign map plays out like FTL-- there are random story encounters and combat segments placed along a branching track to the end of the mission. The combat plays out like X-Com but with significantly less depth. That's too bad because combat encounters are where you'll spend most of your time.

The characters each have different skills that  broadly mark out different classes, but none of them are very  interesting or distinct. The enemies either shoot at you or go into overwatch. that's about it. That's the whole system.

Honestly this would have been better as a mostly text-based experience. The combat sucks all the energy out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072753258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1642091703}
review:
Wie schon oft erwähnt, eine Mischung aus Jagged Alliance und Indiana Jones und beides wird durchaus gut aber nicht perfekt umgesetzt.
Das Setting ist phantastisch und lässt Indy(4) Vibes aufkommen und alleine dafür geniesse ich es.
An Pixelgraphik im Allgemeinen scheiden sich oft die Geister - ich persönlich mag sie und für mich sieht Pathaway unglaublich gut aus (noch eine ganze Schippe über z.B. Loop Hero). Genau in diesem Style würde ich mir ein X-Com remake wünschen.
Die Kampfsystem ist simpel aber gut, doch für meinen Geschmack etwas ZU simpel. Hier hätte mehr Tiefgang nicht geschadet.
Der Erkundungsteil auf der Map gefällt mir und fördert im Grunde die Wiederspielbarkeit durch begrenzte Ressourcen wie Kraftstoff, Munition oder andere Hilfsmittel.
Die Story ist gut und die "random" events zu entdecken macht Spaß aber alles in Allem fehlt mir der große Reiz bzw der letzte Kick, um immer wieder zu spielen wenn man erstmal alles gesehen hat.

Bohrt das Kampf- u. Charaktersystem auf und fügt eine Art Endgame hinzu und ich bin dabei... aber das is natürlich Meckern auf sehr hohem Niveau.

Positiv:
- Setting: Nazis, Mysterien und Wüste - besser gehts nicht
- Graphik
- simple, spaßige Taktik-Kämpfe
- random events

Negativ:
- das einfach Kampfsystem und flache Charaktersystem lassen keinen rechten Wiederspielwert aufkommen

author: {'steamid': '76561197981162179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1637556469}
review:
Deserves its mediocre metacritic score.

A low effort ripoff of indianna jones stories with xcom probability gameplay. "Oh a 90% chance to hit? Oh but it's against AI? lol, lmao, you missed. This is good game design". The meta management is brutally unforgiving, again reminding us all that difficulty doesn't indicate good game design, it shows the devs aren't creative enough to make a balanced game. The armor system, the supply system, all of it is underwhelming. I can't be bothered to pick up the game because wherever I am, it's in an unwinnable scenario, even with restarts. Cool. F that.

I'd refund if I could.

review: A very well thought through tactics game with a lot of Indiana Jones and other new adventure film references, simple, yet varied characters and lots of weapons, skills and, of course, paths to choose from. It has a good campaign and other modes to play as well as a great and readable art style and wonderful music by Gavin Harrison whom you might know from such games as Light (with both great gameplay, art style, and music, all of which I adore). All in all, worth your time and money.
