author: {'steamid': '76561198007353824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1636935617}
review:
This game will not challenge you on a tactical level.  The combat is too easy.  Turn-based combat works much better in an expeditions game because it's a time of history where wars were fought with a mixture of mellee and ranged weapons and firearms weren't what they are in this period of history.  In this game you can walk up to your enemies and shoot them at point blank range.  It is highly unrealistic in other ways too.  Your nazi enemies know very little about fighting as a team.  This game has very bad AI at least on easy difficulty.  Indeed, it is unacceptable for this type of game; and this is coming from a Total War gamer(more than 7000 hours).  It seems from what I've read that the AI doesn't improve with higher difficulty settings either.

You do have to be careful about your fuel and other ressources sometimes.  Your consumables apply to grenades, stitching gear, and grenades so I think we can say that this game is lacking in the inventory system, although it's not as bad as Deus ex 2.  

It is a roguelike where no two playthroughs are exactly the same.  However, you are doing the same basic things such as fighting nazis or zombies(not a big difference), helping villagers, resting at oasises and such.  

The graphics do a good job.  There is a good variety of characters and gear.

In conclusion, my verdict is to not get this game even if it's on salebecause the AI is unacceptably poor.  Could have been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561199011762985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1636735574}
review: I received pathway while it was on sale and have greatly enjoyed it. It is not some thrilling fps shooter, however it reminds me of playing games like fire emblem. That and the combined Indiana Jones feel allow it to be a fun game. When I first purchased it I was worried I would disappointed with the simplistic gameplay, yet it has been everything but disappointing. There are some repetitive aspects of combat but that is the same with all games, the most interesting part of combat is the randomized nature of the turn based combat. Combined with not guaranteed weapon accuracy you have an adventurous battle. And the added cherry on top of this beauty of a game is that the achievement Nazi Hunter. I hope that someone reading this might consider picking up this hidden gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156876169', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1643146298}
review: 确实不错 确实挺好玩

author: {'steamid': '76561197983970666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1636558158}
review:
The game does get a little repetitive after a few hours. So this is a yes with the caveat that you don't expect to get a lot of time out of the game. If you get it for the right price (whatever that is for you), then I think it's enjoyable. There is a story, but I don't care for it. But there are a lot of scenarios that might be interesting. The game is overall pretty and very well made. The only downside I found to the art during combat is that I frequently can't tell depth or where a wall is. I think this largely comes down the perspective used in the art. Or perhaps the separation of colors. Something with the art style makes it more difficult in combat at times. You have to rely on icons for navigation and not the art which I would say is a minus. Sometimes the world meshes and is kind of unimaginative at times, but other times it's very nice to look at. 

I do feel like overall there was a missed opportunity to go bigger with this, but I respect that maybe they didn't want to do anything more. The enemy variety gets old pretty quick, the upgrades/progression is your typical "Well, just add a stat here and you won't notice the difference". So it's very non-impactful progression. Guns just get bigger numbers, armors just get bigger numbers. It's fine, just nothing unique. So some of the upgrading and such feels like more of a "Oh, a bigger number", but you don't really feel the impact of it. You just need the progression for progressions sake. But I don't think it's a dock, just not a positive either. (Same applies to skill trees). 

I do really like the character system where you upgrade characters and you can find/use them again and keep their upgrades. That's a fun implementation of it. 

Can definitely tell a lot of care was put into the game, it just misses a few notes. It's worth a try and doesn't get as boring/tedious as some of the other developers entries into the turn based genre. Once you find the rythem that the game wants you to find, it's pretty easy. 

I also wish they had more intricate encounters like bosses or unique fights. Rather than making it 'harder' by just chucking more basic enemies at you at the final areas. The missed opportunity for me was that the game has zombies and nazis, just go crazy with it at that point and do some crazy unique enemy types. Rather than 'basic melee enemy skinned as zombie' and 'basic ranged enemy skinned as nazi'

author: {'steamid': '76561198077398527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1701102495}
review:
Сразу хочу сказать главное: на самом деле это не стратегия, а RPG: набираете party, ходите по локациям, получаете лут. Классический цикл "выполнил – получил награду". 

Менеджмента ресурсов на стратегическом уровне нет. На стратегической карте можно только подлечиться и подправить броньку (если есть запасы, "supplies"), поднять уровень бойцов, если достигли, и выбрать, куда поедем дальше. Это всё. 

С точки зрения сбора ресурсов локации все одинаковые. Нельзя выбрать локацию, богатую определенным видом ресурсов. Процесс получения ресурсов из лута совершенно случаен: что выпадет, то и выпадет. Управлять тут нечем, просто берёте бензин и запасы, заменяете старое оружие новым. Замена – простая прогрессия: новое оружие чуть шибче стреляет или режет, новых тактических возможностей нет. Тактические возможности, кстати, очень невелики (это вам не Phoenix Point), а ИИ тупенький, так что периодически приходится делать давно забытые вещи, типа обегать здания по кругу, чтобы противники растянулись из компактной группы в линию и подходили поочередно. Тумана войны нет, прятаться нельзя, противники тоже видны. Ландшафт не разрушается.

Прогрессия противников совершенно линейная: "наци штурмовик I", "наци штурмовик II", ну и далее. Посмотреть, что противники умеют делать (сила стрельбы, природа атак, т.д.) нельзя, только догадываться по наблюдаемым эффектам. Зачем-то сделали две лестницы прогрессии оружия: по "редкости" и по "классу". Например, "редкое" ружжо первого класса лучше "обычного" ружья первого же класса, но чуть хуже "обычного" ружья второго класса. Зачем это, если особых свойств у редкого оружия всё равно нет?

Теперь еще скажу про одну вещь, которая уже не недоработка, а моральная позиция. Поскольку это на самом деле RPG с некоей "стори", то девелоперы пытаются заставить игрока играть так, как они задумали: большая часть персонажей заблокирована и их надо "разблокировать" достижениями; сценарии тоже нужно "разблокировать"; сохраниться толком нельзя – вместо этого можно создать нового игрока. Можно играть в режиме хардкор ("hardcore mode"), тогда все персонажи доступны сразу, но девелоперы на таких игроков обижаются и говорят "тогда х*ен вам, а не ачивки". И выкручивают им сложность на максимум. 

Пиксельная графика, кстати, неплохая, даже стильненькая. Несколько смущает, когда в нацистском "укрепленном лагере" стоят 4 танка или самолета, а во всем лагере защитников только 4 солдата да собака, но это уже придирки. Все же понимают, что это условность, вроде абстрактных узоров на восточном ковре.

В общем, в 1992 году это была бы отличная игра, пусть и RPG. А сейчас она выглядит привлекательно ну если только на общем фоне. Очень жаль, потому что есть неплохие и даже отличные игры, разработанные инди. Люди старались, но недостаточно; похоже, просто не хватило идей и кругозора. Может быть, в следующий раз получится?

author: {'steamid': '76561198026536397', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1360, 'last_played': 1636128876}
review:
Gra nie jest w żadnym aspekcie wybitna, początkowo byłem nawet zawiedziony, bo spodziewałem się bardziej czegoś w stylu amigowego Burntime (gdzie mamy prawdziwy surwiwal w postapokaliptycznym świecie) z dzisiejszymi mechanikami, a ostatecznie jest to podobne głównie w stylistyce graficznej i poruszaniu po mapie.

Ale na dłuższą metę - jest to dość dobra gra to zagrania "w wolnej chwili". Nie przeszkodzi rozgrywce to, że muszę na chwilę wstać i zrobić herbatę, pobawić się z dzieckiem czy kobieta wjeżdżająca pod nogi odkurzaczem. Po większe tytuły nie mając świętego spokoju nie sięgam, by nie przerywać historii, nie psuć immersji itp.

Tutaj rozgrywka jest prosta, walka jest prosta, mechaniki są proste, fabuła to bardziej narracyjne didaskalia. Mamy mechanizmy nagrody w postaci odblokowywania i szkolenia kolejnych najemników na wyższe poziomy, zbierania coraz to nowszego sprzętu (którego nie tracimy w kolejnych przygodach - elementy wyposażenia zostają na postaciach), bycia coraz lepszym kozakiem, który może już przejść do rozgrywania trudniejszych map.

Grafika jest bardzo spoko, muzyka też, raczej nie zdarzają się irytujące momenty. Czasem giniemy, bo kończy się paliwo - ot wylosowało się na mapie go za mało na wybranej przez nas drodze, ale to ważny element, który daje ten efekt, że trochę trzeba uważać i trochę mieć szczęścia - inaczej gra mogłaby się wydawać za łatwa (choć jak weźmiemy do trudnej mapy mniej doświadczonych najemników, to o łomot nietrudno, a można też przed rozpoczęciem przygody zmodyfikować ilośc początkowych zasobów jak i wielkość armii przeciwników podczas walk).

Wielka szkoda, że mapa taktyczna służy tylko do walki i nie możemy sobie pochodzić i czegoś pozbierać, albo z kimś porozmawiać - to jest coś, co mogłoby z tej gry uczynić prawdziwą perełkę. Tymczasem dostajemy coś, co może posłużyć raczej tylko za odskocznię. Niemniej, niezłą - u mnie z dysku nie znika, nawet jeśli nie odpalam jej przez kilka miesięcy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010152222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1636370365}
review: This game is fantastic fun and nails the in the Indiana Jones feel perfectly.  Sure it is a mild tactical game that will not match the likes of a dedicated tactical experience but that is not what it is trying to achieve.  Think of it more of an adventure combat board game with a fun roving big map mechanic which reveals encounters as you move around the Adventure locations that culminate in fun little battles where your heroes do turn based battle with their foes.  It a nutshell it is a fun Saturday afternoon game where you can play hotseat with your kids alongside you and everyone will enjoy playing as their chosen hero as you all work to upset the evil plans of various fiends in classic pulp story fashion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003521622', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 913, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1635953929}
review:
整體來說是不推薦的，主要是新鮮感只有初期，後期就是重複感較多，

章節只有5章，遊玩可能最多就6~8小時，如果你戰鬥能避就避可能更短，

角色雖多但走解鎖制，且角色還有等級制，如果只玩一輪，根本就是初期角色用到底，

雖然有事件的抉擇，但那僅限於特殊劇情有不同感受，路途的一般事件會遇到同樣的所以會慢慢無趣，

我覺得這是一款小品的遊戲而已，可以稍微打發時間，故特價入手會比較合適。

author: {'steamid': '76561197977046212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1635759198}
review:
This game is OK, but probably not worth buying unless you get it on sale. I only got about 3 hours out of it before I was bored. The graphics are excellent, the music does its job, the theme/genre is fun, and the writing and story are OK. Unfortunately, the gameplay is very boring and repetitive and this is where the game mostly falls short of the mark.

The game is basically split into combat mode and an overland travel mode where you pick your route along a map and make detours to explore locations. These routes and destinations are punctuated by events with a brief blurb of text, some art, and sometimes a choice or three. A few of these events are interesting and fun, but most are pretty straightforward and forgettable (you find nothing, or some soldiers, or some supplies, or a market). You only need to plan ahead a little bit to manage fuel and supplies to reach the destination, but this resource pressure does somewhat dampen the fun of exploring the maps.

The other part of the game is combat, which is where most of the game time is spent. The combat is very slow paced, you'll find yourself skipping/speeding up animations. The biggest issue here is that combat is tactically uninteresting. There is very little challenge on the default difficulty so not much strategy is required. The characters' special abilities are also extremely situational. With no deep tactical options to consider and few tradeoffs for actions, combat is reduced to basic positioning/probability and resource management. In most cases, having upgraded gear and sufficient numbers will guarantee victory.

The game has some roguelike elements as well. I believe the particular events are randomized in the game. There is also a random gear/treasure system. The issue I saw here was that the rarity and value of treasure was very rarely interesting or important. In a game about raiding tombs and shooting Nazis, I was expecting something more compelling in the treasure/valuables department. Maybe I should care more that I found a ceremonial robe worth $1200 (which will just be spent on junk in markets anyway). I would have preferred shorter runs with more interesting events so that every event is engaging. I mostly found myself groaning when the random event led to combat or when it was a non-event. I also ended up mostly skipping treasure scenes unless there was a weapon or armor item that seemed like a possible upgrade.

There is obviously a lot of talent and passion put into this game. I'd recommend for the developer to work on developing compelling choices in tactical combat and working on interesting variety/randomness. Maybe playing some more games in the genre would help identify good tactical choices that are fun/interesting and randomness that is rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042077545', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1635653317}
review: Game rules. It's basically an FTL 'em up that draws heavily from Indiana Jones with a bit more of a narrative focus. I feel like you'll probably know if the game is your jam from that description, honestly.

review: bon petit de stratégie, relativement dur, dans un style old school appréciable

author: {'steamid': '76561198197769161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1635527553}
review:
평가글 한 번도 써본적 없는데 쓰게 만든 겜

한 판 밖에 안 했지만, 하면서 계속 이럴거면 xcom을 하지 왜 이걸하고 있나 싶은 생각이 듦

캐릭터가 다양하다는 것에 마음이 들떴지만 그냥 커마창에 불과함
캐릭터 특성을 돌려막기 해놓은 것이랑 진급(레벨업)하면 얻는 특성란에 단순히 능력치가 오르는 것이 자리를 차지하는 모습을 보고 뒷목을 잡음
총이 있는 게임에서 특이한 능력이 별로 없으면 누가 먼저 뚝배기를 깨냐가 관건인데 그걸 보여주는 게임같음. 그냥 적 하나씩 왕따만들어서 죽이고 튀고 죽이고 튀면 다 깰거같음

쏘고 나서도 움직일 수 있다는 점은 매우 좋았지만, 
전투가 끝나고 전투불능 캐릭터가 회생불가해서 제정신으로 게임을 계속하지 못 했음(물론 내가 방법을 못 찾은 걸 수도 있고)
전투에서 일어난 일은 전투가 끝나기 전에 처리해야한다는 불편함이 숨을 턱 막히게 함

그리고 자잘한 부분에서 불편한 점이 너무 많음
한 칸 이동하는데 한 세월(캠프에서 회복이 가능인지라 돌아갔다 오는데 애들 차에서 내렸다 다시 타는게 진짜 짜증남. 스킵이 되는 것도 아니고)
맵 확대 없음(전투맵 전체적으로 볼려하는데 못 봄 wasd이동만 됨)
한 캐릭당 행동 2회인데 선택지 종류가 3이다보니 3다 써야할 것같이 생겨먹음(행동 횟수 얼마나 남았는지 숫자로 보여주면 편할걸)
캐릭터가 엄폐를 하고 있는지 모르겠음(커서 갔다대서 알아봐야함)
전투 끝나고 리로딩 선택지가 있는데 이걸 칭찬해야 될지 욕해야 될지 모르겠음
무기 설명에는 크리가 있는데, 전투시 총 겨눌때는 안 나오는점
정확도는 왜 떨어지고 높은지가 측면때문이란 걸 나중에 알았음. 인게임 설명이 없어서.

게임을 만들다 말았나, 게임플레이는 해보고 내놓은 건지 의문스러울 정도
도트퀄리티랑 캐릭터특성, 전투밸런스, 전략의 다양함 등 전부 떨어짐

환불하고 싶다만 악평달아놨으니 환불까진 안 하겠음

author: {'steamid': '76561198127836870', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1673157395}
review:
Some of the most fun I've had with a game like this in some time.

The design of the game is amazing, art style is awesome, the Indiana Jones vibes are great.  Highly recommended for fans of Turn Based Strategy games.  There is a decent amount of replay ability as well, although once you've run through it three or four times it does get a little predictable.

I haven't found any bugs or had any issues while playing the game either.  Just a smooth and fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198989641451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2229, 'last_played': 1698505468}
review:
Pathway versetzte mich in nostalgische Erinnerungen an Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Geheimprojekt DMSO und all die Pixelspiele um 1990+. 
Atmoshärisches gameplay, RPG-Elemente und eine unterhaltsame Geschichte mit all ihren variablen Wendungen haben und machen immer wieder Spass, auch beim 2ten+ durchspielen.
Wem das Kampfsystem zu langweilig wird kann Gegnerzahl und Schwierigkeit anpassen, der Hardcoremodus ist dann eine Nummer für sich.

Großartiges Spiel für einen angemessenen Preis, 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969211312', 'num_games_owned': 1366, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1685652012}
review: this is a really great game. its kinda like xcom meets indiana jones. theres more than 1 campaign. i havnt finished them all yet as i want to level up more of the characters first. but if you like turn based strategy like xcom. you will probably like this

review: I held off on getting this game when it first came out because the reviews were pretty brutal, but I don't regret getting the game the way it is now. It's charming and I'm having fun with it. The only warning I have is that it's kind of short. You can replay and unlock and it is procedurally generated but there are only 5 missions in total. (They got a slider scale for difficulty)

author: {'steamid': '76561198880276147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1710925826}
review: It's  like playing a cross between The Mummy and Indiana Jones, with the tactics of XCOM and the flavor of a TTRPG. If you are not used to tactical games, this one is a good start. Each adventure rises the bar and of course the difficulty, while elaborating on the overarching story. Replayability is made fun by the fact that you may get more money and better items, plus unlocking more characters for your party. If you are into old school adventure movies and pixel art, you're gonna love this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100157646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1632446819}
review: This is pretty great for a light tactics game. I would say the rogue-lite elements and the multiple characters encourage grinding, but this would be a real short game without it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389452077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1690985230}
review: I'm not really into turn-based combat games but the pixel art makes it for me. Overall: charming pixel art, enjoyable combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307103341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1628110879}
review:
Great aesthetics and storytelling kept me curious enough to play trough the entire game. 
The game mechanics are indeed a bit simple and could have been more varied, but i still found it entertaining enough to come back to this game over a few weeks. 
New unlockables becoming available throughout the game, kept asking for applying new strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013674478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1679290710}
review:
Pathway is one of the most fun games I have ever found on Steam. Visually, it looks beautiful with incredible animations and a great colour pallet. Playing this game is like watching an Indiana Jones movie; it's incredibly entertaining and doesn't become a bore.  However I will admit, there is some repetition to the combat system but besides that the fun will never end in this treasure hunting action rpg. 

Graphics 10/10

Play style 8/10

Story 10/10

Characters 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198016641188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3775, 'last_played': 1630112573}
review: As a turn-based combat fan, I really enjoyed this game. I don't usually replay games, but I did on this occasion; re-attempting to unlock characters and level up. I loved the little characters and their abilities and the variety of weapons. You can get through the combat quite quickly and depending the skills and abilities of the characters you have different options. I did find the "Cultist" enemies much harder than the other opposition. I'm not sure what I would compare the game to but I certainly look forward to future expansions to keep the adventure going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077130175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1626953062}
review:
A nice mix of roguelikes, xcom and classic Lucas Arts adventure games. 

Things I liked:
- fast and slim turn-based combat
- storytelling
- variety of characters, gear and play styles
- graphic style

Wished for:

author: {'steamid': '76561198104086371', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1626278652}
review:
这款游戏的战旗玩法还是很有意思，几类兵种互相配合，可以打出很爽快的战斗。
然而，这款游戏的缺点也是显而易见。就是重复度太高，在经历了初期的战斗摸索过后，队伍几乎没有什么成长，也就是在商人处换换武器，买买补给，升级一些没什么存在感的技能。很容易导致疲劳。
除此之外，剧本的时长过长，第二关的上帝之怒，我居然打了10个小时才通关。整个剧本也缺乏支撑如此时长的主线故事。
商人也是诟病之处，售卖的东西太少，一直消费最后通关也是9999钱。建议增加商人商品以及增加更加有趣的商品。
总之，以目前的游戏素质，我还是不推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999938027', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1620609224}
review:
Awesome.

The combat is kind of XCOM-light. Cover and distance affect shot percentages and whatnot. But it's a lot less statistics than XCOM; if you're positioning properly you can guarantee 100% shots and there's no stealth or roaming enemy activation. As an XCOM veteran I found it pretty easy, but it does have some challenge to it, so you can't just make arbitrary moves.

There's a lot of nice resource management: ammo, fuel, supplies. If you run out, you'll have a really hard time continuing.

Not a lot to say about the story. It's well-written. Each mission is like an episodic Indiana Jones movie. You track down the nazis or cultists to the occult object/ancient technology/etc., it gets destroyed in the struggle, and you ride off into the sunset. Rinse and repeat.

Also the soundtrack is fucking [h1][b]powerful[/b][/h1].

author: {'steamid': '76561197964299270', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1624333355}
review:
Pathway is a combination Tactical RPG (like Fire Emblem or Final Fantasy Tactics) and Roguelike (like FTL or Into the Breach). It does, however, lean more into the Roguelike side than the TRPG side. 

In other words, battles are typically short: almost always <10min, often <5min, with just a handful of turns required. Deep tactics aren't needed, but if you want to conserve resources -- ammo and supplies, the latter used for healing, repairing armor damage, and using explosives like grenades or TNT -- then "run and gun" isn't always the best tactic. 

On its Roguelike aspect, it's the typical thing where each playthrough has a different pathway and has randomized events that can negatively or positively affect your journey. You do have to watch your fuel as you traverse the desert, lest you get stranded. So you often have to plan a route, though fuel does drop as loot frequently. 

Somewhat different for a Roguelike is that there is some persistence you level up and develop characters. They retain those stats and abilities. They also hold onto items you've equipped. This does make it a bit easier than many other rougelikes since you can level up a core party and use them through an entire playthrough. You can even revive characters that have died, provided you have the money to do so (and you'll almost always have the money to do so). There are random opportunities to recruit and swap characters during your travels.

As far as setting and story, you're fighting Nazis and Zombies and Cultists across a well put-together 16-bit, pixelated Middle East and NE Africa, as you try to stop the Nazis from finding ultimate weapons. Like others have said, it's very Indiana Jones. The story isn't terribly deep nor long, but it is engaging enough that you'll want to keep moving forward. 

It probably sounds like I'm saying it's a mediocre game. And I think if you look at each section individually, yeah, that's probably true. But I still managed to put in at least 25 played hours.

If you're looking for something kinda low-key, kinda relaxing, but still fun, Pathway is a decent game for that. It's not a deep or intensely strategic game, and that's OK. Know that going in and you'll have a good time. I do think it's a worthwhile purchase, but it may be one of those games where it's more worthwhile if you purchase it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162705684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1674777027}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029013723', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1677952833}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023671892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1623329877}
review:
A really great atmosphere and tone to the game serve to really carry you through the missions. Fun writing and interesting opportunities to gamble with story events (or use character skills) creates something close to a simple Indiana Jones RPG. Managing your resources as you drive through an unforgiving desert creates an atmosphere of pleasant tension as you do things like consider attacking those bastard nazis in the hopes that they have fuel for the jeep-- but likely at the cost of ammunition.

The tactical part of the game- the main mechanical meat of it- is mediocre. It's comparable to a less lethal X-COM in a lot of ways, but the narrative soul that makes the campaign-level portion of the game engaging is largely forgotten about during the game's many battles. Character specific traits, apart from weapon and armor choices, are ignored. One specific example: my giant brute that can break through walls in the choose your own adventure stories has the weakest melee attack of my team in combat- on par with the elderly priest. These sorts of things make it plain that the game has two modes that don't really intersect. As a result, Pathway missed the chance to tell a story during its combat, and missed the chance to make your characters have a consistency that would foster their identities.

Continual combat dialogue and unique character skill usage would have been a good place to start, but the opportunity for things like whip-swinging across gaps and outrunning rolling boulders mid-combat are just some ideas that spring to mind as to how one might have told the Indiana Jones story during tactical combat.   The setting and narration are the main draw of the game; they're not capitalized on during the combat sections. As it stands, Pathway is two things: a story/resource management game, which turns into a straightforward tactics game, then turns back again.

But don't let my musings dissuade you. Combat is still fun and the rest of the game is too. And the development staff is still very active, even after these two years since release!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071776727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1641604632}

review:
It looks pretty promising and I can imagine the game being a lot of fun... if it worked correctly. By the time I finished the first encounter I lost my mouse cursor after changing the resolution and had 2 crashes to desktop: The first was while loading the main menu and the second right after the victory screen of said first battle.

Since there is only a 2 hour window for refunds I decided that 3 problems within an hour is enough reason to stop trying

review: The best thing a roguelike can do is feel fresh and interesting even after you have "done everything". This game sadly feels stale and repetitive before you even finish the first run. A staggering lack of combat variety and generally uninteresting events peppered in between completely sour the simple but satisfying gameplay and progression.

author: {'steamid': '76561199026388122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1622559229}
review:
Reminds me of the kind of cozy game I would have loved growing up
And it still gives me a really cozy feeling, now
If you made a sprite-based XCOM game with the style and flavor of Indiana Jones, great old classic Adventure games on the PC and the old Final Fantasy games on Nintendo systems, along with some influence from Dungeons and Dragons, Stargate, Atlantis: The Lost Empire and old classic Hollywood movies like Casablanca and Lawrence of Arabia

The text parts are really well written, and do a great job of describing the atmosphere in a way that I was really able to picture
And the scratchy, old-PC game style knockoff Indiana Jones narration at the beginning and end of each of Adventure helps add flavor to this already likable game

The combat, while I wish it had a few tweaks (hunker down available for every character, at the cost of a Bravery point or two, etc.) and I wonder if it would make for a charming action game, 
I do appreciate the turn-based battles, something I'm not usually a huge fan of, and is helping me get into the genre, so that's something

I also appreciate the tweaks and updates to the game as well, you can tell there's a lot of care that went into making this game, and whole it's not perfect, 
I've had a great, cozy time with it, so far

author: {'steamid': '76561198080594666', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1619367082}

author: {'steamid': '76561198825885436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3847, 'last_played': 1650230485}
review:
Wonderful little gem.
While gameplay is slightly clunky and repetitive, it gives you an immersive cartoony feel of the old 40's adventure movies. 
The graphics are very nice, for pixel art, and the lighting effects are very nice to look at, especially evening/night scenes.
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005021371', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1621261245}
review: Recommended for fans of turn-based tactics, but with some significant UX caveats. My introduction to the gameplay genre was the modern XCOM games, which may have set the bar too high. While Pathways does have the basic loop down, its 2D pixel style leaves some things to be desired. Moving characters around in a world that cannot be rotated, when cover and line-of-sight are factors, is more finicky than it should be. Often I've found members of my party visually placed behind some kind of cover, since some object is obscuring them from my view, yet the game considers them to be standing out in the open. Also, selecting/rotating through characters on a combat map is trickier than it needs to be. Just let us Tab from one character to the next, or something similar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981680920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1621254362}
review:
[h1] Indiana Jones + Xcom [/h1]

Buenisimo! me ha gustado mucho. Estoy en la última parte de la campaña y me está pareciendo un juego muy bien trabajado, con detalles pulidos, estética atractiva y unas mecánicas sencillas pero interesantes

La ambientación es totalmente indiana Jones, La Momia, Uncharted... ese tipo de género. Con una jugabilidad de estrategia por turnos en casillas. 

[b]PROS[/b]

El diseño Pixel, la trama de ocultismo y la banda sonora

[b]CONTRAS[/b]

No está traducido. Aún teniendo 16 personajes jugables, es muy probable que juegues siempre con los mismos, debido al sistema de experiencia y habilidades

author: {'steamid': '76561198876795827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1599790497}
review:
Pathway is terrific! I would clumsily describe it as, "XCOM meets the Indiana Jones film franchise." The storytelling, art, music, and dialogue of the game are fantastic - it's easy to tell that a log of passion and talent went into creating such an immersive package. 

The combat is approachable while still being challenging and engaging. I enjoyed the variety of characters - their unique strengths/weaknesses and 'personality' types made for fun RPG experiences and 'internal storytelling.' I'd find myself crafting internal backstories for why a surly boat captain, gentleman sniper, and lady scientist might have found themselves traveling together and fighting nazis and cultists (among other character combos).  

Pathfinder is great fun and a terrific value. That being said, I'd definitely recommend waiting for a sale before purchasing - the full-price feels a little steep in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198975040330', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1670946367}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003174259', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1555202652}
review:
[h1] X-Com Lite [/h1]

[b] What I Liked [/b]

I loved the art style of the game.

[b] What I Did Not Like [/b]

I just didn't like the game overall.  The combat wasn't too fun and made me want to play better turn based strategy games.

[b] Why I Stopped Playing [/b]

I wanted to play something with more meat on it, like X-Com.  If you like the art style and setting of the game, without it being as heavy as X-Com, then I say go for it.  I just felt it was too light for my tastes.

[b] Disclaimer [/b]

I have been a gamer for over 30 years.  I tend to play mostly PC games.  I also bounce around between games A LOT.  I may purchase a $60 game and play it for 2 hours or spend $10 on a game and spend 50 hours on it.  Even if I played a game a short time, it does not mean it is bad.  It just means another game caught my attention.  I also complain about flaws in games a lot, even about the littlest of things.  Keep that in mind when reading my reviews.  If I do not have a complaint, then the game must be special!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018978103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1618760172}
review:
We desperately need more non-fantasy RPG's and I had high hopes for this game.

Having played Renowned Explorers, this looked like a less goofy and more serious version. 

The map does largely play the same with limited and dwindling resources and that's a good thing.

Combat though. Oof. Nothing like bringing your German Sniper and seeing "Miss. Miss. Miss." while the Nazis are able to hit you repeatedly behind cover. It's another game that we've seen too many times before. Difficulty is by being outnumbered, RNG never favors the player, your people are incompetent combatants while the enemy is able to make improbable shots reliably and typically have you outnumbered 2 to 1. Oh yeah, they tend to target your medic as well.

Even if you win the next battle is the same slog except you have your ever decreasing health bars. The reward for combat, though generous, doesn't make up for the slog. 

Another game trying to ape the X-COM formula even though it brings so much more to the table. I appreciate you can simply avoid fights but then there is large bouts of nothing. It's either boring because you skip fights and may also miss critical resources or a slog because you engage in battles that are challenging for all the wrong reasons. Can we get past games that want a 3 person team to take on an entire army? 

I stopped playing after a couple of restarts due to RNG coming out against me hard and then when I did get on a roll it just seemed tedious. Before the "get gud" crowd comes out I already have a job. I play games for fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993399650', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1702037449}
review:
This is a very solid turn-based adventure game, with an Indiana Jones setting and aesthetic, with X-Com-lite combat.  It’s slower paced than most adventure games, and there is a decent amount of reading and story involved but I really like all the characters that can be used, unlocked and leveled up.  Resource management also plays a heavy part in each separate mission/adventure, so that’s part of the strategy too.  The addition of a ‘Difficulty slider’ is quite welcome too as some of the missions have the odds way stacked against you. 

As a whole, I thought it was a cool game.  It’s not an award winner, as it doesn’t really do anything remarkably different or better than the games it emulates, but I’d give it a solid 7.5 or 8.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048901440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1623290738}
review: This game is great fun, with challenging but not too challenging tactical combat. The default settings have too little resources; I'm always running out of fuel and medical/repair supplies, even though I usually have plenty of money to pay for them. Ammunition is plentiful, though. I would like to see more character level options; the skill trees are quite simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409803871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1616925937}
review: 我太喜欢这个游戏了，首先很喜欢回合制，之前玩仙剑系列都是回合制，相比需要反应力和动态视觉的即时战斗，果然还是喜欢经典的回合制。整体的感觉非常夺宝奇兵，不同角色的背景也很有意思。希望每次流程结束新的装备换起来方便一点，不要每次要开新一局才能换装备。玩到山穷水尽觉得玩不下去的时候，就会有狗狗出现这点太赞了，让我感觉像在看电影，狗狗真的是生化武器。目前还剩最后一章没玩，总体来说就是士兵和僵尸两种怪物，希望怪物的种类可以更多一点。画面很美丽，沙漠的风景，军营，地堡，遗迹的感觉都很棒，特别喜欢这种带有探险神秘色彩的场景。玩的时候会带入一些克苏鲁跑团的感觉，如果后面能出相关的游戏就更好了，属性点可以自己加，可以见识强大的外神和食尸鬼战斗，技能选择可以有图书馆，乔装之类的，还可以联机，很少见到这种风格的，克苏鲁回合制，感觉也不错，但是要在剧情和战斗的平衡上下功夫，感觉克苏鲁跑团还是剧情偏多的，更像解谜。大体就是这些了，希望你们可以做出更好的游戏，加油。

author: {'steamid': '76561198419718490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2063, 'last_played': 1676475308}
review: Fantastic pixel art, unique lighting and a solid turn based combat system. It's a bit like XCOM except the rules are clearer. The "Indiana Jones"-like setting is also nice. I wish there were one or two more enemy factions for more variety. The frequency in which your team is ambushed by nazis is also a bit ridiculous, but that's more of a nitpick. It's over all a very atmospheric and solid tactics game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005639888', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1707585648}
review:
Pathway похожа на приключенческий комикс. Её скорее не играешь, а читаешь, листаешь странички, рассматриваешь картинки. Очень стильное оформление в духе 30-х годов, с небольшим налётом мистики которая всегда витает вокруг 3-го рейха. А сражения с нацистами тут по большей части для антуража и более полного погружения. 
По своему происхождению она как будто родом из 16-битного картриджа, настолько тут всё привычно, просто. Она не заставит сильно напрягать извилины наличием огромного количества механик, но от неё этого как раз и не требуется. Эту игру-комикс берешь в руки для отдыха между потными сражениями серьёзных ААА стратегий. 
Мне она кажется немного недооценённой. Материала тут хватает на десятки часов, есть много разных персонажей которые постепенно открываются, много снаряжения. Карты генерируются, события повторяются достаточно редко чтобы не надоедать однообразием. Сюжет, описания событий прописаны очень душевно. Звук тоже хорошо вписывается в общую картину.
Отсутствие локализации конкретно в этой игре не считаю минусом, т.к. обычно они поганят оригинальные шрифты и это сильно бы испортило внешний вид и общую стилистику. 
Рекомендую ценителям ретро-приключений и тем кто думает что раньше игры были лучше. Это как раз та игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094829879', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1693192605}
review: Se você estava procurando um bom game de turn-based, não está mais compre Pathway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993941375', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1614550993}
review:
Tu aimes le désert, et les nazis ?
Je reformule.
Tu aimes Indiana Jones et Inglorious Bastards, le tour-par-tour et les rogue-like bien gaulés ?

Ca s'appelle PATHWAY. Ca veut dire "sentier". Oui, je suppose qu'ils ont eu du mal à trouver un titre.
Mais comment appeler un jeu dans lequel une équipe de héros s'engouffre dans une jeep pour sillonner l'Afrique désertique en se fritant avec des nazis toutes les 2 cases ?

Oui, on se déplace case-par-case, on bastonne au tour-par-tour, et Pathway se place entre "Curious Expeditions", "Renowned Explorers", et l'ambiance Indiana Jones.
On peut dire que c'est un jeu de plateau à connotation rogue-like.

La direction artistique est fantastique : pixel art au sommet, précis, éclairé à la torche ou feu de camp dès que la nuit tombe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019285719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1616345050}
review: Not usually enthralled by turn based strategy games, I loved both the gameplay and the story of Pathway. It's simple, but pure fun. Skirmishes feel appropriately "unfair" - war is Hell, bay beee!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118583236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1613718054}
review:
何となくこのゲームは継続プレイしない気がしたので早めにレビューをば。
セールで半額時に買いました。

他の方も書かれてますが、ほぼ好評、の理由は硬派に見えてそうでもない所にあると思います。
自分はタクティクス系のゲームはファイヤーエンブレムを少し触ったことがある程度の初心者同然なのですが、そんな自分でも楽しめる難易度、ということはつまり、その手のゲームに精通している人からすれば、随分とまぁ拍子抜けな難易度なのだろう、と思いました。

システム的にはDarkestDungeonで、ステージをすごろくに、戦闘をタクティクス系にした感じ…ではありますが、似ているだけであそこまでのシビアさはありません。逆にあれほどのシビアさがあれば評価が上がってた可能性まであると思います。DDの難易度を下げて軍事系にしてステージを以下略、という感じですね。

それでもハズレではないのは割に細かいグラフィック、ハクスラのように装備更新が出来ること、ゲームブック風のストーリー展開、実績解除によって使えるキャラクターが増えること、やり込み要素があること、スキルツリーなどの育成要素、などを踏まえた結果の、ほぼ好評、という評価なのだと思います。説明も丁寧ですしね。

ただ、内容が軍事系で、燃料や弾薬などの有限リソース要素もあり、難易度はそれほど高くないとはいえ、それなりに人を選ぶ内容のゲームですので、合わない人には合わないと思います。

なんというか、難易度と内容が合致していないような違和感を感じます。ここまでゆるくするなら硬派が集まる軍事系よりもっとカジュアルなファンタジー系にした方が良かったのでは…と思ったり思わなかったり。
それ故のハードコアアップデートなのかもしれませんが、これに関しては現時点で触れていませんのでなんとも…。
今後触れることがあれば追記したいと思います。

軍事好き、タクティクス系(マス目タイプのストラテジー)好き、難易度優しい方が好き、ハクスラ好き、やり込み好き、という方にはオススメできますが、
上記が一つでも受け入れがたい、という方にはオススメできません。

個人的にはフルプライスでは買う気にはなれないゲームです。
800円ぐらいで買いましたが1000円ぐらいなら納得できる感じです。
そういうわけで、価格に見合わないという理由でオススメしないことにしました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197984849909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2647, 'last_played': 1644609938}
review:
This game is amazingly fun to play, has great characters and a nice story so far. The game can be hard, the undead can drive you crazy and sometimes resources run far too short but overall super great game. The characters and weapon choices make a huge difference in the game so choose wisely. I have recently discovered the character Shani who carries nothing but a knife and you wonder how good she/he can be but holly cow what a zombie killer which I totally recommend for the undead. Also I did not even discover until yesterday that in the codex you have an achievements tab that gives you free fuel and supplies, what a life saver. 
The game combat is very good and the game as a whole is more like a chess game or board game than you think. This is a good thing.
Anyway, kudos to the developers for making this great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013786639', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1613512760}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989051249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1587235173}
review:
Great, Brilliant. Encore!! Bravo!!

I'm unhappy that I forgot to review this game sooner.

A pure delight. Just awesome once u get the swing of things. U can be a great Indiana Jones type character. 

Sometimes the maps are unfair, that was in the early days. I think it may have changed to be easier. 

I have played this for many hours and squealed at delight in the levelling up, choices, quick victories, long victories and finishing the game. 

I think the first time I played it I was unhappy at how short it was, but over time I think the developers have made bigger maps without it being too hard to find petrol. 

More turn based games like this please. And the bigger the better too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035307392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1612541838}
review:
Не буду повторять, что уже написано до меня, если коротко - игра скучная, однообразная и вовсе не имеет сюжета(-ов).

Отмечу один удививший меня лудонарративный диссонанс. Вы можете лечиться и чинить броню - только во время боя. То есть просто представьте в реальной жизни, как изрешеченные пулями, истекающие кровью, в разорванной одежде люди долго едут через пустыню, с кем-то разговаривают, останавливаются в каких-то оазисах, но чтобы подлечиться и подлататься... ждут, когда на них снова нападут!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046670682', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1614033773}
review:
I finished the last of the five adventures after about 28 hours of gameplay. I replayed two of the earlier adventures to level up new characters, and had to replay the last adventure after getting wiped on my first attempt at the final battle. It was definitely worth the low price I paid on sale, and is probably worth the full price.

I may come back and play this game some time in the future to try out harder difficulties and unlock a few more achievements, or I may not. It was fun, and I'm glad I played it.

The combat is interesting, although pretty easy for most of the game. The cover mechanic is frustrating because it's so simple as to seem stupid at times. The map mechanic and item system are satisfying. I like the characters. The atmospheric and story bits are great. Graphics are perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030489903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2790, 'last_played': 1612321852}
review:
For anyone wanting a very well executed "simple" combat strategy game, with wonderful 1930's pulp adventure flair, I highly recommend Pathway. 

I put simple in quotations because I found a lot of fun in the depth of Pathway's combat. Knowing when to go defensive, maximizing your Snipers' with ambush (overwatch) and their range, smart gambling on an offensive Shotgun class cone blast, smart gambling with Pistoleer's double shot, smart gambling on leaving your team out in the open for more accuracy, pairing the classes in such a way that gives optimum success, flanking with sprint (a must use skill for melee class), focusing melee classes on armor heavy enemies, and playing an offensive defense with ambush; I found almost all of the skills to be useful, and definitely all of the weapon "Classes". 

The music, art, and tone of the game are fantastic. 

I think my main complaint is that having finished all the adventures and playing each multiple times on higher difficulties, I kept on wanting more. I feel the game could use a third enemy faction, more adventures, and encounters. I even felt a desire to see more lore, vignettes, or even RPG mechanics. The game does a wonderful job of packing personality in its sprites, so much so that I wanted to see dialogue and interactions between the playable intrepid adventurers. 

Sadly I saw in a related thread that the development team have no current plans to continue adding to the game, although there is a chance that they will revisit. For what it's worth, I feel I got my money's worth with Pathway, and look forward to whatever comes next from the development team.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986285911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1612240059}

적턴에 2배속이 있지만 그래도 호흡이 많이 느립니다. 적군을 한번에 마무리하지 않으면 호흡이 더 길어집니다.

앞선 평가들이 전략 없고 단순 반복형이라고 하였는데 하드코어를 해보시면 그런 생각이 달라집니다. 기름 없어서 걸어가기가 일쑤입니다. 전투도 못해보고 죽었...

author: {'steamid': '76561198050491341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1679259668}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025586135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1674931574}
review:
Although this games reminds me Renown Explorers & Curious Expeditions, this game is uniquely original in its own way, kind of like for comparison all those movies like, Jewel of the Nile, Quarter Maine, etc, and compared it the original Raiders of the Lost of Ark. Now that was fun back in the 80s
Literally, it has that Indiana Jones feel, and almost a Lara Croft, but that is more solo mission, so I will go with Indiana Jones style. The tactics approach with pixels also reminds me of the GBA Advance Wars. 
So I can see, i am going to spend (like I have with Starbound) thousands of hours playing this. 
It is simple to understand, and to act out, and as long as you keep an eye on your resources, or at least plan for grinding then you are set.
Really Good Games are rare, and well this is 3x thumbs up (I am planning on growing another arm - Like Zaphod B.)
Only wish the music was more diverse... but like Starbound, I suppose that could be in later patches.

Review update: for those whom have the game and are considering the soundtrack. Just to let you know, you have already got all the music files except the last song "An Oasis". These will be in the directory under music as *.ogg files which are easily converted to *.mp3 if you need to. 
02 - Main Theme ( Pathway Theme 01)
13 - Map Track1 (Somewhere in the Desert 02)
15 - Map Track2 (Into the Arabian Interior 12)
16 - Map Track2 V2 (Dreams in the Desert Sand 08)
17 - Map Track3 (The Water of Life 05)
18 - Map Track3 V2 (Buried Beneath the Sand 14)
19 - Map Track4 (A Long Abandone Place 04)
20 - Map Track4 V2 (A Friend in Need 06)
21 - Map Track5 (Camel Fever 09)
33 - Battle Track1 (The Undead are Coming 15)
35 - Battle Track2 (Enemy Camp 10)
37 - Battle Track3 (Cultists 13)
38 - Battle Track4 (The Wraith of God 03)
39 - Battle Track5 (Brotherhood of Khonesh 07)
49 - Game Over (All is Lost 11)

So buying the soundtrack on top of the game just for one extra song isn't really worth it, even though the song is nice.

For those who do not own the game, these songs are pretty good for an Indiana Jones style music backdrop plus the last song isn't in the original game, So it is worthwhile buying the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131475358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1612305385}

review: It's a boardgame with 2D pixel art xcom combat. It's not a bad game, some optimisation issues and load times which don't make sense given the size of the game. The achievements are a bit of a grind and the game play gets a bit "samey" once you unlock a half the characters. Still worth getting on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202689638', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1671391473}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021406980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1611250888}
review:
A great pixel-love game, strategy and a bit of luck , is necessary to enjoy the game to the fullest.Don´t expect to go guns blazing, or you will find your demise quickly.

A xcom style of play without the unfair %Range , if there are no obstacles, you will always it your target, but beware, your enemies also.

Indiana jones like stories ,with random events through  all the playzone , you will never know what to expect.

My best playthroughs have always been the ones, when your resources are low and you must make decisions to risk a fight with an unknown number of enemies or keep traveling and hope to find an event or a shop that  lets you restock.

 The only negative point is the number of missions, sure they are replayable, but 2 o 3 more,post launch would have been great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353092589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1618084082}
review:
Build 1.1.6 review
This is an Indiana Jones (Temple of Doom/ Raiders of the Lost Ark) inspired role play tactics game that is suitable for players relatively new to tactical games. This is because each skirmish is generally resolved within 5 minutes. The adventure itself can last an hour or so depending on your choices and the number of sectors (maps) assigned to that adventure. Each adventure sector will always start and end at defined locations, but the possible routes are always procedurally generated. You can save after any encounter has been resolved.

Your party is made up of 3 characters selected from the available roster (Min 6, Max 16); with each character having proficiency in up to 3 weapon types, along with having one or more traits that either increase mission rewards or allow you to access certain resolution options (brute strength, stealth, engineer, etc) [negative traits from the earlier build have been removed]. Extra characters can join through either a randomly generated rescue mission or a recruitment encounter (-$500). You can only have 4 party member at most; all recruitment after this requires you to dismiss a current party member.

Each character may take 1 weapon, 1 off-hand item (knife, grenade, medi-kit, repair kit - subject to skills or a buff item), 1 armour. They gain XP that will allow them to eventually reach level 6. Every level up will award +1 Vitality (10HP) and one choice on their skill tree. You can't select 2 skills from the same tier. In the event of you disliking your choices, you can spend $2,000 of in game currency to re-spec that character.

Your party has access to a Jeep that allows you 30 inventory slots, 30 fuel points, 120 spare bullets and 15 supplies when fully upgraded. Your max cash is $9,999.

The niggles: 
When comparing items, an item level is considered more important than it's damage output/armour value along with any perk the item might have. e.g. Common Level 3 light armour with 16 AP is deemed better than Legendary Level 1 light armour with 18 AP that also provides +1 willpower and the ability to access Shadow options. The character will voice disgust at receiving a lower tier Legendary.

If you have weapons and armour from a previously completed adventure, you can't see if any of your party can benefit from them until you chose to embark on an adventure making it harder to judge if the piece of gear is junk. 

You can't see a character's stat profile during the equipment screen prior to departing on a mission to help you decide if any stat buffs are worthwhile e.g. is it better to keep a weapon with +2 Dexterity and a -7% to hit vs a gun with +5% to hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264962169', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1609413700}
review: 2D版XCOM2， 美中不足的是元素过少，战斗时过于单调

author: {'steamid': '76561198043342061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1707839461}
review:
As we wait (patiently........oh so patiently) for the return of the Indiana Jones franchise in video game form (thank you Bethesda and Machine Games, you're doing the Lords work); this is about as close as you can get to those ol' nostalgia tickles. Please note that I have played all of the LucasArts/ Indy point and click adventures until the paint (probably not actual paint) wore off on the keyboard. So I'm side-stepping those for a moment (note; if you haven't played those...how dare you. Re-examine your life).  But in a world where those "other" games didnt exist, or you're gaming on a Mac with a Catalina 64-bit operating system and simply can't run them....this is the perfect game for you. Think; simplified XCOM meets Indiana Jones and you've got Pathway. No, this game is far from simple. And for someone who sucks at strategy games (yours truly), it was downright difficult at times. BUT. This is going to feed my Indy-crack-addiction for the time being, so I welcome the challenge.  Another BONUS point goes to the pixelated art. I'm 37, so seeing a title like this that calls back to my SNES glory days is almost too much for my heart to handle. Play this for the vibes, the art, and the challenge.

Hope you guys enjoy it as much as I am.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006055070', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1682626359}
review:
Grand fan de tatical et de FF tactics (l'épisode GBA.... celui de la PSone était vraiment trop hardcore pour moi à l'époque)....c'est avec grand plaisir que je m'amuse avec Pathways.

Les plus :
- Petit pixel art sympatoche
- Ambiance Indiana Jones au poil

Les moins :
- Un tout petit manque de lisibilité dans les menus parfois
- La boucle de gameplay assez courte cela dit

Bref, un excellent tactical assez fun et très plaisant

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198090323431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1671430207}
review: 8 hrs in, I can say this game is amazing. I waited for the update before buying, so I never experienced the bad things people mention. I'm a huge fan of Halfway, which was a grindy game, but the atmosphere made it worth it. Pathway has an amazing atmosphere without the grind nor other shortcomings of Halfway. The inventory management was a HUGE improvement over the clunky backpacks in Halfway. I don't know if it will get more repetitive later or not, but I don't care. I got my money's worth. Get it. You won't regret it. Incredible soundtrack and stunning pixel art too. I love the sounds the characters make when hit. Extra points for dog friendly feature in settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095878832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1608770834}
review:
I like the theme and graphics, but the game play isn't fun. I feel like they have tried to increase the difficulty/challenge by just adding tons of little gotchas to everything, often in unexpected places, and lots of randomness. I completed the first campaign, but it felt like I endured it/got lucky rather than earned it.

For instance, I know they have fuel as a resource to make sure you don't go to the camps after every encounter, but even adjusting the slider to easy barely got me enough fuel to get to the end of the campaign without taking any significant detours or random encounters where I would lose even more. As someone who likes to explore having to leave the map only visiting maybe 20-30% of the spots is disappointing. The constant degrading of armor is also annoying as there isn't any way to repair or purchase it (too expensive) early on. You can get it as a random loot drop, but even then the characters can only wear one type out of 3. So, your experience is going to come down to your luck with loot draws.

The combat is also clunky and slow. It is difficult to tell what part of the map you can move and shoot through, especially during character placement. As bad as hitting tab to see if you can even hit things is, you don't even get that during placement. And then there are little things like making you click the reload all button after each encounter. Is there a reason the game wouldn't just always do that for you? It's probably taking ammo away from me for the privilege, but I have no motivation to track it to find out anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008002116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1606086544}
review:
This is a good exploration and turn based combat game set in the inter-war years. It is very much in the Indiana Jones genre which was a plus for me.  I wish there was a neutral vote because while stylish and smooth there was not enough depth to really dig into.
The game seems designed to be replayed but after completing all the levels on normal difficulty I have to say that I am not drawn to try again.  The combat gets a bit repetitive (other reviews explain this in detail) and the non-combat encounters  just cycle through after a while. 
It would have been more compelling if the encounters triggered more off of what characters you picked and they built up more over the adventure.  There is an aspect of the game where character abilities open up other options but it never goes past that single event. The map offers branches and cul de sacs but no real reason to explore them (and fuel consumption is a strong incentive to ignore them). A small change like making new characters unlock by completing plot based elements (ie find the lost jeep at the oasis event) rather than just accruing a number of specific points (ie kill 50 Nazis or evade 25 attacks) would really boost the replay attractiveness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039198507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1299, 'last_played': 1604743440}
review: The RPG and adventure side of the story is interesting, and for the completionist it is replayable.  While the turn based action strategy sequences were far from exotic, you still have 8 bit glory in all its madness.  If you can imagine yourself liking strategy turn based Indiana Jones, this is both enjoyable and original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141641694', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1606313109}
review:
Really great old-school tactics game with a fun storyline. A lot of the plot points are cribbed almost directly from Indiana Jones, but the way each adventure is randomized keeps it interesting. The variety of characters is really cool - you can play the same campaign a few times through and there's enough variation that you won't get bored. The gameplay itself will be familiar if you've played a turn-based strategy game before. I found it a little bit on the easy side, but I haven't tried hardcore mode yet for what it's worth. The pixel art is absolutely gorgeous, and the world/level design is among the best I've seen in games like this.

I did notice a few glitches - for example, sometimes projectile attack animations won't play until after the damage is calculated. The camera can be a little bit annoying when you're switching characters on your turn as well, as it tries to automatically center on what the game thinks is the "next" player to move. One other thing is I'd like to see more content - this isn't really a negative though since the reason I want more is because I enjoyed what's there.

None of these things was a big enough deal to prevent me from recommending this game though. Honestly the artwork by itself is reason enough to check it out, but if you're into tactical strategy or light RPG games, this one is definitely worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083336643', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1676118858}
review: satisfyingly deep strategy mixed with adventure rpg elements. each adventure is just long enough and I love that your progress accumulates for for each adventurer each time you play! reccommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198066521419', 'num_games_owned': 3020, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1605219879}
review:
It's a pretty and nicely put together game.

But 7 hours in, I'm already getting bored. The problem is its primary game loop (turn-based battles) just aren't interesting. The engine is too simple. Most of the time, you just move and shoot and move and shoot, slowly whittling down health of enemies. Occasionally, you can find a way to damage multiple enemies, but that's pretty much it. I haven't seen any of the synergies, tradeoffs or risky moves that make this kind of gameplay interesting.

Meta game is decent (FTL-like), but it too seems to lack the kind of crazy paradigm-shifting events that completely change the tenor of a campaign, like you find in other roguelites.

I get the feeling the game designers were so afraid to unbalance the game, that at every junction, they took the safest - and the most boring - option available.

I still recommend the game, since it is pretty and well executed, but on a scale of 1 - 10, I'd give it like 6. Barely scrapes by into the recommended range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032085715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1604534297}
review:
I am a huge fan of Indiana Jones, and for me this game evokes that feeling very strongly. For one, the narrator sounds like  Harrison Ford. Secondly, the theme is Nazi's stealing ancient artifacts in the 1920-esque landscape....Did I mention that I adore this narrator?

As far as gameplay goes: this is a pretty straightforward tactical rpg. Nothing too special. The items found are predictable but satisfying. The character nuances, and the weapon and tool "classes" do make for some intriguing team composition choices. There doesn't seem to be too many "adventures" (which is what this title refers to missions as)... Which makes me think that this game will be a short play. So hopefully the developers read this and keep supporting this game with add-on "adventures" because this game has got soul and character!

I would give this game a 10/10 for flavor/aesthetic and a 5/10 for gameplay, thus.......

ENVOY RATED: 7/10 (round down always :) )

author: {'steamid': '76561197987114813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1601757467}
review:
Буду краток...
Повёлся на похожесть с FTL. Да - в чём-то похожа. Но эта похожесть лишь в перемещении по карте к финишу, разных эвентах и пиксель-арте. И это всё. За первые часы, вы даже не поймёте - что не так.
 А не так тут одно: унылость. 
Унылы перемещения: если вам вдруг захочется открывать все карты каждой главы, а не просто бежать к финишу, вы начнёте встречать одни и те же эвенты, даже в рамках одной главы. Ну а даже не встречая - вы будете напарываться на врагов, встреча с которыми тоже быстро потеряет смысл: прокачка быстро упирается в максимальный уровень персонажей.
Уныл пиксель-арт. Очень быстро приедаются одни и те же локации, NPC, и противники (которых тут можно пересчитать по пальцам...). Заставок по сути нет. В конце в вас "плюнут" статичной картинкой и парой предложений.
Уныла боевая система. Бои однотипны и просты. Единственная сложность - неадекватный рэндом: если вам нравится промахиваться из дробовика в узком коридоре в упор - эта игра для вас.

В общем... уныло всё. 
Прошёл игру из принципа, и учитывая процент игроков, получивших достижение за прохождение всех глав, то можно уверенно сказать: более 80% игроков потеряли к ней интерес задолго до конца.
Как-то так...

review: A great adventure game where you build your team of adventurers, find and unlock those with new skills, while replaying adventures for new gear and loot to continue your adventures! While a little grindy early on, by the time your team has some levels to them, and you've got a grip on gameplay, it's a great little game that's well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981494880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1684434780}
review: Рогалик в виде пошаговой тактики. 5 глав с большим количеством текста. Но что бы получить максимальное удовольствие - нужно знать английский. Графика в пиксель-арт стиле не делает УАУ-эффекта, но тем не менее очень хороша. Персонажи разнообразны и интересны, каждый со своим деревом прокачки и перками. В общем рекомендую игрушку тем кому нравиться пиксель-арт и XCOM

author: {'steamid': '76561198170045799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 2984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1335, 'last_played': 1601369045}
review:
First I should say that I was reluctant to try this game because of many comments which were all about FTL being better. I played FTL and it was decent, but not something I would lose sleep for. After finally buying Pathway I was surprised a lot, in a good way. I actually enjoy this one much more. It is certainly partially caused by fact that I am huge fan of old Indiana Jones movies. But also game mechanics are much more fun for me as the battles remind me a lot of Jagged Alliance, which is my childhood love and RPG touch is good too. Summed up, this is game that I just cannot stop playing and certainly would recommend.

Pros:
 - Beautiful pixel art, someone really put his/her talent here.
 - Atmosphere - riding trough desert, killing evil nazis and finding secret powerful artifacts is simply cool.
 - Difficulty tweaking: It is up to you, if you want easy play or hardcore madness, you can get anything from those and between.
 - Battles and fight mechanics are nice and fun.
 - You can try any team you want and try different team members combination, which means higher replayability.

Cons:
 - Some maps are confusing, it is not clear what is obstacle, what is hole...
 - Ocassional odd behaviour of battle mechanisms, for example grenade explosion effect being affected by line of sight etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279045531', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1595712815}
review: 后面的关卡要跨三个地图，又臭又长。事件基本都差不多，战斗要清一大堆的杂兵，战斗过程基本一样，比较无聊。打一次大部分人都不会想开第二把。

author: {'steamid': '76561198108341019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1600621954}
review: Si vous aimez l'ambiance pulp et que ce jeu est en solde (20% de réduction ou plus),n'hésitez pas. Un petit jeu sympa pas prise de tête qui vous fait revivre cette ambiance si particulière d'Indiana Jones (on part en Afrique tuer des nazis ou des cultistes cherchant à réveiller un ancien pharaon,cliché mais efficace!) Je ne conseillerai cependant pas ce jeu si vous cherchez un jeu à haute valeur de rejouabilité: on apprend,on comprend les mécaniques en 1 heures et... on fini les quelques missions qu'on nous donne (qui sont pour moi trop peu nombreuses pour me pousser à vraiment m'investir dans ce jeu, sachant que je n'ai pas trouvé de mods sur steam pour "débloquer" de nouvelles missions). On comprend les mécaniques,les intérêts des différentes armes, on déloque des arbres de compétence un peu dirigiste et pas très optimisés pour certains persos. J'ai fini le jeu en 8.8 heures (juste avant d'écrire ce test) sans me presser et c'est ce qu'il vaut de mon temps. J'ai vu que la moyenne des joueurs le finissait en environ 15h ce qui est bien pour un petit jeu. En somme, un jeu agréable à prendre en main qui devient un peu lassant sur la fin mais ne traine pas en longueur. Vous finirez le mode histoire, serez content d'avoir joué à ce jeu, admirerez quelques instants le pixel-art (sublime) et passerez à autre chose,satisfait mais pas transcendé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029479947', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4395, 'last_played': 1678579330}
review:
已达成全成就。 游戏没有所谓[b]“最有价值评测”[/b]说的那么不堪，我怀疑他们连游戏都没打通。
许多测评都提到与《XCOM》做比较，实际上我只接触过《Fallout: Tactics》，游戏类型估计也是差不多的。个人觉得《Pathway》更倾向于战棋。像战术回合制类的看Action来做动作的，也就是说，基本上开一枪就是一个回合。《Pathway》中最多可以进行1次攻击和移动，攻守交换频繁，而战术回合制类的游戏可以打阵地战。《Pathway》也融入了战术回合制的要素——掩体，具体来说是用来武器命中率的。 各个角色有不同技能，比较考验角色之间的合击，阵地战反而会进入劣势，一波合击带走敌人是最好的玩法。
 
游戏背景： 
详见电影《夺宝奇兵》 
 
优点： 
+ 比较好的像素画 
+ 弄弄埃及风的音乐，百听不厌 
+ Roguelike大地图、战斗场景（基本上碰不到相同的大地图和战斗场景，重开会刷新） 
+ 比较快的战斗节奏（其实是命中率比较高造成的） 
+ 无情的AI（包围战术发挥的淋漓尽致）  
+ 单元式冒险（换句话说就是没有剧情，像单元剧一样）
 
缺点： 
- 后期游玩重复率高（普通模式特别严重，后期都在刷装备品质）  
- 装备品质差异不明显（6级金品的装备在最高难度下也只是基础的存在，秒杀不了敌人）  
- 敌人差异太大（不死族和纳粹的输出完全是不同级别，不死族太恶心了） 
- 硬核模式太难（具体就是一次过从1级打完全图，角色永久死亡。太难了，补偿不平衡） 
 
总结： 
游戏估计不会再有新内容了，所以如果想杀杀时间，是可以体验一下这个游戏的。其实我觉得这个游戏应该定位是手游或者掌机上的好点，理由是操作不繁琐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198056468503', 'num_games_owned': 4820, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1670, 'last_played': 1599136716}
review:
Nice round strategy without a lot of downs, but free of real highs.

The game runs bug free, it entertains for the first moment and is not a rip-off. But "Pathway" doesn't have much more to speak of in favor of the game. For me a rather mediocre experience. Almost everything in the game is good average without being particularly outstanding. The story is very simple, for me a missed opportunity to tell an entertaining Indiana Jones-like story. The fights are easy to master and do not really allow you to optimize your own strategy, as almost everything seems to work out somehow. If it does get a bit demanding, then only because the gasoline is running out and my tired pack has to drag its way through the desert to then fight against Nazis or zombies half dying of thirst. "Pathway" has its charm, but Robotality would have been better advised to develop something completely new instead of sending "Halfway", in the truest sense of the word, into the desert. So there are the same problems as in the predecessor plus numerous unexpected new flaws.

Somewhere between thumbs up and thumbs down. But I choose thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962065957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1702766761}
review:
Uno de mis juegos favoritos.
Si leíste por ahí que este juego junta FTL e Indiana Jones, es más o menos eso.
Esencialmente es un título de aventuras y estrategia con acción por turnos (sí, tiré muchos géneros) con gráficos hermosamente pixelados, los muchachos de Robotality me han pegado directo en la nostalgia.
Los personajes del juego son de lo mejor, cada uno con sus skills que tendrás que compensar con otros para salir victorioso. Vas a llegar a quererlos, odiarlos y luego volver a quererlos cuando te enfrentes a los nazis o a los zombies.
Tiene un sistema buenísimo de eventos aleatorios, lo que hace que las aventuras o sean iguales y el componente de rejugabilidad sea buenísimo.
Pesa poco, no necesita una gran PC y siempre está a buen precio, que más querés?

author: {'steamid': '76561198045231098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1648372700}

Un Must have si en plus t'aime les X-com like , bon petit mix.
