author: {'steamid': '76561197992598511', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1624289221}
review: What can I say? I'm a sucker for that adventurers setting. And it tingles the right nerves for me. The enemy and map variety could have been bigger. You come across 15 or so enemies all with different behaviour but always fight in deserts, on desert farms, temples and bunkers. I would have loved if there were more scenarios maybe in the arctic or the amazon. Still the gameplay is fun as all hell and there are some features I miss in an XCom-game like seeing the possible percentages before you move onto a field or you can see the movement area of the enemies. This makes planing ahead more tactical and if you get hit it's mostly your error because you didn't position your characters right. Speaking of the chars they're all out of the 1930s pulp stories like the adventurer like Indy, a tough pilot or the laser weapon wielding scientist. Everyone with stats and skills for useable weapons or items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1594997256}
review:
This is a fun, relaxed little tactics game that does a good job of capturing the feel and spirit of Indiana Jones setting without some of the more problematic elements of that particular franchise. Who doesn't like to explore ancient mysteries and punch Nazis, after all? The music and art are fitting, and the gameplay, while simple, is enjoyable.

There are a few bits where it feels like the game does things for no particular reason; for example, it flags certain event nodes on the adventure map as "Interesting" that don't seem to do anything different. It also has a lot of UI experiences that can be skipped or bypassed, like revealing items or tallying kills; I guess this is meant to give you a cool feeling that you can also skip, but it feels slightly strange. And the enemy types can get a bit repetitive - they don't really make you think very much, after a while.

But those all feel very minor - I found myself coming back to play again and again. Mostly, I just wanted more - more adventures, more enemy types, more event scenarios and branching story paths. It feels like a good foundation for what could be an amazing sequel.

review:
画风我挺喜欢，但是音乐和战斗有点不符合我的预期。敌人种类太少，战斗方式没有太多变数，不同品质装备差距并不大。
事件的不同应对方式需要不同技能这种类似跑团一样的设定挺戳我的，但目前感觉这游戏的事件更偏向于日式RPG一点（事件结果固定，玩家只能选择分支）而不是美式RPG（事件结果是一个概率，选择分支也会有不成功）
总体感觉还行，就是可重复游玩方面没达到我的预期

author: {'steamid': '76561198006567196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1594566026}
review: This is a very unappreciated adventure game. The amount of unlockables and items make what might be considered "vanilla" combat more rewarding than meets the eye. This game only offers five missions, but the rogue-lite events make each step on the journey feel generic and real. It will be easy to sink in many more hours than expected into this turn-based, Indiana Jones-este trek through the Middle East feel like a true adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105772886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1687112109}
review: 二战？沙漠？木乃伊？神秘的邪教徒或是邪恶的纳粹党卫军？这些充满冒险的故事这个游戏里都有了，有什么理由可以拒绝呢？

author: {'steamid': '76561198048676957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1594969692}
review:
The UI is far too large by default. I almost gave it a bad review as it seemed like the whole screen was the UI, but this can be remedied in the main menu options under Video>Advanced.

Otherwise after 4 hours, its a fun turn based strategy. There is also music that directly calls on Indiana Jones nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165271706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1595716757}
review:
I like the game albeit it does take me a while to get into it. Some parts of the game are a bit slow, like travelling in the overworld. the number of maps you need to traverse to increases in each adventure which makes it a bit tedious.

There are some parts of the game that was not clear to me, like the cover system. How some covers can be vaulted over and some can block vision.

Once these issues I overcame, I quite enjoyed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960298815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1594374791}
review: großartiges, abwechslungsreiches Spiel. Wer rundenbasiert mag und gerne gelegentlich Mal spielt ist hier gut aufgehoben. Das Spiel ist einfach gehalten und hat wunderschöne Pixelgrafik ;-) mir gefälltes. Gute Story, Random Events und der Trieb nach besseren Gegenständen mit schwierigeren Einstellungen lässt einen auch gerne noch ne Runde drehen, und dann vielleicht mit einer anderen Char-Kombination, und immer gut auf die Benzin Vorräte achten ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116333100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1594153646}
review: Hra ma peknu grafiku, pripomina mi stare adventurky z 90's. Prostredie, v ktorom sa odohrava, je pomerne nie casto dnes pouzivane (blizky vychod a Afrika v tridsiatych rokoch dvadsiateho storocia). Pribeh je podobny serii s Indym - hrdinovia s roznymi schopnostami sa snazia prekazit plany nacistov a kultistov na ziskanie mystickych artefaktov. Hra ma tahove boje, hrdinovia leveluju a nahodne generovane su zastavky na ceste i udalosti v nich. Obsahuje aj prvok mikromanagementu podobne ako Banner Saga. Pribeh je sice len naznaceny, ale za tu cenu nemam ziadne vyhrady. Ma to aj retro znejuci soundtrack ako uz zmienovane adventurky.  Pre mna zabavna ale kratka hra.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991598892', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1651529826}
review: Man, the art and the music and sound are just fantastic. As for the gameplay, I'm not sure what some of these people want. You have people saying it's too easy and people saying its too hard. With the hardcore update and the ability to apply your own modifier to difficulty in hardcore mode, you have all the challenge you could want. Especially as the end game content tends to lean more toward punishing. You want a decent challenge with some good roguelike elements and some very fun turn based gameplay with skill trees, perks and looting? Still in the right place. This game is a frigging steal right now and bonus for me, it's all gravy on Linux. My only gripe is the mouse cursor has a glitch. Ctrl+M for swapping to software mouse and back but to be honest I can't see the difference so I left it on software and its all gravy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067844396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1594457532}
review:
TL:DR - I think it's better than its current "mostly positive" rating and it's very fun!

Disclaimer: I really loved the Indiana Jones series.

Only slightly longer version - If you enjoy adventure narratives, and turn-based combat, this is a great game. Well done, addictive, fun story lines, great gaming soundtrack, and, at least through 6 hours, has managed to avoid most colonialist tropes by focusing exclusively on nazis and zombies, and by having minority playable characters who are not pawns for white characters. In my book, that's a recipe for a pretty decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286826606', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1593711368}
review:
打发时间还可以 虽然epic免费送不过没领到 五折27块玩8小时满足了
喜欢这种多人角色扮演的系统 还有roguelike要素 非常的妙

简单来说 架子是好的 内容不够 但是27块也还可以了

author: {'steamid': '76561198034439443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1593605712}
review:
I like the music in this game a lot and I think there is some fun to be had. 

The game has retro style graphics, which is ok, but not my favourite.

I do think this game is more for younger people, and not so much for older people, because there is a lot more that could be done to create this immersive world, and some stuff detracts from that I think by not thinking theme, but "just a game" kind of mentality. Ideally I would have seen a less gimmicky style, and more 'realistic' take on weapons, even if you don't really see this in 3D in game, I mean I would have liked real like references best as upgrades. I also think the item rating system isn't very good, because better items aren't hard to come by it seems.

I am writing this not yet having finshed the game, but I think having played through the first three levels/adventures gives a good insight into what the game is like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040823155', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1593459184}
review:
I really wanted to like this game since I'm a fan of tactics games like XCOM and roguelikes like FTL, but this is simply too... simple for me to enjoy. The world building, musical score, and pixel art are great, but the combat and replayability make me sad as this game had such great potential.

The combat isn't up to snuff since the flanking angles you would see in any other tactics game with directional cover are non-existent. You can be at a corner which clearly flanks an opponent down one of the sides of said corner and he still has cover bonus. Range also isn't considered at all in to-hit calculations, so even as you get closer to an enemy behind cover you don't gain a to-hit bonus. I don't think I'm spoiled from XCOM and the like to think these kind of things should be mandatory in directional-cover, dice-roll tactics games.

Just like FTL, there's only one mission: go from point A to point B and have a final confrontation. FTL can procedurally generate a series of maps and events. This game, unless played in the recent Hardcore Mode, has only one map, so "long-haul" resource management (supplies [missiles, drones], money [scrap], and fuel) are null as you are given barely enough fuel to get to point B in a straight line and once you're done at point B in 15ish moves the game ends and you win. Yeah, you can keep things picked up in some meta-storage across all runs, but the only pressing concern is fuel to even explore the map or go anywhere that isn't straight to the objective. Maybe you get a way to increase your starting fuel count, but I only found a way to buy max storage, which I think is completely useless.

Anyways, I guess the short is if you like XCOM or FTL you'll find this game close but lacking too much at its core gameplay fundamentals to really get into. Suppose I'll refund until an even greater sale comes around, and I mean like 90%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003734094', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1557111969}

author: {'steamid': '76561198428791036', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1593342931}
review:
很早就关注了这款游戏，主要是特别喜欢《火焰纹章》这种回合角色扮演类游戏，终于这次打五折入手。说实在的很令人失望，前几个小时解锁不同人物，收集各种稀有物品，探索游戏机制，还是有可玩性的。但是通关几遍图后，一个格子一个格子点过去（竟然不能一次性点到位，我跪了），就疲倦了，偷懒的武器系统（大部分武器只是改了稀有度而已，加了点属性，缺乏新鲜度），奇葩的等级系统（一个人物只能升五级，每级从可以三四个技能中选一个，随机升一点属性，不能自己分配，缺乏能动性，也没有永久加人物的属性的物品），单一的技能体系（基本每种兵种就那几个技能，兵种也没几个，根据武器分，没有坦克兵，骑兵，失望），地图缺乏探索性（基本就是一条路走到底，，每个格子之间有连线，必须按连线走，来来回回，汽油就没了，我能说什么？），匮乏的怪物图鉴（基本就那几种人，真不考虑加了？）。个人借鉴，回合角色扮演类游戏，基本乐趣在于，人物养成，物品收集，boss讨伐，在这个游戏里，我什么也没享受到，游戏中人物只有六级，升级自动分配属性，没有消耗性物品可以永久增加属性，物品大部分就是贵重品，就是只能卖钱，，我目前的的游戏进度还没有打到boss，不知后面有没有？目前游戏内容只值20，不能再多了。
游戏期望，希望后面有大更新（估计不会了）：增加敌人，尤其是怪物、boss（僵尸都有了，不考虑一下？），改善并丰富武器系统，最好高级武器有专属技能，增加坐骑系统（坦克，飞机，马），优化地图移动，增加玩家的能动性，重制等级系统，细化属性加成，等级提升增加属性点，玩家自由分配，人物生成AI，让每个玩家培养只属于自己的角色，增加武器工坊，可以锻造武器等级和合成武器的那种，总之可以改进的地方真实太多了，多好的游戏设想，可以制作组没有做出我心中所想的游戏，或许是我的期望太高了？

author: {'steamid': '76561198120711020', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1593257031}
review:
Oh, man, I understand why this game has mixed reviews. It is good for what it is, but in order to not be disappointed, you have to keep your expectations in check. More specifically, I do not consider Pathway to be a great roguelite with high replayability potential. I don't even consider it an OK roguelite. Barely squeezed 15h of playtime, and have a feeling, I've seen most of the content. It started out great, but got boring and repetitive very fast. However, I still recommend Pathway, especially on sale. Got it with 50% discount and really enjoyed it before finishing the last mission (~12 hours). Below is the summary of my experience with a game.

Pros:
[list]
    [*] Absolutely gorgeous pixel art. One of the best I've seen
    [*] A lot of difficulty options and a hardcore mode (didn't try it, but according to achievement statistics it is brutal)
    [*] Default difficulty is quite relaxing. Only failed last mission once, and it was totally my fault, I have been too reckless
    [*] Nice soundtrack and sound design in general
    [*] Your party composition affects adventures in interesting ways, because characters have traits that will lead to different outcomes of random events
    [*] Combat is not too deep and you have to be kinda reckless sometimes which for me was refreshing after Pillars of Eternity and DOS. However this may be a con, depending on what you expect from a game
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
   [*] There's too little variety to have a decent replay value. After you finish all adventures, you have seen most of it. You can play further to unlock all characters or get all achievements, but I just didn't find it compelling
   [*] Little combat, enemy and map variety
   [*] Little incentive to change party members, I completed my first play through using the same three guys
[/list]

Overall:
[list]
   [*]  5/10 if you are looking for a roguelite with high replay value and variety
   [*]  8/10 if you just want to have some light-hearted Indiana Jones-like adventures with quite relaxing turn-based combat
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198198199955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1620684853}
review:
It's a cool game but it uses too much memory.
I understand that it takes a lot to render the shadows, but it doesn't make a difference to the gameplay. This a turn-based game with retro-style graphics. It shouldn't take 3 GB to run. I was hoping to have this on my laptop so I could play when I travel, but it didn't work out that way at all.
I like the concept, the game itself is a lot of fun, and the aesthetic is pretty well developed. But you have to ask yourself if 4 GB of memory is worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991448453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1592936002}
review:
Envie d'aventure ? Achetez vite ce petit bijou en 16 bits qui vous plongera dans les palpitantes péripéties d'un authentique Indiana Jones. Gérez bien vos ressources, car on ne part pas dans le désert à la poursuite d'expéditions allemandes et de de cultistes morts-vivants sans un minimum de préparation... et un maximum de courage !
Les compétences des personnages débloquent des issues autres que le combat sur certains tableaux, à vous de composer votre équipe d'aventuriers, d'ingénieurs, de filous ou encore de brutes.
Les scénarios sont vraiment bien écrits, avec un fond de recherches archéologiques frôlant les Ancient Aliens series sans effaroucher les détracteurs d'Indy 4.
Vraiment, un magnifique travail dont on n'attend que les prochaines aventures !
Avantages :
- de nombreuses heures de jeu, rejouabilité importante ( vos personnages évoluent et il faut partir à la recherche des drops les plus avantageux )
- Charme 16 bits 
- Musique dans l'esprit John Williams
- Scénario immersif, bien recherché et bien pensé
- système de combat à la  XCOM mais en plus "relax" ( une prise à revers vaut un 100%, ça détend ! )
- Chasser des nazis, c'est déjà un plus notable.
Seul défaut :
-pas de fouet ;'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198218117323', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1592126708}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966476911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1595610292}
review: Ce jeu est génial. Ne tenez pas compte des critiques qui disent qu'il est trop difficile ou que la difficulté varie rapidement. C'est le cas, mais ça fait partie de la philosophie de ce jeu. Car quand vous mourrez vous pourrez réutiliser le même personnage deux aventures plus tard, mais avec toute l'expérience acquise. Bref, mourir fait partie intégrante des mécanismes de ce jeu. D'ailleurs il n'y a pas de gestion des sauvegardes du tout. Ce jeu tourne nativement sous Linux et je n'ai pas rencontré le moindre bug, vraiment top. En plus il n'est pas très cher. Bon jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305229789', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1615230256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170707822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1592451672}
review:
This sat on my wishlist for a while.. I'm not usually a fan of strategy/turn-based games but I got drawn in because of the beautiful visuals and the idea of a 1930's Indiana Jones-like adventure. I got it on sale recently even though I knew the reviews were mixed, and gave it a shot. And as you can see by my play time... not great. 

The first hour or so is quite fun actually, learning how the game works, the beautiful graphics, and the first quest is a solid length. But that's about it. I don't usually complain about game difficulty because the learning curve is usually manageable, and I can stand on my own after a bit, but holy sh** this game goes from 0-100, no in between. The second quest goes from 1 map area to 3 huge maps, divided up by large battles at the end of each section, which if you then die in any section, you go all the way back to the start. And you will die because the enemy difficulty becomes unreal. I attempted the second quest multiple times, each time losing all my characters and starting all over. It just becomes repetitive and demoralising. 

Don't be like me and get drawn in because of the beautiful art style. I cannot recommend this game (even if its on sale) to people who are even slightly trying to get into strategy/turn-based games, there's better ones out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150526684', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1592551219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040907334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2198, 'last_played': 1592259242}
review:
While the pixel art design and environment building are fantastic, the combat truely suffers and brings the game down significantly. The biggest drawback is the lack of enemy types. Through out the whole game I encountered maybe 12 different types, with the biggest difference being whether they shoot at you or run at you in most cases. I found myself sad when my hero's thwarted rituals ment to summon mythical creatures, only to face the same boring enemies again and again. As an example of how uninspired game design was, not once  in over 30 hours of play, did I interupt or have a 3 way fight between nazies or cultists (the two factions in the game). Its one of the most simple ways in game design to make things more interesting...

The second thing that hurt the combat in this game is the cover system and chances to hit. Its either %100 chance to hit (if your flanking) or a percentage based on your character and weapon for *every* other position regardless of distance or angle. Many times you will ask yourself why you have such low chances to hit when your pointing a gun right up their ass. In every aspect apart from environmental design and appearance the game just feels over simplified and honestly flat.

This game has awesome potential but in the current state I just got really bored about half way through. It was very hard to finish it. Best of luck for pathway 2 or whatever they do next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255650769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1592041797}
review:
1.敌我兵种很少（真的很少），武器种类不多（狙、喷子、步枪、电枪以及手雷、匕首两个副武器）
2.掩体判定简单（面对面隔着一堵矮墙硬是打不到），命中率数值固定
3.重复度极高（敌人、战斗策略、人物组合）
4.分支选项没什么重要影响，大部分时候只影响是否战斗以及战斗的先后手
总结：蛮不错的小游戏，策略性尚可，重复游玩性不足，喜欢策略战棋的玩家打折可入，不建议原价入（个人认为可游玩内容还是太枯燥了）

author: {'steamid': '76561198091359842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1593937173}
review: Bon petit jeu rétro, parfaitement dans l'ambiance Indiana Jones. Les combats sont un peu répétitifs par moment, quand on atteint certains plateaux où on fait toujours face aux mêmes ennemis, mais ils sont assez rapides pour que ce ne soit pas handicapant. La gestion de l'échec est sympa - les personnages ne meurent pas mais partent à l'hosto, et on recommence la mission avec une nouvelle équipe. ça permet d'accepter l'absence de sauvegarde multiple. Très bien pour de petites séquences de jeu nostalgiques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030287831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1593095651}
review:
A lovely little pixel romp were you battle evil nazi's and undead to save the world.
The character unlock is fun and a challange though the item collection from the challanges is a bit unclear.
I was able to grind to lvl 3 characters with all but my latest unlock (who is second) and the only character I've not unlocked is the Preist.
Events are very similar to FTL, if your team has the right skill you can do them (Purple actions) and you can run the first chapter in about 30 - 45 minutes so replay isnt to grinding,
perhaps most importantly you can get the best boi and the sounds of stabbing nazi's are just delightful <3

review: A satisfying mix of pulp atmosphere, Oregon Trail-esque travel happenstance, and enjoyable tactical RPG combat. Maybe I'm the unique intersection of the fandom of all these things, but it's incredibly engrossing for me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998324692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1655532728}
review: Fair rather than punishing rouge-like. You die but not all is lost, you still get treasure and xp. So, it's a rouge-like that doesn't want to hurt you but rather actually let you enjoy the game and have a little story along the way. I like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027221726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1710733365}
review:
Xcom type combat with an Indiana Jones theme.

Other reviewers have complained about the lack of replayability.  Yes, like Xcom you can only experience the story for the first time once, but the turn-based combat is the core of the game.  That doesn't get old.  There's also some resource management aspects as well as strategic team building.

I haven't won the final battle yet, but it took me 17 hours to get to that point.  I recommend Pathway, especially if you can get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001070742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1656872219}
review:
You'll hear a lot of people saying this a mash-up of a few different games and genres. Are they right? Well, yeah. But this game is so much more. Watch as your doctor, outfitted with the sneakiest of gear, steals gas and supplies right out from beneath the Wehrmacht's nose. Reel in horror as your daredevil jack-of-all trades jumps from your jeep onto the back of a German supply convoy,,, only to reappear a few miles down the road with some shiny new gear. Converse with the locals to free the stodgy, old Brit that they can't wait to get rid of.

The gameplay is solid. The charm is off the charts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052337834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1577414405}
review:
I get why this game has mixed reviews. To be clear, I purchased this game and refunded it within the two hour limit so my experiences are rather limited. 

The thing that drew me in at first was the Oregon Trail-like RPG aspect of assembling a team, kitting them out for a journey, and managing their supplies, abilities, and kits to handle situational challenges, etc. I knew there was combat and I was looking forward to it. However, the way the game is designed is with a level of built-in ramping difficulty to force replayability. You will fail, a lot, as you learn the kinds of minute mistakes that will add up to demolish your team before the end of the mission. But they retain XP, skills, advancements, etc so that every attempt gets you just a bit further and further along. 

It creates a Russian Doll effect of constantly replaying a map, tweaking for those minute improvements that might get you past this stage with enough resources left to continue on. And on. And on. Just a little...bit..further..each time. It's exhausting and I know from other games it's not what I personally am in to. It's complicated because it can be a satisfying pay off, and I get the appeal for a lot of people. Just wasn't for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988431703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1591478292}
review: Honestly, it just isn't very fun. It's like a bad version of X-Com with a not very interesting roguelike element tacked on. The combat is very bad, the characters aren't interesting, the weapons aren't fun. The interface is not very good, which just makes the already boring combat a chore to navigate. Swing and a miss on this one. I bought it on sale for $8, and it wasn't even worth that. Doesn't feel like a full game, just an idea for a game that has the bare minimum features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130532433', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1678312657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094314206', 'num_games_owned': 1333, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1591853803}
review: As always I'm gonna ding this game for obnoxious anti-save fundamentalism.  It creates a hidden backup that is difficult to find in case you actually find the savegame location and back up your game yourself.  In other words, you restore the game and find it didn't make a difference -- it's got measures built-in to stop you from being able to manually copy the savegame files and restore them.  F you too, Chucklefish.  Just let people play the way they want, okay?

author: {'steamid': '76561198010132028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1593181188}
review: Chill sandbox game/Xcom.like/darkest dungeon.like/ with wonderful graphics and some interesting mechanics. I love it. It is not for everybody and the main campaign is quite short. However, thank to the different difficulty options and different characters, the game has good replayability potential. Game is so hard how you make it for yourself, what can be for some people disadvantage or discouraging. Also if you are looking for some hardcore challenges this game is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010489203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1637170129}
review: An eager Indiana Jones fan I jumped at this title but gave up after three tries. The game is just too difficult - on the easiest level! The first two tries everyone died at the last battle. The third time I won with my last person at 2 hit points. That is not fun - that is frustration. When will game companies learn to make the easiest level a total pushover and then, if you want to be labeled a "tough" game, REALLY ramp up the difficulty.  There is a lot in this game that looks really cool and fun. It is a shame that I, and my family, will never see it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1591028852}
review:
Great adventure game. Best FTL-type game that I have played. Lots to like: campaign unlocks, excellent writing, huge orchestrial soundtrack, and amazing pixel art graphics. There is a lot of time spent in short, XCOM-type combats. The penalty for failing is very small, so no worries about experimenting. A fun, core mechanism in the game is beating the level-end combat and getting a random, powerful item to use in future adventures.

The game is a bit dry, and I totally understand players finding it difficult to sustain interest. The Steam-achievements show 90% of owners starting the game, 60% finishing the first level, and only 30% finishing the second level. One annoyance is feeling super frustrated over a random story-event that kills a character, despite the small long-term penalty. Also, there are long load-times, even with my solid-state drive, which make this turn-based game feel slow.

I searched for lost relics on an ubuntu linux desktop with radeon mesa graphic drivers. This game uses a mouse for controls, it requires 1,000MBs of diskspace, and it uses a java-based game engine. I recommend this game to fans of FTL-style and XCOM-style games, who are looking for a game with interesting characters and stories. Even at full-price, there is a lot of content, including the new hardcore-mode that provides a continuous, one-shot campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003742159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1558701137}
review:
Pathway successfully invokes the Indiana Jones feel. The game moves at a decent pace, so even if your expedition is a failure, you will be on the next and hopefully more successful try soon enough. Insane story beats are waiting for you!

I am not a fan of pixel art in general, however, Chucklefish manage to make it work for me.

If you can stomach a certain amount of repetetive and luckbased gameplay, this is highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007670693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1525, 'last_played': 1589923515}
review:
Buy if it's on sale. Wish there was a "meh" option for ratings. It's an average game in good looking packaging.

It's a great concept for a game, really well presented and with a solid mechanical foundation, but unfortunately it's somewhat shallow and lacks the kind of substance to give it longevity and real joy in a long play through. 

While it appears there's quite a bit of variation between characters, in reality there is very little. In combat, no matter who is in your party you do the same thing: move to cover and shoot at someone (or shoot and move to cover), then rinse and repeat with all three characters across all combat phases. Occasionally you use a heal ability (medkit or repair) or attack (grenade or rapid fire) ability but those are just slight variations on the "shoot at someone" step. Solid mechanics but shallow variation mean combat gets tedious very quickly. 

In driving plot, the difference between characters is null - the story unfolds the same no matter who your party consists of; the only difference is what random events are triggered by their skillsets (i.e. do you benefit from Daredevil perk events, or Medical Expert perk events? It doesn't matter - because neither advance the story in a meaningful way, they just boost your odds at random events). So working to unlock new characters is just a bore. 

Ultimately, if you've played this game for 5 hours, you've played it for 25, and that's a problem. The shine wears off very quickly. With some additional work by the developers (fleshing the plot out for replayability; fleshing the characters out for replayability) this could be a good game. As it is, it's an average game in good looking packaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027826544', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 2050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2050, 'last_played': 1589393650}
review:
Довольно милая на первый взгляд игра, которая обещает захватывающие приключения в мире Индианы Джонса, где вырезание нацистов сопровождается спасением попавших в беду друзей и поиском таинственных артефактов, а из ближайшей древней гробницы на вас готовы ринуться толпы кровожадных культистов и зомби. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2087189363

По сути же перед нами сплав FTL с Halfway, предыдущей игрой тех же авторов. И видно, что авторы сделали ряд очень хороших по сути изменений: например, здесь нельзя проиграть (вне хардкор-режима) — убитые герои просто временно ложатся в больничку, а загубленный забег даже не приводит к потере честно награбленного лута. Более того, получив смешанные отзывы на релизе, авторы потратили ещё пару месяцев на то, чтобы [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/546430/announcements/detail/1590259313195286293]полностью переработать[/url] игровой баланс, навыки, вещи и т.д. Если раньше твоя судьба зависела от того, соизволит ли тебе великий рандом выкинуть достаточно аптечек и ремкомплектов для брони, то сейчас появился просто третий ресурс — "снаряжение", который служит расходным для этих целей (а ещё для гранат, отчего они стали совершенно бесполезны). Если раньше твоей основной целью было по сути гриндить легендарные вещи, которые позволят тебе побить финальные приключения, то сейчас прогресс куда более плавный и щадящий для психики, а легендарность лута — просто приятный бонус.  

Тем не менее, главная проблема сохранилась, и она заключается в том, что игра, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/alpasy/recommended/607050]прямо как Wargroove[/url], откровенно средненькая по всем фронтам. Забеги особо не отличаются один от другого — если в FTL была куча кораблей, оружия и кардинально разных тактик, то здесь вариативность почти нулевая. На глобальной карте ты просто движешься в направлении своей цели, и всё; даже в Slay the Spire при выборе маршрута от игрока требуется больше осознанных решений, чем здесь. Твой самый главный враг — постоянно заканчивающийся бензин, но сделать ты с этим ничего не можешь, он либо выпадает тебе после битв, либо нет. Среди кучи случайных событий — самой, казалось бы, сути игры, очень редко бывает что-то мало-мальски примечательное. Многие просто сводятся к вопросу "хочешь битву?", на который всегда следует отвечать "да", ведь иначе бензин закончится ещё скорее. Другие позволяют героям применить некий уникальный навык (как в FTL), и это единственные светлые моменты путешествия. Самим же героям недостаёт характерных черт и харизмы бойцов Jagged Alliance. Всего здесь пять глобальных сюжетных сценариев, но именно по сюжетной части они сильнее всего и проседают. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2092324750

Бой представляет собой улучшенный Halfway (теперь вероятность попадания применяется только к врагам, сидящим за укрытием, а в чистом поле или вплотную она всегда 100%). Он похож на XCOM, но только внешне: его нельзя играть с икскомовской тактикой — зашкериться за укрытиями и перестреливаться с врагами. Из-за того, что укрытия резко снижают вероятность попадания, у врагов при такой тактике будет явное превосходство из-за численного преимущества. Здесь авторы рассчитывали на более бесшабашный подход, присущий всем искателям приключений, где герой отважно выскакивает из-за укрытия, чтобы подбежать к врагу и сходу проломить ему череп! А на следующем ходу — другому. Дело разнообразят спец-навыки, но недостаточно. Голубая мечта боевой системы — найти такое оружие, чтобы один выстрел давал один труп (а лучше два), но тогда бой превращается в откровенный тир, самые опасные мишени которого — культисты с гранатами, против которых нет особого приёма. 

Ещё если бы мне десять лет назад сказали такое, я бы ушам своим не поверил, но существенный недостаток игры — отсутствие поддержки геймпада. К расслабленной позе на диване ой как быстро привыкаешь, и склоняться перед монитором за мышью уже кажется изрядным ретроградством. Но тут управление (и интерфейс) в принципе далеки от идеала. Игра сразу приучает тебя пользоваться кнопкой Tab, которая показывает доп. информацию по наведению курсора, но на самом деле эта информация жизненно важна (н-р, вероятность попадания по врагам с данной клетки), и не понятно, зачем тут вообще нужен Tab (совет о котором к тому же так легко проморгать).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2089433755

В общем, я хотел покончить с игрой уже на третьем приключении, но потом увлёкся неким подобием здешнего метагейма — разблокировать новых героев и достижения (за многие из которых дают игровую награду — отличная идея, которую стоит применять чаще). В итоге доиграл "до конца", но считаю, что лучше бы просто расчехлил FTL. Да даже Halfway, при всех его недостатках, мне [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/alpasy/recommended/253150]понравился больше[/url] — сюжетная и атмосферная составляющая там была куда лучше, а битвы куда разнообразнее (были даже боссы, которых здесь почему-то нет). Pathway же можно рекомендовать только самым истовым фанатам приключенческо-сорвиголового сеттинга.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022079241', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 447, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1610911835}
review:
"We gonna be doin one thing, and one thing only : killing gnazis"
Brad Pitt, aka Lt. Aldo Raine, "Inglorious Bastards" ---


Tu aimes Indiana Jones et Inglorious Bastards, le tour-par-tour et les rogue-like bien gaulés ?

Ca s'appelle PATHWAY. Ca veut dire "sentier". Oui, je suppose qu'ils ont eu du mal à trouver un titre.
Le jeu précédent, HALFWAY, avait une tonalité SF mais la base était déjà implantée : du pixel art et du tour par tour.
Mais comment appeler un jeu dans lequel une équipe de héros s'engouffre dans une jeep pour sillonner l'Afrique désertique en se fritant avec des nazis toutes les 2 cases ?

Oui, on se déplace case-par-case, on bastonne au tour-par-tour, et Pathway se place entre "Curious Expeditions", "Renowned Explorers", et l'ambiance Indiana Jones. 
On peut dire que c'est un jeu de plateau à connotation rogue-like.

La direction artistique est fantastique : pixel art au sommet, précis, éclairé à la torche ou feu de camp dès que la nuit tombe.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2083782358

Le jeu est quasi muet (et tant mieux, car le tactical est par essence hyper-répétitif, alors c'est un choix pertinent que de nous éviter des voix qu'on ne supporterait plus au bout de 4-5 runs). Cependant sa musique et sa palette sonore font preuve de beaucoup de charme.

On parcourt de délicieux petits inserts scénaristiques au gré des événements aléatoires, tandis que notre groupe avance sur la carte et gonfle son expérience.
Les rencontres variées et hasardeuses, couplées aux accidents divers et autres revers de fortune, peuvent faire basculer le run entier, dans la grande tradition rogue-like, mais Pathway, qui n'a pas choisi de réelle position (walking sim ou hardcore tactical ?), s'offre totalement, par des jauges / potentiomètres tout à fait réglables, où l'on agence son aventure comme on le souhaite.

J'ai eu le privilège de discuter avec un des auteurs, qui m'a expliqué que les ventes du jeu allaient déterminer si des mises à jour seraient déployées ainsi que d'autres modes. Ce serait bienvenue, car au bout d'une petite vingtaine d'heures, on a plus ou moins fait le tour.

Car si on en revient à "Inglorious Bastards",et à la citation de Brad Pitt, aka Lt. Aldo Raine :
"We gonna be doing one thing, and one thing only : killing gnazis" / "Nous n'allons faire une chose, et une seulement : tuer des nazis" ... vous allez en occire des centaines en quelques sessions, et au final on est rassasié en quelques soirées.

Bien sûr, si on est sensible à la chaleur du désert, aux trajets expéditionnaires de groupe au doux son de la jeep qui patine entre les dunes, et de combats tactiques, on y reviendra avec plaisir, d'autant plus que les runs ont leur part d'aléatoire, et que les personnages gardent expérience & équipement au fil des voyages.

On a également un ensemble de succès, ingame et Steam, à déverouiller, d'autres aventuriers à recruter, des armes et du matériel à looter, des événements de hasard pas encore gagnés, ou bien des envies de sniper du nazi, tout simplement.

Mais en se privant -pour l'instant- du Steam Workshop et d'un éditeur d'aventures, sans DLC (les 5 expéditions se torchent en 20-25h en prenant le temps), il se prive aussi de gravir un échelon vers l'excellence. 



Alors pour qu'il brille d'avantage, il faut lui donner sa chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080123570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1588513360}
review:
Gorgeous pixel art backs well oiled, yet simple, combat mechanics.
The light node-based exploration, while being well written, lacks both in quantity and impact.
The character cast also lacks variety and game changing skills/traits (enemy AI is composed of two factions).
I really enjoyed the first couple of hours (first two adventures), than the feeling of discovery fades fast but the tactical combat is still there to be enjoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049118964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1585989092}
review:
Pathway is a game I dearly wanted to love. It's got great music and a really eye-catching art style, and it's heavily inspired by Indiana Jones. Plus I love tactical, turn-based RPGs. This should have everything I want in a video game, but it doesn't.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z8GFqzMntZA

The biggest problem is that Pathway is simply boring. All events, characters, fights, gear, and collectibles are effectively the same, so after only an hour or so, you've already seen everything this game has to offer. It doesn't help that the fights are also extremely repetitive. The same tactics work for every encounter, get behind cover, and shoot at the tougher enemies first. There are unique abilities for characters, but most of them feel useless.

There's also no story to speak of. You're going around trying to find treasure... and that's it. Where's the Indiana Jones influenced we were promised?

This is simply not a very good game. If you want a more detailed review, I suggest checking out my video review of it. Otherwise, there are many better tactical turn-based RPGs out there by a mile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982690094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1680114772}
review:
It is a really nice turn-based tactics game in an Indiana Jones-ey setting. Does not overcomplicate managing your team, still gives you the great feeling of success when you get through a level. As said before, the levels can be repetitive, but that is the actual fun part of the game. I never had problems with blocks in Tetris :)
Try not to run out of fuel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155983470', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1588370483}
review:
I guess i can understand the negative reviews but i find the game to be very entertaining so far. It's a little on the easy side if you have played tactics games (like their previous game Halfway) and pick the "healer" character but i like the immersion of the encounters. Also, this game has maybe the polished pixel art UI i have ever seen. Only real big issue to me is that the tactics systems seem clunky but i thought the same thing about Halfway and I would say what they have here is an improvement over that game. I'll echo what others have said: you can't really play this game like X-Com in spite of the fact that it's tactical systems seem similar. Have to play it a bit more aggressively.

PROS:
- amazing pixel art, lighting effects
- very cool encounter system with lot of things going on and being visualized
- super immersive setting
- music seems ripped straight from Indiana Jones movies
- great character skills and weapons to make them feel unique
- very cool systems designs

CONS
- tactics UI system is a little clunky
- a little on the easy side
- not much variety of enemies
- cover and initial move systems are a little confusing at first

author: {'steamid': '76561197970523425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1992, 'last_played': 1670103657}
review:
Solid entry into the "FTLbut" genre. This time it's FTL, but with an Indiana Jones theme and XCOM mechanics. 

The presentation is extremely charming. The graphics combine pixel art and dynamic lighting (camp fires cast shadows, there's a full day/night cycle, enemy dogs and zombies have eyes that glow in the dark) in a way I have never seen before. The writing is skilled and evocative: each of the many player characters speaks with a distinct voice, and the story hints at greater mysteries.

The mechanics are FTL with turn-based combat in the tradition of XCOM. The combat system isn't quite as deep as modern XCOM, but it's a lot more polished and fun than old-school Xcom or any of its many imitators.

Travelling across the overworld between each combat encounter doesn't have as many interesting decisions as FTL, but it has some fun mechanics. If your expedition fails, the characters you used end up in hospital, forcing you to try a different team, and incentivising you to unlock more characters. At times you have to choose between pressing on with the risk of losing your faves for the next run, or just giving up and restarting. 

The game has weak points (on some of the tactical maps it's hard to tell what you can and can't hide behind or walk through; there's a lack of variety of enemies and environments, so you are fighting Nazis or zombies in the desert the whole time, when a trip to the Antarctic or Tibet or the Hollow Earth would have made a great third act; I ran into technical glitches on Windows where the game began to crash and suffer corrupt sprites the further I got into the campaign). But it was enough fun that I played the whole main campaign over a long Covid-19 lockdown weekend.

Buy if you like FTL and turn-based tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004808922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2031, 'last_played': 1701407554}
review:
Really decent game with fun turn based tactics, a cool variation of characters, and a really entertaining story and theme.  It's easy to learn and fun to explore all the different way to build your squad.

The game is a bit short though.  I got through all the adventures in a matter of days, and character and item level only progress to 6 (at least on standard difficulty, it can be increased).  Still worth a buy, especially if you find it on sale.  It's a good way to spend a weekend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240862168', 'num_games_owned': 3722, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 2911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2911, 'last_played': 1586441538}
review:
[h1]🎤Introduction[/h1]
[i]Pathway[/i] is a turn-based rogue-like that takes its core mechanics inspired by the [i]Xcom[/i] series and its art style and story inspired by [i]Indiana Jones[/i]. Neither of these hinders the game because it’s not original, in fact these two combined work well together. Though the rogue-like elements don’t suit the strategic and cautious gameplay style very well and overall it makes the game more repetitive and frustrating than it needs to be.

[h1]✔️Pros[/h1]
• 16 unique characters all with their unique abilities, skills, perks, and personalities 
• A difficulty slider to make the game as easy or difficult as you like
• Constant risk-reward choices
• Writing is detailed enough to compensate for the lack of animation
• Soundtrack is simple and minimalistic
• Sound effects are powerful and varied
• The art style is beautifully represented with pixel graphics
• Environments are varied, very distinct and unique from one another

[h1]❌Cons[/h1]
• It can get repetitive at times
• It might’ve been better off not being a rogue-like
• Only 5 adventures (About 15 - 20 hours of gameplay)
• Some levels are too big for their own good
• Occasionally the percentage of landing your shot doesn’t make sense
• Sometimes the screen isn’t zoomed out enough to see how far an enemy can move or shoot

[h1]🕹Gameplay[/h1]
You’ll be greeted with a vast selection of characters at your disposal, only starting with a handful at the beginning whilst the rest you’ll have to unlock by completing certain tasks. Each character possesses their own abilities, skill trees and perks that they can utilise as well as certain types of weapons, armour and off-hand equipment that can aid you in battle. Micromanaging all of the equipment for every character however is tedious, if there was an optimise button to give all the characters the best equipment from your storage it would make things a lot easier.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2054275580

Each adventure you’ll be traversing across various maps, going to different location points to reach your destination. Each of these locations will provide a randomly generated scenario whether it’s an ambush from enemies, a shop, a camp to heal, a risk-reward scenario or just flavour text. It’s your job to ensure you have enough supplies (ammo, fuel and supplies are all limited) to reach your destination and succeed at defeating the evil forces.

The handcrafted battle maps are carefully designed to ensure that there's plenty of cover to tackle any situation you might find yourself in and offer variations of maps with the cover in different places. Even though there are explosive barrels that can aid you in battle, I wish there were more environmental objects to utilise to make the maps more intriguing.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2054251996

Rogue-like is quite a popular genre nowadays, sometimes it feels like it’s thrown into a game for the sake of it and this can either hurt or enhance the gameplay. Unfortunately, I feel like this title would’ve been better without some of the rogue-like elements and focused on a more linear game with more handmade adventures. Having to restart an adventure over again because you died at the last hurdle is frustrating, especially if it’s taken you an hour to get there because you’ve been playing cautiously. Despite obtaining better equipment when dying, it doesn’t seem plausible enough to compensate for the lack of progress you could’ve made by completing the adventure and moving onto the next one. Since the game encourages you to play cautiously there isn’t much incentive to try again immediately after failing. Even if you do, you’ll probably find yourself rushing through the adventure to try and complete it as fast as possible to progress to the next one.

However to counter the aforementioned problem, there is a difficulty slider you can adjust before setting off on your adventure making it as easy or difficult as you wish. Changing certain variables such as the amount of ammo, fuel and supplies you start with or changing how many enemies will spawn on each map.

During each adventure you’ll undoubtedly be faced with random scenarios that you’ll have to make decisions for which can yield either positive or negative results. This is where the risk-reward system comes into play. For example, you might discover an abandoned building that could hold valuable loot, on the other hand you might not find anything and instead get ambushed by Nazis and be forced to battle. Some characters have perks that can be used in a handful of situations for a higher chance of yielding positive results.

What this game lacks in animation it makes up for with detailed and impactful writing to best describe the scene, probably better than it could've been animated. The sheer level of detail is never let down and is consistent throughout no matter if it’s part of the main story or if it’s a random situation that you’ve found yourself in. The occasional voiceover at the start and end of each adventure is equally as impactful and helps set the atmosphere for each journey.

[h1]❓Bugs[/h1]
Occasionally the health of an enemy won’t update immediately. Killing 2 Infected enemies next to each other in a single shot causes one of them to stand up as if it’s still alive.

[h1]🎧Music & Sound[/h1]
This game does a fantastic job of keeping the music simple and minimalistic, setting the atmosphere for every battle extremely well whether you're outnumbered and trying to survive, or if it’s another encounter with the Nazis in the desert.

Sound effects are also a big plus for this game, from shotguns to snipers, pistols, rifles, everything has a specific sound. When you hit your target there is a lot of feedback even more if you land a critical hit. When you miss there’s a very distinctive sound to it that’s satisfying every time you hear it. Though hopefully you won’t hear that particular sound too much...

[h1]🎨Graphics[/h1]
The visuals in this game are stunning and the pixel art in itself is impressive, but it’s further enhanced with great use of lighting and a lot of very distinctive and diverse environments. From gloomy underground caves, to rancid sewers, to villages with lushes green grass, there is a lot of variety. The characters and the majority of the enemy designs are all recognisable (besides the Cultists and Zombies) so you can instantly tell what types of enemies you’re up against.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2054252056

[h1]💭Closing Thoughts[/h1]
[i]Pathway[/i] doesn’t try to disguise itself from being inspired by [i]Xcom[/i] and [i]Indiana Jones[/i], and this in no way holds the game back because it’s not original. However, I feel the style of gameplay doesn’t suit the rogue-like system very well. As enjoyable as it might be the first few times, it does get repetitive after a while and you’ll find yourself rushing through an adventure that you were narrowly close to completing previously. However, the game provides stunning visuals and varied environments to keep the game fresh for as long as possible and the detail in the writing is fantastic. You might only get a couple of hours out of this game depending on your tolerance, but those few hours will be worth it.

[quote]For more critically honest reviews of mine, check out [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/MetrosReviewCorner]Metro’s Review Corner[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017965344', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1621318227}
review:
While this game has a great premise, it fails to follow through on it. I'd say the two biggest problems with it is that the combat lacks variety and depth, while the exploration isn't interesting.

As you explore the over world, you'll find a lot of empty space in between the interesting stuff. About a third of the nodes amount to "You admire the scenery." or "You lost some fuel." Maybe the intent was to give you feeling of a long adventure, across the vast sands of a foreign land. But in practice you're going to be spamming the skip button, so that you actually find something to do. Also, those "You lost fuel" moments stop being an issue after a few runs. By that point, you've accumulated enough money that you can freely buy all the fuel you find in shops. When you do encounter combat, you'll start realizing that there's not much variety. 

Your crew's abilities are half the issue here. A lot of skills sound cool or useful, but are too specific or weak. For example headshot instantly kill off an injured enemy. Sounds cool right? Except if someone has already injured an enemy, they'll usually die in one more shot. Then there's sucker punch which pushes an enemy back and does extra damage if they collide into some cover or another enemy. Except a grenade does at least as much damage, can hit more people, and doesn't require your crew to run into punching range. Then you get to the enemy variety, or lack there of. Enemies basically boil down to melee and ranged enemies. Sure some have a couple abilities like your crew has. But many of the enemies don't. So you only need to worry about getting in range or flanking them.

To be honest. You're better off buying Faster Than Light, Renowned Explorers: International Society, or Into The Breach. All of these games do combat and exploration better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235709886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1586402143}
review: This game is... a disappointment.  I knew, going in, that the combat was a bit clunky and the encounters were limited in scope, but I really underestimated how unfinished the game felt.  The characters have enough variation to feel unique, but some are clearly better or worse than others.  Combat is basically the only relevant thing in the game, which makes it extra disappointing that the combat is not only slow and unpleasant, but also that there's no variation.  There are, as far as I can tell, fewer than ten different types of enemies (counting reskins as different enemies), all with two very predictable AIs.  There are no occasions where the combat is notably different from any other time.  No bosses, no 'endurance' modes, no different objectives, nothing.  Just the same damn enemies over and over in slightly different quantities.  There are a few different weapon types, but even with legendary weapons and artifacts, the gameplay does not measurably change.  Seriously; as of April 2020, this game is not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421443903', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1674889196}
review:
游戏总共有5个剧本，我达成了十次冒险的成就
一看成就达成率1.5%，这是一个带有肉鸽元素的游戏
官方应当好好反思一下玩家为什么不愿意重复玩这个游戏
除开第一个关卡，其他的都持续三个地图，中间大量的重复和拖沓
游戏人物很多，但其实战斗表现来看非常同质化，触发事件方面，结合上一行所说，空旷的地图上只有枯燥乏味的重复战斗，普通事件一张图一句话，和没发生过一样，特殊事件要依靠人物的特殊能力才能继续进行，有时候仅仅一个人物还完成不了，一个队伍起手任选三人，途中随缘增加一个，这样的情况下想要触发较为稀有的特殊事件真的千难万难。
我打了双倍于剧本数量的游戏局数，积累性任务还不到总要求数量的1/3，特殊事件更是只见过最容易的几个，制作者也许是想通过这样的方式延长游戏可玩性，但其实只是把游戏变得更急枯燥乏味，我觉得设计这方面的制作者如果亲自通关了游戏就不会还留着这么滑稽的设定。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993974177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1585267214}
review:
A nice roguelite based on Indiana Jones. World map movement is akin to FTL, events are standard multi-choice, combat is like XCOM and character development has RPG elements such as levelling and skill trees. Graphics are really nice and the 5 story driven campaigns are just enough to go on. There's a reasonable amount of content. Lots of characters to choose from, each with their own perks and skill trees. Lots of various, highly detailed battle maps, and an adequate amount of events. 

Though the game is designed to be replayable, don't be fooled, there isn't enough content for a second playthrough of each campaign. Instead, it's better to think of this game as a linear series of episodic story-driven campaigns set in an Indiana Jones setting - once you've completed them, then they are done and there's nothing more to get out of them. 

As others have already said, events are too-often avoid combat or choose combat or something is forced upon you. When I said they were multi-choice, well I use that term rather loosely. Most events in the game give the option to interact, use a special perk if applicable or leave. If you don't have the special perk for the event, you get two choices. That's absolutely bare-bones. What's more, there are plenty of events which require a perk for you to succeed and if you don't have it, you face negative consequences or you have to leave. The fact that you never had a chance really sucks and makes the event pointless. Curious Expedition does this so much better as you get much more tactical choices which give you an actual chance to succeed, no matter how little skill you may have. 

Regardless, I'd say the game's theme, pretty graphics, and content is enough to drive you through the game and enjoy it. I think it has a good price point. However, if you don't already have Curious Expedition, get that first. That game also has an adventurous theme but is considerably more replayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024929184', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1586466971}
review:
👾 Qu'il est bon le petit Rogue Like a papa 😋, nostalgiques de l'univers Lucas/Sieplberg des années 80 vous allez vous ré-ga-ler et oubliez que ce jeu s'adresse à un public jeune 🤫 voir très jeune 🛴…😄
PATHWAY est un jeu tactique tour par tour dans un univers genre "aventuriers de l'arche perdue". Vous allez pouvoir dégommer🧨du Nazi 🤮 à souhait 🤤.
Le jeu emprunte plusieurs codes vidéoludiques comme des soldats nazi modifiés, inspiré de "return to the castle Wolfenstein" ou un armement proche de "Borderlands", agrémenté des sempiternels zombis 🧟‍♂️ égarés ça et là. Pour chaque aventure vous choisirez trois personnages (+ 1 à recruter en cours d'aventure), 16 personnages sont à disposition ou à débloquer, chacun avec ses propres attributs, équipements et armes. 
Pathway est un jeu à "génération procédurale", ceci est valable pour les décors des combats autant que pour les évènements qui sont le cœur de l'histoire de chaque aventure, et ça marche plutôt bien 👍. La gameplay est souple et intuitive, l'interface claire et documentée (juste ce qu'il faut), l'inventaire est succinct mais pratique. 

Conclusion, ce petit RPG très FUN 🤩 n'a pas la prétention de faire de l'ombre au gros cube du genre. Pathway allie la détente, la réflexion (sans prise de tête 🤯) dans un environnement cohérent et une IA équilibrée.

Astuce :  En plaçant un outil de soin et de réparation dans l'inventaire, vous pourrez soigner vos personnages et réparer les boucliers entre deux combats ou évènements sans l'obligation de posséder un attribut adéquat 😉.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030785428', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1635122864}
review: Thoroughly enjoyable game.  Lots of customization between various characters and playthroughs, adjustable difficulty, and plenty of RNG - it's just what I look for in a roguelike game.  The artwork is great and the events are short enough that I actually have interest in reading what they say is going on, unlike most roguelikes other than maybe FTL (the first time).  Strong theme and great play experience, I would definitely recommend if you're into this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025268740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1584188443}
review:
Pretty disappointed in this game.  The description/trailers describe a choose-your-own adventure style narrative, perhaps similar to "Curious Expedition".  The actual campaign experience involves very little, if any, meaningful decision making.  Deciding which "Pathway" to take on the gamemap is entirely a matter of deciding how much you want to grind before you get to the final boss.  With the exception of a few icons to indicate the presence of stores, resting points, and recruitment, there are no hints at all for what might lie ahead on the various paths you can take.  Indeed, it seems as if all of the stopping points are entirely randomized, with the exception of important plot point stopping points which you are guaranteed to encounter no matter which path you choose.  The game also promises a decision making experience within each encounter, but this is also basically untrue.  Even if you load up on as many character encounter skills as possible, the vast majority of encounters involve only one decision: fight or not fight?  The game's resource management system always favors fight, because fuel is the limiting factor rather than health or ammo, so it is always worth it to fight for the chance of getting more fuel.  Many encounters involve your characters doing exciting things without any input from the player.  In other encounters, literally nothing happens at all.  A very small minority of events include an option to use one of your character skills, if you have it, in which case the correct answer is to always use the character skill.  In the end, outside of combat there are pretty much no decisions to make.

The combat itself is solid, relatively fun turn based tactics.  I like it, but it could certainly be improved.  The AI is pretty bad, with enemy units running away from safe cover to exposed ground and neglecting to take what might be devastating flanking shots at the player's characters.  The AI often seem to be moving completely randomly.  This makes the combat both easier and less tactical - if the AI does not make strategic decisions, you can't try to predict what they will do, which makes the player's own decisions less meaningful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015376233', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1642113566}
review:
You move on the map, micromanage fuel, ammmo, supplies to heal yourself with etc. Characters have skills in combat that level up i.e. someone uses knifes, someone sniper rifle, someone grenades and shotguns etc... Characters also have special skills that yield different, very often better outcome in event situations. These events are a mainstay of the game. They are text based and go together with some animations.  It's up to you which characters you take on each of the journey. The combat happens sometimes on it's own, sometimes as the result of the event. It's ufo-based, somewhat repetetive, easy, but I found it fun nevertheless. 
----
In overal it's a neat take on rogue-like, you can play it easily for few tens of minutes before leaving to work / school or if you are not in a mood for AAA great games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993201489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1583241438}
review:
Игра неплохая, но рекомендовать не могу.

Из плюсов - приятная графика и атмосфера, есть какое-то ощущения а ля Индиана Джонс.
С другой стороны сюжет совершенно никакой, бои быстро надоедают, нет интересных ситуаций, нет глубины. Случайные события на карте крайне репетативные и очень простые, как по сценарию, так и по геймплею.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330088783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1380, 'last_played': 1583388971}
review:
（7/10）

通关后给的装备仍旧存在质量上的问题，比如第一关的高难度出的装备永远比不过最后一关的低难度出的装备，结果就是通关后只能反复攻略第五关。建议难度更改后出的装备能赶上现有装备的质量。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047477372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1708313576}
review:
I must recommend this game as it is right up my alley. I love 16-bit AND turn-based strategy so it's a match made in heaven. If you're like me, dive headlong into this beauty. It is chock-full of 16-bit eye candy an the TBS is good enough with the variety of characters and weapons to choose from.

Having said that, what was done with the graphics, the engine, and the music fails to impress. The game is quite limited, having little to no linear story (the five adventures available feel quite independent), no perspective of expending on its limited content (no modding, no dlcs, no extra stories). So you're basically stuck with five not-so-different adventures that range from 1 to 3 hours long and you get to replay them as much as you want to unlock different adventurers and get the achievements. Yay. Keep in mind, a lot of the procedurally placed events happen in more than one adventure, and quite often you'll see events repeat themselves inside the very same adventure.

This is a beautiful-looking game with an excellent soundtrack that unfortunately was made into a casual experience in adventuring. I still recommend it though cause its hella fun. Lets shoot nazis!

author: {'steamid': '76561198354026018', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1647015529}
review: 这款游戏地图方面借鉴的ftl，战斗上和XCOM如出一辙，每个人物有自己的特点和功能，还是有一定的可玩性的。但是这个游戏所有的装备都可以继承这一点感觉就有点像刷刷刷游戏了，个人觉得如果做成单纯的rougelike游戏可能会更好一点，毕竟刷出好武器护甲了以后感觉游戏难度瞬间下降了很多。剧情内容的确是有点少，而且没有boss战，每关关底就是打多几个小兵而已，感觉在战斗上就没那么过瘾，像那些破甲高的武器都没有什么用武之地了，因为打护甲高的小兵直接刀杀反而更加简便。文本内容和背景音乐感觉都比较普通，打完了以后也并没有像ftl，itb和XCOM一样有一种完成了使命、拯救了世界的那种史诗感，打折的时候入的话还是蛮划算的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029128551', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1583435934}
review:
Estrategia, combates tácticos, elementos rpg y un toque de roguelike es lo que ofrece Pathway, la propuesta de Robotality, que nos pone al mando de un pintoresco grupo de héroes que deberán cumplir peligrosas misiones en Medio Oriente y África a la vez que frustran los planes de los malvados nazis.

Pathway es un videojuego de aventuras y combates tácticos por turnos que nos lleva a 1936, una época en que la influencia nazi se extiende por toda Europa y Medio Oriente. El título nos propone reunir a un grupo de aventureros, cada uno con sus características y habilidades especiales, que deberán explorar antiguas ruinas para evitar que el ejercito del reich se haga con antiguos y poderosos artefactos. Estamos ante un juego que divide su jugabilidad en dos segmentos bien marcados: Por un lado, tenemos la exploración, para la cual se nos presenta un mapa, donde nos podremos mover por distintos puntos -siempre que no se agoten los recursos que nos permiten desplazarnos- en los cuales se presentarán diferentes eventos que tendremos que resolver mediante toma de decisiones. Por el otro, el combate táctico, cuyas mecánicas resultan ser bastante similares a las de XCOM. Las misiones, en general, consistirán en eliminar a todos los enemigos haciendo un uso estratégico tanto de armas como de coberturas. Una vez cumplido el objetivo, obtendremos experiencia, lo cual hará que nuestros personajes mejoren. La producción presenta un apartado artístico muy bien cuidado y una ambientación sobresaliente que recuerda a los filmes de Indiana Jones. Pathway resulta ser un buen videojuego, que si bien adolece de algunos problemas, resulta una interesante propuesta para quien quiera iniciarse en el genero ¡Recomendado!

Lo Bueno:
+Apartado gráfico muy bien cuidado.
+Su lograda ambientación.
+Es bastante amigable para aquellos que se inician en los juegos con combates tácticos.

Lo Malo:
-Los eventos del mapa suelen repetirse a menudo.
-La inteligencia artificial no es especialmente brillante.
-Poca variedad de enemigos.

review: 我希望这部游能进一步的丰富剧情，谁能接受进游戏就看到副本只有四五个，而且副本里第一个打纳粹，第二个zombie，第三个又打纳粹，而且对不同种的敌人也没有区分度，也没有boss，这让整体游戏难度下降。应该可以学学战场女武神里面的游戏体验真的是我玩战棋类游戏最棒的了。这游戏的优点在于剧情战斗part之外的画风、人物装备上，虽然装备的掉落率也太高了吧？

author: {'steamid': '76561198042174730', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1583021808}
review:
100点満点中50点
よくある売るときの見た目のためにガワだけ作りこんだ作品。
グラフィックやBGM、ゲームシステムなど非常によくできていて最初の数時間は100点満点の出来の良さです。
XCOMをコピーしたシステムは好きな人ならば楽しめると思います。
しかしある程度プレイすると作りの浅さが見えてきます。
目標は敵の全滅しかない、敵の多様性のなさ、5面しかないうえにあまりにも拍子抜けなラストステージ。
フィールドマップも最終的には戦闘やイベントは可能な限り全スルーして進むだけになりがち。
とぱっと見の部分はよくできているのに中身がなさすぎます。
1000円程度なら十分遊べるのでセールの時にかいましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198340140736', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1622702134}
review:
[h1]我手里有块精致的小蛋糕，他没了[/h1]

[b]画面[/b]
首先为什么说他精致，这个像素游戏的画面表现简直吓人，自然光和火光以及阴影的处理上无比细腻，同时也营造出富有层次的立体感，使得人物丶建筑与背景的区分非常明显。在一款2D像素画风的游戏中，如此出色的光影效果简直是难以想象的。

[b]战斗[/b]
游戏的战斗系统做的还是很不错的，远程攻击的话子弹有限，建筑掩体和射击视角以及命中率直接挂钩，近战则要担着挨枪子的风险却能必定命中且不浪费资源。单纯莽夫或者全局怂着打黑枪都是没有出路的，敌方的AI也不低，不走位容易被包抄。16个角色的能力和天赋各有特色，合理搭配队伍才能有效规划战斗风格，提高作战能力。

[b]资源管理[/b]
初始会自带一些资源作为起手，当然是远远不够撑到终点的，而旅途中能获取的资源不仅少也非常昂贵，所以资源管理就显得非常重要。由于本作的设定是在沙漠，所以汽油为第一重要的资源，在第一步时玩家就该规划好行进路线，不然半路没油可是致命的。而弹药和补给也是重要资源，开枪就要弹药不说，修补护甲/回血/手雷可都是算在补给物资里面的，这也给游戏增加了一些模拟经营的要素。不过相信大家都很容易上手，毕竟在游戏里面怎么贪才能最大化利用资源可是必修课啊。
游戏进程是多周目的，得到的装备和解锁的角色能力可以一直保留，所以也带些养成的感觉。

[b]总结[/b]
怎么说呢该有的都有，可惜敌人类型太少，事件也不够丰富，整体流程满打满算十来小时。游戏好玩是真的好玩，怎么不多出点，就这点内容才刚上手呢。
[h1]————————————[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101208474', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1582811278}
review:
《Pathway》是一款策略冒险像素游戏，由呵呵鱼工作室代理发行。
因为《星露谷物语》，《星界边境》这些像素游戏珠玉在前，所以一直对呵呵鱼工作室颇有好感。在这个追求高清画质精美建模的游戏时代，能有人执着于在像素中发现游戏的美的确是一件很了不起的事。
 
可能源于呵呵鱼对像素美的追求，《PathWay》的画面表现的确让人惊艳。
不管是宏观表现还是细节设定，都可见其用心之处，和其他像素游戏的廉价感对比明显。而
Pixel/Voxel成像技术，更是将光影与像素进行了深层次的结合，让这个由16X像素构成的二战中东世界变得更加立体和鲜活。
 
比较让我意外的是游戏过程中遇到的每一个事件，居然都配有详尽的过场动画，的确是良心十足。

在玩法设定上，《PathWay》也给与了玩家们足够的惊喜，首次将策略RPG与rougelike融于一体，给公式化的游戏旅程添加了一份随机性。玩家每到达一个地点，会触发事件或者战斗，事件充满着随机性，有可能是获得补给也有可能会发生意外，而其中一些特殊事件还会和角色特性相关联，以此产生不同的后果。
 在大地图上加入了生存机制，结合游戏背景，用汽油限制玩家的行进路线，在保障剩余汽油能到达目的地的同时，尽可能的探索更多地事件点，获取更多的经验和补给。

这些改动诚然都加强了游戏性，可是却恰恰在战斗这个核心方面，丢掉了策略游戏最关键的严谨性，或者说本作刻意而为之的使战斗元素轻量化，服务于所谓的随机式沙盒冒险。
之所以有这种感觉，是因为战斗副本过于同质化，每一次遇敌都是大同小异，几个远程士兵加两条近战狗，后面出现的僵尸兵种也没什么特点。相比于能力各异的主角团，敌军的能力实在是不忍直视，就算是高难度也不过是血更厚了点，攻击更高了点。
 
源于战场设定的行动机制，所有的战斗只要贯彻“边打边退”的套路，基本没有什么难度。玩家要做的就是尽可能的用最少的血和补给赢得经验和奖励，以此在后续的冒险中有更多的可选择机会和容错率。

总而言之，《PathWay》弱化了策略元素，更像是个随机冒险游戏，我不大喜欢里面千篇一律的战斗，但却也并不妨碍我完整的体验这款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561197963213840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1638459490}
review:
Mein erstes Spiele-Review, weil ich einfach danke sagen möchte für die letzten 16 tollen Spielstunden. Genau die Art Spiel, die mir gefallen. Wem rundenbasierte Taktikspiele wie Jagged Alliance (wer das noch kennt), die X-COM-Reihe, Faster Than Light oder Into the Breach Spass machen, dem wird dieses Spiel auch gefallen. 
Was ich besonders gut finde: Das Spiel ist m. E. sehr gut ausbalanciert und der Loot wirkt extrem belohnend. Es gibt wie bei anderen Spielen normale, seltene, epische, legendäre und einzigartige Waffen und Gegenstände/Ausrüstung zu finden. Ausserdem ist das Szenario sehr cool und die Missionen sowie die Ereignisse überhaupt nicht platt, sondern im Gegenteil ist das Storytelling äusserst gelungen. Nur selten repetieren sich die zufälligen Ereignisse pro Wegpunkt, wo man jeweils meist die Wahl hat, wie man verfahren möchte. 

Ich habe das Spiel während einer Aktion gekauft, finde aber, es wäre auch den vollen Preis wert gewesen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213697065', 'num_games_owned': 1661, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1583629334}
review:
[h1]《Pathway》-二战背景轻rogue战旗[/h1]
《Pathway》的剧情发生在二战时期，纳粹不仅发动了战争，还进行了各种惨无人道的实验和人体改造，甚至产生了丧尸这种生物，而且纳粹的影响已经蔓延到了欧洲和中东地区，在沙漠里都能看到纳粹的足迹。冒险者们组成了四人小组，开着吉普车穿越沙漠，挖掘宝藏和秘密，并与纳粹和丧尸展开殊死搏斗。游戏是类XCOM的战斗模式，随机生成的地图和事件提升了游戏性，并且普通模式下关卡都是独立的，当作饭后茶余的小游戏来上一局也是不错的选择。

[h1]身怀绝技的冒险者团队[/h1]
	冒险者们都是多姿多彩的，各自精通不同的武器装备，霰弹枪、狙击枪、突击步枪、手枪、手雷、医疗包、针线、军刀、盔甲等，初始冒险者中会针线修理盔甲的竟然是个沙特王子。每个冒险者们都有自己独特的属性，关乎着生命、移动距离、精准度等，其中耐力属性有点意思，重伤后可以苟活数个回合，治疗后又是一条好汉。

	游戏还有着数个需要解锁才能使用的冒险家，大多数的解锁条件为击杀一定数量的敌人，就算为了新人物，也不能逃避战斗。普通模式下每个关卡都是独立的，游戏最近还更新了硬核模式，每个关卡的物品都会继承，人物死亡就会永远消失，虽说难度会增加，但这样更感觉是在体验一个完整的剧情。

[h1]随机生成的地图和事件[/h1]
	每个关卡的地图都是随机生成的，并且还拥有各种随机事件，以图画和文字表现出来，增强了代入感。地图中还有着商人、休息处、战斗点等固定事件，休息处甚至可以反复休息。吉普车在地图中可以任意移动，但每次只能移动一格，并且移动需要消耗燃料，没有燃料步行的话又会消耗生命，合理利用燃料做到收益最大化，也是需要考虑的一点。

[h1]灵活的战棋类战斗[/h1]
	触发战斗后会进入当前场景的战斗地图，首先在固定绿色范围内布置队员，需要注意的是首个回合只有一个行动点。其余战斗就和xcom类似了，但与之最大的不同是，本作的射击并不结束当前回合，也就是说可以打游击战，攻击后撤退，但这仅限于射程比敌人远的枪械，否则可能被敌人溜死。近战武器和xcom一样强得很，军刀输出又高，又不消耗弹药，实属突击首选。战斗胜利后还会获得各种装备道具，增强团队实力，但车仓数量有限，合理取舍也是个问题，幸好燃料、弹药和补给不占用空间。

	打败敌人或进行事件还会获得经验，人物升级后能解锁新的技能或增加属性，战斗中需要消耗勇气才能使用，比如手枪的二连击，突击步枪的扫射一条线，可以在一回合攻击多个敌人，还有着猛冲这样不消耗行动点的位移技能，勇气可以通过击杀敌人恢复。这款游戏的移动相对灵活，受伤是在所难免的，推荐征募队友的时候选择一个医疗兵，不然手里空有补给却没有医疗包，急死个人。

review: I didn't get this game when it first came out, so I don't know what was in the initial release version that lowered the game's ratings. However, I can certainly say that the game - as it is now - is really great! A strategic Indiana-Jones-adventure style simulator that is both really enjoyable and very engaging. While, obviously, the "roguelike turn-based" style of this game isn't everyone's cup of tea, if you're on the fence and you like the look of the gameplay, I'd recommend giving it a whirl.
