author: {'steamid': '76561198005645440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1582843159}
review:
Not sure why this is getting bad reviews. It's a very fun well-made Adventure game. Combat is fair and challenging, resource management is also simple and straightforward. Your experience is highly customizable, from number of enemies per mission to amount of resources you'll find, which lets the player tailor the game to their fancy. There are some issues with the menu system and DEFINITELY the camera; I've accidentally moved a character and wasted a turn far too many times. It's also annoying that you can't easily observe the battlefield when you are placing your units. 

If you like FTL and turn-based strategies, rogue-lites, and Chucklefish, definitely give this a try. I give it a 10/10 for what it is clearly trying to be, and an 8.5/10 for enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323861665', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1582816140}
review: 美术方面挺厉害的，但游戏性实在拉跨

author: {'steamid': '76561198018253113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1592447982}
review:
I think the non-recommendations are a little too harsh on this game, granted I barely only finished the first campaign, I can already tell what the rest of the game has to offer and it's a fun little ride that I think is fun.

The game dares to be a hybrid in that it has the game play of XCOM, although not nearly as unforgiving while having the carryover function of a Rogue-Lite. The story is told as you advance on a board to a location that's reminiscent of FTL: Faster Than Light with events that end in three ways: neutral, positive, negative. 

Is it too simple? Maybe. Time will tell though as I advance further, but is it so wrong to be easy? Sometimes, you just want to have fun in this genre without getting frustrated and the initial campaign offers just that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085342301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1584276382}
review:
這遊戲可惜了
什麼都不錯，但為什麼不再拚一點做到更好呢？
印第安納瓊斯的主題風格都有做到，但人物的動作要是再多一點就好了
故事內容似乎還不錯，卻又不夠明顯到讓人記住
角色培育有，但欠缺感情設定，徒有技能差異而已
關卡難度與其說是難、不如說看你初始位置的運氣好壞
敵人的AI大便一樣，遮蔽物的效果太微妙，戰鬥毫無戰術可言、敵人變化性0

戰棋式的經典，西式有鐵血聯盟2可參考、日式有皇家騎士團2可參考
就連台灣骨灰級的天使帝國變化性都比這個大
當然以上的價錢也是比較貴，不過當時的內容都是超值

這遊戲40%折扣我認為還是可以一玩，但不玩也不會有損失，雞肋等級
當作投資希望遊戲公司未來可以更好

author: {'steamid': '76561198043941027', 'num_games_owned': 1433, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1598011541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198327054352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1582798284}
review:
明显游戏模式对标的是 暗黑地牢，有人说剧情薄弱是搞错了，游戏模式是，不断刷地图，打怪、刷装备，每个章节有三个难度，高难度刷高等级装备，而不是把每个章节打一遍就通关；
ai的智商不错，会兵种间配合，会充分利用掩体，比幽浮ai好多了——幽浮的ai常年奋不顾身，热衷于和玩家一换一；pathway里面的小兵低血了还会且战且退，甚至狙击手之间交替掩护前进；

和幽浮的回合作战思路很大不同，幽浮这类是攻击即结束，所以幽浮玩家常年习惯于打阵地战；而pathway里面攻击后还有一回合，就可以攻击后移动，往往打得是运动战。如果死脑筋非要躲掩体打阵地战，往往就会被敌人包抄惨败。

唯一的不足就是游戏性，美工其实很出彩了，完爆绝大多数像素风游戏、回合制游戏；但是游戏性很吃瘪。
虽然有反复刷地图的游戏机制，但是并没有与之匹配的，体量相当的战斗-奖励的循环系统。重复战斗之后，装备就是翻来覆去那么几件，无非等级稀有度的区别，战斗奖励很有限；游戏缺乏功能道具对事件选择的影响，造成了很多地点没有特定的专家角色就解不开的问题。

所以总结下，运动战风格的战斗系统挺好的；美工非常出色；游戏性上有待提高。
纵然有瑕疵，仍然不失为值得一玩的作品。
pathway的奖励与任务系统，目前是没有回答好“为什么要重复战斗”这个问题。也就是说这个沙盒世界没有建构好。应该再借鉴一下暗黑地牢之类的经验。再丰富一下装备和道具，再添加进新的地点互动。不需要填主线剧情，而需要填满沙盒世界。要让玩家有兴趣进入到这个世界里去探索，而不是想着“这条路啥时候是个头”。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102814928', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1582807605}
review:
pathway，一部绝美的互动小说。
一口气玩了十多个小时，目前在最后一章。前面三章我调整难度刷了多周目。下面来详细评价这个游戏。
优点缺点放在一起说：
1：画风音乐在pv里很明白了，实力过硬的优秀，不赘述。不少人应该都是冲着这两项入手的；
2：人物设计合理，搭配丰富，可以创造出各种不同的过关组合。人物解锁之前可以点击人物头像，看到人物的特性和技能，以及解锁方式。像我用纯女性组合刷了第一章2周目，解锁了神秘妹子。
3：大部分事件都有对应不同人物特性的分支选择，稍微增加了重玩性。除了战斗场景外的所有事件，均采用左侧图画，右侧文字描述的方式进行。很像读小说，配合优秀的bgm，很有沉浸感，也是能让我一口气十多个小时的主要原因。缺点是需要玩家有一定的阅读基础和想象力，我相信这也是不少快餐玩家诟病游戏节奏的主要原因之一。
4：地图，关卡设计。每一章的第一站和最后一站是服务剧情的，其余站点均随机生成。目前随机事件略显不足，勉强能够撑起整张地图，如果再现有的基础上再新增3成左右的事件，一周目的体验会更好。关卡重复度稍高，比如沙漠地图里从头走到尾，最短路线大约7-9场战斗，有大概4个关卡是画风近似的；如果探索全图，这个感受就更加明显。希望能多一些与事件关系紧密的更特殊的关卡，比如沙漠中废弃的飞机场由于中央有个飞机，映像深刻。
5：道具，战利品。第一是太少了，以突击步枪为例，四个等级大概每个等级只有1-2把；第二是深度不够，寻常的装备性能随机还算不错，但是最稀有的红色的特殊装备没有深入的改变玩法。一周目就能明显感觉到搜集进度的尽头不远了，喜欢搜刮装备道具的人会很痛苦。
6：战斗玩法。看评论有人说自己打不中掩体后AI，而反之AI却可以，导致游戏容易失败。我并没有这种挫败感。前期只要带医生，控制好距离战斗，避免被包围，基本不会突发团灭。游戏的战棋玩法是很成熟的，适应周期也很短，2-3次战斗之后驾轻就熟。
7：游戏掩体机制。掩体分3类，小掩体盾牌图标，掩体所在方向75%miss；大掩体叉号盾牌图标，掩体所在方向75%miss；特大掩体砖墙图标，掩体所在方向安全。简单来说就是如果你能找到一个U形掩体站进去，就是三个方向都75%的miss，这人是很难被射中的。手雷和怪物抛投的脓疱可以越过小型掩体和大型掩体，不能越过特大掩体。
8：游戏命中率机制：命中率主观受人物精准属性，武器精准度，人物精准技能，人物对武器精准技能影响；客观受掩体影响。无掩体时命中率一律100%。有掩体时，上面那几个精准有关的词缀越高越准。1周目就可以有打掩体后敌人90%命中率的狙击手，只要合理培养自己的队伍，不会被敌人按在地上摩擦的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053311483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1596346348}
review:
游戏质量还可以，但制作组显然没考虑到战棋玩家都是抖m，难度有点低了，模式也过于单一，玩几个小时就索然无味。
战术和xcom差不多，只要喷子砍刀骑脸就能赢，而想着和ai对枪的请自觉去非洲。
操作很不友好，不能右键取消，要到处找按钮才能关闭当前界面……
总之是一款可以尝试的小品级游戏，不要报有太高期望。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100750732', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1582565942}
review:
这游戏还挺好玩的。
不太懂为什么评论里一堆说掩体没卵用，敌人爆菊的。
（虽然AI可以不要命地冲过来确实挺不讲理的）
相当程度上都是掩体提供的大量闪避活下去/节省补给的。
这种体验大概只有初期还不会玩的时候才会被敌人冲到屁眼上。
因为可以射击完再移动，很多时候可以边退边打。
资源基本不缺，回血回甲在地图里直接右键背包里的道具就能用补给恢复了。
掉好枪的快乐大概跟无主之地差不多。这游戏大部分的快乐大概就在这里。
总体来说战斗系统尚可，loot带来快乐。但是章节比较少（五大关），敌人类型有限，也没有独特个体之类的说法。
通关一次以后索然无味，就算刷了枪也没后续内容，有点空虚。

另外有个重甲匕首姐。太尴尬了，上去捅人就没点数开减伤，冲的不好就挨一顿揍。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032643577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1649454701}
review:
So I really like this game because:
1. The pixel art is tasteful
2. The POIs during each mission. It's actually a CHALLENGE to see everything on a map during a mission. I also like that the maps add the appropriate pace / length to the game. 
3. The combat, the combat in combination with the maps makes this feel like 2 games in one. basically it's a great mix of mechanics paced just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973231536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1607300034}
review: This is a must grab for any fan of Jagged Alliance or X-Com. Sale or no sale. The devs respond to the comments and act on suggestions. I give this game an extra thumbs up just because it's the only one of the the few I have bought lately that actually scratch an itch. That jagged alliance itch I've had for like 30 years or more. Don't even think about it if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974605885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1582650768}
review: The art style is great, but as others have stated, the game gets repetitive rather quickly. Most fights are too easy, but once in a while the RNG presents you with an unusually hard fight that quickly ruins your run... which wouldn't be too bad if the runs were shorter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115483728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1582645515}
review:
Right from the beginning when I booted this gem for the first time I was hooked. Now, I've only just started playing but its easily one of my favorite modern games. If you like X-Com or any kind of turn based strategy rpg, you'll feel right at home here. Its got a wonderful setting that feels like something right out of an indiana jones classic. You and your ragtag group of mercenaries battling it out against nazi's while plundering ancient tombs and collecting sweet loot. The game may seem simple at first glance but the more you play the deeper it goes. 

My one con with it is not neccesarily a deal breaker its more of a nitpick on my end. But i come from an RTS background and I'm used to using the mouse to zoom around the map to get my bearings. So I did that here and I often find myself wrestling with the cursor to get to go where I want to. Now thankfully, they have a button that allows you to teleport your view on your enemies but the placement of this button is a little awkward the cursor itself is a little too large for my preference

Overall highly reccommend you check this out if you dig tactical rpgs and with its pricetag, you'd be a fool to not give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271225941', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1621182140}
review:
能感觉到角色一点点变强的成长感。
有内涵的剧情和猜不透的未来。
友好的击败机制、死亡机制，舒适的难度阶梯。
在快乐中刷刷刷，如果你沉迷于探险，等你反应过来时，会发现自己积攒了不少神装。

推荐这款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198289299556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1582535410}
review: 满心欢喜的在打折时入手，又喜得更新，又有了中文，简直完美，然后就tm翻车了。。。。。。。不到1G的游戏，竟然用了三倍体积的内存，老笔记本直接原地爆炸，本来喜欢像素类就是因为适合配置低的老本杀时间，结果为了这个我竟然还得去开台式？不理解优化怎么做的，再见吧，等优化了再入吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198007008998', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1585415222}
review:
It is the game I was looking for. Adventurous, Roguelite, Turn based game. Little like Xcom but much simpler and enjoyable. 
 First time I played I found out that 6 hours have passed I should go to sleep. Not many games can do that nowadays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128257999', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1582504058}
review: Feels a little clunky, liked the narrator. I don't appreciate games that replace Nazi Swastikas. You know what your source material is. That was a real turn off for me. I did expect it to be Fire Emblem-like instead of mission oriented though. Didn't really grab me much.
developer_response:
Hey Lorenzo,
We are a German developer and in Germany it is forbidden by law to use Swastikas at all in anything not art related or of documentary purpose. 
There are some disputes going on currently that games should be allowed to do this too like movies, that are considered art, but we are a too small a developer to test the law here.
We also do not like the fact but we have to follow the law in this regard. 
Sorry that this turned you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858826983', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1582480474}
review:
Klasik sıra tabanlı bir oynanışı var. Başta seçtiğimiz, farklı özelliklere sahip 3 karakter ile başlıyoruz ve arabamızla çölde yol almaya başlıyoruz. Her gittiğimiz yol için arabamız benzin yakıyor ve bu benzin bitiyor o yüzden yol haritanızı iyi çizerek ilerlemelisiniz. 
Savaşılması gereken yerler oluyor, savaş olmayan rehine olan yerler oluyor veya benzeri karar verilmesi gereken yerler, boş yerler oluyor (Gidilebilir yerler küçük bir halka ile işaretlenmiş siz oraya gitmedikçe orada ne var ne yok göremiyorsunuz, yani nasıl bir yer onu göremiyorsunuz)

Bölümler sonunda da 2-3 tane hediye kazanıyorsunuz bunlar fuel, ammo, medkit falan olabiliyor.

Rehine olan bölgelerde (ya da başka bir karar verilmesi gereken yer) rehineleri kurtarmak isteyebilirsiniz eğer isterseniz burada dereye RPG unsurlarından "dice", "zar" sistemi giriyor. İyi mi kötü mü bir aksiyon olacak orayı zarımız belirliyor. 

Güzel bir indie gibi duruyor indirim varken alınır.
İndie'leri sevin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968742511', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1555101733}
review:
Beautiful pixel-art. A Charming and optimistic Nazi-Killing romp in an underutilized setting.

Boring and repetitive as all hell, though.  The combat becomes a drag and expect to see multiple repeated "events" in a round.  It's a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987803768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1621030889}
review:
I read that the game had a lot of issues at launch but having just purchased it this weekend, I love it. I've gotten through the first 2 maps (adventures) already and am anxious to continue. 

Gameplay: It's like FTL and Indiana Jones had a bebe. Tough but fair.
Replay Value: Tons of characters and items to unlock, a good selection of maps to traverse that change every time you play, so yes.
Graphics: Pixel beauty at it's finest.
Sound: Music is great, gives you that Indiana Jones/Treasure Hunter vibe. Love the SFX for items too, fun sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280970409', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1582516452}
review:
玩了两个小时，总结出了一点经验。
第一局不熟悉的时候会有些劝退，因为我选了毫无配合性的角色吧。第二把只能选六个初始角色的奶妈，狙击手和海军，瞬间感觉找到了一个黄金三角。狙击手负责控制和远程输出，奶妈负责加血和补刀，海军负责抗伤害和突脸。奶妈的初始技能诱饵可以完美的控制狗爹的走位。只要没有狗爹，剩下的枪兵可以利用狙击手的超远输出完美克制。可能运气比较好吧，Miss几乎没有出现过。里面的所有小兵都可以两到三枪带走，所以说狙击手最开始的消耗血量非常重要。还有一个小技巧是，当敌人不在你的射程范围之内时（包括走路加攻击），可以先等敌人走到我们的射程。毕竟电脑没什么脑子，设计师又把小兵数量设置的比较多。取巧比硬钢打的舒服的多。第二章我因为汽油不够就直接回城了，建议遇到汽油就买。补给和弹药只要遇到战斗关卡都会有，但是汽油不一定。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031519574', 'num_games_owned': 2692, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1582645018}
review:
Everything good about Halfway is still here and everything bad (like how linear it was) has been replaced with better things.
The FTL like choose-your-own-adventure stuff adds a whole new layer to the game that the previous one lacked, making this a total winner.
For the people saying it's too hard I gotta wonder what tactical strategy games you've been playing, this one seems about average in difficulty. What does make it a bit harder for people new to the genre is probably that flanking shots always have 100% accuracy, so if you don't take cover and you don't flank enemies, yes, they will seem to hit you a lot more than you hit them.
The messages for the random events getting repetetive after a while, while I haven't reached a point like that yet myself, I can imagine that being true since that is true for all of these types of games, FTL included

author: {'steamid': '76561198016392886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1582894911}
review:
The combat gets stale almost instantly. 

Abilities are very uninteresting- the weapon abilities (with the exception of snipers) are some minor variation on 'shoot multiple targets.' The armor abilities fail to add complexity (move fast, die less, die less.) The only skill tree ability worth using is Dash (move fast). 

The only meaningful difference between enemy types is range and effective HP. (With the exception of snipers)

The 'tactics' can be mostly boiled down to 'shoot enemies who aren't in cover, while staying in cover from all the enemies.'
This is not difficult to do. 

About the only interesting bit of design in the game are snipers- they can enter overwatch, which interrupts an action taken within a cone. Overwatch can be cancelled with damage, so if you want full action effeciency in the face of  overwatch you need to find a way to shoot them without passing through their cone of fire.

Absolutely nothing else incentivizes different tactics. It's just fight after fight of 'sit in cover, shoot guy who isn't in cover'

author: {'steamid': '76561198003827633', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1695435706}
review:
Pathway is a game that probably could of been the game that you were looking for but isn't. 

The game is has multiple chapters each with different map and different story. There are multiple characters each with their own little backstory and specializations, and there are many characters to unlock. You pick your team and off you go! Then, there's this old guy who sounds kind of like Harrison Ford that will narrate the opening setting the stage. Then you get to this mess of a map where you get to chose your "PATHWAY" of how you will travel from point A to B. The first chapter takes you on only one map, while the latter chapters are comprised of multiple maps. You have supplies, gas and ammo as inventory that you need to manage as you make across the map. On the map you can get into fights with zombies, cultists and Nazis. You can also hire new members, trade and find special events. Then at the end there's a big battle and fake Harrison Ford narrates an ending for us.

The pathway section of "PATHWAY" is where the game gets boring fast. After a while the messages that pop up on each stop are all the same, just with different words. That isn't a problem but the fact that each run is composed of so many little stops it makes the game just unnecessarily slow. So the latter chapters of multiple maps become something I just wanted to skip. The rest of the game is alright, but not good enough to make up for how annoying the pathway section is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019154549', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1581787836}
review:
In its current state, it's really hard to recommend this game.

The resource management part gets far too easy early in the game and managing your fuel and supplies never really becomes a challenge.
Random events quickly become repetitive and do not offer any real kind of excitement through the game.

As for the battles, well the strategy part is sadly the most disappointing thing in this game IMO. Aside from getting into cover and shooting mindlessly over the enemy over and over again, don't expect much. There are basically 2 kind of groups you may encounter: Nazis and zombies. With 2 or 3 kind of enemies in each group. No boss, no special encounter, and no interaction whatsoever with the environment.

At its current price point, you should not buy this game. I'll keep an eye out for future patches that would include additional enemies and encounters. But for now, there are numerous better alternatives in the genre already available on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120400500', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1581239520}
review:
[h1]Weak Indiana Jones Homage RPG[/h1]


[i]Pathway[/i] is half RPG, half tactical shooter, and all Indiana Jones homage.  One can easily see the influences of all four Indy films so far.  In fact, the music here would not sound terribly out of place among the Indiana Jones franchise's soundtracks.

The game is actually a series of five loosely-connected adventures.  When you embark on these adventures, you choose three adventurers/agents.  (A fourth slot is shown, but isn't relevant until you head out.)

Each adventurer has a particular skillset.  Most of these skills are relevant to combat.  Each specializes in a weapon or two, such as shotguns, assault rifles, or pistols.  Some will also be able to wield knives for melee attacks.  They also specialize in a type of armor, which come in the form of anything from coats to flak jackets.  Some, of course, can use medkits to heal.  Others can toss grenades.

The RPG part comes into play in the form of Perks.  These are qualities and skills unique to each adventurer.  Jackson Sheffield is the closest to Indy and is a reckless Daredevil.  The "Baron" is really a con artist whose Trickster trait helps fool NPCs.

Your party travels in a jeep that can eventually be upgraded for more room.  This is your main inventory stash.  It also holds your ammo and "supplies."  Both of these are hilariously generic.  Ammo fits all types of guns equally.  The supplies are used for medicine doses, repairing armor, and in grenades.

Mission maps are a series of one, two, or three screens.  At one end is your starting point; at the other is your destination, marked by an X.  In between is a network of nodes.  Travel between nodes requires one unit of fuel.

Most of the nodes are some sort of event.  This could as benign as merely seeing some interesting sight along the way, or an instant ambush.  Events and such are distributed mostly randomly, as are the precise placement of most nodes themselves.

Other event nodes are decision points.  Some events put you in a position to either attack or withdraw.  Others offer a Gamble, a risky move.  Some put your party Perks to use.  Jackson's Daredevil perk might make him do something crazy but effective.  A Medical Expert is useful for some events.  Some of these decision events still trigger combat.

You can also encounter traders where you can sell off loot from various temples and Nazi camps, campsites to restore health, and events to rescue and recruit another unlocked agent for that fourth slot.  Some of these three types are automatically flagged as if locals tipped you off.  Others will be found only as you come to a neighboring node.

Longer events, such as the mission-ending ones, are rendered in the game's combat animation engine.  Your characters are pixelated and almost cute.  The animals (goats, camels, guard dogs) are adorable.

Combat is a turn-based tactical shooter.  Combat starts in one of three modes depending on who ambushed whom, or if both sides discover each other at the same time.  These modes simply restrict what your opening moves are.

Once full turns begin, your characters can perform two actions out of three types:  Move, attack, and neutral.  Characters can move once and attack once, in either order.  Or, they can do either one and a "neutral" move like reload or heal or repair armor.  Or, two neutral acts.  Some moves use up a small pool of Bravery Points for special actions, such as being able to Hunker Down in battle.

Since the armor in this game is mostly clothing, repairing takes thread and needle.  Attacks shred armor, so attacks hurt more as battle rages on.

The tactical part of the game is in the use of cover to boost chances of a miss or evade and to mitigate possible damage.  This is where the game falters.

Combat is played on a map of 2D square tiles.  The angle is such that buildings and trees obscure open tiles and makes it difficult to see at a glance what's useful cover when considering enemies at an angle to you.

The overlays for movement and attacking mitigate some of this frustration.  The move phase will highlight your path to the tile you are considering and flag which sides offer cover or a tall wall to block snipers.  It will also highlight any enemies that are within range of that tile, even when hidden.  Attack mode will also highlight enemies in range.

If an agent's HP hits zero, they go into KO mode.  Anyone with a medkit or the First Aid skill can rescue this agent, but a timer is ticking.  If a KO'd agent is not healed within that timer, they must be hospitalized and will have to wait a whole adventure attempt.  The timer continues as you travel.  You either need to heal or reach a campsite in short order, or the adventurer is lost for the rest of the mission.  Their slot is immediately freed so you can recruit one of the other agents made available in this mission.

A full party wipeout is not game over.  Instead, all your adventurers on that trip get hospitalized while others attempt the mission or another one, and you get to keep the XP and items and cash you earned.

Medkits, repairkits, and grenades all have a limit of uses in combat, per combat.  However, you can access them in between combats on the team screen.  There, you can use them as much as you like providing you have enough supplies.

The real frustration of combat is ... there's just not a wide range of enemies and enemy AIs.  You get several tiers of Nazi soliders and their guard dogs, cultists and their pet zombies, and a couple high priestesses.  That's pretty much it.  Most of their moves are the same ones you can do, if some interesting variations on them.  Some zombies can belch forth something that acts as an explosive.

A larger and related disappointment is that there no real "bosses" to be had, not even in the final fight.  The closest you'll come is in getting more enemies to fight, and a higher tier than you encounter elsewhere in the mission.

The story itself is a disappointment, too.  Part of this is inherent in the game design.  Adventures have a beginning and an end, but with several path options on a map, there's not much place for plot twists in the middle.  At most, you'll get some "you're on the right trail" sort of events.

Adventures have little connection to one another beyond the use of the two main enemy groups, the Nazis and the cultists.  There's no building toward a satisfying ending over each adventure toward the end of the fifth and final one.

The endings of these adventures are also disappointing.  Ironically, the best one might be the first one, where you are merely rescuing a friend from Nazi interrogation.

The main problem with these endings is that everything is scripted to lead to combat.  There's no use of relevant Perks like there is in some of the events.

Like Indiana Jones, you are chasing bad guys who are chasing some powerful (and suspiciously alien-looking) artifacts.  However, there's no race to disable these devices while fending off Nazis and cultists.  Rather, those events resolve in a scripted and disappointing manner.  All the player gets to do is the final combat event.


The overall idea of an Indiana Jones homage is solid, but the execution here stumbles in the story department.  Any replay value is in trying for all the achievements and in seeing all the various Perk options for node events.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030479423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1581357194}
review:
遊戲雖然是不錯玩的, 但內容太少(5個章節, 大概6~7小時就完吧)
這遊戲明明只是像素顯示的而且沒有什麼複雜的東西, 但莫名地吃電腦資源, 運行就用了2~3GB RAM, 在我的老電腦運行之下, 只好關掉其他程式才能夠順暢運行.

同類的遊戲我覺得Into the Breach好玩而且耐玩得多了

author: {'steamid': '76561197971321573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1641937868}
review:
Man nehme Indiana Jones und Jagged Alliance, würze mit einer Prise Pixel-Art und fertig ist Pathway. 
Schön gemachte, kurzweilige Rundenstrategie mit dem Setting: Nordafrika der 30er Jahre, wo sich Abenteurer vs. Nazis gegenüberstehen. Nicht zu detailliert aber auch mit ausreichend Möglichkeiten um das Team seinen Bedürfnissen anpassen zu können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034655270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1582510372}
review: A polished game with a neat pulpy adventure story and fun old school game sprites.  It also allows you to choose your heroic pair from characters of different variations on stabber, shooter, and healer roles with a short skill tree for each. What's missing is enemy variety; you only have Nazis (3 types), Nazi dogs, and Undead (3 types). Game play consists of random occurrences of "move & attack" combat either in Nazi camps, ruins, or tombs, jeep fuel & ammo management, and limited multiple choice rpg text boxes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003312894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1582321536}
review: Its a great pick for a first X-COM type game, is a decent podcast game, and is otherwise pretty good, albeit frequently quite simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983186920', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1656258632}
review:
SPOILERS
- You will enjoy this game a lot if you like XCOM and old Indiana Jones movies.
- The only thing that prevented me from loving the game is it's light approach to story. Every adventure has a story behind it, but it never gets more than skin deep. Also the ending is always something like "the ancient artefact exploded, and everybody went home". So at the end, all you take away in terms of progression is some incremental upgrades for your dudes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098169589', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1582293982}
review: 讲真，这游戏不咋地，可能是呵呵鱼第一次做这种战旗类的游戏，实际上在游戏里面随机事件太少了，而且负面作用太大，跑起来之后很容易就团灭，导致成长也没什么意思。真正的硬伤是战斗系统，几乎是没有掩体一说，谁人多突脸谁一波就赢了，所以一定要带个喷子或者手榴弹，缺少了xcom的地形或者是剩余技能点的优势。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072939821', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1580582086}
review:
In estrema sintesi si tratta di un rogue like con combattimenti a turni nel corso delle vostre avventure.
Mi è sembrato una sorta di  Faster Than Light con ambientazione alla Indiana Jones nei predatori dell'arca perduta e combattimenti a turni anzichè in tempo reale.
Partirete alla volta dell'ignoto con un party di 3 personaggi, che potrà arrivare a 4 se recluterete un personaggio per "strada". I vostri nemici saranno suddivisi in 2 schieramenti, da una parte i nazisti, dall'altra i seguaci di "Brotherhood", una sorta di cultisti.
Vi sposterete lungo la mappa scegliendo la "rotta" rappresentata da "nodi" collegati uno all'altro.
In ognuno di questi nodi potranno succedere diverse cose, dal niente agli scontri con i nemici.
Il combattimento prevede che i vostri personaggi abbiano due mosse, una neutra (camminare, ricaricare le armi, usare i medikit) ed una di attacco (sparare, lanciare granate, usare una mossa speciale e così via).
I combattimenti sono piuttosto veloci e non particolarmente impegnativi, quanto meno alla difficoltà media pre impostata.
Credo che il difetto maggiore sia la longevità, nel senso che le "avventure" (cioè le mappe su cui giocare) sono solo 5 e fatte queste, potrete rifarle variando il party, sbloccando nuovi personaggi, ma sempre quelle saranno. 
Il risultato, combinato alla relativa difficoltà di cui sopra, comporta che in una decina di ore ho finito le 5 avventure e quindi la voglia di ripartire sarà relativa (poichè potranno variare gli incontri e la strada per arrivare alla fine, ma il risultato finale sarà il medesimo).
Detto questo, le 10 ore di cui sopra sono state comunque godibili.
In definitiva lo consiglio, ma solo in sconto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052664013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1582148090}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988117679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1633576888}
review:
It kind of seems like this game is about killing dogs.  After killing 20 or so dogs and probably 15 humans, i searched and found that i could put it into dog friendly mode, which makes the dogs not whimper when you kill them.  After killing about 20 more dogs, I came to the conclusion that this is a game about killing dogs set in a Nazi universe where sometimes your car runs out of gas on the way to kill more dogs.

Many other tactics games have "fast melee" units.  This game just has dogs to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006932705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1619902128}
review: This game a been like the old Indiana Jones movies. It has been a ton of fun so far. The writing is great, the feel is great and the battles have been a good time. I highly recommend this to anyone who likes the feel and a little resource management.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994049319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1626102145}
review:
Great game!  Choose your own adventure set in the desert during WWII.  Build a team from your roster, equip them, and plan your route to the finish line, with each spot being a random encounter.  But keep your XP, equipment, and money even if your team runs out of fuel or fails.   Battles are usually about 5 minutes, focusing on cover, range, flanking, and timely use of special actions.

Non-obvious hints for quality of life: 
1 Once you make a team, you can freely switch equipment around from not just the jeep and the active team, but from ANYONE unlocked in your roster.  
2 As long as you have a med kit/armor repair kit in the jeep's cargo inventory + supplies, you can heal/repair armor outside of combat, even if no one on the team has those skills.  
3 The Trophies page of the codex shows your progress towards unlocking each new character. 
4 Before you commit to a move, enemies within range and line of sight light up red.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021078112', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1699965561}
review:
На первый взгляд что-то интересное - приходится тактикулить, можно набивать чистые победы при умении, практически убирая рандом. Но потом накатывает жуткое однообразие... Вражеских группировок 2, в каждой несколько типов врагов, боссов нет в принципе. Укрытия никак не различаются по типу, меткость тоже, ты либо 100% попадаешь по врагу в открытом поле, либо МЕТКОСТЬ% за укрытием, никакого учёта дистанции и прочих вещей нет. Большинство спецприёмов бесполезно, потому что врагов надо убивать с 1-2 выстрелов, АИ действует на редкость тупо. Бои становятся шаблонные, как только просечёшь оптимальную стратегию, думаешь только над тем, чей первый ход.
Сюжет дебильный, искатели приключений останавливают фашистов-сатанистов и сами остаются ни с чем, концовки нет, предлагает снова перепроходить миссии на более высокой сложности. Варианты действий в событиях в зависимости от навыков героев - тоже стандартно. Игра именно что как заготовка - введены стандартные элементы в минимальном количестве и всё, наполнением больше не заморачивались.
Разве что графика более-менее сносный пиксельарт.
А ещё тут говнодизайн наград за одноразовые ачивки... Правда можно новый профиль в игре создать и прогресс обнулится, в том числе по ним, хоть не натупили.

review: Очень атмосферно, очень пиксельно и очень.... весело! Особенно если вы, как и я, иногда скучаете по приключениям, похожим на Томб Райдер или Индиану Джонса. От всей души рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198301491601', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1667494530}
review:
Crystal Dynamics (the same devs who gave us the Gex trilogy) have really outdone themselves with this one. Everything about Pathway just works. From the beautiful 3D models to the inclusion of Our House on the game's soundtrack - it's all top notch.

Hideo Kojima directs the story which excites and amazes all throughout the game. His unique approach to writing is really on show here. Instead of going through the normal writing process, Kojima instead rips all dialogue from Resident Evil 5, making Pathway a true testament to his phenomenal writing.

Due to the studio's previous work on "Gex: Deep Cover Gecko" I had expected a cameo from everyone's favourite pop culture spouting lizard. Alas, he was no where in the game due to his previous alleged abuse scandal back in '96, denting my overall enjoyment with the game. In Gex's place they try to create a new character named Master Chef. This completely backfires on Crystal Dynamics. Chef's personality doesn't come close to that of Gex's and he doesn't even share Gex's minor drug problem (a common trope in children's platformers).

During my first 60 hours of game play, no one location I had visited had been the same. Sure, they may have all looked like desert ruins and huts to an untrained eye, but I saw the real beauty in the locations. Weather it was Sudanese or Palestinian, every patch of sand stood out and had its own identity.

My only issue with the game is the removal of JME as a voice actor. As many of you will know, JME had been brought onto the project in early 2007 and had finished recording lines for the character of Donkey until he was replaced with the 14th Dalai Lama to play the role. This may not bother most players but the matter of the fact is the Dalai Lama does not speak a word of English and only spouts Tibetan, rendering all cutscenes completely inaudible.

Like all great triple A games, Pathway really makes you feel like the Pathway through it's innovative game play never seen in a game before this. In fact, I'd say Crystal Dynamics has created its own genre due to the innovation on display here. The gameplay transcends beyond reality. This genre has been deemed "strand style".

Overall, Halfway has something for everyone. I rate it a 9.0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008949631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1589136096}
review: I really liked this gem of a game. The atmosphere is spot on and you really feel as taking part in an alternate Indiana Jones timeline. The sand, the graphics, the nazis...perfect! The mechanics are engaging and the story ties in to exploration and combat in a nice "lite" way in a tight fit that does exactly what it's supposed to. Sure it's not acres deep and after about 30 hours I began to feel some shortcoming in terms of difficulty, replayability and loot balance - mainly that it get's quite easy and upgrades are rare. However these are minor drawbacks in what is a wondeful gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043670054', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1661897477}
review:
Is this game one of the best roguelites, up there with FTL and Into The Breach? Probably not. But if you're a fan of the genre and want to play a permadeath tactical RPG with some unique flavor, check this one out when it's on sale like I did and you won't be disappointed. This game gets better with every update too, so keep checking back.

Pros:
-Indiana Jones flavor feels fresh, bit different from the standard fantasy/sci fi fare
-Unlocking new characters and trying different squad combinations is enjoyable
-Pseudo-pixelated graphics are gorgeous

Cons:
-Very little enemy and map diversity. For the first few hours you might think that Nazis are the only enemy. They aren't, but it really doesn't get much more interesting from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198830012111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1823, 'last_played': 1577780755}
review:
目前這個遊戲打通了，談談我的看法。評測中很多人拿Xcom說事，我個人覺得Xcom並沒有那麼好，我給Xcom是差評，Xcom儘管是最早弄這類遊戲，但是本身的缺陷也非常大，只是單純的slg，回合制戰術遊戲缺乏rpg要素就已經是巨大的缺陷了。Xcom的預算並不小，最少也算是3a工作室的預期，但是實際上並不怎麼樣，Xcom更噁心的傷害以及命中，即便戰術正確你運氣不行也會出現重大傷亡，並且缺乏養成要素和跟地圖元素的互動，格局等亂七八糟的東西被神界2完爆，Xcom的模式我都可以背出來。Xcom在我看來就是比較早弄出來的偏寫實3d融合fps元素的回合戰術遊戲，他的優點是早，但是早也意味著不完善。那個吐槽這遊戲劇情的人，他怎麼不談談Xcom的劇情怎麼樣？我覺得Xcom也是屬於可以完全不要劇情的那種遊戲。


說下這個遊戲，這個遊戲的優缺點都特別的明顯。


這款遊戲的缺點就是怪的種類太少一共就只有10多個種類的怪，德軍邪教兩大兵種沒了，還不如玩家的種類豐富。關卡太少，一共5個副本，重複度高。戰鬥難度太低，怪太弱，沒boss。缺乏重複遊玩價值。戰鬥模式缺乏深度，地圖要素互動少。


這款遊戲的優點也很明顯，大體上回合戰術跟惡魔城類融合，每一次遊玩都是不同的流程，類似於殺戮尖塔一樣。然後就是比較有特色的技能養成等。


總體上就是一個小品遊戲，沒那麼好也沒那麼爛。我覺得就6～7分這樣。這款遊戲就是內容少。

author: {'steamid': '76561197967764797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1577513878}
review:
This game was a bit of an unexpected treat.  It has a great atmosphere, wonderful art and music, etc. and I love the design premise of embarking on a journey to a pre-determined endpoint and finding interesting encounters along the way that don't overwhelm you with complexity.  That being said, I do wish the characters weren't so set in their abilities and item skills.  For example, I was dismayed to find that none of my characters were able to equip some simple grenades I found, nor would they ever be able to as far as I could tell looking at their skill tree, simply by due to the fundamental nature of their characters (I could also just have misunderstood how to use them, in which case please do tell!).  Would be great to have those simple elements (weapons, armor, items, etc.)  be a little more interchangeable between classes so that as a player you aren't constantly faced with arbitrary limitations on who can wear what or who can shoot what.

All in all, as someone who doesn't have very much free time for games, so far this game has given me a fun, relaxing evening and scratched my indiana jones nostalgia itch.  Looking forward to checking out more adventures!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010245842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1080, 'last_played': 1650653612}

author: {'steamid': '76561198322401140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1346, 'last_played': 1577992106}
review: Tenté depuis le départ par ce jeu mais un peu refroidi par quelques critiques à sa sortie, je l'ai finalement pris vu les derniers commentaires lu ici ou là. Pas déçu du tout, bien au contraire. Graphiquement très beau pour ceux qui apprécie le pixel art, très facile à prendre en main, avec beaucoup d'explications disponibles si besoin. Plusieurs niveaux de difficulté réglables. Rogue like tactique avec un petit côté rpg que j'aurais aimé plus développé finalement mais c'est très fun à jouer, vraiment. Pas encore arrivé au bout mais pour l'instant je m'éclate. Pour le prix, il ne faut pas hésiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028882665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1711132045}
review: Super ambiance, surtout pour les fans du genre ! Parfois punitif, mais pas trop (pas de mort définitive des personnages, les joueurs les plus hardis le regretteront peut-être). Les histoires respectent les codes et sont plaisantes à suivre, chaque avant aventure a sa propre ambiance et ses propres stratégies à adopter. Il est parfois intéressant de refaire une aventure avant de commencer la suivante pour améliorer ses personnages, sinon on risque fortement de galérer (ce qui est une bonne chose, au vu de l'expérience de ma dernière partie !). Les chemins changent et chaque aventure est à peu près unique. Manque peut-être de contenu : personnages, aventures, mécaniques etc. Un jeu que j'apprécie particulièrement et qui se prend en main facilement. Ceux qui ont joué à XCOM retrouveront rapidement les sensations, quoique moins poussé car plus porté sur l'histoire. Ma note : 17/20, il vaut bien son prix !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067783657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1680656365}
review:
It's alright. X-COM combat meets FTL board-progression, in case that's not already clear. It doesn't necessarily improve on the mechanics of either, but it's a fairly effective marriage. A work in progress, and from what I can tell from past comments, the devs are pretty reactive to feedback.

The combat can get old pretty quickly. There's only a few enemy types, and they go pretty easy on you (AI's kinda watered down). The combat doesn't require much strategy; all the right building blocks are in place (different unit types, with different weapon classes and special abilities), but the combat is just too easy to necessitate implementing them. So far the best solution I've found to any battle is simply to charge in and shoot enemies with your standard attack. It only takes two shots at most to kill anyone, and unlike X-COM, you can move after you attack, so there's not a lot of tough decision making.

Each board is setup like FTL: you pass from node to node toward an end-point, expending one unit of fuel for each move. The nodes will either contain a battle, a random event ("your car gets stuck in the sand costing you 2 fuel points!", or "you find a random cache of ammo!"), or nothing, with your occasional trading post. Certain random events require you to make decisions ("scale the cliff to see what's on top?"), resulting in either a reward ("you found two barrels of fuel!") or a punishment ("you fell and broke your leg!"). These are few and far between, and the punishments light, so all the choices are kind of no-brainers.

But it's fun, and charming. I intend to at least play through all the missions. Nothing I've encountered so far (just finished the second mission) screams replayability, but it's at least good enough to play all the way through.

(And to be fair, there are certain parameters you can tweak that I'm yet to mess with. You can customize the general amount of enemies it will throw at you in the combat sequences, the scarcity or availability of resources scattered throughout the boards, and stuff like that. I've only played the game at the default setting.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031671350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2429, 'last_played': 1696269888}
review:
Nice little game, especially for the price

Positive: I love the aesthetic and presentation and even though the gameplay has a solid core, it is relatively simple, yet it can still be rather rewarding. If you are looking for a pleasant looking and easily digestible turn based strategy game this is a bargain.

Negative: A rather short and kinda shallow experience, but this game could get some serious legs if the devs add a certain layer of depth with more missions and more character customisation, and more items.  

Anyway i'd give it a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989885835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1556943448}
review:
The Pathway that you can buy now is very different than the one I played earlier in the year. The developer has released several updates that complete change combat, enemy encounters, and progression. When I finished Pathway, it was a very simple but fun tactical roguelike inspired by Indiana Jones. Select your team of team and travel along a map while managing your fuel and food. Increase your team to a max of 4, outfit with weapons, armour, and consumables, and level everyone up. You never lost your character progress so the next time you go take a character on an adventure, after a healing cooldown, they’ll have the same weapons, armour, consumables, and unlocked skills as they left with. There were 4 chapters to get through each with a different theme. I found them challenging but fair and fun. They were simple. The two factions only had 6 enemy types each and the zombie faction only slowly shuffled towards you. Weapons were different but they only came in 6 different varieties (and 1 of those is a melee knife). Of the 16 characters, some were very powerful while others were useless.

The game has seen continuous support by the developers and is currently in version 1.1.3. The combat, weapons, enemies, encounters, character progression, and exploration have all been overhauled and rebalanced. It was good and simple game. From the sound of it, there’s a lot more depth and variety than when I played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052327333', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1583725298}
review:
[h1]Só de ler rogue-like eu já fico de pau duro, mas esse foi um belo chute no saco...[/h1]

Eu gostaria de poder reembolsar o jogo, nem é por mal, o jogo não é tipo muuuuito ruim, mas, o preço dele pelo que ele oferece é tipo um custo x beneficio HORRÍVEL. 

O jogo oferece muito pouco, tem pouquíssimas missões que mudam o caminho, nem devia ser rogue-like, só rogue-lite mesmo. A duração de cada missão me incomoda, é muito curta, mal da pra "ajeitar" os seus personagens direito, a progressão é meio meh, e ainda que eles permaneçam com as mudanças de level e itens após perder ou completar a run, sei lá, é esquisito... 

Não é por não gostar de jogos de turno, ou estratégia, eu gosto de ambos, mas [b]esse jogo meio que te oferece de tudo um pouco porém POUCO de tudo[/b].

Se você tiver numa situação afim de esbanjar dinheiro e gastar muito com pouco tempo de conteúdo, vá em frente, caso contrário eu não consigo recomendar isso.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035182410', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1572248955}
review:
A X-Com style 2 Indian Jones themed game about killing zombies and nazis. 

I personally like this game much more than Wargroove as that game was more of a turn based strategy game with unit building that tended to drag on way too long. 

Here you have an FTL like map where you go from point to point and encoutner text based encounters or fights. There is a big roster of charters to play and unlock with unique equipment and abilities. Also there is meta progression as you can keep equipment and upgrade stuff between games. 

What I don't like is the randomness of fuel, amo, supply drops. Not only that but you have a cap on how much you can carry so even if you have enough to stock up, you often have leave stuff behind and then in later areas it might not give you enough to continue. And running out of ammo in the last boss fight is the worst feeling ever. 

Other reviews complain about severe bugs but I have not encountered any so I guess they have patched them already. 

Overall a good game, though loading times are weirdly long for a 2d game.

CONS
- seems a bit laggy / unoptimized sometimes
- negative achievements ("lose X times to achieve this" )

author: {'steamid': '76561198060351643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1628545125}
review:

I'll leave the review as recommended because I don't trust journalists that much, however it's a fine line of 50/50 uncertainty at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278049795', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1636511796}
review:
还将就，需要大量的更新

基本上没有随机内容，战斗地图（可能一个大战役中最多就只有5、6张，然后就是重复利用，随机只能随机出生地，不能生成随机的战斗地图）和大地图（线路可以随机，但变化不大）太少。而且还要练级和刷枪（刷了三把金色手枪和两把金色狙击枪，但是直掉了一把能用的突击步枪），很多策略性要素没有体现（带击退效果的近战，如果没有油罐就伤害巨低、霰弹枪和镭射枪的特殊攻击收益太少且达成条件困难、用手枪和狙击枪的角色太多经常搞成平推全图（基本不空枪+打一个死一个=排队枪毙）），军犬有重叠在一起的bug（此时手雷只能对一只照成伤害）

author: {'steamid': '76561198023626984', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1703934430}
review:
Gra, godna polecenia jeśli gracz wie czego oczekuje!
Nie jest to produkt wybitny, ale porządna garść rozgrywki jeśli ma się tą chęć na przygody w stylu Indiana Jones :).
Muzyka jest wspaniała, pixel art na najwyższym poziomie. Sczerze Polecam, bo po dość średnim starcie, po naprawach-patchach znacznie lepiej się gra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006394987', 'num_games_owned': 1385, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1555790935}
review:
It's a fun game with really nice pixel art. The main gameplay concept is really cool with the overland map, random encounters and the strategic fights. Sadly there's not much variation in all of these. There are a couple of random encounters, but they're always the same and I feel like the 'pool' of scenarios is really very small (similar to games like Orion Trail). Also the enemies and tactics in the fight scenarios are very repetetive, there's not much variation in it. After a couple of them it feels like it's always the same.

I feel like this could have been a great nice little game if there was more variations in it. Nonetheless I still would recommend it, even if it's only really fun for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064739137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1578978442}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134794963', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1560274566}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028335288', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1680313424}
review:
Отличный рогалик с тактикой в духе X-Com. Всем любителям раннего Индианы Джонса, заброшенных храмов посреди пустыни, нацистов, отстающих на шаг где-то позади в пыли и прочих Касабланок строго рекомендую. Атмосфера тут просто шикарная.

Основная претензия, которую я увидел - это однообразие, но если играть не спеша и под настроение, то однообразия не замечаешь и получаешь удовольствие от игры. Игра разбита на 5 почти не связанных между собой глав, каждая из которых проходится за вечер-два. Я делал перерывы между главами в месяц, иногда больше, и игра мне, как любителю атмосферы, описанной в первом абзаце, очень зашла

author: {'steamid': '76561198026321547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 9050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7710, 'last_played': 1579724103}
review: So I've played pathway for... a few hours. Its just so damn polished. Nothing feels rough or unperfected, and the pixel graphics are just lush. Im actively hungry for some paid dlc to support the devs and get more maps and enemies! If youre a fan of Rogue Lites, and a fan of HQ pixel art, give this a try. One play is likely to suck you in.

review: This game had a lot of promise when it first launched, so I'm extremely happy that the devs did an amazing job adding depth the game play and in the recent large update (1.1) corrected a lot of flaws and bugs. If you didn't like Pathway at launch or didn't pick it up because of the mixed reviews, please give it another chance and try it, the devs really deserve the praise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048023922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1574777050}
review: I really wanted to like this game! Love tactics, Cthulhu, Indiana J, everything is there! Waited for the big patch... But still such a deception. It's a game about tactical combat and the combat is boring. There's too few enemies types and behavior, the battleground are very repetitive, i mean devs, seriously, play Shining Force II released in 93 it has more interesting battles!!! Played 80% of the game (4 adventures) There's no boss!!! No traps, no turrets, no reinforcements, no chest to loot in the battle field (with timer so you take risks!), no clicky hidden somewhere, no doors, well anything to do besides shooting the same enemies from under cover. No surprises in a game inspired by adventure. Many things are done well, and this is the enraging part. The loot system and items is good, the character selection and unlockables not bad, there's many events... But it's not enough to save uninteresting overall map movement and boring battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142562973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1701648500}
review: Pathway is the perfect blend of resource management, strategic battles, and unique characters with interesting abilities that work differently in and out of combat. Extremely heavy Indiana Jones theme, but the characters are all different enough that I found myself trying all sorts of combinations. I wish there was more voice narrating or acting. I wish there were more missions. Otherwise, this game is fantastic. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060181740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 3977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1704230666}
review:
(Scroll down for TL:DR / Highs & Lows)

Indiana Jones meets X-COM-lite in this slimmed down turn-based combat game.  Some would like to through FTL in the mix but really the only comparison is the choosing your next location from the overall point A to point B which is limited by your jeep’s fuel.

This game is a bit of a struggle to discuss because I feel it is in a category that is very hard to please.  For some there won’t be enough in the strategy area, and for others it still might be too difficult as this is not a game designed for you to win every play through. When I comes to something like this I look at the price of the game, and what it tries to be.  Not every movie made is with the intention to win an Oscar, and not every Turn-Based combat game is looking to be a X-COM clone.

With that said I feel that this game is very reasonable priced for what you get and the fun to be had.  You get a party of up to 4 (sometimes you start with 2 and pick up others on the way) and travel the desert solving Indiana Jones types mysteries killing as many Nazis and cultist as you can on the way. Combat is short usually lasting around 5-15 minutes depending on skill and amount of baddies, and you have the standard 2 actions per char.  The AI is relatively smart and challenging, and it really feels like the game is designed for you not to combat every chance you get. Although death means the end of your adventure, XP, items, and money carry over making each attempt that much easier as you unlock other stats and features along the way.

The biggest let down I feel is with the actual journey you make across the map. Although you can choose your path along the way triggering random encounters it feels very inconsequential and you’ll often choose the shortest path straying only to hit a known rest stop or shop along the way.  The encounters you meet are well written and add a good amount of flavor and atmosphere, but you will eventually see them all and skip over text encounters just to get to combat encounter.  It would be nice if games like this could build a sense of permanence or maybe more interaction with the map.  A path that leads to a dead end in the dunes or by a city is no difference than another other dot in the middle of the dessert, so why would I go there, why is it even an option. Encountering a creepy shrine of the damned in one event isn’t a sign that the next encounter will be super zombie Nazis that could have been weakened if I destroyed the shrine.  Your choices from one dot to the next doesn’t build when it could giving those choices some weight.  I would say that at least in FTL the dot could have a bearing on combat (nebulas, asteroid fields etc.).

The meat and bones of the game though is in the combat and there I get my values worth.  I like the variety of character and abilities, skills aren’t overly complicated, and the game doesn’t try to be X-COM and is successful at making its own style. I paid full price and feel I could get my monies worth, more so than spending the $16 to see the next Oscar trying movie.

TL:DR “Kill Nazis in this X-COM-lite Indiana Jones like Crusade”

-	Travel from point A to point B, seeing random encounters that force you to kill Nazis and their cute murder dogs in roguelike TBS combat. (recent update allows you to not be so mean to murder dogs, good thinking)
 Learning curve assessment (Because every day I’m getting older, more stubborn, and now I need to go hug my dog)

-	If you’ve played any move and cover turn based combat game then you have the basics. The rest is all explained in their in game manual which can feel a little heavy but thankfully the game is not overly complex.  Can get the feel for it in one go.

Highs
-	Story and flavor is great, I almost feel I need to dress for the part
-	Good variety of skills and each weapon feels unique
-	Combat is short the game is easy to pick up and put down
-	Steady updates and improvement from the devs
-	Killing Nazis and their zombies never gets old

Lows
-	Map travel feels very lacking, gets to feel redundant after several sessions
-	Skill trees might feel lacking to some
-	Would love to see more voiced events as the game can be rather text heavy
-	No undo, live with the fact your cat just walked on your keyboard and made you move to somewhere without cover

author: {'steamid': '76561198038375425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1574004475}
review:
저는 턴제 게임을 몹시 좋아하지만 이 게임이 평가가 그다지 좋지 않아서 구매하지 않고 있다가, 최근 평가가 매우 긍정적으로 돌아선 것을 보고 구매한 사람입니다.

때문에 원래 게임이 어땠는지는 잘 모르고, 그냥 제가 플레이하며 느낀 점만 말씀드리겠습니다.

간단하게 말하자면... 이게 나아진거면 대체 원래는 어땠다는 것인가...

우선 게임 자체는 스테이지를 선택하고 보드게임처럼 한칸한칸 이동하며 랜덤 이벤트를 조우하는 방식입니다.

뭐... 캐릭터를 키우고 새 캐릭터를 해금하며, 장비를 파밍하는 것은 좋았습니다.
장비마다 다른 사거리와 데미지, 스킬 등이 있는 점도 꽤 좋았어요.

단점을 꼽자면 자잘한 것들도 많습니다.
이벤트가 랜덤이고 좋은 결과를 보려면 특성(Perk)가 필요하니 강제적으로 특성이 겹치지 않게 파티를 짜게 된다던지,
랜덤 이벤트이긴 해도 결국에 조금 지나면 읽지 않고 선택지만 누르고 패스하게 된다던지...
스테이지의 호흡이 미친듯이 길어서 하나 깨려면 한 두시간은 걸린다는 점 등등.

하지만 가장 치명적인 것은 위에 쓴 것처럼 스테이지 호흡이 엄청 길어서 전투만 몇 십번을 해야 하는데
전투가 특별히 재미있냐하면 그렇지 않다는 점입니다.

오리지널 엑스컴처럼 시야가 존재해서 적이 보이지 않는다거나 했다면 좀 더 전략적인 플레이가 가능했겠으나...
뻔히 적 위치가 전투 시작때부터 보이니 결국 내가 첫턴에 몇 놈을 죽이느냐가 전투의 결과를 좌우합니다.
그냥 첫 턴에 샷건들고 뛰어가서 버스트 날려서 적 한둘 잡아버리면 그 전투는 쉽게 가는거에요.

결국 전략이 좌우한다기보다는 좋은 장비와 무기 명중률에 의한 운빨이 거의 전투를 좌우합니다.

그래도 추천하는 것은 이번 패치로 유저들의 엄청 좋은 평가를 끌어내었다는 점에서 앞으로 더 좋아질 가능성이 보여서입니다.
이대로 포기하기에는 픽셀그래픽에 게임 배경까지 취향인 저로서는 너무나 아깝네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026704521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1574735971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012161898', 'num_games_owned': 2986, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1554, 'last_played': 1574082182}
review: I just completed all 5 adventures.  It was fun while it last.  Get boring towards the end.  Great potential but it was too short.  Hope it adds more adventures or have more random events.  While it may look random a la FTL at first, it gets repetitive quickly.  I ended up skipping a lot of encounters because they are just more fights.  The non-fight encounters utilizing your skills perks are more interesting. I would recommend if you like simplified Jagged Alliance 1 mixed in with Indiana Jones.  If you expect FTL complexity, look elsewhere.  Still good game to kill time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186608015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1685935214}
review:
It's a good game, you punch Nazi's and zombies while being a pseudo-archaeologist! As an irl-archaeologist though, the only thing that upsets me is the selling of artifacts for in game money, which kind of hurts my soul every time I do it since black market artifact selling slowly destroys what little we have of many ancient cultures. 

BUT the game itself is a great little turn-based game with several really neat environments to play around in, a cool cast of characters to choose from, and lots of fun mix and match with team composition. It's not a stressful game and has a really great soundtrack honestly, great to just sit and play when I'm not feeling up to a more story heavy game but don't want to play a mindless shooter either! 

The Mesopotamian/Egyptian etc environments you are in really feel pretty well researched, just little in game touches that make it feel like the original places that inspire it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993200618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1574011128}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072185485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1583613680}
review: This game despite it's reviews holds up to be a great turn based game that makes you feel like your on an Indiana Jones adventure. A constant betterment of your characters is easily spread over multiple adventures so even if your adventure comes short it still makes progress. The individual play-styles for each of the characters compliment each other quite well allowing you to have either a varied or specific group for your liking. The difficulty is easily changed by adding enemies or a difficulty, or by lowering the supplies you start the adventure with. All in all this is a great game that you should try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066960521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1663001433}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960364086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1623516517}
review:
Indiana Jones meets XCOM - Challenging turn based combat spiced up with well narrated random events, and wrapped up in a nice story line. I enjoy this game a lot.

The only downside I see is that the small font in the mouseover tooltips and tutorial popups is hard to read. I'd wish for a bigger font size there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088283033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1653446310}
review:
This game is excellent, FTL style overworld with XCOM combat, and a wonderful old timey adventurer theme. Everything is well excecuted and it has a gratifying metagame that gives a lot of importance to your playthrough while also deincentivizing save scumming. 

There is one small issue which I feel has a large negative impact however. The first time you play any given mission, the difficulty is locked to easy. This may be appropriate for someone who has never played FTL or XCOM before, but for someone who has, it makes this game way too easy. I still enjoy it quite a lot, but it isn't challenging. I think a mere suggestion to play on easy for your first time would suffice. 

Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198259748901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2892, 'last_played': 1612942109}
review:
一款偏战棋类的桌游类型游戏。上手易无需精通。现已中文补丁上线。更高难度可解锁。果然还是橙色武器强。
不同角色的能力不同，搭配也不同，后期地图一把能不能走完基本就靠队伍技能。

author: {'steamid': '76561198074667492', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1573535862}
review:
[h1] Yes, but actually, no [/h1]

This game is a deception. It has great perks: great arts, good sound effects, nice setup... But it falls short.

First it is [b] very repetitive [/b]. You have 5 adventures, the first is quite short, then it gets longer and longer. The setting does not change a lot. You set in the desert, the enemies are the same, they just level up.
And you level up as well, but you are caped pretty quickly, then all XP earned by those characters is just lost...

The game encourages you to redo the adventures several times, increasing the difficulty, but it is just the same, and the random events are not that numerous to allow a good time.

A decent game, but I could live without it and miss nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096378275', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1655666749}
review:
Mein erster Eindruck nach 3 Stunden Spielzeit ist gut. Ich muss zugeben, lange mit dem Kauf gewartet zu haben aufgrund einiger negativer Kommentare.
Eventuell war das die richtige Entscheidung ... bis heute. 

Die letzten beiden Updates scheinen dieses Spiel ordentlich aufgebessert zu haben, sodass ich sagen kann:
Klare Kaufempfehlung! 

Die taktischen Kämpfe wirken anfangs zu einfach, das ändert sich jedoch spätestens im zweiten Kapitel - sofern man den Schwierigkeitsgrad nicht schon vorher ändert). Pathway entfaltet mit seiner unterhaltsamen Story und den zufallsgenerierten Ereignissen ein wahres Abenteuer ... bei dem taktische Kämpfe eindeutig im Fokus liegen.

Die Atmosphäre, das schnelle Spiel und die Ausgewogenheit zwischen gemütlichem Brettspiel und explosivem Rundenkampf machen Pathway zu einem sehr charmanten Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174539641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2151, 'last_played': 1573365363}
review:
出了中文就买了，表示一下支持。商店页面上的恶评主要是在玩法单调无聊上，其实也还好啦，一共才五关，玩法单调就意味着简单，适合休闲党。
这游戏就是努力想再现印第安纳琼斯的感觉，挺好的，可解锁人物多，乐趣在于如何拼齐三四个人物的个性，在事件处理分支时候总能占到便宜，后期还有道具能加个性。最后我的四人队伍只差活命主义和古老的语言

author: {'steamid': '76561198036257580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1636986580}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053950281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1573667201}
review:
Addictive “how has it been this long?” gameplay.

As a lover of X-com and board games I seek out turn based tactics and strategy games to fulfill that itch. Some games succeed and some fail, but both of Robotality's offerings have succeeded. From the aesthetic to the moment to moment adventuring is great and the combat system is streamlined but still extremely satisfying.

I don’t know how the game was at launch but reading through the updates everything they have added has been great and I appreciate the tireless effort the developer puts into making the product as good as it can be. 

Give it a shot

author: {'steamid': '76561197988319173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1515, 'last_played': 1572956696}
review:
Pathway is another game that I really wanted to like. Its reminiscent of FTL but in a wonderfully realized WWII Egypt Eldritch Horror setting. The graphics, sound, and characters are well designed and I like how the encounters are handled- little in-game cinematics that accompany the text.

Unfortunately, the actual game play still feels half baked, even after a major update. The combat is bland; there are few tactical options (cover, zone of control, etc) so you really just shoot everyone until they're dead. Special abilities are almost entirely worthless, and characters are only unique in their combination of abilities. You just grind through the same trivial fights over and over.

The maps are big but theres no incentive to explore; you might run out of gas and lose, and you don't need extra money/gear to advance because the fights are so easy. Party composition has little impact on your strategy. Ultimately, theres potential here, but it hasn't been reached yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055072347', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1573133242}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009350771', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1573622560}
review:
It's like FTL, except that the ship battles have been replaced with X-COM style tactical turn-based battles. It's a little bit rough around the edges: the battles could still use a little tweaking to be more interesting, there's not quite enough information in the UI (why isn't there a way to know how much melee/grenade damage I can do to a creature without getting right next to them? why aren't there keyboard-hints for all my buttons and why don't all my buttons have keyboard controls? Required use of mousewheel can be disastrous (Edit: apparently, it's not required, but similarly to the previous complaint, the keyboard control is not discoverable when you need it), etc). 

Nonetheless, **if you fundamentally like the idea of FTL campaigns mixed with X-COM battles (and inter-game persistent unlocks as you progress), you should definitely pick this up**. It seems like the developer is still tweaking/improving. Hopefully that remains true until this is a well-polished gem! Would love to see all the latent potential in this game unleashed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967818561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1572156128}
review:
This review was originally published on [url=https://epicbrew.net/2019/11/04/pathway-review-a-great-discovery/] Epic Brew. [/url]


Pathway, developed by Robotality, released back in April to mixed reviews. I saw the game’s cool reception on Steam and decided to bypass it in favor of other games on my to-play list.

A few weeks ago the game’s publisher, Chucklefish, reached out to me about Pathway’s latest update, “Adventurers Wanted,” and how it introduced many new updates and changes to the game that the developers implemented based on players’ feedback over the past half-year.

Some of the changes outlined were 18 new character abilities, improved enemy A.I., new story events, a more rewarding loot system than what was present previously and new combat areas.

But, if you’re like me and are just playing Pathway for the first time, you have the luxury of first experiencing the game with all of these quality-of-life updates. Lucky us.

Pathway is a set of rogue-like adventures where players direct a team of adventurers through 1936 Northern Africa and parts of the Middle East. Think of it as an Indiana Jones turn-based roguelike — that was my elevator pitch for Pathway, when my friends asked about it.

Players start out by choosing a trio of adventurers who each have their own unique skills and stats. The trio is then sent out on a mission that spans a game board-like level where the adventurers travel from spot to spot encountering random events at every stop. Each transition from spot to spot costs one fuel, and if players run out of fuel, their heroes must walk and take damage with each move. Basically, if you run out of fuel and don’t immediately find more, you’re done for.

Your jeep cannot carry enough fuel to get you from the start of the mission to the final destination without refueling, so players must scavenge for supplies and fuel as they play. Considering that the only fuel depots in 1930s Northern Africa are held by Nazis, you’re going to have to fight for that fuel.

Combat can happen during any turn. Unless you move to a merchant spot, there’s a good chance you’ll be fighting Nazis. There are other combat opponents, besides angry Germans, but I won’t spoil those surprises here.

Combat is turn-based and allows each character to move and use action points that provide offensive or defensive options. Each character can use a ranged weapon to simply shoot at opponents, or one of their unique abilities to control the combat.

For example, one character I used could set up a defensive stance that stops enemy movement in a designated region. If an enemy entered that area, my character would fire a warning shot that stopped the enemy in their tracks. I could use this ability to control a zone and allow my other characters to move to a better position or heal up if necessary.

What I liked about the combat was that while it is turn-based, Pathway doesn’t lock you into a specific order of which character to move when. When it’s your turn you’re free to move any of your characters, or attack with them, in any order. This opens up the creative possibilities that are more-restrictive turn-based system would be unable to provide.

If I had one character standing between an enemy and one of my other characters, I could shift the sandwiched character out of the way, have my other character fire a shot at the enemy and then move them to cover beside the character I previously moved. I could then use the previously sandwiched character to heal the character I just moved beside them.

That sort of dynamic opened up the gameplay so that each encounter felt unique, beyond the unique scenarios themselves, and I had the freedom to solve the combat situations as I wanted to. This freedom, packaged with the overall brevity of combat scenarios, helped retain my attention — and enjoyment.

Each level is tied together with a narrative that it would be generous to call interesting, but it does try to make the experience cohesive. After attempting to stick with the story for the first mission, I realized that it wasn’t incredibly vital to the game as a whole and it was easy to dismiss it altogether.

What was more interesting to me were the bit-sized events that took place with every location. After playing through three complete missions, I rarely encountered events that were repeated, apart from some story-related segments that I had to replay though when I failed them.

As someone who can easily shrug-off a turn-based game by my second-or-so hour with it, I found myself playing Pathway for longer periods than I intended to. The game has that “one-more-turn” lure and that coupled with the rewarding gamble of not knowing what the next move will bring makes Pathway an easy recommendation to make.

Beyond the lack of interesting narrative, players who are more experienced with turn-based games may find Pathway too easy or simplistic. There’s very little complexity to the game and while that worked in favor of retaining my attention, players looking for a game that’s a bit less casual may be disappointed with the experience they find within Pathway.

While I can’t speak to how Pathway has improved since its launch, I can say that right now, Pathway is a great, casual strategy game. All the work the developers put into improving the game has made it one I would have difficulty believing people were lukewarm about at launch.
