author: {'steamid': '76561198076046376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4898, 'last_played': 1613822108}
review:
算是最早接触这款游戏的那批人之一吧，原本是屎大棒玩家，因为呵呵鱼代理发行接触到这游戏，不得不说对于没接触过xcom的玩家来说刚上手时玩起来还是很有新鲜感的

我本身对战旗类比较有爱，当时这款游戏就给我种“枪战版火纹”的感觉，像素画风的光影效果也不错，大地图挑选路线的设计让我眼前一亮，难度可调节，打不过或者汽油不够你可以选择最低难度最多资源（新版本还有最少敌人数量），然后把全图探个遍都没问题，当然挑战高点的难度装备爆率也会相对高点…

要说缺点瑕疵其实也比较明显
1）首先是主线剧情很薄弱，几乎没什么存在感，也许可以当半个rougelike玩，这点是我感觉比较遗憾的，不过如果你是打折入的话你可能会发现其实它有一个姊妹篇前作，想体验剧情的推荐玩玩那作，代入感非常不错，创意工坊也有中文补丁
2）事件容易给人重复感…这个除非事件数量能再翻几番，不然确实没办法
3）战斗系统方面的瑕疵，这个其实已经经历了好几个版本了，我参与了后来官中的内测，制作组其实一直有听取玩家意见不断改进，原本的战斗系统比前作就已经好不少了，官中更新后又有很大改动，技能树全部重做了一遍，装备和敌人ai的调整等，新版的战斗体验比之前还是有极大改善的

不得不说官方在游戏发售时犯了个极大的错误，过早地宣布支持官中，看到评论区有很多差评仅仅是因为当初没有中文，还是替制作组感到有点可惜…如果你了解到这个游戏制作组总共只有四个人，你就能理解官中为什么拖了这么久才出来了，除了中文，他们同时还要兼顾一同发布的日文，而游戏的文本量其实是非常大的。

另外我也参与了这游戏的民间汉化（也就是评论区里的贴吧汉化，这也是为什么我玩了80+小时的原因）。在这里想多说一句，把民间的汉化版本放到评论区里其实对制作组是不太礼貌的，希望大家能体谅下小型游戏工作室的不易…当然我们出民间汉化的初衷其实也就是出于对游戏的喜爱，希望更多的人能够了解到这款游戏…现在官中已经出了，旧的民间汉化自然也就停止更新了...

总之希望这家工作室能继续打磨这款游戏乃至以后能为玩家呈上更多精彩的作品吧～

author: {'steamid': '76561197968614151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1572943413}
review:
I'm glad I got this game. It's demanding but never unfair.
I would describe it as xcom meets choose your own Indiana Jones Adventure. 

I got hooked immediately. Nice buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198964922890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1590766192}
review:
I've been wanting to play this game for a long time and I finally caved in after seeing the reviews break away from the "Mixed" rating. 

If you're expecting a huge, overly complex strategy game, this might not be the game for you. While it can be demanding on higher difficulty settings, it can very well be enjoyed as a "coffee break" game - the first mission takes ~20 minutes to complete on the lowest difficulty settings without being too challenging. However, a certain amount of grinding is required to unlock more characters and/or achievements, but a lot of these will unlock as you progress organically through the course of the game, especially if you play on higher difficulty settings. 

Other than that the game is very thoughtfully developed - I personally really appreciate the inclusion of the Dog-Friendly mode. The pixel art  is simply beautiful and I did not expect this game to include as many story elements as it does. Don't be deceived by the small number of missions - there is plenty to discover just by replaying the same mission and travelling to different nodes each time. Different events get triggered but every single one of them adds a layer of depth to the game I didn't expect to find. 

All in all it is a solid game for casual players and more experienced players of the genre alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080991354', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1699465747}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011469837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2270, 'last_played': 1572747998}
review: It's good

author: {'steamid': '76561198035306771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1667329557}
review: FTL meets Fallout Tactics to take on Indiana Jones' Last Crusade. Excellent turn-based tactics RPG with a well thought-out retrofuturistic pulp comics aesthetic, a deep and engaging story, fun characters, and a soundtrack that somehow manages to evoke the best of John Williams' scores to classic Lucas-Spielberg adventure flicks while sounding fresh and fun. All this in a lo-fi indie game from the same publisher as Starbound. I haven't even finished the main quests yet, but I'm enjoying the heck out of this game and not only do I recommend you play it, but I recommend they make more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028594943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1575715655}

review: I liked this game's visual style since release, but didn't buy it because of bad reviews. They said, combat system was a joke. Well, someday I saw that recent reviews are "very positive". They said, combat system was fixed. So I bought it and don't regret. Lovely art, entertaining combat and FTL-like traveling (but without Rebel fleet). I dig it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993544665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1676835058}
review:
Die Kombination von 2 Mega-Spiele-Themen,
RPG(Rundenkämpfe) und 8-Bit-Grafik! Das i-Tüpfelchen ist dann noch der "Indiana Jones" -Background!
Eine mega Kombi. Ich schreibe diese Review ca. 1 Woche nach Kauf und in der Woche gab es keinen Tag ohne Pathway!
Pro:
+ 8-Bit Grafik
+ passender Soundtrack
+ zufällig generierte Karten
+ "Indiana Jones" - Thema
+ der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist nicht zu einfach!
Con:
- die Durchgänge sind (gerade am Anfang) etwas unausgewogen aufgrund der zufälligen Generierung der Karten!

Alles in allem macht das Spiel richtig viel Spaß

author: {'steamid': '76561197994705291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1603828374}
review: The game is simple enough to learn, like a Xcom lite mixed with Indiana Jones like globe trotting simulated through linear "adventures" that incorporate some random map generation. With just enough complexity in it's core game loop in replaying with different party set-ups or changing the difficulty for better loot or greater challenge. The only real gripe is enemy variety will get stale after a couple of hours and that there is currently no ability to create custom adventures though with the narrative set pieces in each of the 5 adventures and semi random nature of the maps themselves I could see this being difficult. I personally enjoyed the game very much, having bought the game during a daily sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968353041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1575392844}
review:
I Love It. The mechanics are good, the pixel art is good. The Indiana Jones setting is awesome.
It crashed a couple of time though but no progress was lost.  Really good game, worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028674222', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1572548284}
review:
Pathway's best quality lies within its simplicity. Where some games in this genre demand careful and thoughtful planning, in here you pick some adventurers and go adventuring, Indiana Jones style.  

I picked this game for loving both pixel art, Indiana Jones and X-Com, so it stands that if you like those settings as well you'll enjoy Pathway, even if it will hardly come as one of your favorite games ever. 

The graphics are bright and bold, but lack a certain charisma, as your adventurers only move what the battles asks them. You'll see them run, jump, shoot, cover, but not think, disdain, fear, enjoy, or any other kind of personality or emotions.

Battles with nazis are the meat of gameplay, and they are cool enough, but with an Indiana Jones setting, it seems a missed opportunity to do some kind of exploration and discovery. Certain battle maps could enjoy a fog of war, the possibility to enter buildings, more interaction with the environment (like, say, press a button here to open a trapdoor there, where enemy soldiers are covering).

The battles lend themselves to the X-Com comparison, but X-Com created this amazing gameplay loop where you win battles to gather loot to research said loot at your bases that result in better weapons and equipment that allow you to win battles to gather loot and so on. Pathway gives you a very light experience, with a basic run and gun strategy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991473781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1572359570}
review:
Excellente surprise !

J'avais vaguement suivi le jeu à sa sortie et avais été démotivé par l'accumulations de mauvaises critiques. Coincé à la maison avec une petite fièvre, je cherchais un jeu pour m'occuper et, paf, que ne vis-je point Pathway en promo !

Et bien, comme beaucoup semblent l'indiquer, les nombreuses critiques pre-patch 1.1 ne s'appliquent plus et le jeu est devenu un rogue like fort plaisant.

Ca valait presque le coup de tomber malade !

author: {'steamid': '76561198220087396', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1579535630}
review: 游戏的画面与剧情是加分项，开场确实是被像素画风引入坑，但是整体游戏性不强。 随机事件以及地图互动没有什么新意，深度不够。

author: {'steamid': '76561198202600864', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1668045042}
review:
咋们玩个游戏不就是图个新奇新鲜感吗？剧情一共就五个章节供玩家自由调整难度游玩，不过剧情代入感依然瑕不掩瑜，剩下最为核心的战斗过程就是在找掩体打游击战，行动无法撤销确实让我这个手残党吃了大亏。过了五个章节之后就显得枯燥乏味了，人物的技能不少是比较鸡肋的——这让我这种喜欢养成类的很难受啊。

入坑的大家想必一定是被他新奇的游戏玩法和独特的非马赛克游戏画面（略带光影）所吸引的，不过很可惜游戏深度不够，度过了艰难摸索的过程，后期就是固定几人的刷刷游戏，我干爆它。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989129410', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1572067660}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975367020', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1572209714}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198028792160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1635971076}
review:
Gra miała jakieś problemy na początku, które odwlekły moją decyzję o zakupie. Obecnie jest okey, nie napotkałem żadnych błędów czy braku balansu. Deweloperzy mocno popatchowali grę po premierze.
Jestem w połowie drugiej przygody (z pięciu dostępnych). Przypomina pierwsze Jagged Alliance ale osadzone na bliskim wschodzie i w afryce. Bitwy są naprawdę przyjemne i trzeba trochę pogłówkować, żeby przejść je z niewielkimi stratami. Jedne co na razie mi przeszkadza to trochę monotematyczność samych walk, może dalej się pojawią jakieś urozmaicenia. Szkoda też że postacie nie mają unikalnych skilli. Historia i setting na duży plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100390758', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1584928656}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013776165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1572735625}
review: I treated myself to this game for my birthday , and Im enjoying it so far. Read thru the short codex and played the first mission , this is a classic adventure game, with turn based combat .First impressions very good story narrative , art is fun to look at . Combat is lethal , but fun ! I purchased the game after the recent patches , and im not experiencing any of the negative things some of the reviews speak of . Im hoping it keeps getting more updates and new campaigns in the future , theres a whole pulp world out there to explore . Just in the first mission there was a good variety of loot , and weapons and gear to find .The resource management aspect is light but critical . At this time I can easily recommend this game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032365802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1624895300}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093059862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1572329656}
review: I followed this for a while because of the incredible pixel artwork, but didn't buy because of the negative reviews. author: {'steamid': '76561198119776605', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1572101579}
review: 很好玩，难度刚好，如果显示效果再精细一点就好了

author: {'steamid': '76561198152097673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1574480595}
review:
还挺好玩的 整体战斗难度不高 机制比较简单易懂 画风和音乐比较讨喜吧
战斗过程基本保证打远程等他们凑近了送 打近战往地图的一个方向走聚怪溜着打还挺随意的
如果前面能爆到一个橙装很久一段时间都能感受到我起了一枪秒了的快感
我前面爆了一把手枪 医生开局先杀两个 游戏难度直线下降
因为通关很快所以简单尝试了一下其他的打法，三狙击手开局去打平原关非常有趣，只要两个伏击一个输出基本可以控住对面人
但是三狙击手地下狭窄的关会很痛苦，打僵尸会比较难受
这里一共有三个纯近战职业，近战职业的特点就是跑的特别快，打到后面有会复活的女祭司 站在很后排 近战职业处理起来就很快
虽然有一些功能有点雷同的人物，但是总体来说只要研究还是可以发现很多套路的

author: {'steamid': '76561198030271396', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1572119407}
review: On a dit beaucoup de mal de ce titre au moment de sa sortie. Il avait certes des défauts mais les intentions étaient parfaitement louables : proposer un roguelite d'aventure pas trop prise de tête et ludique. Après de nombreux patches, témoignant de l'attachement des développeurs à leur titre, il me semble que le cahier des charges est respecté. On ne passera pas, sans doute, des heures à jouer à Pathway, mais une petite partie reste toujours assez réjouissante.
developer_response: Merci beaucoup pour ces mots trop gentils!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045143501', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1663119563}
review:
Pathway es un gran juego con una bonita historia detrás, y en más de un sentido.

Cuando se lanzó hace seis meses, contaba con una buena jugabilidad y una duración acorde a su precio. No obstante, los usuarios mas exigentes denostaron ciertos defectos y frieron el juego a opiniones negativas. Tremendo esfuerzo después, y tras leer numeroso feedback de sus usuarios, Robotality puede alzar la cabeza orgullosa de haber reinventado Pathway para mejor

Adventurers Wanted es prácticamente un rework completo, y no una simple versión 1.1. Muchos de los problemas de repetitividad han sido atajados. Pathway es un juego que, ahora mas que nunca, merece la pena jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072377114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1640130593}
review:
I've really enjoyed this game so far! Beautiful artwork that is just GUSHING with theme. The music and vibe of the game is completely charming and grips me with a cinematic feeling. A true "Indiana Jones" experience.

Tense situations call for thoughtful strategy and careful team configuration. Love the ranking system - simple but makes you look forward to the next one!

Another big reason for this review is the true attention to detail in making sure this was the BEST possible game. The Devs went back into the game, fixed many bugs, quality of life issues, and made the game STRONGER. I applaud their efforts - not many companies are willing to do that. Bravo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966655697', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1572042907}
review:
Graphismes pixel de toute beauté.
Ambiance Indiana Jones avec un petit gout de Jagged Alliance.
Bon jeu de combat tactique, les events sont sympas.

Un peu répétitif sur la fin, une phase exploration de tombeau serait top !

author: {'steamid': '76561198151577762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1572781868}

developer_response:
Hi,

This is certainly not supposed to happen and it just sounds like a technical issue that I'm sure we can resolve. Could you reach out to us at hello@robotality.com?

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198011148008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1693411556}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966553175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1572200302}
review: I'm not too far in to this game but from the couple hours I've played I'm really enjoying it. The setup and the way in which it tells its stories is compelling and the soundtrack really adds to that feeling of you setting out on an adventure. There's a great deal of depth the combat and resource management, I'm looking forward to seeing where it goes once I've unlocked more of the characters and adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084194423', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1572658867}
review: 好玩的很嘛，战棋的玩法也很不错，如果人物头像有更细致的头像就好了

author: {'steamid': '76561198034127417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1687598655}
review: 有装备就是大爷，流程有点短，地图有点少，其他都挺好

author: {'steamid': '76561198236879018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1582963397}
review:
经过几次版本更新，平衡和耐玩性都很不错，画风精细度在像素游戏里算顶级的，很合自己胃口。
整个故事主线可以说是照搬电影赏金奇兵系列，不过，路上会遇到很多随机事件，可以领略二战时期的北非风土人情，非常带感。
也不知道为啥俄罗斯那边的开发商出的全是战旗游戏，预告片都还整的不错，偏爱战旗游戏的我当然见一个买一个，买完一玩全是垃圾内容，没一个能玩的，这款pathway算是一个例外，对得起这个价。

PS：如果队友死了或者选错事件分支，直接关掉游戏重开就可以重选了。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026511921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1572171223}
review:
I enjoyed Halfway a lot and this is considerably better in terms of customisation, great cut-scenes where various archaeological digs are plundered and more than fair balancing.  As others have noted the Indiana Jones styled theme has been near perfectly captured down to the cheesy jeep ride dialogue at end of mission.  I am yet to encounter sable fedoras and bringing whips to a gunfight, but the spirit shines through.

The pixel art is really well crafted and the turn based combat very satisfying, giving plenty of options to dispense with occult obsessed fascists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271872353', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1582380721}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018790516', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1574803420}
review: There's a soft spot in my heart for turn-based strategy games, there's a soft spot in my heart for themes and graphics that remind me of Lucasfilm games from my childhood, and there's a soft spot in my heart for developers who make a game that's imperfect, listen to feedback, and then improve it until it's pretty good. If those things are on your checklist as well, this game is probably worth checking out. I'm looking forward to seeing how the game continues to evolve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992361287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1586254463}
review:
Un rogue-like/desert crawler (bah ouais c'est pas dans un donjon donc...) bien sympatique dont le but est, à la manière d'un FTL, d'avancer de case en case sur la carte d'un scénario prédéfini. Des évènements aléatoires vous tomberont dessus, parfois bons, parfois mauvais. On dirige un groupe d'aventuriers tout droit issus d'un film  d'Indiana Jones dont nous suivrons à peu près le même type d'aventure. Les phases de combats seront familières à tout joueur de tactical rpg : les persos ont des capacités unique comme la spécificité à un type de port d'arme, de grenade, soin, etc.. Et le but bien sur, arriver au bout du scénario.

Le jeu avant la dernière mise à jour ne valait pas vraiment le coup : gameplay trop lisse, évènements très peu fournis, phases de combats inintéressantes (on place ses persos au plus près, on bourine et c'est réglé), en bref, une fois la joie de la découverte passée, on retournait jouer à FTL parce que bon, c'est quand même mieux.
Depuis la mise à jour j'ai l'impression de découvrir un tout autre jeu! On à des personnages avec des vrais compétences propres à eux même, les évènements sont diffusés plus aléatoirement, les pool d'armes s'est aussi vu agrandir et diversifié grâce au niveau  qu'elles possèdent) ce qui rend chaque aventure vraiment bonne et unique. On peut enchainer une bonne série de combats et tomber sur une meute de chiens affamés qui nous rappelle à la dure réalité des rogues-like.

En gros depuis sa quasi refonte, je recommande vivement !

author: {'steamid': '76561197986108008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1706745004}
review:
This is a great game!  Obviously, it is a turn based tactical game like XCOM but with pixel art and a cool Raiders of the Lost Arc theme.  Unlike XCOM though it is a bit simpler as far as post combat management systems.  You don't need to craft armor, weapons, or upgrade a home base to enhance your characters.  You just go out on fun, beautiful, and often challenging adventures.  Even if you fail, your run doesn't feel like a waste too since you often collect gear or supplies to make a better go at it for future runs... AWESOME!

I did enjoy this game when it first came out but would have been hesitant to say go buy it at full price.  With the recent update though, this game is now a strong recommendation!  For anyone who was on the fence about this game before due to the initial reviews, things have changed.  The devs have done an incredible job expanding the game into a vastly superior polished work.

The original game did feel a bit stale combat wise since there was not a lot variety in combat abilities.  They have done a great job overhauling the characters and skill trees by introducing a variety of different skills to the game.  Also updating the storage and supply mechanic to the game has made it a lot smoother while new rare items makes each adventure all the more satisfying.

In short, this is an easy tactical game to pick up and enjoy.  The most recent major update brought a huge breath of fresh air and life to the game.  Anyone who is interested in the style of this great tactical gem is likely to be very satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145417195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1572078253}
review:
首发时买的，怎么说呢？感觉战棋类枪战挺有趣的。
上来找掩体索敌，打几枪换子弹啥的。有种盟军敢死队的那种感觉。
但是探险过程玩的不是很有趣，感觉还是略显单调。
战棋模式的敌人配置又是基于探险模式下的随机分配敌人，感觉玩多了就没意思了。
其实我觉得哪怕没有探索模式，单纯做成剧情向枪战战棋游戏也是挺有趣的

author: {'steamid': '76561198032012607', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1571803793}
review:
发售时买的一直没玩等中文,发售6个月更新中文来玩,结果什么狗屎优化
显示完开发商和发行商logo后不是黑屏就是无限加载,不到1G的游戏加载比文明6还久
内存占用比文明6多,打开游戏程序加载时内存占用最高1855MB
开始游戏后,没想到熬过进入游戏的大载后还有一操作一小载
旅行移动到下一地点要加载!,触发事件和事件结算要加载!,战斗结束战利品结算还要加载!
本来进入战斗要切画面加载就有点割裂感了,各种小加载更加放大割裂感
战斗中移动后还不能撤销移动,时不时点射击后无法攻击再点射击才能攻击

author: {'steamid': '76561197997678601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1572978673}
review:
I like the Game a lot. charming graphics and the loot system is rewarding... on the normal difficultys its not too hard but i was dying a few times or my fuel was empty. But it was okay. Your heros have a skilltree and nice perks. it goes fast to get new heros. The fighting is turnbased, with cover mechanics and so on. i havent completed all the levels yet but its often against nazis and the cultist lack on enemy variety there would be room for more i think. 
i like the desert maps but it would be great to get a Amazonas Map or something in southamerica, i think there are plenty of story there. And something in eastasia would be great.
here they could even make whole new enemy factions like and secret aztec society or japanese soldiers(and even there they could change the dog to a katana wearing soldier for example) i think i would even pay a few bucks for a new adventure dlc or something if they would include one or two new heros in it and new items. And they could make an event where you be able to rent a merceniery(its a hero who earns no exp and who goes away after the adventure, and has some special abillity and profession ... they could look like the natives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995436318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1757, 'last_played': 1644280673}
review:
The general gist of the game is this:  You're adventurers in the middle east/northern Africa in the 1930s.  Nazis/local cults are operating in area, and you set out to stop them.  You do this by putting together a party from a diverse cast of characters, and then setting forth, making your across the map node by node while encountering random events and turn based battles.  While doing so, you obtain new and more powerful weapons and armor for your team, valuables you can sell, and manage your fuel, supplies, and the health of your adventurers.

There are currently 5 set "adventures" in the game that has a different plot.  You pick one, and then set up your adventuring crew for the adventure.  You pick 3 from a pool of characters that have a diverse selection of abilities and skills.  Characters have innate aptitudes for specific weapon and armor types, dictating the type of equipment they can equip, and skill trees where you can unlock stat boosts, abilities, and new aptitudes as your characters gain levels.  Once selected, they embark onto the map.  There, you travel from node to node, which costs one fuel.  At each node, something happens- sometimes a blurb that tells you "literally nothing", sometimes an event that has a random outcome, sometimes it's a shop, etc. etc.  These events can have positive or negative outcomes for you, and can be positive influenced by blue options if you have a crew member with the appropriate trait.  And then, sometimes, these nodes are a battle.

The combat system is terrific for what the game is.  There's not a ton of depth to the combat, where battles probably last 5 minutes on average, but there is [i]just[/i] enough to it that you do need to engage with the combat by planning and making good decisions, and can't just faceroll your way through, particularly at higher difficulties.  There's two action points and a cover system, which might be enough to induce eye rolling, but there's a lot to differentiate Pathway from the games following Nu-XCOM's lead.  Every character has a unique stat spread,  dictating their combat stats (Movement range, health, accuracy, etc.).  Each weapon and armor type has a unique ability as well, which you employ by spending "Bravery".  For example, of the armors, Light gives you "Sprint" which is a very far move; Medium gives you "Low Profile" which guarantees an evade on the next attack that character receives; Heavy gives you "Hunker Down" which reduces the damage you take to 75% for that turn.  There's also armor "health", which mitigates damage and requires you to bring either armor shred or enough raw damage to punch through.  There's two factions of enemies, which have 5-6 enemy types apiece, with their own special abilities to contend with.  As you progress through events, adventurers gain levels and become stronger as they gain access to more of their skill tree.

That's the majority of the game.  You push through, traveling through nodes until you reach your destination.  Adventures have 1-3 "legs" each, and as you progress through, you'll unlock more characters for the roster and find stronger equipment, allowing you to fine tune your crew to your heart's content for the final adventure.

One thing that definitely deserves praise is the "New Adventurers Wanted" update.  Pathway at release was fun, but it definitely felt like it was lacking in some respects, and that it was just missing [i]something[/i].  With the new update, Pathway is a much better game, and the devs deserve a lot of props for seeing their initial version could've been improved upon, rather than stubbornly digging their heels in and insisting  that players just didn't appreciate their vision.  And improve they did. We got new skill trees, new combat systems, and a new item generation system as well as new additions to the event and map pools.

I think Pathway is terrific.  It's an incredible lite FTL/XCOM mashup that scratches a lot of itches at once, and I hope to see more content from the devs in the coming months.

review:
INTRO Music |||||
8 bit vibes, check
Familiar combat turn base, tooltips / CODEX was real neat into settling in
No similar Pathway, always a different [b] Adventure	[/b]
Locking the difficulty was a really neat game design choice , i had peaked mine on max unit size! Daunting !
Yet to find a bug hanging about...
--------
The Bravery mechanics is very welcomed, makes it situational use to turn tides
makes choices very vital, you do not always want to pick a fight ! 
Great design choice to pick for a character that could make events interesting , making it so that there isnt a reason to always go for three of the same on every Adventure 
There is a speed up AI movement button ! could slow them back to Normal if i wanted too, very handy for those battle replays 



How deep on the latest edit of review?
- [strike] Friend in Need[/strike]
- Wrath of God

author: {'steamid': '76561198061104026', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1607150640}
review:
一句话总结  深度不足 
本来应该由剧情和随机事件推动游戏进行
但是剧情非常薄弱，随机事件基本只是物资和生命值加减法
经济系统方面首先收入方面战利品很不行，只能靠卖淘汰下来的装备勉强维持生活
支出方面装备实在是太贵了，现行的减伤机制下一千多块买件新衣服又没什么提升

战斗这里主要是有一个简单粗暴的掩体机制
沿掩体画一条无限延长线 线后面的敌人在攻击掩体后的角色时命中率-70%
---------------------------------------------
剩下的鸽了 只能说还有进步的空间吧 建议打折买

author: {'steamid': '76561198023583430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1571503236}
review:
I highly recommend this game, as the devs have learnt a lot since their first game Halfway. It is a little gem with XCOM gameplay that would remind one of "Renowned Explorers".  So far, I have finished the first scenario twice, and it was 2 hours of joy each play.

Think of it as a "Coffee break" XCOM. 

Very nice, AND beautiful. The stuff they did with pixel lightning and shadowing is delicious.

Plus, it's a Linux compatible game !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977768876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1571115036}
review: Pathway is greatly improved by its recent updates. There is a ton of additional content in terms of encounters, and more varied and interesting loot. The AI is still not very smart, and sometimes seems not to want to attack you, but really the difficulty in this game is not in any particular fight, but in surviving over the long run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998087529', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1570928377}
review: So I played only after the Adventurers Wanted Update. The Combat is by no means deep now, but I found it enjoyable. There quite some ways to structure your party, many skills do make a difference and some of the encounters feel interresting combatwise. I thinks there is still space for improvement, especially the enemy types could be more varied or there could be different versions of existing enemies. Even more radical starting conditions would be nice too! (being limited to one move for mutible turn etc.) The story is written nicely and also the Grafics to illustrate every story bit (often animated), which really feels great. The Overwold map has some taktics to it, though also here there could be more and different goals visible... There had been a system of different ressources before, having overworld hints and readding those ressources might prove nicely. Right now I'd call the game a tactical casual roguelite, with emphasis on a beautifull illustration, some dungeon crawling elements and ocassional difficoult encounters. I enjoy playing and think its worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065002006', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1573292370}
review: I think many people left negative reviews because they expected way too much out of a 14€ game and it being compared to FTL. The game had some flaws at launch but the devs kept working on it and i have to say that the last patch really improved  the gameplay and variety of fights  by introducing special rules from some encounters. I feel like now pathway, while still falling short of surpassing FTL, is a very enjoyable experience well worth the asking price and that the devs managed to build upon the release version and deliver a much better product

author: {'steamid': '76561198039884239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1586362542}
review:
Sold as a Mac game but bugs prevent is on running smoothly even on MBP 15".
Devs don't care and never fixed the bugs.

Selling it as a Mac game right now is almost a scam and the option should be removed.
developer_response:
Hi Elias/Damien,

I totally understand your frustration. Were I in your position, I would feel the same way. 

Let me try and expand a bit on what's happened and what we're doing.

Pathway may look like a 2d game, but it is in fact relying heavily on Voxel & 3d mesh data to render its looks. This allows us to create real-time shadows and lighting that's quite unique in a pixelart game. This is why it needs significant rendering and CPU power. You may not agree with our choice to do things this way, but for us, the look of the game is a significant part of its DNA.

On the Mac issue: A large portion of the game was developed on a MBP Retina and I worked exclusively on my MBP for over a year whilst making the game. The game runs just fine on my MBP (which is a 2012 machine!). The issue you (and others) have encountered seems to be specific to a series of macs. 

We've tried a lot of things and have spent a significant amount of time trying to fix this issue. Unfortunately we still don't know why this happens on some macs and not on others. The only guess we have is that this is due to some small driver & hardware differences. Interestingly enough, older MBP seem to often run better.

If you feel adventurous, you could try the game in bootcamp and you'll most likely see that it'll run just fine on your hardware under Windows.

We're still very much committed to fixing this. It's just a really, really tricky and weird issue. If you'd like to help us in testing and tracking down these issues, we'd love to hear from you at hello@robotality.com

Stefan | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198030769698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1584112147}
review:
I was hyped for this game before it's release, but sadly it is a letdown.
I really like turn based tactics games and the whole package with exploring the desert and looting ancient tombs like Indiana Jones seemed so much fun. But to summarize, the game is a drag. 

Each fight you know 5 turns in advance what will happen, who will target who, and who will do how much damage. But you still have to power through it, only to get into the next fight on the next location. And sadly, every time against the exact same enemies. There is also not much strategy involved. Get into cover, shoot people, and hope they miss when they shoot back. There are different classes but not many different skills to allow for more strategy.

Also the exploration of the map didn't prove to be interesting. I was at first interested in the random encounters, but mostly either nothing happens or you get some gas for the jeep. Or, of course, you get into a fight.

The graphics are really nice, the music is decent, the sounds effects are passable.
All in all, although the game looks fine at first sight, unfortunately I cannot recommend buying this game.
developer_response:
Hey Laylance,

Thanks for your review! You may have seen this already, but we just recently released a major free update to Pathway that I think may address quite a few of your issues with the game (blog post: https://steamcommunity.com/games/546430/announcements/detail/1590259313195286293)

For example, we've added a whole range of new combat abilities that can be unlocked over time. Combat in general has received quite a few significant changes.

We've also reworked a lot of events to give them more significant choices and consequences.

Hopefully you get the chance to check the game out again - we'd love to hear what you think of the changes!

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198056019702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1566858868}
review:
Cute and fun but not hugely challenging tactical combat game with limited replay potential.

Apparently there was more of a story at some point in development but right now you just pick a team from a collection of heavily-armed misfits and head out into the desert to shoot Nazis and cultists because the text box told you to. It leaves you wondering how a Vatican official, a tribal huntress, and a Russian scientist know each other, and how they got into the hobby of chasing Third Reich X-Files. But it has an odd sort of charm, and anyway, who needs an excuse to enjoy killing Nazis and zombies in a video game?

The combat is fun but not terribly deep. You will always have 100% hit chance when not obstructed by cover so much of the game is about establishing superior positioning to take advantage of this while not leaving yourself exposed to counter-attacks. Different party members have better or worse combat skills against various opponents and situations, and you can only choose 2 while RNG picks the others for you, which adds some variety and tension to the proceedings. Weapons are not balanced well; the humble pistol is the powerhouse of the game with its special ability Double Shot blowing assault rifles out of the water for flexibility and threat erasure (although the tooltip does not say so, you can use both shots on one target, making a powerful first strike). Meanwhile disintigrators are just about useless because they do less damage to unarmored targets, which are about 75% of your enemies. 

The game has an odd progression system which I think doesn't work well. There are five scenarios that unlock in sequence, but they aren't part of a "campaign" so you can always go back and replay the previous ones as much as you like to grind for XP and loot. So it's only your honor and/or tolerance for grinding that keeps you from becoming as powerful as you wish before moving on to the later missions. It's also hard to keep enjoying the game once you've finished those 5 scenarios, since you keep all your gear and XP, making previous missions unchallenging. Turning up the rudimentary difficulty sliders and replaying them all with higher enemy HP is the only endgame on offer right now. Compare this to something like Renowned Explorers which uses the same choosable-team 5-mission structure but gives it better replay value by linking them as a linear campaign with no persistent stats or items, and providing a score and a failure state. I enjoyed this game and feel like I got my money's worth but unless new content is released I'm pretty sure I'm done with it.

The game is very attractively presented with pixel graphics and lovely lighting effects, and I greatly appreciate the developers adding toggle options for gore and a "dog friendly mode." It looks like they plan to continue releasing patches so I'm hoping they will add some more content and balance, and give me more reasons to return and enjoy the nice parts of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014229134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 5436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1587905146}
review:
Review updated a second time, after some plays of the new version with Hardcore mode.

Now there's two games in one, when you create a profile you choose its type, Normal or Hardcore. The Normal mode is more a casual game, but the Hardcore mode at default difficulty is very hard even for games of this genre. I'll detail further in the review key aspects of both modes.

CAUTION this new Hardcore more is also a lot harder than the Normal mode, both at default difficulty are no way comparable.

If you played Halfway, this game is much better, on any aspects, combats, items, roster building, more.

[h1]I - The genre[/h1]
It's a party Tactical turn-based shooter with RPG elements, Roguelite elements, persistent elements, and a fixed roster of heroes. 

This is NOT an "Expeditions" like game, nor a classic Roguelite approach, and nothing like FTL or it's very borderline.

[h1]II - Classic turn based shooter elements and some aspects less usual[/h1]
The combats are quite singular despite they use mainly standard elements of turn based shooters:
[list]
[*]Cover/Half Cover/Full obstacle/Side step shoot/Range/Hit chance/Line of sight/HP/Armour/Evade/AOE/Critical/Double shots/Counter Attack/Aggro/Grenade/Heal kit/Armour repair kit/Various overwatch types/Sprint/Crouch/Trench/Bleeding/Armour piercing/Barrels exploding.
[*]Two phase movements, move and action in any order, or two actions but not two shoots nor two moves.
[*]Pistols/Shotguns/Assault Rifles/Sniper Rifles/Energy Weapons/Blade Weapons.
[*]Weapons varying from various parameters, range/clip size/precision/special attack/armor shredding damages/health damages/critical chance/critical damages/attributes bonus/trait bonus. Because of all the changes for now only Normal and Piercing attack types are meaningful.
[*]Special actions coming from adventurers skills.
[/list]
Some aspects are less usual:
[list]
[*]Bravery point system, special actions use 1 or 2 points, and they are restored from other actions or events like kill an enemy. It's a great system, that avoid abuses and add some tactical value with the Bravery points management.
[*]Special actions that are linked to armour, weapons and items equipped.
[*]Ammo management but one type of ammo and a global reserve for party, ammo reload but not clip reload.
[*]No timers nor timed combats which is a rarity in tactical games. :-)
[*]Various skills, some are very rare in turn based shooters if not new for few.
[*]Combats modes that influence combats start, which isn't unusual because many similar games use initiative aspects influencing mainly combat start. But their implementation is quite uncommon in Pathway.
[/list]

[h1]III - Quick combats with a very fast pace, most often[/h1]
The combats tend be short and intense, there's a lot of diversity and a fair depth.

Plenty combats are intense and will be solved in 3/4 turns, some even in 2 turns, and some are quite longer. Also as there's no timer, sometimes you can use all the time you want to progress more cautiously and make it even longer.

The combats are changed by various aspects, for example, enemies AI with different AI types, terrains and map size, types of enemies and types of groups of enemies, but also your current party.

[h1]V - Adventures and simple global management[/h1]
The game is divided in 5 adventures, and there's two play modes quite different, Normal and Hardcore.

In Normal mode you can stop an adventure at nay time and keep items and XP, and you can replay an adventure as many time you want. There's no scaling of party power so it opens a grinding to make the game even easier.

In Hardcore mode not only the default difficulty is higher, but also it has a design more like a campaign, you chain the 5 adventures, lost one ends the play, and you can't replay any adventure.

[h1]VI - Roster management[/h1]
It's an interesting system merging well heroes that aren't anonymous soldiers and a roster approach. But quote that it involves no true permadeath at Normal mode, this would be quite rough with a fixed roster of heroes, and no new (generic) recruits. But at Hardcore mode if an adventurer dies he isn't available anymore.

There's a fixed roster of 16 heroes plus two dogs you can met along an adventure. Each hero has specific characteristics including a level up specific tree.

The result is a nice diversity of heroes. In Hardcore modes all heroes are available at start. But in Normal mode at start only 6 heroes are unlocked, for others you need succeed various achievements. For my tastes, some of those achievements are too long to complete, it delays too much some heroes.

You start an adventure with 3 heroes but can increase party size to 4 along the adventure, and even change party composition. It pushes to use more the roster than to stick to 4 heroes.

[h1]VI - Conclusion[/h1]
The original design of the game was the Normal mode, but now it is a bit too easy, at least you can change option and increase number of enemies and make the game less easy.

But they added the Hardcore mode which is a quite good challenge and you can even increase the difficulty with options.

So I warmly advise this game because:
[list]
[*]It has fun short fast paced combats with a quite good diversity and fair depth.
[*]No timers, which is a pleasant change for a Tactical game.
[*]A fairly good diversity and depth for characters and roster building in context of a Tactical game.
[*]Light but fun global management, which only adds some light management aspects, a story layer, and some light decisions/gambling.
[*]A well designed roster system based on distinctive heroes, but don't except that their personality is much developed.
[*]Nice graphics, it's not that I like everything using a pixel art style, but in this game it is very nice and well done.
[*]A quite solid UI design, no noteworthy flaw, only few very minor details.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970561207', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1668370494}
review:
Repetitive, procedural generation is limited, not enough encounters, and generally boring.

Stick to curious expeditions.
developer_response:
Hi m007268,

deducting from the time you played our game it looks like you played it from A to Z.

I'm sorry to hear that you didn't like it in the end.

We have launched an update recently that tries to fix many of the issues you're mentioning: 

We added many new events, a host of new battle arenas, three different battle modes, and 18 distinct combat abilities, amongst others.

We also reworked our skilltrees so that levelling up should now feel more rewarding. A new item system and new unique artefacts were added as well.

Should you take a look at our post-upgrade player feedback, you will notice that it has improved substantially.

So if you were thinking of giving Pathway another shot, this might be a good time for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077180025', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2003, 'last_played': 1670868036}
review:
Crossover between XCOM/FTL/Indiana Jones
Pretty interesting game, cool concept, fun combat until you learn your way around.
Gets pretty repetitive after a while and feels like there are at least two more missions the devs could have ramped up for even harder difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055759960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1572579966}
review: If the combat wasn't so basic this game would be a nice little gem. But it's just so boring after a few fights. Nothing really changes.  very few types of enemy, very few types of combat abilities/options.
developer_response:
Hi Crash,

we‘ve spent the last 6 months adding new content to our combat system as well as reworking its general mechanics. 

Amongst others, we have added 18 new combat abilities to give the player more options on how to handle tactical problems. Battles now have three distinct combat modes; there are now many new battle arenas that breathe fresh air to the existing ones. 

Our armor system has seen a fundamental overhaul; the way consumables like bandages and grenades are used has also been reworked. These are just some of the changes.

Players tell us in their feedback that they like the changes that we implemented to our game. Take a look for yourself if you find the time – Pathway has evolved since you played it in july!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098643176', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1585996464}

developer_response:
Hi 看我的头大不,

we just published a major update that changes many elements in Pathway that didn‘t seem to like: 

First, Pathway is now available in chinese!

We reduced the enemy movement, they now can‘t circle you as easily as before.

We also added 18 new combat abilities, new unique artefacts, and many new story events.


嗨，看我的头大不，

首先，Pathway现在提供中文！

我们减少了敌人的行动，现在他们无法像以前那样容易地绕过您。

我们还增加了18种新的战斗能力，新的独特手工艺品以及许多新的故事事件。

author: {'steamid': '76561198046487463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1648312579}
review:
Only played for a couple of hours and find the game quite enjoyable.

What I expected to be a tactical RPG feels more like an electronic board game with some rouge-like features and nice pixel graphics and sound.

There's no permanent death (so far) and single scenario takes about 30-60 minutes to complete. Even though individual attempts are not connected a player may chose to effectively make them part of a "campaign" to develop a play style or party they find most enjoyable to use by focusing on character and skills unlocks and items collection.

A bit conerned about the number of chapters and enemies available as griding tends to become tedios with games shallow in content, so hopefully more is coming in the Summer update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062730378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1556744440}
review: Um jogo que mistura o melhor de Xcom em um cenário de mistério e aventura durante a segunda guerra mundial, uma grande homenagem aos filmes de Indiana Jones e outros desse gênero. Para quem gosta de jogos de estratégia o jogo é bem divertido. Os múltiplos eventos a cada movimento, tornam a experiência de cada mapa sempre algo diferente. Os personagens são envolventes e a história é bem divertida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368639635', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1599701738}
review:
게임 설명
로그라이크, 턴제 전투 (XCOM-Like), 전략 게임입니다.
근현대의 탐험가들이 나치에 대항하여 모험을 떠나는 내용을 그렸습니다.
리뷰
전투 방식에 감을 잘 못잡았을 경우 난이도가 꽤 있는 편입니다.
특히 일반적인 RPG를 하던 저의 경우 감을 잡기가 더 어려웠습니다.
타 RPG처럼 맞으면서 편하게 때리는게 아니라, 불편하더라도 피격을 덜 받는 움직임을 보여야 합니다.
그리고 게임패드 조작이 안 된다는 단점이 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007233194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1562521087}
review:
Pathway a de bonnes allures, une excellente inspiration d'Indiana Jones.

J'avais vu quelques reviews et j'ai attendu plusieurs mois que le jeu soit bien patché.
Je ne suis pas dérangé par les jeux difficiles, mais j'attendais que les dévs aient eu le temps de peaufiner.

Bonne musique, bon concept de départ, et un roguelike dans un univers 39-45 sur fond de tombeaux égyptiens...

Alors qu'est-ce qui cloche ?


Le bug si vous mettez full screen (pas de souris) et une police peu lisible, c'est gênant mais pas grave. Il y a bien pire.

C'est que quelque part pendant la conception du jeu, ou les tests, personne n'est arrivé à faire comprendre un tas de problèmes récurrents.


- Pas assez d'événements.
Rien qu'en deux aventures je suis tombé 50 % des fois sur les mêmes événements.
Qui étaient en plus très simples.

- Evénements à choix simples et linéaires.
Le jeu mise sur le combat.
Il n'existe pas vraiment de système de jeu sur les événements, à part que certains aventuriers ont des compétences permettant certains choix.

- Combat extrêmement répétitif.
On affronte dans la même aventure les mêmes ennemis à répétition (càd des soldats allemands et des chiens) et on se doute que d'autres adversaires passionnants viendront plus tard, mais au bout du 6ème combat contre les deux mêmes ennemis on voit déjà qu'on a joué un certain temps sans renouveler le plaisir.


- Combat simpliste, mal fichu.
C'est le vrai sujet qui me fait mettre pouce bas.

Déjà, les game designers doivent se poser une question sérieuse quand la capacité d'un mouvement fait le double de la portée de tir, et souvent de vue. Je vois plusieurs jeux comme ça et c'est un peu ridicule.

Le principe est d''avancer à l'aveugle ? de recevoir des ennemis qui avancent à l'aveugle ?
Et de pouvoir tout contourner ?

Evidemment ça s'inspire de XCOM remake, mais faut peaufiner pour que ca tourne

Moi, je ne cours pas de 25 mètres avant qu'on puisse me tirer dessus.
mais apparemment tout le monde oui.

Ensuite, le principe de bouger + tirer (et pas tirer + bouger d'ailleurs)
associé au fait qu'un ennemi demande souvent 2 coups pour être tué (sauf skill spécial),
et qu'il n'y ait absolument aucun tir de réaction, fait que :

- la détection est mal fichue
- le couvert sert très peu (pour un jeu de combat à armes à feu c'est dommage)
- les mouvements contournent tout ce que vous voulez dans le tour ; donc tout le monde se tire joyeusement à "point blank". Le 100 % chance to hit étant finalement l'esprit du jeu.


Je rappelle :
aucun effet de réaction, pas de zone de contrôle, rien, c'est du move and shoot.

C'est trop simpliste pour un jeu qui se base quasi exclusivement sur les combats.

J'aime assez le principe de Bravoure (les points de compétence) et les skills associés, mais ça manque encore d'affinage pour que ce soit intéressant / passionnant.

Pathway => point blank and repeat.

Je pense que les développeurs devraient revoir le système de combat, varier les événements, les adversaires, les compétences de réaction... ce sont des éléments "non lourds" en développement, mais je doute désormais que ça verra le jour.

Du coup, perdant espoir pour le titre, je mets un pouce bas.
Je surveillerai par contre les épisodes suivants, s'il y en a !

author: {'steamid': '76561198049224725', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1658781534}
review:
Visivamente molto bello, l'atmosfera è resa benissimo.
Le meccaniche sono curate, e una volta metabolizzate le azioni da svolgere all'interno del turno, fila tutto liscio.
I combattimenti sono leggermente limitati dal ristretto numero di nemici disponibili, e questo dopo un po' rende il tutto ripetitivo.
Si sente la mancanza di un qualcosa (boss, scenari un po' più particolari) alla chiusura delle varie missioni che ti ricompensi di tutta la fatica fatta per arrivare fino alla fine.

Trama e narrazione ok, nazi e zombie son sempre di moda.

Tutto sommato un buon gioco.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197985643226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2894, 'last_played': 1683302662}
review: At first, I thought the game was great, sorta like FTL just not as good. I did like the simple combat at first but after you play through a few of the campaigns, which all feel the same, the combat leaves something lacking; turns into a game of checkers. I did like my 30-40 hours of play and sorta worth it for my $15. Granted FTL was about the same price when I got it and I have like 200+ hours in it. Not sure if they updated it with more content or not might give it another shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972399252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1597199390}
review: Not sure why this game is getting so many negative reviews. This is a good game. It has great art, an engaging theme,  and serviceable turn-based combat, in an easy-to-consume play session that doesn't waste my time. Every game doesn't have to be 100's of hours deep, or as good as GOTYs like FTL. Take this game for what it is: it's own unique take on turn-based combat that evokes The Last Crusade, and just enjoy it for a few hours. It's worth the money.

review: Indiana Jones Meets XCOM - for fans of turn-based tactical gun-fights and choose-your-own adventures like Curious Explorers, this one comes highly recommended.  It reminds me of the room-selection parts of Slay the Spire and discovery reveals similar to the beginning few dozen turns of a Civ game... to have an elegant package and narrative that is slowly revealing itself in a compelling way is tomb-defiling good fun.  It's a Nazi-killin', character-levelin', zombie-explodin', rare-weapon-revealin', pulp-fest!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973619488', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6667, 'last_played': 1585409949}
review:
The game is in a holding pattern waiting for the developers summer '19 patch.  The expectation is 1 or more clearly outlined goals will be put into the game.  Right now most goals are more player driven vs game designed.  That said I've found considerable fun playing the game as follows:

[list]
[*] New Profile (restart from Adventure 1)
[*] Set your difficulty up
[*] Try to beat the final adventure (5 as of this writing) in the shortest time, with fewest restarts
[/list]

This style playing allows the economy (since you don't have stockpiles of cash), how you attack/use skills (which determines unlocked characters), and inventory management (what extras supplies) you keep/bring, and the luck of RNG items found all mater through the duration of the game.  In addition this allows you to see all 5 adventures instead of focusing on the final 2 (which offer the best rewards, and leads to burnout).

Tip: If you are struggling in the starting adventures, look through the character unlocks and work towards one that doesn't require a purchasable consumable (ex: Georgette).  Many of the locked characters are far superior (Baron is F tier).

Tip: Hunker (heavy armor) round 1 will expose many hidden enemies with relative safety in more cramped maps.   Several hunker characters can Repair (for the bravery point), to hunker again the 2nd round.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970628616', 'num_games_owned': 876, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1561734187}
review: Decent roguelike, a good mix between FTL and light tactics combat. The combat is very shallow though, the enemy types are extremel limited and the "deployment phase" is also near pointless. There are only 5 missions, and I feel after the first they're unnecessarily padded out to increase your chance of failure for the sake of 'roguelikeyness' but just winds up feeling tedious. Not worth it at $15, but if you can catch it on sale I'd say it would be a good addition to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176638902', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1582367907}
review: 幽浮玩家（铁人模式受难者）前来评测，这个游戏底子还是不错的，事实上在我的想法里改动还是很好改动的，老子就是要在吉普车上架枪（笑），好了说重点，幽浮玩家熟悉的射击命中率（+1），熟悉的掩体机制（+1），没有高地优势（-1），守株待兔玩家表示为什么的只有狙击手能监视射击（+-1），我以为会有重武器，等等你都木乃伊了，死灵法师了解一下（-1），优秀的BGM（+1），敌人种类没几个外加AI有点迷（-1），没有中文（-1）。综上所述 得出结论   我-1

author: {'steamid': '76561198001620434', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1555050337}
review:
Α game that ticks a lot of boxes, has some nice ideas (Make Your Own Indiana Jones Adventure, who wouldn't like that) but eventually falls victim to an unsatisfying combat system and lack of interaction with the map (you simply move from point to point, always mindful not to run out of fuel, because then it's game over, and finding fuel is entirely random, which is a rather odd design choice).

It looks lovely, especially if you're a fan of pixel art, and the unlockable characters can keep some semblance of interest of a while, but in the end just 5 adventures and the restricted maps make for a rather unsatisfying experience.

Wish I could recommend it, because it has some nice ideas, but there are far better "make your own adventure" games out already. So, with regret, this one is a thumbs down.
developer_response:
Hey Tobabot!

We released a significant update to Pathway a couple weeks ago, bringing a lot of changes to the game. We've put a lot of effort into rebalancing and improving combat. Tons of events have been reworked and we've also introduced more variety. (this blog post gives a good overview of all the changes: https://steamcommunity.com/games/546430/announcements/detail/1590259313195286293)

I think quite a few of your concerns may have been addressed with the update. Hopefully you get the chance to check it out again. Would be great to hear what you think!

Bach | Robotality

developer_response:
Hi Sunbowl,

I‘m sorry to hear that you didn‘t enjoy Pathway very much. 

I‘m actually not sure if you refunded the game, but I‘m writing you anyway - just in case that there is still any interest in Pathway from your part.

We published a major update some weeks ago, and current player reviews tell us that we‘re on the right track (take a look for yourself if you‘re interested).

These are but some of our changes: 

- We reworked our skilltrees to make the character progression more enjoyable.
- We added many new story events because we felt that our story needed more substance.
- We tweaked our enemy AI.
- We added 18 new combat abilites, 3 new combat modes and many new battle arenas to boost our combat experience.

Maybe if you take another look at Pathway, you will see for yourself if we succeeded in making it a better game.

developer_response:
Hey Avarice,

Wit the recent "Adventurers Wanted" update we've added a Tutorial to the game. The game's also received lots of additional content. If you launch the game, make sure to create a new profile on the main menu to catch the tutorial.

We also have a fantastic community on Discord/Steam Forums if you need some extra help. We're always in those two places answering questions should anything pop up!

Hopefully, you get the chance to check the game out again. We'd love to hear if the recent update has changed things for you!

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198056575983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2440, 'last_played': 1561997348}
review:
Lovely turn based strategy game, with a wonderful atmosphere. It sets the adventure, characters and music on what felt to me like "Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark" movie.

The game sends a two adventurers party and a jeep into a map full of locations. The player then choses their path until they reach that map's objective location and move along the adventure (and a new map). Locations on the map and their events are randomly generated. 

During the adventure the player must keep an eye on two things: Fuel and Ammo. If you run out of ammuniton you can still punch or use knifes (not all chars can use knifes), but if you run out of fuel that map is mostly over - every move you make on those desert maps on foot, will cost health to your party, and after 3 or 4 moves your adventurers are KO. If you run out of fuel, just "Give up" that run, and go back to the menu keeping all the items and achievements from the last adventure. Most likely you will have picked up better gear and make that second run easier.

Also, along those adventures, one may be able to pick up aditional members to your party - you can have a max of four people on one party. Each character has a different set of skills, perks and abilities, like the possibility to use some kinds of weapons, armour or items. Some also have the ability to unlock certain choices at specific locations/events. New characters are unlocked when the player reaches the required achievements.

As you complete the maps/stories and progress on the game, you are allowed to select the next "episode" on the story. Gradually you pick up new gear, level up your chars and become stronger - and so do your enemies.

After a while the game may get a bit repetitive, as fights don't change that much. The game kept me engaged while I was trying to get all playable characters and the required achievements. It also has some rare pieces of gear to collect, but then again your inventory space gets quite limited if you start collecting one of each. After I completed the game once (it has 5 episodes/stories at the moment), I'm unlikelly to play it again.

It was a very entertaining game which I recommend, specially if you are a fan of Indiana Jones - that music and the atmosphere won me over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344904307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1556472200}
review: There are computer games which are oriented to a certain topic which already existed in the cinema. The strategy RPG Pathway is Indiana Jones in great pixel graphics. It's the year 1930 and the Nazis are looking for mystical artifacts in Egypt, Syria and the desert. You have to kill zombies, Nazi soldiers and skeletons. The game is incredibly lovingly designed and the details and allusions are a must for every Desert adventure fan. Technically brilliantly elaborated, Robotality and Chucklefish have once again published a masterpiece of the game's history. Even though the cliché box was very deeply grasped, the Pathway is not bad at all. I love this game and start it again and again when I want to play something slower to enjoy a good story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085494392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1622071805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198319226670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1619284351}
review: Me arrepiento de no haberlo comprado antes. Precisamente fue por algunos comentarios que me hacían dudar, pero, finalmente, me lo he comprado y estoy más que contento! El pixel art me encanta, la dinámica del juego te atrapa y no dejas de viajar y luchar contra el ejército de los nazis y los zombies en un ambiente del desierto, además de escuchar la banda sonora a lo Indiana Jones. Recomiendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198188288659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4997, 'last_played': 1667075841}
review:
В целом, неплохо. Очень подходит в качестве казуальной развлекалки, когда и фильм смотришь, и поигрываешь на ноуте. 

Но очень сильно не хватает контента. Всего 5 (!) миссий? Серьезно? Никакой глобальной сюжетной линии... 

Реиграбельность заключается только в открытии всех персонажей и их прокачке, но зачем это нужно - не понятно. Мотивации особой нет.

P.S> У меня самая боевая комбинация - дробовок+нож и снайпер (+нож/граната) - убойный дуэт.

Если подъедет нормальный DLC, то игра может вырасти в нечто большее!

author: {'steamid': '76561198326653891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1618367585}

author: {'steamid': '76561198390722812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4833, 'last_played': 1556305557}
review:
Идея игры классная, покупал по полной стоимости и остался разочарован:

1. Игра проходится очень быстро.
2. Контента нет. Просто однообразные действия (что на первой миссии, что на последней).
3. Игра полна багов....потерял 2 легендарных предмета, которые так тщательно выбивал - от того не хочет ее проходит повторно или лутать уже старые локации.

Рекомендую игру только с ОГРОМНОЙ скидкой! А так очень дорого для такой пустой игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000764629', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1560253890}
review:
Absolute gem of a game. 
It's as addictive as it is satisfying, challenging, adorable, hilarious, quirky and most importantly - fun! 
Indiana Jones theme meets Stardew Valley graphical style. While it does feel like the gameplay possibly could have been improved further before release, I was more than happy to pay the $22 asking price. I'm over 30 hours in and still enjoying being stuck on the last level. Ignore the bad reviews - while they offer some valid points, this game is still an absolute winner and deserves a higher user rating. Easily at least an 8/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969669612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3369, 'last_played': 1603096443}
review:
Perfect mix of:

- The Indiana Jones LucasArts adventure games from the 90s.
- Squad/turn-based RPG/strategy games from the 90s, most especially Jagged Alliance.
- Rogue-like games with randomly generated maps, most especially the 90s classic Nethack.

All this beautifully orchestrated together into an irresistibly charming (and often very challenging!) game that also  incorporates features that wouldn't be possible in the 90s, such as dynamic lighting and a rich, orchestrated soundtrack (which again, consciously call out John Williams' Indiana Jones scores).

Read more: https://nwn.blogs.com/nwn/2019/05/pathway-turn-based-rpg-indiana-jones.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198196908278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1562695654}
review: Miła taktyczna turówka + elementy RPG wraz z pixelową oprawą cieszą oko. Przyjemny zamulacz :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198840155886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4444, 'last_played': 1630192934}
review:
This game was charming and entertaining from the start and even though at first it was somewhat buggy, the devs kept providing us with patches and fixes to address such things. 
They also took into account people's requests and added new helpful features to make this game even better. 
It would be fun to have even more languages available but I understand that can take a while to do so I don't mind it.
As a fan of turn based combat and pixel games this felt like a must buy despite me not buying many games to begin with, I haven't once regretted it and find myself wanting to replay old campaigns just for the heck of it. 

Thanks to everyone who was a part of making this gem of a game, I'm in love with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067957747', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1559270267}
review:
[h1]TL;DR: I bought [b]Pathway[/b] after watching ~1 hour of reviews, knowing it held a mixed review status, and still wanting to take a risk on a smaller development studio; however, simply put--it is not fun.[b]I will be requesting a refund.[/b][/h1]

Or at least the first half hour was not fun. My favorite indie video game of all time is [b]FTL: Faster Than Light[/b] and I love turn-based strategy RPGs (and one of my first purchases on Steam was [b]Robotality's[/b] prequel game [b]Halfway[/b]); I was happy the two designs were married into the hybrid that is [b]Pathway[/b]. Unfortunately, my happiness ends there. I was underwhelmed by the lack of combat depth, the awkward and unnecessary animations and pauses, the too long text multi-dialogs for random events, and the funky balance between systems--where some systems were quick whereas other systems were too too (yes, 2 too...s) in depth.

This makes me sad. I can tell the sheer volume of work put into the design of said systems. Sadly, they are all just one-off or two-off from a flush and overall well-design video game. Moreso, all the beautiful pixel art and animations will not be appreciated to the extent they should be--thanks to gamers not enjoying the game design.

Best of luck with your next game, [b]Robotality[/b]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036409411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1572314979}
review:
First review!

I usually don't pick up games that have mixed reviews but I bought this one up because I really like everything that Chucklefish publishes. They have good taste and I think their trust in Robotality isn't misplaced. 

The game has an incredible art style and is super fun the play. Time is short for me so I'm all for jumping in and playing a quick game. Pathway is something that does that for me. I'm not forced to put in hours upon hours, but if I want, I can stick around and put in a full day's worth of gameplay. I played the initial release, and while it did have some quality of life issues, the updates are squashing those issues left and right. The bigger updates that are on the horizon should expand this game quite a bit as well. 

If you're on the fence, I say give this game a try. It's worth the $16. You can always get a refund in the end if you don't like it. But don't let the mixed reviews sour your perception of this game. It's really well made, has loads of character and is super fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994470166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1586098906}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978613774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1572019128}
review: I really want to like this game based on its setting, but the fact is that the combat is boring, simplistic, and one of the main features of this game.
developer_response:
Hi Gabeed, 

we added many new features to Pathway with our recent update 1.1. 

A lot of them have a direct impact on how battles work, e.g. a host of new character abilities, three different combat modes, a rework of our armor system, or the way we now handle consumables like bandages and grenades.

We‘d be interested to hear your opinion! So if you want to give our game another go, this would be a good opportunity!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993770690', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1555012615}
review: Refunded after an admittedly short playtime due to how clunky and dissatisfying combat is. It's not a fun strategy game by any means; with only 2 characters playable at once it never felt like I could work out any interesting squad strategies. While the art in it is nice, the UI is clunky and at times hard to parse, and most animations are so stiff that they look completely mismatched with the otherwise pretty looking environments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017939919', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1692745651}
review:
I'd really love to give this game a positive review, but currently the combat is so shallow and repetitive, it's too boring.
Will gladly change it to positive if some patch fixes the situation.
developer_response:
Hi acmd,

we listened attentively to player feedback like yours and worked hard to improve the way how combat feels in Pathway. 

Now, with update 1.1 out, we have added many new features to our game: three different combat modes, many new combat arenas, 18 new combat abilities, and a new item system, amongst others.

Our aim was to make sure battles feel more engaging and, overall, more fun. Maybe you‘d like to take another look at Pathway sometime and tell us your opinion?
