author: {'steamid': '76561198228026084', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1620541476}
review:
This game is fantastic. The stories are intriguing and even if you have to replay maps, there is so much potential variation that it's never the same game. The characters are all unique and switching them up gives you different options and keeps you on your toes. The music is really enjoyable and the controls and playing are fairly simply, but you do have to think through your strategies and attack plan. Also, the artwork is very appealing to look at. 

It also has an Indiana Jones feel to it which is a plus in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1558935166}
review:
Je ne trouve rien de bien précis à repprocher à Pathway, juste qu'à être moyen en tout il n'est notable en rien. En fait il me donne envie de réinstaller le beaucoup plus typé Renowned Explorers:International Society.

Rien à voir avec le visuel pixel ou le combat pas très sophistiqué, j'avais adoré Halfway de la même équipe. C'est juste que guider des archéologues qui butent des nazis n'a rien de bien excitant quand il n'y a ni humour, ni délire, ni mystère, ni mécanique atypique. Bon, ce n'est pas que ça se prenne très au sérieux mais, perso, je n'y trouve ni le fun ni le stress que j'espère dans ce type de jeu et le contexte n'éveille pas ma curiosité comme avait su le faire Halfway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286333768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1603547211}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329160355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1558755335}
review:
TL:DR (2/5) (yes/no isn't enough for me XD) - This game could have been good, if the "bar to entry" weren't so high... it seems to take a lot of effort to get into it. It seems to ask the player to "git gud" while also saying "you cant progress until you have grinded early levels and made your characters super strong, so mindlessly grind without any strategic improvement"

The things I think it needed to be a great game:

 - A story driven tutorial. Some way to introduce you to the mechanics of the game, while playing the game (not just reading text)
 - A more strategic combat. Combat felt like a face-roll. There was very little advantage to trying to abuse a strategic-defensive position (matter of fact you got punished for trying) even though there were mechanics that seemed to incentivise it (bonus dodge when behind a wall)



This game felt pretty difficult to get into. I respect the whole "no tutorial, throw you right into the action" mindset. But it seemed to go a little far. No introduction, no incremental additions of game-play mechanics, no intro scene for story or anything at all, just into the action. From a game design stand-point ... I get it, as a dev that's a hard one to get right, people will complain if you "hold their hand" too much and here I am complaining that you didn't "hold my hand" enough..... its a fine line. A very forgivable offence.

A little less forgivable: the strategy element of this game seems to be pretty knowledge heavy. which is fine in and of itself... but there was no way (at least not that i could find) to check the stats of your enemies (other than hp and armour).... which means you would need to memorize them in order to figure out whats actually going to happen. This game seems to position itself as a strategy-heavy tactics game, but had no other way to acquire the knowledge base required other than extensive wiki-searching, or pouring through the intimidating wall of text that is this games - quote on quote - "tutorial" or "guide". 

On one hand it threw you into the game with no preparation... On the other hand it gave you a dry textbook of preparation... I don't know how to react to this. Simply put: I read the first couple tabs in the "codex" but after seeing that there was the equivalent of about 50 pages worth of tabs to read, i didnt bother. I would say that was my fault, but similar games introduce you to things over time so that you never have to read more than a page or so of mechanics at a time, and allow players to incrementally improve their understanding of the game. This felt like all or nothing (and i suppose i chose nothing)

All in all, this game felt like it was asking 2 (sort-of incompatible) things of me simultaneously:
1. play the first mission over and over to get better item slowly so I could eventually beat it, by brute forcing the level with superior items
2. figure out the strategic significance of the various skills, attributes, weapons, so that I could progress through the game. 

The funny thing: I really enjoy strategy heavy games, AND I really enjoy games that require a lot of grinding. But I shouldn't be asked to do both at once, I never realized how much I would hate to be asked to do both at once. You are pulling the gamer in two VERY different directions. 

I feel like the devs of this game didn't have blind playtesters. When you playtest your own game you know EVERYTHING, and that knowledge might make you blind to what someone without any knowledge will see when they play your game. I get the impression that the devs of this game playtested it themselves, and never understood what the game felt like blind. It left me with a "wtf am I suppose to do???" feeling

At this point I think I am rambling on a little, so I'll end it here.

Overall: 2/5
This game has potential, and I could see myself enjoying it if I put in the effort... It just gave me no reason to put in the effort when I could just go play another game that I knew I enjoyed. For me, it was a waste of ~$20. I wouldn't recommend to anyone, even if this game is right up their alley. There are better games that are basically the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000360570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1557086194}
review: Les combats manquent franchement d'intérêt. La principale difficulté du jeu c'est l'essence, qui vient aléatoirement. Et contrairement à un FTL où une panne d'essence peut être compensée, ici elle équivaut quasiment à un game over (vos personnages vont perdre de la vie à chaque déplacement une fois que vous n'aurez plus d'essence, et ça descend très vite). Il existe une option pour rendre l'essence moins problématique (en augmentant le stock de départ avec lequel on commence la mission), mais bon c'est quand même dommage d'en arriver là, le jeu devrait de base proposer assez d'essence pour au moins faire le chemin en ligne droite! Les événements sur la carte sont peu nombreux, on en a vite fait le tour, et la construction procédurale des cartes est totalement anarchique. On se retrouve souvent avec des magasins dans des impasses tellement longues que ça ne vaut pas le détour. Le jeu n'est pas totalement horrible, mais je n'ai aucune envie de le terminer...

author: {'steamid': '76561198040783895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1573530842}
review:
PATHWAY strives to be an Indiana Jones pixel-roguelike-tactics-adventure game, and the first few hours are exactly this. But the majority of your time will be tedious, boring, and lackluster.

Pros: 
1. First few adventures are fun, fast and exciting
2. Gorgeous pixel art, beautiful locales, awesome score
3. Excellent cast of characters
4. Adequately channels some of that Indiana Jones goodness

Cons:
1. Shallow management mechanics; not enough character customization
2. Combat becomes tedious and slow
3. Exploration can be too linear and random
4. Not enough story to tie everything together


Check out my full review here!

https://youtu.be/LG3NImIKRpw
developer_response:
Hi Barunnen,

we spent the last six months improving our game. 

Now that we‘ve finished our update 1.1 I can tell you that we have added 18 new special character actions, thereby completely reworking the skilltrees to enhance character custumization and overall progression. We now have three different combat modes and many new combat arenas. There also is an option to speed up enemy movement...

In addition to that, we have created many new story events and added regional flavor events because we felt that the storytelling aspect of the game just needed more substance. 

We‘d be very interested to hear from you if our latest additions made an overall change to Pathway!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982615575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1555204560}
review:
I'm giving this one a tentative thumbs up, thanks to the low price point and the competent execution of a simple concept.  This review is 100% contingent on the idea that you are paying less than ten bux for this game.

I like the charming Indiana Jones vibe and I like the attempt at ripping off FTL and combining it with a squad tactics game, and overall the game works and is engaging to play through once.  But that's about it.

Big issues:
-Persistent unlocks/progression are insanely stupid in a game like this.  Character XP/equipment absolutely should not be persistent through every run.
-Tactical combat just isn't that deep or interesting.
-The cultist enemies are really boring to fight, and not only that, but a bunch of brainless zombies who can spit phlegm somehow being more dangerous ranged combatants than guys armed with machine guns.
-A bunch of the characters just plain suck.

Overall, would buy on sale / 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101233182', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1678277360}
review:
Pathway is as if Indiana Jones, a game producer and a group of friends who enjoy playing tabletop games joined all together and decided to build a game.

Pathway is a turn base RPG set in the 1930s, in the great desert between the Palestinian zone and Turkey. The objective of the player is to confront Nazi troops and zombies. It seems that Nazi troops went down previously unexplored paths and brought the dead back to life in the form of zombies. In fact, something that had already been aborted by various titles (Achtung cthulhu tactics), however now presented in a slightly different environment.

After choosing his team and setting (mission), the player is taken to the dotted and multipath map. It gives a bit of the idea of ​​being a board game where you need to use / waste gasoline to move around the map.

At some of these points on the map, or "houses", it is indicated what will come up, a combat, a resting place, a shop or a "special" mystery house. Most of the time, each house triggers a random story or event, and sometimes choices have to be made. These choices may have to do with a specific perk of one of the characters on the team (up to 4 individuals), or simply fighting or fleeing the venue. Finally, completely different events between them that present a wide range of interactions.

Unfortunately, each character's combat and skill tree are too restrictive to make it fun for a long time.

Combat goes a long way to hiding behind objects, be they walls, stones, cars. All of them with different levels of protection. Each character has the ability to use different weapons, but can only be maintained with weapons of this type. If the shotguns perk is assigned this character can only use shotguns. It is possible, however, to have a secondary weapon like a knife or even grenades.

During combat, each team member can only perform two actions, move, fire, reload, heal, or throw grenade. It is possible for each character to perform a special action, depending somewhat on the weapon they have available for that purpose, and in some cases the perks they have. An example of this is the possibility of using a medkit in combat, a double shot with the pistol or as already mentioned, a grenade. Unfortunately this is the depth level in terms of combat mechanics. Sometimes it is possible to find some differences in the distance that can be attacked, such as the difference between a sniper and a shotgun. Since there is no control zone or attack opportunities it is perfectly possible for the player to press the enemy and run towards him and use the melee attack, which in most cases is the most effective and effective attack. Differs more damage.

Regarding the skill tree it is not possible for the player to change anything, just to evolve the character, and then unlock the other branches of the tree.
It is extremely rewarding to watch short action movies translated into lines of text and images with the touch of pixel art. This is all related to the choices each player makes at certain moments in the story's outcome. However, events sometimes repeat, which leads the player at a later stage in history to skip these lines of text throughout the story and wishing the combat sections could finish faster.

Pathway's pixel artstyle gives a great level of charm, even to players who aren't very interested in this type of graphics. The music goes very well with the mechanics and atmosphere of this title. Overall it is a very successful game but it becomes repetitive and can be a bit frustrating as it has elements like the rogue like not to lose the characters forever but if the player has the misfortune of losing all characters, is forced to return to the beginning of the expedition.

Check more recommendations from Exile [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8004642/] here! [/url]

review:
Read my full review below:
http://indiannoob.in/noobreview/pathway-review-pc-indiana-jones-one-turn-at-a-time/

Pathway is a game with a lot of missed opportunities. While the first few hours are really good, the Repetitiveness and shallowness of the gameplay soon set in. Newcomers to tactical RPGs might have a good time with Pathway but veterans of the genre are better off setting their sights on something else for the time being or until it receives a major overhaul. That being said, the game is pretty cheap so it all depends what you're looking for.  
Argh Steam needs a semi-thumbs up at this point

+ Excellent art style and setting
+ A wide variety of characters to unlock and play as
+ Welcoming to genre newcomers

- Serious balancing issues
- Combat is too simplistic
- Repetitive gameplay loop

review: Brilliant setting and atmosphere, but repetitive combat. I usually like turn based combat and unlock system as in Pathway, but this just bored me in couple of hours. What's the point in unlocking new characters if you get just a new char that can move and shoot or shoot and move. Trivialities like +1 agility or shotgun instead of assault rifle feels just bland. Halfway had so much better combat system with imaginative special powers and endless combinations of different team compositions.
developer_response:
Hi Hezehoo,

many people felt that Pathway‘s character progression wasn‘t satisfying enough, so we gave it a general overhaul: now each character starts with a unique special ability like sucker punch or headshot, providing each character with a signature move. 

Skilltrees now unlock further special abilities, resulting in individual special ability combinations for each maxxed out character. Combined with our new combat modes and a new variety of added battle arenas, we think that the combat in Pathway has improved substantially. 

Just take a look for yourself and tell us if you like the direction that we‘re going!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970348119', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3740, 'last_played': 1557065474}
review:
Pathway is a game featuring turn-based tactics, node-based overland travel and a semblance of an RPG-like progression system in which you manage an ensemble of characters with different traits. On the surface, from its trailer to the screenshots, Pathway looks very good and might entice fans of XCOM or those who are drawn to the pixel art aesthetic. I have played it for some time and I've enjoyed it, but there are some points I want to highlight that may be a deal-breaker.

As many have pointed out, this game is very light on its combat system compared to other turn-based tactics games like XCOM, Into the Breach or Wargroove. It has the same language, but some of the depth is missing to a degree. The variety of enemies is also kind of low. You either fight the Nazis or Cultists with Zombies. My main gripe with the combat system is the lack of clarity and sometimes glitchy behaviour. The art style obscures a lot of information, such that enemies or paths might be hidden by columns or structures. With no option to see through such features, it becomes hard to make an informed decision during a turn. I wish they spent more time polishing this kind of thing. The confirm move is a must, but there should also be a possibility to see where your arc of fire goes before having committed to a move. This comes back to the art style's influence on the gameplay. There have been several turns I've wasted due to my characters taking cover in a spot where they cannot fire at the enemies. The combat system also leaves a lot to be desired, ranging from terrain destructability to interaction with elements such as doors or vehicles. Usually combat only lasts a few turns anyway, so maybe they did not prioritize this part? Which is odd, because the rest of the game is just menu-clicking.

The adventure part of the game is essentially travelling along a node-graph, where each edge you travel along costs 1 fuel. Upon visiting a node, you may end up in combat or get dragged into a light dialogue tree. Nothing exciting happens here, really. The adventure starts up with a narrated intro, but the narrative aspects of the events in the game seem to have little cohesion and are probably randomly placed on the map. You don't really make that many significant decisions in this mode. You can broadly choose to take one of two directions towards the 'goal' node, and maybe decide to visit a node that holds  market, some 'special' event or a place to rest. With this aspect of the game being so half baked, it makes me wonder what they prioritized. The combat is pretty simple, as is the adventuring section. 

Finally there is the character ensemble, which is a list of different characters, many of which you can either unlock or discover through play. Each of these have level trees with traits you can pick at each level, similar to XCOM's system. What I dislike about this levelling system is that you do not really get any interesting options. You can pick simple stat boost, occasionally the ability to use a new class of items (i.e. enabling the use of assault rifles). In comparison to XCOM, where you get very distinctive special abilities, this seems rather bland. There is an itemization aspect to the game as well, where you can find rare, epic and legendary items and an inventory that is common to all the characters (also persistent throughout the game). Through play, you can increasingly optimize your characters by finding better weapons and armor, which is fun. 

While I written up a bunch of criticism, I also enjoyed this game a lot. The casual-level difficulty of this game makes it enjoyable to keep the mind busy while watching youtube or netflix. It's a relaxed game, and great to randomly put 30 minutes into. You can sit down and enjoy this game without squeezing and straining your brain, which is a great entertainment-plus compared to the other games I mentioned here. If the developers are going to put in more content, then that's good news for me, because I think I'll start this up every now and then just to run through an adventure to see if I can get a epic knife or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046144500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1650160029}
review:
TL;DR: decent game that does decent at everything it tries to do, but comes out kinda flat. A decent romp for genre lovers that is riddled with too many bugs and crashes to be worth it. 

I enjoyed this game. I really like their choice of setting, I think they chose their mechanics well in how they mesh together. 

It's a solid game. But it gets repetitive. Enemy variety is a big problem, for one thing. They introduce more enemy types as you go on, and there's actually a decent few, but you interact with most of them in exactly the same ways. Because of this it doesn't feel like there's very much variety. While there are a good number of characters, a lot of them play similarly and they all lack variety when it comes to in-battle choices. It doesn't feel like it brings much new to the tactics genre besides, everything it wants to do FTL and X-Com have already done better. 

The only thing it really adds to the table is a blessing and a curse: it's low stress. It's not deep. It can be boring. But in that, it can also be quietly satisfying if you're just a fan of the genre. Personally, because of that I enjoy the game. 

But why am i thumbs downing? Crashes and bugs aplenty my friend. They've recently updated the game and now when I start my old adventure the game just crashes. At least I got to the battle first, last time! And this isn't the first time I've been locked out of an adventure because of constant crashing. As far as I'm concerned, releasing a game that doesn't work is fraud. It's inexcusable this is allowed to be a norm. Fix your game, then release it. Not the other way around.
 
I'd urge you to avoid this game on principle. But honestly, you're not missing all that much. 
This game is recommended only to die-hard tactics genre fans who need a fix.
developer_response:
Hi there,

Thanks for your feedback - it's noted. We're actively working on addressing some of the issues you've brought up.

I wanted to specifically address the crash you're experiencing as I think this is something we can fix for you. In general we do extensive testing on everything, but sometimes we miss things and that sucks. I can totally understand your frustration and as a developer there's nothing more frustrating than realizing we missed something. However, we are totally committed to fixing these issues.

Unless I'm mistaken I think the problem you're experiencing has already been fixed in the latest patch. When we released 1.0.9 there was indeed an issue that caused a crash for some people when finishing a combat. We fixed that issue quickly in the first 24 hours after the update. If the game still crashes for you on the latest build, I'd love to take a look at your save and see what causes the issue. If that's the case, could you send us an email at hello@robotality.com?

Thanks again!
Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198076734994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2923, 'last_played': 1606076227}
review:
Milé dědi!
Inu, vrací se nám čím dále víc staré žánry a vývojáři z Robotality na to kápli, že hráčská základna o takové tituly stojí.
NEKOUKEJTE na zdejší záporné recenze - proč?!
V první řadě tahle hra, hledá hráče, který umí číst, pakliže nezvládáte víc, než je chat na FB nebo SMS, rozhodně to není hra pro vás.Tahle hra konečně pracuje s postavami v duchu starých RPG (jako UFO, Fallout 1,2, v jistých věcech i Commandos), takže výběrem jedné možnosti si zarazíte druhou. Je potřeba mít vyvážený tým (co se týká keců u nevyváženosti zbraní či prostředí - upgrade your IQ). Ti kteří hráli někdy X-com (94-5) nemají problém s formou útoků a protivníkem. "Zambící jsou příliš blízko mne" - to je jak z první třídy, když žalujete soudružce učitelce!
Ke hře samotné - rozhodně solidních 30 hodin zábavy a taktizování, která skvadra s jakou výbavou a perky bude účinná!
pro:
Taktické Turn base RPG s klasickou zápletkou ve stylu Indiho Jonse
Spousta charakterů, které se dají rozvíjet a jejich perky mají nemalý vliv na postup po mapě
Parádní množství kombinací, způsobu jak postupovat po mapě, ale i v bitvě
Úžasná pixel-art grafika
Vtipné eastereggs

Proti:
čekám že se dostaví DLC s dobrodružstvím v Indočíně (ale zatím není známo kdy)
čekal bych v posledních (pokud tedy jsou poslední?!) dobrodružstvích mapu o třech rozlohách

Pro mě 90%, pokud bude s DLC dobrodružstvím 95%
Gratulace týmu Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198064617333', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1578849496}
review:
도트에 미쳐서 워그루브와 패스웨이를 묻지도 않고 구매했는데 둘다 뭔가 하나씩 핀트가 빠진 느낌이 크다.
서양의 니혼이치같이 B급냄새의 느낌이 풀풀난다. 스타바운드가 그나마 성공적인 게임이라면 나머지는 흥미를 느낄만한 핵심적인 요소가 하나 둘 씩 빠져있다.  워그루브는 핵심 인물수의 부재와 레벨링이 없어 캐릭에 대한 애정이 없고 그냥 돈되면 뽑아서 들이박는 소모품 정도의 느낌, 패스웨이는 재미없는 전투. 

깊이가 없으면 가벼우면서 중독성이라도있는 게임을 바랐건만 이건 이도 저도 아닌게임이 됐다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1556975652}
review:
Il mio rapporto di amore/odio con i roguelite (roguelike e affini) è qualcosa con cui devo avere a che fare ogni volta che qualche sviluppatore riesce a catturare la mia attenzione. Non sono ancora certo del perché si sia diffusa questa tendenza masochista, ma evidentemente ci piace soffrire, pur in un momento dedicato al "gioco" e al divertimento. Ma proprio a causa di questa tremenda situazione in cui l'obiettivo è farci provare piacere solo per farci inalberare subito dopo, non è facile riuscire a trovare quella perfetta alchimia che rende un roguelite di successo tale. Ecco perché gli amici di Robotality, probabilmente, avrebbero dovuto fermarsi al loro grande primo successo, Halfway.
Pensato per essere un'alternativa simpatica agli strategici a turni (in pieno filone XCOM), Halfway aveva dalla sua una storia interessante, con personaggi molto caratterizzati e dalle abilità piuttosto diverse. Un prodotto semplice, limitato forse, ma che raggiungeva perfettamente l'obiettivo. Al contrario, con Pathway sembra quasi che il team tedesco abbia fatto il passo più lungo della gamba, non prima di creare un'aura di curiosità mettendo in mezzo un'ambientazione à la Indiana Jones tra deserti e nazisti, proceduralità e un team di eroi da sbloccare durante le nostre avventure.

L'incipit è piuttosto semplice: siamo una compagnia di avventurieri disposti a tutto per fermare i malvagi nazisti. Armati quindi di fucili, pistole, coltelli e kit di sopravvivenza, dovremo avventurarci per i tantissimi luoghi a disposizione nei cinque livelli del gioco, i quali ci presenteranno in maniera del tutto random determinati eventi. Durante questi, ci verrà richiesto di scegliere un approccio, o magari tentare delle azioni particolari che si sbloccheranno grazie ai talenti del nostro team: ognuna di queste decisioni potrebbe portare a risultati inaspettati, positivi o negativi. Questo almeno in potenza, perché durante la prova non solo mi è capitato di rivivere esattamente lo stesso tipo di evento più volte (sia come situazione sia come risoluzione), ma mi è capitato sia prendendo strade diverse nella stessa missione, sia in missioni totalmente nuove. Certo, in alcuni casi vi capiteranno quei rarissimi eventi unici (spesso collegati ad achievement) in grado di risanare il vostro senso di curiosità, ma in altri casi la ripetizione di questi sarà inevitabile.

Alla stessa maniera, ogni missione sarà gestita da una più totale casualità di fattori, prime fa tutte le materie prime per giungere alla fine (benzina e munizioni). Niente di nuovo sul fronte roguelite, per carità, ma vi assicuro che il ritrovarsi senza benzina a poche caselle dalla fine perché NESSUNO dei luoghi possibili prevedeva di trovarne non è piacevole. Ecco quindi il secondo grande difetto di Pathway: la randomicità dei suoi elementi rende l'esperienza fin troppo casuale, generando spesso e volentieri frustrazione per un bilanciamento inesistente, che si tratti di meccaniche di base (come il movimento) o quelle più complesse degli scontri. Questi sono chiaramente ben più semplificati rispetto a strategici a turni di un certo calibro, offrendo un paio di armi e un sistema di coperture piuttosto interessante (evitando situazioni ridicole viste nei mediocri Phantom Doctrine o Mutant Year Zero), che però trasformano il risultato finale in qualcosa di estremamente piatto e, manco a dirlo, monotono. Benché i vostri eroi siano specializzati in un'arma rispetto a un'altra, o nella cura, a parte l'ovvia differenza di portata delle armi, difficilmente vi troverete ad architettare attacchi e movimenti particolari; anzi, a dirla tutta i miei team erano basati unicamente sull'uso del coltello, micidiale e risolutivo in quasi ogni occasione.

Anche gli alberi abilità dei vostri comprimari non brillano per profondità, donando dei bonus passivi o il poter usare una nuova arma rispetto a quelle iniziali. Peccato che i bonus ottenuti non siano così vantaggiosi (e rimango dell'idea che il coltello sia l'arma definitiva), nonostante l'interessante sistema di loot implementato. Troveremo armi e oggetti di qualità migliore — contraddistinti dall'immancabile alone colorato — da sostituire in missione e al campo base prima di ogni partenza, ma tra l'inventario estremamente limitato e la scarsità di oggetti di qualità a disposizione, capite bene che "variare" l'evoluzione di un personaggio diventa sia inutile che pericolosa. Anche perché poi questi sono ben settorializzati, quindi un approccio generalista renderebbe tutti versatili ma non eccelsi.

Un netto passo indietro rispetto ad Halfway, senza ombra di dubbio. E fa male dirlo, anche perché Pathway è decisamente curato sotto l'aspetto artistico, con una pixel art che non disturba e una colonna sonora magistrale. Eppure gli amiconi di Robotality si sono un po' persi nel loro voler strafare, che ho sicuramente apprezzato, ma che purtroppo non riesce a reggere il confronto con altri esponenti del genere. Non si tratta certo di un gioco brutto, ma di uno pensato male, che potrebbe soddisfare i palati più estremisti dei roguelite, o chi invece voglia lanciarsi all'avventura come un moderno Indy pur sapendo che dovrà affidarsi al caso per la riuscita delle missioni. L'impianto è chiaramente pensato per un'alta rigiocabilità, peccato per la somma delle parti che non funzioni. Nel caso vogliate però tentare la sorte (e divertirvi in ogni caso), potete trovare Pathway su Steam a 14 euro in inglese (tedesco e francese).

Mi sono avventurato tra dune, laboratori segreti e piramidi grazie a un codice gentilmente offerto dagli sviluppatori.

7

author: {'steamid': '76561198014963564', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1617675013}
review:
11-16-19 Update -- Pathway is much, much better with the difficulty sliders for each adventure. Very much appreciated.

Although I had some initial problems, Robotality is very responsive, hard at work at fixing issues with Pathway. I was a huge fan of Halfway, and disappointed in the different type of game that Pathway turned out to be. 

Review still in progress! I am going through the recent changes to the game.
developer_response:
Hi!

Finding the right balance in difficulty is a very tricky process and people's preferences vary wildly. Seems like we missed the mark for you :( We're still actively tweaking the game and balancing will improve.

In the meantime I just wanted to point out that the game does have a difficulty slider you can use to make the experience more casual. When you select your adventure there are 3 little sliders below the description that allow you to reduce the strength of the enemies as well as give you additional resource boosts. Maybe this will do the trick for you and make the game more fun!

Appreciate your feedback.

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561197971269084', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1588959638}
review:
I don't know how, but this is another example, where a developer managed it ot make a (more or less) sequel worse then the original game.

In this case the predecessor Halfway was a really good turn based squad strategy game, that had a good story and gameplay mechanics. The new title Pathway is still a nice game and I enjoy it, but i lacks something, that make the original good.
One thing is the weak story. The five adventures you can play right now only progress the story at the end of each map. On the map itself you only face random missions, that are either play out by random luck or by combat. The devs promote the game with the high number of random missions, but 100 times more or less the same is not fun.

So why do I still recommend the game:
I like the game mechanic, even if it is dumbed down in comparisson to its predecessor. Also the grind for better weapons keeps me going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107412985', 'num_games_owned': 1979, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1559475273}
review:
[h1]《行动通路》 (Pathway) 评测：开吉普，寻宝藏，打纳粹[/h1]
[i]* 感谢SteamCN提供游戏评测机会
* 本评测在SteamCN社区的图文链接：https://steamcn.com/t485288-1-1[/i]

  
[h1]总评[/h1]
一款16bit艳丽像素风的回合制冒险游戏，玩家扮演二战中的特别行动小队，驾吉普车在北非和中东古迹中冒险，探求宝藏，消灭纳粹和丧尸，挫败纳粹的阴谋。
Roguelike探险过程形似FTL，战斗过程形似2D版X-COM，包含大量养成和成就元素。无中文，但必读的英文内容有限。当前版本的可探险剧本偏少，连续战斗有重复感，平衡性需微调。建议回合制策略爱好者先加愿望单一波，观望制作方后续更新和折扣情况。


[h1]完全政治正确的背景设定[/h1]
地中海的新月地带，尼罗河冲积平原，美索不达米亚……这些早期人类文明的发祥地，孕育了辉煌的古代文明。

众所周知，纳粹在二战中进行过各种疯狂实验，从V2火箭到载人飞碟，从喜马拉雅的雪人到人种纯化，随着第三帝国的覆灭都一齐被扫进了历史的故纸堆。
  
或许是历史带给了制作者足够的灵感，本作有着自洽的世界观。疯狂的纳粹想要勾结狂热的邪教徒，培育丧尸，且看我们夺宝奇兵式的主角小队答不答应！

在游戏中，玩家可以心安理得地打纳粹、虐丧尸，但玩家想杀狗狗不行！游戏甚至有专门的屏蔽开关，启用后将不再显示玩家击杀纳粹战犬单位的动作和流血动画。为了政治正确，开发者也是够拚命的。


[h1]形似FTL的Roguelike探险[/h1]
游戏当前版本预置了5个难度不一的独立剧本，玩家可逐步解锁共16位队员，遴选其中两位，踏上探险征程。单次探险中，至多还会有两位队员随事件加入队伍，组成四人小队。

游戏内置大量可解锁元素，典型例子包括“以XX特定武器击杀XX名敌人”等等，也允许玩家反复刷各独立剧本，但老实讲，有重复体力活的嫌疑。
  
玩家的主要交通工具是吉普车，在地图上每次可向相邻方向移动一步，同时允许玩家走回头路，且没有FTL式的严厉惩罚机制，仅通过有限的给养和载具空间来限制玩家的有限行动。

给养包括小队公用的油料和弹药，弹药通常够用，但油料尤为珍贵。每次探险的地图均为随机生成，特殊剧情事件点相对固定，想以有限的给养走遍全图是不可能的！油料耗尽，队员们就只能徒步行军了，在地图上每次移动都会扣除一定生命点数！

载具空间永远只有区区10格，好在公用油料和弹药不算在这10格之内。玩家需要时刻精打细算，既要足量储备探险必备的医疗和修理耗材，更要在主力队员和替补队员间合理分配探险获得的更优质装备，否则任何冗余的物资，都只能塞进战利品大口袋，待探险后一次性折成金钱。


[h1]形似2D版X-COM的战斗[/h1]
如上一段提到的，进入带遇敌图标的场景，或行进途中随机遇敌，一场遭遇战就此打响。

进入作战场景前，首先请最后确认己方队员状态，包括生命、护甲、装备等等。
每位队员可依自身技能条件，装备武器、辅助品和护甲各一，各装备有从普通级到传说级的档次之分。

[b]武器[/b]
匕首：拥有游戏中最大的伤害输出和不错的暴击率，还能节省弹药，强力突击型队员必备。
手枪：威力、射程、弹匣容量中等，对同一目标的连续两发射击是神技能，确保当回合消灭目标。
霰弹枪：大威力、低射程、低备弹量、高暴击的鸡肋武器。论威力比不了匕首，很难一枪撂倒一个；要是都能走进3格射程了，大概率也能近身用匕首了；赌这一发能不能打出暴击、秒杀目标？本非酋贵有自知之明啊。
突击步枪：中威力、射程远、大弹匣，游戏早期的垃圾武器，但后期爆出的高级别突击步枪，单发威力足以秒杀非boss级敌人，非常适合主力队员远远躲在掩体后方，安全控场。
狙击步枪：拥有游戏中最远的射程，其它指标通常略逊于同档次突击步枪，但其主动狙击技能在实战中有战略意义！玩家通常可预先瞄准强敌必经之路，下回合首个进入被狙击区域的敌人，一定会被命中，同时打断此敌人在当回合的攻击动作！
射线枪：可击穿发射方向上的所有敌人，其它指标通常略逊于同档次突击步枪，仅我方某位特定科学家角色可装备，在队内的通配性不高。

[b]辅助品[/b]
主要包括各种医疗品和修理工具，分别对应回复队员生命或护甲，在此不再赘述。

[b]护甲[/b]
有轻甲/中甲/重甲的区别，赋予穿著者额外移动力或减轻受伤的主动技能。实战表现来看，重甲有明显优势。
  
进入作战场景预览，绿色格子是我方单位部署区域，画面下方会显示此战敌方单位总数。其中，仅在我方视野内的敌方单位类型是可见的。

准备妥当，终于开打了！战斗以回合制呈现，我方有强制先手回合的优势。沿用X-COM的成熟设定，每回合每队员有两点行动力，至多可攻击一次，外加移动/使用物品一次。活用每位队员的技能点数，是取胜的关键。

技能点数，直译即勇气点数(Bravery Point)。我方队员施放各种主动技能需要消耗一定技能点数，比如持匕首者造成对方持续失血效果，穿中甲者卧倒以减少伤害等等。主动杀敌可恢复技能点数。

依然是师承X-COM，掩体分为全掩体和半掩体，有直观图标显示。掩体可减少敌方正面射击的命中率。当然，掩体对兜后/侧袭无效。
  
敌人分为纳粹和丧尸两大类，各自再可细分若干兵种，从肉搏型到远射型不等，具体可参见游戏百科，总之都是很萌的像素外观。
  
战斗胜利后，依照击败敌军的强度，玩家可获得相应经验值和战利品。队员可积累经验升级，逐步解锁技能树。战利品可能包括油料、弹药、回复品等耗材，也可能爆出高级别武器或护甲！且看我欧气满满，开！


[h1]写在最后的不吐不快[/h1]
笔者作为策略游戏重度爱好者，日常自诩生冷不忌，却很难向同好们直接推荐本作。
本作的艳丽像素风、探险猎奇背景设定、看似呆萌却有一定策略深度的回合制战斗，都是相当讨喜的地方。制作者的用心良苦，显而易见。但是，不吐不快……
  
是平衡性不足吗？有那么一点吧，像是默认的二人探险小队，容错率低而可用战术贫乏；非酋的贴脸miss与欧皇敌兵的连续暴击，这些都可以多给制作者一些耐心和反馈，期待后续版本的数值平衡完善。

或许，整体内容太单薄，才真心是硬伤吧。区区5个探险剧本，几无探索解谜元素，玩家只能在有限的补给限制下，反复在看似精美、实则大同小异而并无卵用的场景中，与种类有限的敌人，反复刷刷刷战斗。制作者还能通过后续的不破不立，来消解当前三鼓而竭的审美疲劳吗？

author: {'steamid': '76561198061380950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5446, 'last_played': 1668869273}
review: I really love the game can't wait to see how it expands

author: {'steamid': '76561198090321189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3266, 'last_played': 1557074050}
review:
Fun turn-based strategy game similar to FTL (Faster Than Light) but much less punishing. Lots of different characters to mix up how you run through a certain adventure and a lot of different weapons and armor to find. The fight mechanics take a bit to get used to but once you figure them out you can get good at going through fights without taking any damage (or at least only 1 or 2 hits).

Plus the pixel art is fantastic.

Hopefully there will be more content in the future (more adventures, characters, items, etc.), but for now the current content is great and has good replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970405393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1556499455}
review: This game was promising, but disappointed over and over. The complexity of an RPG is not there. My biggest gripe is that the AI knows exactly where you are at all times - no ability to be sneaky, even if the flavour text says you are doing so (ambush, etc). Lack of replay value since the 'flavour text' is re-used over an over. Too much left up to random chance - including whether you make it to the end of a level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026214575', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1584782098}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056700704', 'num_games_owned': 1370, 'num_reviews': 594, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1556490544}
review:
ベースはめちゃくちゃ良いです。
絵、曲、システムどれも本当に良い。

ただ、難しすぎてクリアできません。
どうしてこんなに難しくしているのか理解できない。
超人しかテストプレイしていないのだろうか。
ただ一つ、高すぎる難易度だけのせいでオススメできない。
こんな悲しいことがあるだろうか…

戦闘パートはSLGで、銃による間接攻撃があるのだけれど
敵味方ともかなりの確率で命中するんです。
しかも射程が移動範囲をまるまるカバーする勢いで、
被弾した味方を下げようしても逃げられない。
加えてHPを回復する手段がとても少ない。
結果ジリ貧で死ぬ。救いは無い。

成層圏まで達しそうな高すぎる山であることをきいても
尚チャレンジしたい人はどうぞ登ってください。
一般人にはとてもとても楽しめるとは思えませんでした。

やっぱりFTLは偉大なんだなって。

review: I have been playing this game off and on for 2 weeks. Mostly it is good and a lot of fun. The few bugs I encounter annoy me but mostly I want a few quality of life improvements. If they improved the quality of life the game would knock it out of the park.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973046583', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1556397626}
review:
I've booted up the game to play on two occasions.

The first time, the map bugged out and I couldn't click anything.  I thought I was doing something wrong. 

The second time, no enemies spawned on the map and so I was locked in perpetual combat. What a waste of time :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198306315604', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1607945011}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011941869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1574916242}
review:
Doctor Jones meets FTL.
The gameplay is pretty simple, you choose your path, some of them lead to straighforward combat, other to events with 2 or more options with results often determined from your party's characteristics (as ancient language speaking or daredevil). The oasis event replenish your health and armor, while your odd trader appears here and there...
Your 2 actions per turn battle Xcomish style appears here too, hp, armor and bravery points (used for special skills) are the primary features used in combats. Opponents vary from nazi soldiers and zombies to teslaborgs and high priests.
Plenty of unique unlockable characters from your Indy clone to your sharpshooter priest, shotgun and knife old sailor and the savanna deadly huntress, armed with many 1940's weapons ranging from poor to legendary quality.
For many fellow gamers the siplicity of the game is on their cons list....for me its what do you expect from a game.
If you are searching for a carefree, simple and full flavor Indy game, buy it with no regrets. On the other hand if you want a Phantom Doctrine like game, look elsewhere mates.
Update: New skills, new items and new weapons!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045440268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1556336166}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118296012', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2478, 'last_played': 1684086935}
review:
I Really enjoy playing the game and i even got almost every character with legendary weapons, but there is some sort of glitch with the Desintegrators weapons. For example my legendary Disintegrator is doing from 59-61 dmg with Bellamy and its doing Corrosion dmg which is 125% of that base dmg to armor units. but in reallity im hitting 52-54 dmg to Teslaborgs II
not even doing my min dmg of that weapon there is something wrong with the calculations. but overall great game.

P.S. add more missions or maps

author: {'steamid': '76561198012028297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1556222654}
review:
The looks and the setting of the game are very promising. Pathway is a love letter to Indiana Jones' adventures (which is, imho, a huge pro), BUT

- the combat is shallow (and i put it VERY mildly).
- the game is poorly balanced. some weapons are just useless.
- the development of chars is absolutely undermined by the fact you can have many chars, but only 2 can be picked up for the adventure + the system of perks and upgrades is rediculous. it is simply non-existent (each of your chars has 4 levelups and each of em allows you to pick 1 of 2 or 3 perks and THAT's IT. period.
- the travel through map is a terrible and exhausting CHORE - you can travel only by one tile (even through the points you have already visited) + the animation of the process makes you literaly feel your nerve cells are being killed in the most painful and slow manner. Please note that the map travel is round 50%-60% of the whole gameplay.

In general: do yourself a favor - just avoid pathway and better consider re-watching good old Indiana Jones movies instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991740103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3128, 'last_played': 1555954942}
review:
좀 아쉬운 게임입니다.


이 게임이 표방하는것

- 담대하고 역동적인 모험

- 미스터리로 가득한 모험, 숨겨진 보물들

- 다양한 선택과 그에 따른 결과

- 전략적인 턴제 전투

- 다양한 파티조합

- 짜릿한 시각효과

- 실수를 통해 배운다 : 회복과 반복플레이



실제로 나온것

- 호흡/분량조절이 미흡한 길고 지루한 플레이

- 연계성 떨어지는 미해결 떡밥으로 가득한 모험, 대량의 잡템들

- 스토리에 영향이 별로 없는 다양한 선택과 결과를 위한 반복플레이

- 무조건 선턴잡아 죽창으로 치고빠지는 반복전투

- 다양한 이벤트를 원한다면 쓰는놈만 쓰게됨
  개성적인 파티를 원한다면 이벤트가 제한됨
  파티원 해금을 위한 부자연스러운 노가다

- 적절한 시각효과와 돌려쓰는 모션

- 별로 배울건 없다 : 죽을 일 많지 않은 반강제 노가다

author: {'steamid': '76561198011961023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1556163283}
review:
Pathway's got issues but overall it's a very pretty and enjoyable game. I completed the 5 scenarios in a little over 10 hours, and had a good time the whole time. The combat is fairly straightforward but can feel a bit cheap sometimes. My main issue with the game is I never really wanted to explore as I was constantly low on fuel, but that didn't hurt the game too much as you are meant to be racing towards the objective anyway. 

If they could blend this game and Renowned Explorers: International Society I'd be a happy camper.

Still, at it's price, I thought this game was definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037377534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1556161159}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996695647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1555730952}
review: Plays much different than the games it is influenced from. It is a refreshing experience, Indiana Jones-ish. Only gripe is no respec on characters, but I am sure that will soon change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083258255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1555164945}
review:
The good parts: 

I can recommend you giving this game a try. It is reasonably priced and if you don't expect another XCOM and enjoy the (truly marvelous) art style, it will surely give you some fun. I also think that this game is perfect for casual players as it does not require a whole lot of strategy and planning ahead but can be played while chatting with friends or unwinding after a long day. 

I guess you will like the story, if you enjoyed Indiana Jones. 

The bad parts:

I regret buying this product. Runs very unstable and caused my system to freeze several times (not just the game, the whole damn computer). Freezes are unpredictable and I strongly suspect the game to cause it as they never happened before. I run it on Ubuntu 18.04 using Proton runtime. This makes me not playing the game for now and waiting/hoping for an upcoming patch to fix things. 

Apart from that, very much what the other reviews say. Lacking content and oversimplified combat/character design. 
Will not keep you playing for months or years but neither did I expect a  handful of indie devs to code the next skyrim in their free time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055117946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1558183017}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036485214', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1707778840}
review: I thought it was fun. It's definitely a $15 game, meaning it's shorter and shallower than standard triple A blockbuster. But it's not bad. I think you could get about 20 hours of entertainment out of this game before it starts to feel redundant. I would buy a DLC for this if it came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995236872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1581220074}
review:
Those comparing this game to XCOM and then giving a thumbs down are fools and are missing the point.

The atmosphere is on point. The soundtrack is fantastic. The set-pieces (randomly selected when a map is generated) have satisfyingly, if predictable, pulpy and well-written content.

Expect to re-run a given mission a few times to level up characters, earn equipment, and possibly unlock other characters. While the overall objective of each mission is the same, the interstitial events at each set location along the way are randomized, generally within the parent mission itself. Beware; these missions can and often do last more than one map screen and you may find yourself at the "destination" only to reveal yet another full page of your path. I'm assuming that a lot of the thumbs down reviews have never left the first two missions.

If you like Indiana Jones and it's contemporaries as well as strategic-lite combat and resource management, there are far worse ways to spend your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073755634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1555926996}
review: I dont know why, but I have to agree with what someone else said. Despite the fact that it's looking nice and the mechanics aint bad, for whatever reason it's just not fun. I played it through because I hoped the feeling of adventure and exitement would kick in, but unlike Renowned Explorers and Curious Expedition it just didn't happen. And that's a shame because I feel like the creators of this game are realy invested in it. Maybe, given time and update it will change for the better, but I cant recommend it right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034787971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1570777589}
review:
Love the theme and the aesthetic of this game. I want many, many more Indiana Jones themed games. Just... not this one.

Pathway is repetitive. There are only five missions in the campaign, and there's no real story to any of them. You get a narrative blurb at the beginning and one at the end, but in between it's just the same events over and over again. There are absolutely no surprises. There are a handful of types of events you can trigger, and you just travel across the map setting them off over and over again.

This is billed as a game about exploration and adventure, but in reality you spend almost all of your time fighting. And the fights are... fine. If they were less important, the fairly shallow combat system would work. But combat is almost the entire game, so the lack of any real depth pretty quickly shows through.

Love the theme. Glad someone's trying it. This one is a swing and a miss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206551864', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1555053416}
review: 엑스컴 비스무리해서 구매해봤는데 전략전술이라기보다 펔이랑 템채워서 죽창싸움하는 게임이다. 무조건 측면잡을정도로 이동거리가 무식하게 넓음

author: {'steamid': '76561198028271853', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1559340059}
review:
I enjoy playing Pathway a lot. There are 5 campaigns that become longer and more difficult.
So far, I haven't beaten a campaign first try but that's part of the game. It is a rogue-lite so when you fail a mission, your characters will be hospitalised / unavailable for the next mission but they keep their XP, skills and inventory. To finish everything, you need to do missions again and level up your characters.

The mix between turn-based combat and text adventure elements is great but the text encounters might become repetitive at some point - I'm not there yet.

2D pixel art and soundtrack are great too and I think there's a lot of potential for more compaigns in the future.

Approvements could be made (and afaik are actually already in the making) to display more info during combat but apart from that it's perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022704157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1556197736}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974430389', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1555149750}
review: FTL movement combined with xcom combat. Lots of unlockable characters with permanent progression to your profile. Appears to be fun but becomes more of the same a bit too fast for the current price. Would absolutely pick up on sale, great fun game with a short life span.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044876918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1570772416}
review:
포텐셜은 있는데, 현재는 구립니다.
경로 선정은 그냥 운빨.. 기름을 운좋게 획득하면 끝까지 가는거고, 획득 못하면 그냥 도중 리타이어입니다.
플레이어가 간섭할 수 있는 선택지가 매우 적습니다.

전투도 깊이가 거의 없다시피 합니다.
상대가 어떻게 들어오면, 어떻게 응전하고.. 이런 전략전술이 부재합니다. 그냥 밀고 들어왔을 때 한 두방으로 눕히면 성공인거고,
실패하면 피해를 받습니다. 이 과정을 반복하다가 힐팩이랑 방어구가 바닥나면 그냥 게임 끝입니다.

솔직히 게임 시스템에 비해 그래픽이 너무 아깝네요. 도트의 매력만 보고 사기엔 시스템이 너무 부실합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969245987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1584877818}
review: A great tactical strategy RPG with heavy Indiana Jones thematic elements. The first level allows for a quick game, the later levels take a lot longer and get more difficult. Lots of fun, not super deep but the enemies have a nice variety of behaviors. The story elements add some good flavor without taking up a lot of time. Totally worth list price, IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040848876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 34236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3563, 'last_played': 1689578198}
review: This game is a rough cut gem.  It's brilliant as-is, but like anything it has room for improvement.  The core of the game is fantastic, and most complaints are about superficial issues that won't be around much longer.  The developers have given a ton of little tweaks in the first couple weeks alone, and there are teasers of some good stuff in the works as well.  I fully suspect with the proper support and a little bit of patience this will be a classic that I will keep coming back to replay.  If they were selling preorders for an expansion I'd be the first one in line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043610751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1555879773}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968809314', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1557430017}
review: C'est beau, mais hyper répétitif: ça finit tout le temps en combat. Les mécaniques du combat sont simpliste. Bref a éviter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970487447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1568, 'last_played': 1558122423}
review:
steam wipes reviews if you navigate away from this page as youre writing to find facts.  Nice.  

Game is unfinished.  The few characters you start with are the only ones really calibrated to work with the plot.  if you try and level the unconnected characters you will have a bad time of it.  
weapons are all the same and locked behind skill requirements.  Skill requirements are not frequent enough as level up perks for your characters, thus making any character building a futile effort.  
Combat is solid, but lack of variety strikes again with units, tactics, and combat areas.  This game smacks of the devs kicking design cans down the road, and yet it is not an early access title.   
Loot is awful, useless, and the individual items you scavenge of archaeological value basically go into a big bag with a monetary value on it so you can sell it to a villager when you run out of your limited fuel.  

Most of the game is here, it just needs to be properly balanced and plated before serving up to the customer.  The chefs here can cook, but the eatery needs refurbishment.  You could have reasonably released the first two levels, balanced for those, and then trickled out the black pharoah and later missions had you provided enough content instead of jumping ahead to new scenarios.  I wager it was because the first two missions were really bland, plot wise, and you wanted to hint at more supernatural elements later in the campaign. 

Do not get me wrong--this game has something exquisite about it in it's simplicity.  Once the devs put some focus into adding content so that the unlockable characters have actual meaning and the fights actually have rewards players hope for other than fuel, I think they'll be tapping into something that could be very re-playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977450557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1555640647}
review:
I wanted to love this game. It checks off so many boxes that I look for in a game.  Cool art direction, from Chucklefish no less? Check. Roguelike? Check. Tactics style combat? Check. Indiana Jones, Nazis, Zombies, and wacky Sci-Fi laser cutters? Check. Resource Management? Check. 

Fun? No check. 

The game falls flat for some reason that is hard to pin down as it has so many cool things going for it. The click and move adventures with random events are pretty bland for a game released in 2019. I think if they were slightly more interesting it would make navigating the adventure map more compelling. As others have mentioned the combat is not very deep, and this is painfully obvious in the AI behaviour & the weak cover system. It is often your best move to not do anything at all, since all AI enemies will eventually just walk into your line of sight. Moving a character out into the open exposes them to attacks from 3+ enemies, which is often enough to down that character. I rarely moved my characters outside of the starting setup phase zone, and I just waited for the enemies to walk toward them. 

I only played one and a half adventures before returning this game. It walks a weird line between trying to have a compelling story, and a cool tactics battle system. But it fails to be as engaging as Banner Saga, or as deep as XCOM - so I think it misses the mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046222380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1556454202}

You have to think about what tools and money you'll pass to next adventure, or your next run will have a short walk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020087176', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1555603076}
review:
Con un arte de pixeles hermosos  como suelen serlo algunos de los juegos de la editora Chucklefish, nos llega esta Aventura de corte rogue-lite. Su nombre es Pathway, ambientado en la primera Guerra mundial. Nos enfrentamos ante miembros del ejercito Nazi en distintas misiones  donde podemos elegir de entre una cantidad bastante aceptable de personajes mientras buscamos cumplir con un objetivo.

Es un juego de estrategia por turnos, donde siempre nos veremos en desventaja numérica, contra todas posibilidades. El tomar decisiones correctas es fundamental para la supervivencia, puesto que en un juego rogue-lite, una vez morimos, nos toca empezar desde el inicio.

Iniciamos partida escogiendo a los miembros de nuestro escuadrón en nuestra aventura. Cada uno tiene habilidades especiales que le hacen único, como la posibilidad de curar compañeros en batalla, usar granadas, disparos devastadores con sniper, o usos de escopetas por comentar alguno de la gran cantidad que tenemos a disposición.

Una vez da comienzo el viaje, entramos a un mapa en el que vamos avanzando casillas donde hay eventos aleatorios en cada una de ellas.  Vamos en un jeep, que necesita gasolina, cada casilla que nos movamos (hacia adelante o atrás) gasta un galón de combustible, por lo que es necesario prestar atención al detalle para no perder la partida por quedarnos varados en el camino.

Algunas de las casillas no solo son para encuentros armados, sino que agregan zonas de loot, o pequeños pueblos con mercaderes a quienes podemos venderles los objetos que encontramos tras vencer a los soldados alemanes o en locaciones con las que topamos en nuestro trayecto, otro tripo de zonas son las de descanso, que son de suma importancia pues rellenan la vitalidad y la armadura de manera total. Muchos de estos objetos tienen la particularidad de ser usados solo por aquel personaje que tenga la capacidad de hacerlo, por lo que una chaqueta de blindaje pesado no podría ser usado por la doctora, por ejemplo. También, algo que determina si lo pueden usar o no, es el nivel. El elemento de RPG en Pathway provee un árbol de habilidades pequeño, donde tendremos que decidir siempre entre dos o tres opciones  cuál será la que mejor de adecue al miembro de la escuadra en cuestión. La experiencia de nuestros aventureros se gana con vencer contrarios, o al realizar acciones en las escenas de carácter narrativo cuando no tenemos enfrentamientos armados.

Tras vencer la primera misión, la segunda se verá disponible, y de esa forma el resto van a ir desbloqueándose poco a poco. Siempre las misiones siguientes son más complejas que las anteriores, asi que el grinding será necesario (podemos repetir todos los niveles cuantas veces queramos) para poder salir avante en aquellas que sean complicadas.

Los enemigos no son tan variados, siento que en este aspecto el juego queda debiendo, pues se ven algunos pocos soldados de diferente tipo; soldados, perros, o hasta momias zombies que vomitan sustancias tóxicas. A su vez, los escenarios sí aparentan ser suficientemente diversos como para no caer en lo repetitivo pero no cambian en el sentido de todos ser desiertos; hablando de cosas repetitivas, siempre que da comienzo una nueva, todo el contenido cambia en relación a nuestra partida pasada en esa misma misión. Tal vez el acomodo de los escenarios rota, pero sentimos que los acontecimientos en realidad no son tan surtidos como lo expresa el desarrollador.

El combate se divide en dos partes, la fase de planeamiento, durante la cual podemos colocar nuestros personajes en posiciones estratégicas dentro de un rango determinado de cuadros (en los cuales está dividido la zona de batalla). Algunas veces tenemos la ventaja, mientras que si somos emboscados, será un poco más complicado dar con un buen lugar para colocar las tropas. La segunda fase, es la refriega en sí misma, que otorga turnos a cada bando para hacer sus movimientos. Los enemigos siempre tendrán plena visibilidad de nuestros soldados, sin importan que nos hayan visto o no, mientras que nosotros, tendremos fog of war con aquellas unidades que no estén en nuestro rango de visión. La parte final de la batalla, es la que nos muestra estadísticas, pantallas de loot, y demás.

Hay cosas que me quitan un poco el empuje, como por ejemplo, cuando en alguno de los eventos que salen en el camino, opto por hacer una ‘emboscada’ contra soldados nazis desprevenidos. Claramente, si decido emboscarlos, es porque tengo el elemento de la sorpresa, o el sigilo, pero aún sin hacer disparos, los enemigos siempre van a por mí en el primero de sus turnos, incluso si yo no he revelado mi posición. Esto le quita ese elemento de sorpresa, y sobre todo, resta crédito a la opción de emboscadas.

Me gusta mucho el sistema coberturas, muy parecido a Mutant Year Zero, donde estar bien cubierto es importante para evitar ser alcanzado por las balas en los ataques que recibimos. Eso sí, también debemos buscar flanquear para lograr infringir el mayor daño posible. Aunque esto no hace que estemos exentos de fallar uno que otro disparo casi que a quemarropa. Y me encanta el arte del juego mismo, siento que estoy jugando un Metal Slug de estrategia por turnos, la música es bonita, y todo en general está hecho excelentemente.

Se echa de menos la posibilidad de jugar a Pathway con mando, pues el estilo y la forma en que los mecanismos se hicieron nos hacen recordar juegos de Nintendo DS de estrategia, y deja un pequeño sinsabor pensar que lo pude haber disfrutado desde la comodidad de mi cama o el sillón. Pero es un detalle menor, que el desarrollador prometió ahondar en caso de ser una petición con gran apoyo detrás (y lo es).

En cuentas ya resumidas, Pathway me encanta. Aún con el limitado -visualmente- paisaje del medio oriente, su propuesta es divertida, sus más de 15 personajes jugables le dan rienda suelta a la rejugabilidad, y la narrativa, aunque no es su atractivo principal le da valor extra una obra de buen ver, fácil de aprender con mecánicas poco innovadoras pero muy bien realizadas. Pathway es un juego recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007351176', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1555896281}
review: It has the potential to be a good game. There are some major framerate issues right now though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970659761', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1578237735}
review:
I like turn based tactics, roguelikes and pixel art, so this game ticks a lot of boxes for me.

Overall I really like this game.  It's pretty difficult, some of which is intentional and some of it is issues with how much information the game communicates to you.  Reading the codex helped - once you understand how the cover system works etc. it makes it much easier to make informed decisions.  I think those communication issues are mostly what people are complaining about, and the developers are working on improving them.

In conclusion I like the game as is, and I think it'll only get better.

Update after about 44 hours of playtime - this is one of my favorite games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013215897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1670, 'last_played': 1555788860}
review:
Watered down XCOM. Little content. Battles are boring and not rewarding enough.
By the 4th adventure, it seems like you have to grind previous adventures to stockpile on resources, otherwise you're pretty much fucked.
Wish I could recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071834628', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1580058988}
review:
Let me put it this way:

"I am not mad, I am just disappointed."

I´ve tried playing on an on, but it´s just sooo repetitive. There is progression/grind, but it doesn´t feel worth it.
I mean, it´s not a bad game, and maybe it could be worth it in the future. Right now, IF you are interested, wait for sale.
Or don´t, it´s cheap anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969699787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1555090850}
review: Trop simpliste pour en faire un tactical. Les devs ont eu retour de ce fait dès la sortie et ont annoncé qu'ils allaient retravailler l'IA. Qui plus est, l'ennui pointe au bout d'un moment car trop répétitif (un peu le même défaut que skyshine's bedlam). Même si le prix n'est pas élevé, je m'attendais quand même à mieux. Je déconseille fortement pour l'instant : à voir par la suite si des  changements peuvent donner un peu plus de profondeur au gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314099644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1564392038}
review: Well. I have never reviewed a game here. This game was over-hyped and overpriced. Beyond very redundant game play & clunky fight scenes are repetitive cut scenes that do nothing to augment or tell the story. Wait. There is no story. Wait, there is a story, but the game has little to do with it. I was lured to this game with great promise and accolades, only to find I can have a lot more fun with some 59 cent match 3 game. Don't waste your time nor money on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028656814', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2008, 'last_played': 1640792787}
review:
Pathway is a really fun turn-based adventure game. I like pretty much everything about the it - the art and music, characters and adventures, enemy AI and random encounters, and if I were to ever make a game, this is the closest thing to my dream project.

I've spent around a week playing Pathway, and I've bonded with the characters, gathering Legendary equipment for my favorites, like Pereira and Natalya, and gradually giving scraps to those I've had the worst luck with (looking at you, Bellamy). The RNG element does a good job of keeping you on your feet, though at times it's felt like I'm playing Darkest Dungeons. Meeting Donut and Fenris at these dark times was a truely heartwarming experience.

I see Pathway getting a lot of critisism due to certain scenarios often repeating, or being too similar to one another, but during many of my adventures, when fuel is often running low, predictability is what you want. When I'm racing to the next trader or encounter with barely anything left in the tank, I'm extatic when I'm greeted by a scenario I can instantly recognize and act on, to get assured loot. I feel that if the game would truely offer hundreds and hundreds of scenarios, my own planning would offer very little to the success of the mission, because everything I encounter would be uncertain.

I also don't feel that being forced to chase encounters to get fuel is a bad practise, it's just a gameplay aspect you have to account for. The game revolves around encounters and cheesing your way around them all would make it too easy. The game is designed to be tough. I quickly realised that even when doing lengthy preperations, all it takes is some bad RNG to ruin your good time. 

All in all, quite cheap of a pick-up for a great up to 50 hour experience. Can't compliment it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024157673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1710803878}
review:
I'm not 100% sure what people expect for $15, but this game is really a lot of fun. Anyone giving a negative review after playing the game for 15 hours... well, I don't know where else they can have that amount of fun for $1/hr.

I felt compelled to write a positive review, with a thumbs-up, because I couldn't believe all the over-analysis of the game mechanics and so forth. Jesus, it's a pretty casual game... and a good one at that.

I would say, though, that there is one mechanic that I'm none-to-crazy about and that is the very, very limited amount of stuff that can be stored in the inventory. This game makes no differentiation between "on the road" (where space should be rather limited) and at your "base" when you first start an adventure. For me, it would be nice if they'd unlocked another page of inventory storage at the base when you unlock each chapter / quest.

All in all, a compelling story that is well-told and casually fun (yet very addictive!)

Oh, and one last feature request: I really enjoy playing through and adventure and it would be fun if it could be re-capped in a log or something... something persistent, with screen-shots or something for interesting highlights or plot points.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990998857', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1556323144}
review:
For this price, yes, I would def recommend it. The music and visuals are great and it has many hours of gameplay.

From time to time it feels like it's not a stable release, mostly because of some tiny bugs here and there and some missing features. But again, for the current price, I can live with it.

The battles are short (5 ~ 10') and easy to grasp, which I like a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968623850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1555903945}
review:
Amazing graphics, great concept, fun gameplay. I get the complaints about the combat getting kind of repetitive, but I DEFINITELY think this game is worth the money does NOT receive the amount of thumbs-downs and criticism it is getting. The devs clearly seem like they have put their heart into this game, and definitely sound like they are listening to and will be responsive to criticisms. 

Keep in mind that you don't have to "thumbs down" a game, if you have criticisms and you want it to improve. Thumbs-downs, at the end of the day, have disproportionate weight really bad knock-on effects of a team's income/chance of survival and should be reserved for games that are really so crappy that you want to see them die. It's usually good enough to put thoughtful criticism into a thumbs-up review. They'll read it, and will be plenty motivated to improve!

Anyway, I thought the game was definitely plenty good and I'm sure it will improve, as time goes on. I'm glad I spent my money on it, and will likely come back to it time and time again to unlock all the characters and get all the achievements. Thanks, devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198177803470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1658478717}
