author: {'steamid': '76561197970720972', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1556392837}
review: FTL style world map, light TBS combat, and rogue-lite style progression make Pathway a lot of fun, but it's prone to frustrating mistakes made in combat due to a mediocre UI, and the performance is garbage for a 16-bit style game. However, it's a lot of fun regardless and the problems are easily fixable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980283816', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1598081860}
review:
Gets boring pretty fast.
The combat mechanics are very strange and the ui is terrible.
The graphics look nice but it's very hard to actually see the terrain that you're fighting on. Also the movement is one-shot. You misplaced your character by one square? Get rekt. No undo, no remaining movement points.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966505095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1581114843}
review:
Given its currently mixed status in review-world, I figured I'd do what I don't normally do and throw it a thumbs-up. Though it's not without its problems, I've been really enjoying Pathway so far. The overall gameplay loop--choosing a narrative, branching pathways leading to your own "Story" along that narrative path--is pretty strong. 

The stops on the path usually fall into one of three categories: Simple narrative beats, narrative beats with a choice of some sort (Perform action, explore ruins, drink boiling green water, etc), or combat. They're all pretty colorful, but I wish there were about 250 more of them scripted, and all of the story beats offered deeper choice. All the pieces are there to do this well. 

Were I the developer, I'd ask the community to help write some of the scenarios, and branching pathways to improve the story, either through mods, or by offering some sort of game-related incentives for their input. 

As many others have said, the combat is zippy but limited. Right now, it feels like just moving around a map and clicking the "gun" button, rather than employing much of a strategy. Every character should have one additional action slot (Perhaps a second limited use weapon or ability) and the game would be well served from a more diverse enemy population than "Nazi" and "Nazi with armor". Yes I know there are cultists and zombies. Yes I wish there were more than JUST cultists and zombies. Why not throw in some dinosaurs, or, in the "Wrath of God" scenario, change the mechanics (Depending on the choices) so that either one of your characters, or one of the enemy characters, plays with a Wrath-of-god-enhanced ruleset.

It may seem like I'm whining a lot, but all of these recommendations are sparked by the genuine enjoyment that I experience playing this game. I hope the team listens to the community, deepens the choices and the combat, and with some updates to the core experience, I see the potential for great things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014792611', 'num_games_owned': 943, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1690498230}
review: A great game, somewhere between X-com, FTL and Renowned Explorers. Not that easy yet not that hard once you mastered it. One of the best games in 2019!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010280803', 'num_games_owned': 4974, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1555441927}
review:
[quote][url=https://www.gimmgimm.com/]叽咪叽咪，每天都好玩！[/url]
喜欢的话欢迎[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/27162873/]关注叽咪叽咪鉴赏家[/url][/quote]

[h1]游戏概述[/h1]
Pathway是一款像素风冒险寻宝主题的游戏，游戏主体都是在大沙漠中进行，战斗方式上有些像XCOM，整体的内容并不是太多，体验上前几小时尚可，后面就多少有些过于重复，让人继续刷下去的动力不高。

[h1]玩法 [/h1]         
游戏主题是有些类似电影印第安纳琼斯那种以冒险寻宝为主，背景故事以及事件的文本量并不是很大，所以虽然没有中文，但是使用翻译进行游戏完全可行。游戏中一共有16名不同角色，初始能选6名，后续有不同条件来解锁新的角色。玩家需要从这些角色中选取任意2名，来进行自己的冒险。不同角色之间的能使用的武器装备与初始技能完全不同, 不同角色所能遇见的随机事件，相对有一定程度的区别，其他的方面比较相似。比如医生能帮忙治疗，狙击手有预瞄技能。
玩家可以培养自己的角色进行升级、更换装备，升级目前似乎都是属性的增加，所以没办法起到丰富战术的作用。角色死亡后，除了花费500进行复活外并没有其他的损失，这点感觉比较不错，玩家基本没有什么后顾之忧。

大地图是一种随机生成的网格图，玩家需在地图上驾驶小车走格子，每一格都会消耗汽油并触发随机的事件。因为初始的汽油量是有限的，而事件会不会碰见汽油这些完全是随机的，所以需玩家自己考虑是否要绕原路多冒险一会，建议是初始资源量选多一点，这样能更从容的进行冒险而不用担心概率。战斗上是类似XCom的回合战旗。

[h1]战斗体验[/h1]
战斗上基本类似XCOM，拥有掩体降命中的设定，玩家一开始可以设定角色的出生站位，在地图的一角布置好位置。难度上还好，在看到敌人的大致移动范围后，玩家可以选好位置躲在各种掩体后，慢慢的歼灭一个一个冲上来落单的敌人，然后往另外一边移动。

感觉头疼的点.1、是敌人的移动范围相对比较大，经常在玩家躲在掩体后，还能移动到玩家侧面进行攻击，这点就导致玩家的设想很难完全如愿。2、是没有小队成员能看到敌人的情况下，敌人就是隐形的，可能这样对高玩没什么影响对个人这样的一般玩家来说影响还是有有一些的。3、敌人的种类比较少，大部分敌人都没什么特殊的，以纳粹、丧尸这些居多，都只会冲上来消耗，所以这种情况下重复刷敌有些腻味，而敌人又是经常可见的频繁触发更带来了比较枯燥的体验。

[h1]探险体验[/h1]
大体上事件基本就是去荒废的庙宇探险、与纳粹、邪教徒进行战斗或者躲开，去随机商店里购买补给品，卖卖用不到的装备等，初始的新鲜感还是有一些的，这种寻宝的冒险代入感不错。每个事件都会播放一点小动画，在沙漠中探险的感觉很好，但可惜的是目前的事件不够丰富，几张图之间碰见的事件基本完全相似。大部分事件都只有个文本概述，然后点两下鼠标就结束了，所以后期基本都懒得翻译事件剧情了，几乎完全一样的。

[h1]总结[/h1]
如果能添加更多的不同类事件与更多不同种类的敌人，升级技能也增添更多差异，让玩家有更多有趣的选择的话还是不错的。目前的程度比较容易腻味，只有一个大体的框架，内容填充过少比较重复。游戏基本最近都在更新，只能期待开发组能够继续努力了。
 [quote]图文并茂版：[url=https://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info/16941.html]《重复度较高的寻宝游戏》 [/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198049669982', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1555925171}
review:
Great "little" game... 
...for sure not highend graphics or amazing features, but real enjoyable gaming and a lot of fun for hours. i realy enjoy playing it, with my feet on the table, leaning backward in my seat and just making the right klicks an decisions in the fights. 
i just hope for more content over the time, but for this price i can give both thumbs up :-)
Best wishes :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198204878992', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1555158260}
review:
[h1]TLDR：[/h1]

[i]前面那么多优秀的回合制战棋游戏你一个不学，非要让自己活成所有回合制战棋玩家最讨厌的样子。[/i]



《Pathway》是一款由Chucklefish发行的回合制战棋游戏，玩家在游戏开始时配置好自己的角色，从中选择两名，选取其中已解锁的一张地图就可以正式开始游戏旅程。

在一局游戏(一张图)里，游戏被分成了两个部分：

一个是类FTL式的类树状地图，其中有着相当多的分支，每个节点都可能包含不同的随机事件，互动NPC或战斗，玩家在地图中的最终目标就是到达地图终点并完成终点的战斗，当然这里还有玩家的配装界面，能够管理所有参加本次行动的角色及收集到的物品。

一个是类XCOM的回合制战棋界面，正方形网格，掩体，射击范围，命中几率，只要玩过类似游戏的玩家都会十分熟悉的概念。

其实从外表看起来这些设计都没什么问题，加上游戏本身对抗纳粹士兵+沙漠古神/怪奇生物的设定，在玩上手之前怎么看这都会是一款比较讨喜的游戏。

然而这样的外表之下的游戏内容，实在是让人失望透顶。


[h1]毫无灵魂，缺乏战术性的回合制战斗[/h1]

这是这款游戏的致命伤，也是我最不能理解的地方——你去找个战棋游戏照抄都不会做出这么烂的玩意，这更像是想借鉴几个游戏但又非要想着自己加点创新，弄巧成拙的典型案例。

(此处假设看到评测的各位都玩过XCOM或类似游戏)

我先讲讲Pathway的机制吧:
战斗地图的大小：60*60左右(肉眼估算，没数格子可能有误差)
攻击范围：除狙击枪外均为5-9格，霰弹枪更短，3格
移动范围：根据角色属性不同范围大致在6-10格之间，部分敌方单位有更强的移动力(比如军犬)
行动方式：消耗行动点(AP)，每个单位[b]2行动点[/b](不排除以后的敌人会有更多，但玩家2点是不变的)
行动类型：战斗行动(射击/近战/拳击)，移动行动，辅助行动；其中战斗行动和移动行动[b]每回合最多执行一次[/b]

好基本介绍完了，我开始讲问题：

Q:这款游戏在一定程度上直接借鉴了XCOM的掩体系统，玩家可以躲在掩体背后对敌射击，但是当你的射击范围和敌人的移动范围完全相同甚至比它还低时，会发生什么呢？
A:你的掩体将会几乎毫无作用，你这回合射击了范围内的一个敌人，下回合他就会用一个移动行动直接冲到你的菊花后面，然后用枪疯狂戳你。

Q:我不能用多余的移动点做准备吗？XCOM的监视射击之类的功能也没有？
A:没有，你这回合蹲在掩体后面，你要么打人要么走路要么打人+走路，只要你在敌人移动范围内而且你没打死他，他下回合就会举着枪，走到你后面捅你，而你对此一点办法都没有。

Q:我这回合不想进行战斗行动/移动行动，这些行动点能否被转化掉呢？你不是还提到有辅助技能吗？
A:不能；辅助技能的话分为两种，一种是护甲特技，轻/中/重甲各有一套技能，然而它们非每回合都可进行的行动，而是需要命中敌人积攒充能才能进行的；另一种是医疗/维修，治疗角色的生命值和护甲值，然而这些需要用到消耗品。

Q:所以你在这款游戏的回合制战斗中都能干什么呢？
A:互相捅对方屁眼子；蹲在掩体后面等对方到达位置然后互相捅屁眼子；以及开护甲技能冲到对方面前然后互相捅屁眼子



[h1]搭配战斗机制后变得无比苍白的其他系统[/h1]

在一局游戏中，生命值和护甲值从开发者设计来看，应该是和其他roguelike游戏一样，属于极难恢复的属性(药物和维修包售价不低而且较难获取)，然而两个因素把本该凸显游戏硬核度的这么一个设定活生生碾碎至渣：

1.几乎无法避免受伤的战斗，除非你的武器能够保证把对方一枪毙命/你把敌人分散成多批然后逐个击破

2.无限使用的休息点，每个地图中都会提供1-2个休息点，此处休息能够恢复全部生命值和护甲值，但因为只要停留在原地就可以不消耗移动力(燃料)无限制使用，玩家完全可以把队友的其他所有衣服扒下来带在车上，每场战斗后更换护甲，在休息点利用这样的漏洞把护甲全部维修到满状态。

每个角色都有属于自己的独特技能树与正面/负面特性，及武器/护甲专长，然而这之中除了单纯提高某方面的角色属性(使用物品的效果，武器的伤害/命中率，移动力，生命值等)外，没有任何其他的改变，尤其是当一部分数据已经彻底失去其平衡性和存在意义时，这些内容更加地毫无意义可言。



[h1]披着Roguelike的皮，用着RPG游戏的刷刷刷，裹着空洞的事件设计[/h1]

每局游戏的体验都独一无二——或许遇到的事件会被转移到另一个节点，地图也会有些变化，然而游戏中的事件没有一个是能较大影响本局游戏进程的。

很多角色的特长都会使其在特殊事件中发挥更大的作用(特殊选项)，然而它们除了提供一些更多的奖励，对于游戏进程却依旧没有较大的影响。

随着关卡难度的提高，你会发现自己手头的武器会开始逐渐应付不来更加强大且更多的敌人了，这时你就会发现：

我需要个传奇装备了

欢迎回到前面的关卡，你将重新体验和之前别无二致的游戏，经历类似的事件，就是为了获得更好的装备去打通下一关。

我是谁？我在哪？我为什么要玩这个游戏？

上述提到的缺点，加上这款游戏同样失败的外围设计，彻底毁掉了这款游戏的复玩性。



Pathway利用了我对同类型游戏的喜爱，成功让我在游戏发售后按下了购买键，但这之后的游戏体验让我深深感受到开发者毫无灵魂的空洞设计，我不知道他们游戏的QA在数十甚至上百近千小时的测试中会不会留下心理阴影，至少我应该是很难再拾起这款游戏了。

我仍然无法理解，在拥有这么多同类游戏的现在，一个看起来制作经费不低(考虑到Chucklefish发行宣传经费估计都不低)的战棋游戏能够把自己做成这副丧心病狂的模样。

如果你没有玩过战棋游戏，而且今后也不想接触战棋游戏，可以考虑入手，因为它会坚定你日后远离一切战棋游戏的意愿。

一定要给一个分数的话，我应该会给出5/10，5分交给游戏的美术，故事，基本设定和经费不低且比较讨喜的像素制作，0分交给被这款游戏毁到支离破碎的回合制战棋模式。

author: {'steamid': '76561197975900299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1614717097}
review:
Great premise and cute art offer so much promise in the first few minutes. 

Then terrible design decisions keep piling up. You keep waiting for the game to keep its initial tantalizing promise but it never does. Terrible randomized loot; inconsistent rewards; insane roller coaster of difficulty; and occasional bugs. 

I suppose my playtime technically means I got my money's worth, but frankly I did not enjoy all but the first hour of it, and the rest was trying to chase a pipe dream. I'm OK not getting my money back, but boy do I want my time back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028926033', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1555147578}
review:
Nem rossz kis indie játék. Én átneveztem volna Anti-John Wick Simulator-nak, mert amennyi kutyát le kell lőnöd, hogy az valami elképesztő. Nehéz belegondolni, hogy a németek katonánként két kutyát vittek anno magukkal a száraz sivatagba.

Hangulatos grafika, kellemes inventory rendszer, jópofák a hangok és a zenék. Tetszenek ezek a véletlen események és a valódi randomitás a lootokban. Ami külön tetszett, hogy az első küldetés után kicsit meg voltam ijedve, hogy ez nagyon rövid lesz, de később kiderült, hogy igencsak terjedelmes a küldetéssorozat.

Az egyetlen negatív amit ki tudok emelni, az sajnos pont a legfontosabb része a játéknak: 
De először is szögezzük le, hogy nem a monotonitás a probléma a játékkal, ahogy sok külföldi kritika írja. Engem speciel nem zavar, ha sok dolog ismétlődik. A probléma az, ha valami ami "szar", na az ismétlődik. És itt most a harcrendszerre gondolok. Átláthatatlan, hogy hol van fal, hol nincs, hol tudsz átmenni, hol tudsz átlátni, stb. HA az ellenség "abmush"-t, azaz orvtámadást hajt végre, vagy lesből támad, akkor valójában te ambusholod öket, ami eléggé WTF logika. Több harcot éltem túl sebződés nélkül ambush alatt, mint mikor én támadtam hátba az ellenséget.

Overall 06/10 számomra.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961994959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1571068909}
review:
This game is infuriating! It has the framework to be something awesome but the devs apparently think RNG is more important than the gameplay and the story. If this is an attempt to seem more "X-COM-y", well then it falls flat on its behind! 

So what's wrong?
The smaller things:
Stuff like raiding a fuel depot only to find 0 fuel is just... dumb... It takes all the strategy and reasoning for doing gambles and optional encounters out of the game. It turns it into a "lootbox" game - which basically seem to be a contious desision seeing how the loot appears like it is actual lootboxes... an odd choise in a strategy game?
There are tons of points like this ... but that would literally take up WAY too much space.

The big stuff:
The only hard thing about this game is some of the RNG. Sadly - this isn't even a combat issue, but rather the way they choose to give out loot. You can stroll through this game with no issues - and then run an easy mission and not even get half way through it if the RNG desides to be against you - like you getting 0 fuel and dying with NO way of countering it! It's dumb - it's BAD design - and makes me not wanting to play it ever again.
- And pray you don't get crappy RNG and get no ammo ... you kill tons of units who all shoot (and would have ammo on them) however - again - the loot is F-ed up RNG and you have - again - no way of countering it. Good luck winning fights if you didn't bring melee characters (because they are WAY too OP and make the game even easier!)... Try punching a 100 HP+Armor unit to death at 5 damage a turn... yeah ... great ... Thanks Robotality!


Also - the combat is VERY limited. At first it seems to be fairly detailed and complex, but it's just the same thing over and over and over... 

Also - some of the classes makes no sense ... They are just dead weight - however it's not really an issue since the game is so easy... and no ... that's not a good thing! LOL

This game could be SOOOOO good - and most upsetting of all seems to have the system in place to make it so, however the dev apprently don't understand/don't have the vision to take it from a very MEH experience to something great and unique. If I had been on the dev/design team for this game, I can insure you a lot of encounters would be a lot more fun! LOL ... A quick example - you are fighting nazsolds, zombies and cultist... How can there be 0... ZERO real boss fights? And no a souped up normal mob is NOT a boss...

I honnestly think they just got lazy - or rushed to release - whatever it was this is a damn shame... So close yet so very very VERY far!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970434679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1719, 'last_played': 1557090335}
review:
Pathway is a strategy game set in an Indiana Jones-style world, where you have to save the world from occult threats from Nazis and cultists.

There are five procedurally-generated adventures to go through, although you are likely to require several attempts at them - you keep all your unlocks, equipment, character levels and team between each attempt, although any critically injured team members from the previous mission are unavailable. The game moves between a strategy map to move around and a tactical map for battles. Much of the game is resource management - fuel to move around the strategic map and ammo to fight battles, requiring players to pick their battles carefully. The tactical map is essentially very similar to the recent XCOM game: limited items, cover, move and shoot.

Pathway is a simple game, but it's reasonably effective. It will probably take a few tries and fails to get the hang of it, and then you'll be fine. The procedural generation can result in a lot of repeated encounters so it might wear after a while. Sometimes also the random nature of finding things - particularly fuel and ammo - can result in some frustrating failures if the RNG is particularly unkind, although you can mitigate this with care. The graphics are cute, and the music is well done.

Ultimately, the game's a decent independent production worth the price tag - you should get quite a few hours of fun out of it, although it is by no means a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978499328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1555832645}
review:
For someone who normally doesn't enjoy rogue-likes I have to say this game is an absolute delight!
Like a mix between a boardgame, FTL and XCOM.

I've played three out of five adventures so far and haven't gotten bored yet.

Really fun and addictive gameplay, nice music, pixel graphics and a great atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104946121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1555655714}
review: I enjoy it

author: {'steamid': '76561198027358808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1555571139}
review:
I really, really wanted to like this game. There is a real scarcity of good roguelikes and Tactical strategy games. I found that this game scratched none of those itches.

The progression system is designed such that there is very little real depth, items are always just better or worse (rarely any inbetween), and character progression is incredibly stale. 

The combat is by far the worse part of this game. It is incredibly one dimension, either playing super defensive kiting or playing super aggressive to wipe enemies out before they can hit you. There's very little depth to it, just shoot or melee.

I was hyper excited to play this game but in the end it's way too tedious and not enough fun. I was sorely dissapointed despite really wanting to enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972162607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1699843352}
review: It's like a make your own Indiana Jones adventure. I sunk almost ten hours into it on my first day. Amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962573105', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1555608125}
review: Como fan de las películas de Indiana Jones, le tenía muchas ganas a este juego. La primera hostia en la cara, que no está traducido al castellano. Pero bueno, acostumbrado que estoy ultimamente, puedo pasarlo por alto. No hace falta mucho tiempo jugado para llevarte un par de hostias mas. A pesar de que afirman que cada partida es diferente, no da esa sensación. Los eventos se repiten, muchos están vacíos o son combates. Ay, los combates. Que dolor de cabeza... Ojala no tuviera que decir esto, pero el Curious Expedition está mucho mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974313093', 'num_games_owned': 2076, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1555163609}
review:
I initially enjoyed it... But then I began to realise that the combat is just a pain. The AI consistently flanks you with no real regard for its own positioning, so you take damage most of the time with no real counter (only one char has an overwatch mechanic, and even that is limited).

Game looks lovely, and is a nice idea, it's just that the mechanics only feel half-baked.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993901497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1555457343}
review:
The combat is easy to win, but that isn't the goal. This is a game about minimizing attrition, you want to make perfect clears of the encounters if at all possible. Combat may be simple but I also think that is totally acceptable when the game is then asking you to execute cleanly as well.

The issue I feel is that I feel like the developers don't have a great sense of how to scale this out. It's hard to briefly summarize the various issues I'm seeing for a review; most every system looked okay at first blush but by the time I was working on the 4th and 5th scenario I found myself blurting out "Really? Is this what we are doing now?".

I think there is potential here still, but it's going to take a lot of polish to get there. For now I can't recommend the game. Check back in a few months though, maybe a different story by then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030382038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1602980263}
review:
Do not waste your time or money buying this yet.  It is weak and thin.  

I tried to jump in and explore this game and see if I could enjoy it.  I am an enthusiast of the genre of turn based combat.  I just could not find anything this game currently offers to keep me interested or care about to keep playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973934801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1616499550}
review:
TL;DR overall very solid IMO but a few quirks to iron out.

As an avid player of FTL, XCOM, Slay the spire, DOS2, what have you ... I've thoroughly enjoyed the game so far (end of part 2). Positives include a great design, pretty cool encounters, interesting map navigation and tactics during fights. Negatives include a few (non breaking) bugs here and there, some weird accuracy/range/hit interactions, and that's mostly it. Difficulty is alright so far especially considering there are options to tame it down a little bit if necessary for better enjoyment. It is overall a rather challenging game during the action, but more forgiving mechanics ease this significantly imo (in the sense that you cannot actually lose your characters, they just keep on growing).

author: {'steamid': '76561198128741809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1680451206}
review:
MODIFICATION DE L'EVALUATION, VERSION 1.1.3 :

Pas mal de choses ont changé au fil des différentes mises à jour. Le jeu c'est bonifié et a gagné en profondeur tout en corrigeant certains de ses défauts. Pathway demeure excellent et reste plus que jamais recommandable.

Points positifs :

- de nombreux ajouts de gameplay, tout en conservant une grande simplicité de prise en main

- de nouvelles compétences pour les personnages donnent d'avantage de profondeur stratégique aux affrontements

- de nouvelles maps et de nouveaux événements permettent de casser la répétitivité

- de nouveaux items permettent de renouveler l'intérêt des parties

- temps de chargement moins longs, problèmes d'optimisation moins nombreux

Points négatifs :

- encore quelques petits problèmes d'optimisation ici et là

- la difficulté générale à été revue à la baisse


EVALUATION INITIALE :

Un tactical au tour par tour dans un univers qui s'inspire de celui d'Indiana Jones, voilà une promesse qui m'a fait me ruer sur ce jeu.

J’ai été un peu déçu sur les premières heures de jeu. L’ambiance est bien là, finement travaillée, avec cette BO incroyable ! Mais je trouvais le gameplay très sommaire, loin d’un XCOM ou d’un Invisible Inc.

Et puis j’ai changé d’avis en avançant dans la progression du jeu, et surtout en débloquant de nouveaux personnages. Le level design permet petit à petit de varier les situations de jeu. De nouvelles capacités apparaissent au fur et et à mesure que le roster grandit, et permettent une plus grande complémentarité entre les membres de l’équipe. La dimension stratégique du jeu gagne en profondeur (merci aux snipers qui permettent enfin de créer des embuscades).

Alors certes le jeu n’a pas la profondeur tactique d’un XCOM, certaines limitations sont un peu crispantes, et l'optimisation laisse pour le moment à désirer, avec des ralentissements et des temps de chargement trop longs. Mais Pathway reste un jeu charmant, amusant et prometteur !

author: {'steamid': '76561197993030957', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1557161488}
review:
Fun game.  Its like a dumbed down xcom with rogue like variety.  Char progression and inventory remains through future playthroughs so you feel a sense of progression.

The skill trees are pretty basic but there are def a variety of ways 1 char could end up with different strenghts and weaknesses.  

Its a turn based strategy game, you go, i go kind of concept.  You get up to 4 chars in your party.  2 you start out with choosing from a variety of unlockable chars and then you can save or recruit more during the missions giving you up to a party of 4.

The enemies in the chapters seem to have different strats and abilities.  Im up to the 3rd chapter and each one is uniquely different in the maps, enemies and random events.

It does feel a little "Lite" and would certainly love to see more content added in the future.  

I do recommend this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006647933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1648067457}
review:
Great potential but unfortunately it gets boring very fast. All the encounters look alike and there isn't any customisation. You just go from mission to mission where you need to traverse a map with points of interest while keeping an eye on your feul. Renowned Explorers did this before, and quite frankly, they didn't entertain me for long neither. Battles get boring soon too and there really isn't any depth. People comparing this to  XCOM- and stating that it is a Light version of the game, really need to play XCOM some more. 

Ofcourse things might change as the game is out for only a few days, but in this state I cannot recommend the game. I will put in a refund and keep an eye on it if it will improve in the future. Shame really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970637747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1616353072}
review: Great game!  Having a lot of fun with it.  Keep in mind its a very inexpensive game.  If it was $40, I might feel differently, but at $16 its a great light strategy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969388723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1674749372}
review:
Edit - postive review  : the game is now ok and has been corrected. very enjoyable .



Original negative review : well.. the game is really nicely put. It is appealing by its atmosphere and setup. I like the general idea of fighting nazis and the occult. It does forcibly have nice Indiana Jones fouch to it.

The combat are very simple and not really a big challenge. Yet they are not necessarly why I wanted to play the game. I was really looking forward to play a story book.

But but but... it is really repetitive. I am on the second scenario, second part, and I already feel bored but how repetitive the events are. This is to me the major flaw so far. And I do have only 4 hours in. So I am not sure I want to go on ...

All those events that are always showing again and again just break my immersion a lot.

I really think there is a huge potential to this game. A bit like The Curious Expedition or even games like Star Traders.

Pathway is presenting itself like a rogue-like.

I have no doubt it is a rogue-like : you will die. And your characters will get stronger to figth all the way to the end eacth time you replay. And you will unlock new characters to help you along.

I believe a good rogue-like set some milestones to achieve and overcome with, in between those, lot of different ways and events who need randomization to not make the game less boring and repetitive. 
Pathway does fail flat on that part and does not succeed on keeping my interest and curiosity because the events are just always the same. It even happen to me that I've got the same event 3 times in row...

So I will say maybe wait a few months and see if the devs will address that specific game design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032665641', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1555395975}
review:
Interesting formula, it's fun for a few hours but gets tedious eventually. It has alot of potential, perhaps the devs/publishers would consider allowing mods?

The tactical turnbased combat is satisfying for a bit, very XCOM like, only it lacks real depth. The game forces you to switch up your team so everytime you play (after you fail an attempt) feels fresh, but there's only so many combinations before the game feels like it drags on.

The fact your progress matters and is saved between attempts is fun and different, it feels like you're driving a caravan through the harsh desert surrounded by enemies. However it's very grindy in that sense, because loot matters.

The random events feel unnecessary at times.. like a loading screen in the middle of a zone that's already loaded, perhaps those events that do nothing at all other than waste time should be removed.

The level up choices are quite limited, but they do allow you to make highly specialized characters. The issue is that you're rail roaded because of the lack of choice.

This concoction of being forced to mix up your team and the two different types of enemies you can face in a fight can give you the feeling that you've bested a tricky foe. This feeling is rare though, i've felt it only twice. There are some pleasant/unpleasant surprises hidden in the game, based on how things go.

My last gripe is that you might feel robbed after certain events or occurances. For example in one of my runs, i had run out of fuel but i had plenty of medical equipment, pushing my team across the desert, 2 members instantly died when i was expecting them to become revivable. It was a good run and i felt disappointed that it ended like that. I learned from that mistake ofcourse, but it certainly felt like a warning prompt was missing about that, since until that point nothing "instantly killed" your guys.

I might revisit this game again after some time. It has lots of potential and it can definitely become something amazing and memorable. Still recommending it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045059867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1555440694}
review: I got bored of this game really fast. It doesn't have the replayability or variety of events to keep you engaged like FTL does. I'd say this is closer to a Jagged Alliance: Flashback type game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014863727', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1555463563}
review:
I really should have read the other reviews before buying, and I'm glad Steam allows refunds these days.

The idea for this game is great, but the implementation is tedious and boring. Combat is the core of the game, and it's shallow and boring. Doing anything but moving and shooting uses up limited resources that don't come back at the end of the fight. The between-fights map is uninspired, the non-combat encounters are sketched in.

I hope somebody looks at this idea and makes a game that's actually fun to play.

Aesthetics and music are great.

It is not a bad game for the price, but FTL and Into the Breach are in this same price range and are far more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967976610', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1555383266}
review:
Nice art, but that's about it.

Game gets very repetitive and unable to advance in the story style with the characters you like.
Items are not limited in usage per mission, but by stock, so good luck getting a good item to use.
Leveling up characters is almost pointless,

Steam/Valve need to more reasonably consider refunding/un-selling games that do not live up to an expectation and demos need to be set for all games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064403976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1555022553}
review: The combat isn't complex enough to be as interesting as the XCOM it's trying to emulate. And in the overworld where the FTL influence is clear, it's never as varied or interesting as that game, either. The most it has going for it is the pulpy, Indiana Jones aesthetic, but that's nowhere near enough to keep it interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041704289', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1555398446}
review: I don't usually write reviews but I feel the need to warn people about what to expect with this game. People are saying that this game is like FTL but for fans of FTL, you probably wont like this game. The combat is entirely different and because it takes so long to get through each one, it's the majority of the game. Now, I could say that the combat is "like" XCOM but this game does not live up to that standard at all. Its got a couple simple turn-based combat mechanics but it gets repetitive after the first fight. Nothing changes that when you level either. The leveling system makes you choose between 1~4 choices that mostly affect stats and not playstyle. Playstyle comes from the starting "ability" to hold a weapon type or armor type. Even so, there's only a handful of weapon and armor types and the game doesn't make up for anything with its use items (which are so basic they bring no value either). So you end up clicking the same few things over and over through the whole game. It's this combat with a lackluster leveling system that goes on, because of the odd unit visibility/AI mechanics, for far too long to be considered fun. I love Chucklefish. I think Robotality has a good foundation for a fun game here but I also think they're doing what a lot of devs do and just polish something under-developed because game making is hard. If more content were to be released or updates that add a significantly larger amount of variation to exist, I would happily change my review and hopefully play the game past the first two adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028020795', 'num_games_owned': 6567, 'num_reviews': 502, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1555220936}
review:
[quote][h1]Full review (including score): https://youtu.be/xj0peuiBoZE
Written review below![/h1][/quote]
[h1]The rundown:[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Nice pixel graphics and soundtrack
+ Cool progression system
+ Expansive adventure design
[b]Cons:[/b]
- Repetitive gameplay
- Lackluster combat
- Boring upgrade trees

I’m sure that the comparison has already been made countless times, but Pathway really is what you’d get if FTL were to meet Indiana Jones. The pixel art and soundtrack are nice, the progression system is cool, and even the map design is noteworthy. However, the game is brought down by its very repetitive gameplay and lackluster combat.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*][b]Nice pixel graphics and soundtrack.[/b] Pathway is pretty much the pixel-art equivalent of Indiana Jones. Everything from its setting, to its characters, and even its soundtrack all help in establishing this. It definitely works in the game’s favor though, as the pixel art is excellent and the various effects layered on top of it look great, especially when it comes to lighting. In fact, I would say that the game’s art and soundtrack were my favorite things about it.

[*][b]Cool progression system.[/b] Although Pathway is a strategy RPG, it does borrow from the rogue-like genre. The maps are procedurally generated, the loot is random, and dying kicks you right out of it. Fortunately, the game has a progression system to go along with this, allowing you to make bits of progress even if you fail an adventure. Not only is money carried over, but items can also be saved and then transferred to characters back at home base. As such, if you come across a certain weapon during an adventure that you cannot equip at the time, it may be worth saving it for those back at base rather than selling it right there. As someone that’s not really a fan of the whole permadeath trend in rogue-likes, this was a nice way to balance the game’s sense of progression.

[*][b]Expansive adventure design.[/b] The gameplay may have its problems (more on that later), but at least the map design is pretty cool. Each run in the game takes the form of an “adventure”, where you are plopped down onto a map full of events and tasked with reaching the end of it. Sometimes these adventures even span multiple maps, having you travel between countries. The game does provide a simplistic story to go along with these adventures as well, all of which could definitely be something straight out of Indiana Jones. In fact, the game’s second adventure is basically the plot behind Raiders of the Lost Ark. This, combined with the art and soundtrack I mentioned before, makes for some pretty cool adventure design.[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*][b]Repetitive gameplay.[/b] While I do like the way the adventures are designed in this game, it unfortunately does not provide the gameplay to match. If you’ve ever played FTL, this game is basically laid out the same way, but with events that really aren’t all that exciting. Half of the time, moving to a new space presents you with the same recycled “there’s nothing here” or “enemies set up an ambush here”, with little difference between such encounters. It’s not long before you start seeing the same events reused again and again. For a game that encourages exploration, this pretty much kills the fun in it.

[*][b]Lackluster combat.[/b] The combat in Pathway is pretty much your standard turn-based tactics gameplay. It’s definitely passable, but for a game that relies on it so heavily, it really lacks depth and doesn’t feel fun to play over and over. There’s maybe two abilities max per character and even then, many of them are very situational, so you’re pretty much stuck using basic attacks for most of the game. Considering that enemies are conveniently placed four or five HP above the damage you deal with one character, you end up falling into the loop of “move here, attack, end turn, take damage, attack again, and move away”. It also doesn’t help that there’s no stealth in combat, so there’s really no point in trying to hide from enemies.

On top of that, there are a few technical issues with the combat. The first being that it is oftentimes hard to judge where your line of sight will be after moving. It may look like you have a clear line of sight to a certain enemy, but after moving, you’ll find that the line of sight is more restricted than it appeared. If there was an undo function, this would not be a problem, but movement is permanent as it stands.

The AI is also a pretty big issue. You would think that, given the simplicity of the combat, the AI would at least be somewhat decent, but it seemed like every other fight, the AI would pull some stupid move that doesn’t accomplish anything. Running away from me when I’m low and they have full HP? Check. Aimlessly moving back and forth and not coming to help his teammates? Check. Running up next to me and not doing anything? Also check. Really, the AI as a whole could definitely use some improvement.

[*][b]Boring upgrade trees.[/b] Pathway sells itself as a “strategy RPG”, but when you get to the RPG side of things, the skill trees are pretty disappointing. Instead of providing cool perks and unique upgrades, the vast majority of the skills are simple stat boosts that really don’t feel like they have that much of an effect. On top of that, you level so slowly that it really just isn’t worth your time to seek out XP. I actually ended up skipping out on most of the battles I came across for this reason.[/list]

[h1]Overall:[/h1]
Pathway may look nice and have a cool progression system, but the core gameplay is simply too lackluster and repetitive to be worth the recommendation. It’s a shame, because I quite liked the adventure design, but there are far better games out there that do the same thing.

Follow my [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/3215371]Steam Curator Page[/url][/b] for more reviews + videos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198835255197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3204, 'last_played': 1602804884}
review:
52hrs into the game.

Positives: Very fun battle system, the environment  is a great part (if there was more variety it would have more replay value), the graphics and music just flood me with Indiana Jones movies, the characters are fairly fun and play into the era type really well, really reminds me of FFtactics which is again a huge positive, and using the adjustments can really add a level replay to it.

Negatives: Variety. In characters, skills, enemies, land setting, choices (that have more impact), no customization the player can adjust (colour, or visual change from different clothing) and I could go on but again its variety related and if you have played the game or will you will come across this issue.

Overall: LOVE IT! I honestly am completely addicted, its fun and hard enough to keep adjusting the setting to find a sweet spot. It just pains me that this game could have been more. Variety of so many things would have made this an instant epic game. 

Things Dev could fix: 
1.Music, lengthen and add please; the atmosphere in this game gives it it's true charm and if they even changed that alone it would be a massive upgrade.
2. User Characters. Lengthen the skill tree or add levels to the characters so there is more re-play. give the people depth, maybe even add individual squences along the path that are more meaningful to the individual characters. Again the bare bones are all there just a bit of polish and it will do miles for you.
3. Enemies - pleaaassseeeee add more enemies. Give me some differences, I can only kill so many of the same dogs. I honestly have PTSD when I hear dog's sigh, NO DOGGYYY NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198256323625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1600604250}
review:
推薦原因是美術很漂亮，另外是我很喜歡這遊戲的音效 (SE)，
背景音樂 (BGM) 雖然好聽，但一直重複也挺煩的 XD

覺得遊戲設計有點問題，先撇開視窗操作有點障礙，
在資源過少的情況下，我過程中盡可能去尋找商店買油，車很容易沒油，
而且戰鬥取得的東西通常不太好，除了每一關最後的戰鬥除外。

還有手榴彈很爛，因為設計上是利用地形迴避的關係，
所以怪物基本上都不太站在一起，
範圍太小、傷害太低，裝手榴彈不如帶把刀，省子彈。

最後就是殭屍數量多，走得又慢，把敵人回合時間拖得很長……

總而言之，算是很有潛力的遊戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090750916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1555404805}
review:
S’il y a bien une chose que le jeu vidéo partage avec le cinéma, c’est l’amour des nazis. Robotality le prouve encore une fois, en servant un rogue-like inspiré du héro qui toucha du fouet le cœur de nombreux enfants, et beaucoup de soldats de la Wehrmacht aussi : Indiana Jones. Avec une structure en forme de Faster Than Light et des mécaniques de combat inspirées d’X-Com, on voit difficilement ce qui pourrait mal se passer pour le studio. Partons donc explorer leur édifice de pixels, mais n’oubliez pas : si vous volez un bibelot sur l’autel, tout s’effondrera. 

Pavé d'impressions complètes et illustrées sur La Gazette du Game : 
https://lagazettedugame.com/2019/04/16/pathway/

author: {'steamid': '76561198035886796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1555261297}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974187125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1555389794}
review:
This game HAD a lot of potential.

- Good visuals, art, environment (nice 2d shadows) and incredible music.
- Awful game design.

"Duuuu-de I had an idea for our indiana jones-like roguelike game"
"Yeah? What is it? Cool temples with logic puzzles? or maybe traps? treasures? or maybe relics that give you powers?"
"No man, that's boring!!!1111one"
"Then what is it?"
"I want to kill dogs man! with a knife, I want to slice some dog fucking throats and hear them die, and watch them die slowly in the sand"
"YEAH DUDE THAT SOUNDS AWESOME LETS MAKE THE PLAYER KILL DOGS"
"THEY WILL LOVE THIS GAME"

author: {'steamid': '76561198136447385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1557200069}
review: I have a MAC so I was excited to see I could play this game. I really like this game when I can play it. Sadly since sunday I'm just able to get the loading screen with the two characters and it crashes. I thought the issue would have been fixed by now but it hasnt. I really liked the game when I could play it though.
developer_response: Hey Newland, we fixed a lot of crashes and technical issues since release. Also, we added many new features recently. If the game still does not work please contact us at "hello@robotality.com" so that we can try to sort out your issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018192531', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1652380032}
review:
Having an absolute blast with this one. Indiana Jones-ish rogue-like with some elements of FTL, RPG-lite character advancement, squad-based combat, and a big batch of characters. The recruitment and recovery system is well-conceived. Very easy to tweak difficulty to make it your own level of "fun." Lots of stuff to unlock. Devs are responsive and involved.

Hits all the buttons for me. Very glad I picked it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058740391', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1572783335}
review:
The game looks promising but as is often the case looks are deceiving. I could write an extensive review later but right now I'm feeling lazy. To the art of a Pros/Cons list we go.

Pros:

- A lot of characters to pick and unlock, this is however also a con. More on that below.

- Combat is smooth, nothing deep but it has a nice pace to it at least.

Painfully short pros I'm afraid.

Cons:

- Characters. None of the unlockables are really worth a damn since skills are weapon and armor based, not character based. So all shotgunners have the same abilities, all machine gunners as well, etc. Aside from slight +/- quirks, there is no difference between them.

*Characters do have "unique" skill trees, often these are simply another characters skill tree in a different order with one or two unique skills. Important to note that these skills are passive buffs, not abilities.

- Grinding. One of the biggest but not my biggest gripes is the grinding. Enjoy replaying mission 1 several times to get medicine for mission 2. Then again for mission 3. See the problem?

- Missions are incredibly damn boring. There is little to no story aside from the start and end of each and even this is.. pathetic.

- Events are surprisingly shallow and boring. Attack or don't are often what your options boil down to. Sometimes you get an event a specific character can have a spicy third option for but in my experience and others, these just always fail. I never had one succeed.

- *Nothing* is deep in this game. Looting, combat, events, story, grinding. There is no depth to anything. I'm fine with some things being incredibly simple but everything? 

- There is no variety in what you fight or what you do. Enjoy the same event 7 times and fighting the same Nazis in every battle.

Ultimately the game is a let down. I had high hopes and purchased it despite negative reviews, but please don't make the same mistake. I will change the review as updates are made, since the developers at least *say* they want to make the necessary changes but I'm skeptical personally. Keep your eyes on it for a little and see if anything major changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000854522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1556503209}
review:
Relatively shallow game game. Starts off interesting, but the quirk runs out quickly. Random events get extremely repetitive and it's not uncommon to see the same style events on a single map. 
Only 5 core missions, but they do get longer as go through them. 
Lots of characters, but the differences between them aren't dramatic other than weapon choice.         

Overall? Meh. Get it on sale, but full price was a bad purchase for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979536926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1637006112}
review:
I'm a huge fan of Indiana Jones and I've played nearly every official Indiana Jones Game (Fate of Atlantis, Infernal Machine, Emperor's Tomb, etc.) and too many Indy knockoffs to count.  Pathway is easily one of the best Indy inspired game available.  I haven't beaten the game yet but I can say with confidence that this is a truly addictive and all-out-fun experience.

I noticed a few minor bugs that I'm sure will be fixed soon (enemies getting stuck in walls) but that didn't hurt my experience.  My message to the developer: Job well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040439394', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 40, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1712064406}
review:
BLUF: Fun strategy/exploration game that mixes lite versions of XCOM combat and FTL resource management and exploration with an Indiana Jones theme.
Combat is turn based like the XCOM game series, but lacks some of the depth of it. If you want to keep things simple, that's a good thing. However, if you want in depth leveling and abilities, you'll find it lacking.
Adventures (campaigns) work similar to an FTL run. You go from point to point on a map with your party, managing ammo and fuel along the way and encountering randomly placed events.
Prior to starting an adventure, you can pick 2 of your unlocked characters to start out with. Sometimes, you'll find more party members during the adventure that you can keep with you for the rest of that run, or decline to join. Characters are permanently unlocked from the roster by completing various milestones, such as kills, repairs, or in one case, finishing a campaign with an all girl squad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034937095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1556220154}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078288067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1557567937}

Von mir Daumen hoch! Soundtrack ist genial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008856189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1340, 'last_played': 1663619364}
review:
Simple fun combat, interesting resource management, all wrapped up with enjoyable graphics with a great aesthetic. Character progression is interesting with small tweaks on each character making them feel different, and with the chance of getting any one of the characters while on a longer adventure can shake things up.

Easily worth the $16, certainly worth checking out.

I see a lot of complaints that combat isn't as deep as X-COM, which I can see, the combat is simple. I find it's more similar to something like Fire Emblem, Advanced Wars, Front Mission or Final Fantasy Tactics, with a good deal of ChuckleFish's games harkening back to these classics, the general style and flow of the combat makes sense to me and didn't seem lacking.

If you're looking for a multi-layered combat Tactical RPG that will keep you on the edge of your seat, you will probably want to stick to X-COM. If you're looking for a fun little adventure game where you kill pixel Zombies and Nazis, Pathway is a great option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034950181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1555346738}
review: Neat concept, the Indiana-Jones like exploring feels fresh and interesting. Sadly the combat, the main gameplay aspect of this game, is shallow and uninteresting. No micromanagement like FTL nore strategic depth like X-Com, you and the enemy trade shots until someone dies. I really wanted to like this game but I can't, sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037640050', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1555272034}
review:
Seems a little unfinished. Good idea and base system, but not a lot of content or polish. 

A lot of annoying UI and interface issues, dumb AI, a lot of systems that never really get used or matter, poor balancing, not many new challenges after playing the first campaign.

Feels like an early access game that could get better. I might check in on it later but would not recommend it in the current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257778274', 'num_games_owned': 9625, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1591505257}
review:
目前这个1.07版本，想要购买还是请仔细考虑一下，玩了20个小时简单写写
游戏是以探险寻宝为背景进行冒险的游戏，但游戏战斗重复度极高，战斗模式也比较固定

[h1]敌人[/h1]
游戏只有两种怪，由纳粹和兄弟会组成
纳粹8种，2种狗，6种各异的纳粹步兵
兄弟会5种，女祭司、信徒和3种僵尸
你的全部敌人就由这13种怪组成，而且不存什么BOSS，强力boss之类的
没有城堡机器人，没有动力盔甲的纳粹不是好纳粹……
一群狂热的邪教召唤了半天除了把自己炸成一团碎肉什么厉害玩意也没招出来……

[h1]故事线[/h1]
玩法就是选择一张图，然后走格子，随机触发战斗或者事件，每走一步都会消耗油，没油了可以选择放弃或者扣血，走到终点就算任务胜利。
关卡很少，就5关，打完了就是反复刷刷耍了
首次打的时候可以设置敌人强度、血量和自身补给子弹、油的数量，打过一次以后可以设置一天的长度，游戏解锁全人物和刷橙装可能是唯一的乐趣了，橙装最后两关都会出，最后一关流程短一点

[h1]战斗[/h1]
战斗就是一个策略战棋了，回合制进行，你拍一我拍一，两个小孩吹牛逼
命中敌人(+1)、暴击(+2)、闪避(+1)、加血(+1)、修甲(+1)都能获得勇气值，勇气值够了就可以使用武器技能或者中立技能等，可以帮助你AOE敌人或者增加躲闪率，减伤伤害等
游戏的命中设定很奇特，完美效仿XCOM，虽然大部分枪械贴脸100%命中，但是贴脸匕首或者霰弹枪才是最好的选择，狙击枪这个武器命中低的让你无法忍受，各种打不中
刚开始还有点意思，千篇一律的敌人加上不怎么让人惊喜的奖励，后面就战斗相当无聊，我的内心毫无波动甚至有点想吃黄焖鸡。
游戏中没有真正的死亡，被打死了有个KO值，在这期间内加血都能救回来，如果都死了也只是关卡失败，当只有一个人物的时候默认会失败，第一次死的只剩下一个人会给你补一只小狗狗，失败了也没事500刀买活或者再选其他角色开一局游戏就满血复活了！

[h1]人物角色[/h1]
多个角色也算是这游戏的特点了，但是目前做的还不够好，目前一共可以使用16个角色，就算没有解锁，在关卡游戏中招募队友的时候也有小概率招募到，我不确定是不是bug我招募到过一次我没解锁的角色，也招募过两个相同的角色（可以看我游戏截图）。
我是玩了将近20个小时，目前感觉人物没什么特别的特点都差不多，无非就是触发的事件不一样。
天赋制作的一般般，无法就是加点属性多穿点装备，多用点武器，武器伤害高点，没有加不出什么大技能……而且不能洗点
当你小队第一次死到只剩下一人的时候会有一只可爱的小狗狗加入队伍，这个小狗狗并不会体现在队伍选择菜单里，一个人一条狗装备全靠捡的生活你就不要想了。

[h1]装备[/h1]
这可是非常让我不爽的一个部分
首先装备栏是有限制的，你除了吉普车里的10个格子和人物身上，过关以后没有仓库让你放收藏品，你可以升级子弹上限，可以升级油箱，但是你这破车不能加个货箱我多装点东西吗，我考古挣那么多钱我就不能换个坦克开开吗！
10个格子非常有限，加血物品和修补装甲的物品以及手雷都是必需品，但是物品能装的上限太少了，手雷这玩意只能装3个一组？您不能修改一下库存多放点，身上多装点，这做的太偷懒了。
其次，装备竟然不会改变队友的外形，这就太偷懒了吧，我穿了液压装甲，这么帅气的重甲，还是个原始的草包造型，这我真心不能忍，做个皮也好啊。你穿或者不穿，都是这个样子。
游戏设置了几个品质，白色，蓝色，紫色，橙色。我目前见过最好的就是橙装，橙装的突击步枪Burst Fire 可是一次打5个格子的（按鼠标滚轮调整方向）
武器分类（影响武器技能）：手枪、猎枪、突击步枪、狙击枪、粉碎者(激光枪)、刀和手雷
装甲分类（影响中立技能）：轻甲、中甲、重甲

[h1]成就系统[/h1]
这游戏可是自带成就系统的，边打边弹成就给奖励这也算个特点，不过这个系统非常之坑爹，这弹出的成就要你自己手动点领取的，不然可就没了，刚开始不知道我损失了好多东西。人物满足特定的条件自动解锁，比如闪避75次，全女性角色通关等等。
当你使用特定的枪械杀够敌人，可是奖励橙色武器的，记得一定要点击一下奖励拿到，不然没了可是欲哭无泪。

[h1]结论[/h1]
游戏算是中规中矩，玩起来尚可，游戏中不少梗还是挺逗的，虽然说是寻宝，但是那些宝物一点都不值钱，也不让人心动。游戏虽然有一些特点，但是耐玩性有待提升，后续还是期待丰富关卡和敌人种类，自身也可以增加一些独特的装备和玩法，比如小狗狗，机械类的盟友，甚至僵尸，装备系统体现到人物身上模型并不会改变，这让我非常不爽，帅气的橙装还是那个土鳖样。我都好几万刀的存款了，也只能开这个破jeep，我就不能换个坦克开开，或者整个飞机，一次飞几个格子？

author: {'steamid': '76561198010100365', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1645133611}
review:
Das Spiel hat einen tollen Grafikstil und die Idee einer Kombination aus XCOM und FTL im Indiana Jones Setting ist natürlich sehr verlockend.

Leider hat das Spiel extrem wenig Tiefgang, der Level-Up-Progress ist super-langsam und die skillbaren Punkte nicht wirklich motivierend (bislang nur Stats-Boni). Es gibt nur sehr wenige verschiedene Gegner-Typen und 4 Waffen-Typen ohne zusätzlich erlernbare Perks.
(Die vorhandenen Perks stecken schon im jeweiligen Charakter.)

Ehrlich gesagt war schon nach 2 Stunden ziemlich die Luft raus.
Hab's dann noch ein wenig weiter gespielt, in der Hoffnung, da käme noch was.
Naja ... hätte es lieber refunden sollen. Jetzt leider zu spät.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099131436', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1555266110}
review:
Als ich die Bilder gesehen habe, musst ich es haben.
Beim spielen habe ich mich ziemlich schnell gelangweilt. Muss aber auch zugeben, nicht länger als 100 Minuten gespielt zu haben. Danach habe ich das Game zurückgegeben.

Hier ein paar Punkte die mich nicht überzeugen konnten:
- Ausserhalb der Kämpfe fährt Mann/Frau mit einem Jeep zu den verschiedenen Knotenpunkte um möglichst schnell zum Finale zu kommen. Laut Hersteller gibt es ca. 400 kurze Events, die nach einem Zufallsprinzip erscheinen. Nicht immer wird dort gekämpft. In vielen Fällen muss eine Entscheidung getroffen werden (z.B. umkehren oder Baumstamm überqueren, Sarg öffnen, Eingang betreten). Danach wird nach einem mir nicht bekannten System gewürfelt... leider erhalte ich keine Prozentangabe wie hoch die Erfolgs-Change mit meinen Protagonisten ist! Viele Male konnte ich wegen eines fehlenden Geschicks die Aktion nicht ausführen.
- Jede Reise zu einem Knotenpunkt kostet eine Spritration. Wenn der Tank leer ist, so geht es zu Fuss weiter. Leider kostet dies bei jedem Zug Lebenspunkte, welche einem im nächsten Kampf fehlen. Die Benzinrationen sind schon im ersten Level ziemlich klein.
- Die kämpfe sind OK. Der Bewegungsbereich wird zwar richtig schön dargestellt, leider aber nicht der Kampfbereich. Zwar sehe ich anhand der Farbe des Feindes die ob ich nach dem Zug einen Angriff starten kann. Bei anderen Titeln wird aber auch dort die Angriffsfläche vor dem Zug angezeigt. Wenn ich mich nämlich bewege, so war dies mein Zug... es gibt kein Zurück mehr! Die meisten RPGs lassen es zu, die Bewegungen rückgängig zu machen. Manchmal möchte ich ausloten ob die prozentuale Trefferwahrscheinlichkeit in Position 1 auf einen Gegner besser ist als in Position 2 auf einen anderen Gegner. Dies hat mich am meisten gestört!
- Wer die alten JA kennt und liebt der wird vom Umfang enttäuscht sein. Die Waffen lassen sich nicht upgraden und die Loots sind teilweise nur Krimskrams welche ein paar Dölles beim Händler einbringen.
- Bei diesem Game läuft alles inkl. Gegner nach einem ziemlich gleichen Schema ab... kein Vergleich mit Jagged Alliance oder Xcom.

Schade... die Optik ist super und macht echt was her. Vielleicht überarbeiten es die Entwickler ja nochmals. Dann werde ich es mir nochmals überlegen, momentan ist es mir keine 17 Franken Wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198384643740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1555880377}
review:
Le jeu manque de dynamisme, les ennemis sont peu intéressants, les personnages sont mous et l'ensemble manque de vie ( une bulle qui s'ouvre pour qu'un personnage s'exprime ce n'est pas suffisant, quand une balle te passe à côté et que tu frôle la mort, un simple "c'est pas passé loin" est ridicule, une animation de surprise serai bien plus agréable et rendrait le tout plus attrayant ). Les personnages s'incrustent mal dans les décors, tandis que les cartes sont très belles bien que très peu pratique pour se repérer, les personnages sont immondes et font tache.
Les tours sont lent et l'absence d'un brouillard de guerre fait que l'on ne comprend pas pourquoi les ennemis disparaissent ( je me dis bien que c'est à cause du champ de visons, mais encore là, une indication ou une animation/ un fondu serait le bien venu.
J'aurai encore des défaut à citer, mais j'ai la flemme et je trouve que ceux-là suffisent pour le moment
En bref un lifting des personnages, une plus grande variété d'ennemis (Nazis, zombies merci mais c'est très léger), des expressions et des réactions (on se crois dans roblox bon sang!), et un gameplay plus dynamique, avec une option pour passer le tour de l'ennemi et plus d'indication (même en ayant lu le tuto (un carnet pour tuto oui) je ne comprend presque rien.
Très passable, on préfèrera un Fire Embleme...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005261722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1555293613}
review:
This game is simply....boring. It's just that simple.

The game itself is very simple. The game is very easy. 

You know how I know its easy? They have no tutorial. So you're just flung right into the middle of this game.

But even so I was able to figure out how to play and beat the first level with barely any problems. It's just the same thing over and over again. It has a small mechanic for saving items, money, and characters experience but this mechanic is just too simple. The levels are too short, the combat too easy, the story is boring and lame. The game feels like its supposed to be a shell of a different game. It's absolutely ridiculous.

This is a small pixel game that probably didn't take a lot of time to make. I wouldn't be so upset at this game if its price matched its quality. 16$ ? Are you kidding me? This game is no where near worth that much. It's worth MAYBE 10$.

MAYBE!!

It's not worth 16$ don't buy it for that much. Unless your REALLY into simple pixel games that you can chill with while watching tv (And just doing the same thing over and over again) then fine...buy it. But It's not worth 16$.

What makes it worse is that I really loved the idea of this game. It even looked interesting here on the steam page. But it's not what you're expecting. Just...don't....just don't bother with this game. You'll spend 2 hours doing the same thing over and over again while hoping something different happens or changes but it won't. Then you'll be out 16$ and unable to get a refund. Don't even bother taking the chance. Go find a different casual game to play. If you'd like to see some ACTUAL gameplay of the game and see what its REALLY like...then check out my YouTubeChannel. I just uploaded my first and only video of gameplay for this game and I feel its my obligation to let people know not to buy this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GlNzcLRR4MA

author: {'steamid': '76561198135450619', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 1767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1594647282}
review:
Зомби, наци, пауки – все приятели твои.  Это если коротко. 

Роглайк о поиске источника вечной жизни компанией на 50% состоящей из женщин и на 50% из пацифистов. Это 2019 год, детка. И разработчик из Германии. Причем немец в команде самый кастрированный персонаж, боящийся своей сути, по факту наносящий меньше всего демага именно нацистам. А персонаж, наносящий больше всего урона – это  негритянская женщина с большим ножом. Символично. Для 2019.

Игра вообще больше о поиске культурного кода и аллюзиях на современные новостные заголовки, нежели о поиске источника вечной молодости в песках Аравии и северо-восточной Африки в 30-е годы прошлого века. И является парафразом новостных независимых пабликов большинства европейских левых. Хорошо это или плохо – вопрос спорный, но изучать содержимое игры и искать параллели с настоящим очень интересно. 

Искать аллюзии нам предлагается в игре, ттх которой являются:

5 больших отдельных глав, каждая из которых, кроме первой (обучающей), состоят из 3 карт. Каждая карта последовательно генерится заново, когда на неё заходишь. От одной точки старта надо пройти до финальной чаще всего 2-4 разными путями. На каждом из которых есть множество ответвлений. Суммарно точек на каждой карте штук 40. Пройти по всем и собрать весь лут/врагов не удастся. Ибо, на каждое перемещение тратится такой ресурс как бензин, и которого на каждой карте ограниченное количество. Примерно как в Slay thе Spire с самого начало стоит прикинуть свой оптимальный, на основе потребностей, путь до финала и идти им, корректируя, в зависимости что дропнулось в случайных встречах. Разновидностей которых, к сожалению, очень мало. Хоть авторы и заверили, что в течении месяца выпустят апдейт, расширяющий контент случайных встреч, пока их категорически не хватает. И ситуаций, когда, на одной карте встречается один и тот же храм с зомби, хоть и с разных лутом, более чем достаточно. Бои, магазины, лагеря отдыха, пустые заглушки, герои для команды, рандомный лут без боёв – вот и всё что пока есть. В Slay thе Spire, в принципе тот же самый набор. Но вот текстовых квестов не хватает. А они прямо так и напрашиваются, учитывая, что с контекстным креативом у авторов всё в порядке. И квесты бы получились отличные, учитывая сеттинг игры.

Боевая система перекочевала прямиком из предыдущей игры студии, Halfway. И система не то что бы плохая, но  Halfway делало 2,5 человека, и это заметно. В Pathway, всё то же самое, разве что понерфили снайперки, и схема «отбежал-выстрелил» уже не работает. Нужен мясной щит, хилер и основной демагер. Не то чтобы это работает на интерес, но с вариациями на выбор из 12 персонажей стало лучше. Бои пошаговые, карты маленькие, враги от миссии к миссии жирнеют, ваши герои ищут новые  пушки куда как медленнее их, и посему гриндить одни и те же карты придётся, как не грустно. Ну да какой рогалик без повторных заходов «на поляну».

Пиксельная графика класс. Передать атмосферу и дух полумистического приключения в 30-х годах получилось на ура. Пикселятина – самая сильная сторона этой игры. Ну, конечно, после скрытого цитирования. Музыка неплоха, не надоедает, но 133 р. отдельно за саундтрек – нет.

Плот хорош, не обширен и велик как сочинения Радищева под водку на лоне природы, но скриптовано занятен. Насколько может быть занятен поиск источника вечной жизни наперегонки с нацистами.  Великолепно прописаны герои вашего отряда. Каждый индивидуален и запоминается. Описывать каждого – заспойлерить добрую часть игры. Лучше самим изучить. 



Pathway может огорчить, если ждать от игры, созданной 4-мя немцами (людьми?) слишком многого[strike]гогогогого[/strike], и верить что может быть идеальная боёвка в подобном инди. Если даже в текущем ХСОМ она на 3-. И доставить удовольствие, если с роглайк-играми вы на ты [strike]и ты на вы, и выйти ты на ты, вы в вы, и ты-ты-ты[/strike]. Или математическое накопление для вас в радость – ачивки тут, их много. Или поиск скрытого. Или пострелять нацистов. Или подымить на джипе в пустыне – анимация хороша. В любом случае всё будет хорошо, если умете развлекаться, а не ждать, что вас развлекут.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999288875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1555191342}
review:
This is a mix of FTL and X-Com, if only at the most basic level.

I guess the story mechanic it shares with FTL is pretty well implemented, but the combat is just straight terrible.

Weapon range can best be described as Short while movement is about triple the range of a shotgun and 1.5 assault rifles. Which means that cover becomes completely useless as the enemy you could just barely shoot from your covered position can now easily outmanouvre you and shoot you in the side, without a common option of an overwatch skill this leads to a lot of cheap shots being taken at your squad that chip off your persistant health little by little over the course of your adventure. Being unable to take more than 2 characters on your first 2 adventures(didn't play more than that before refunding) means you either need to bring the mediocre medic or live with the fact that the first time you take more than 50 damage total you're losing one of your guys.

Really can't recommend this game in its current form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047277850', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1555219745}
review:
장점

- 도트를 좋아하는 분들이라면 분명 맘에 꼭 들어할 그래픽.

- 라이트 유저를 배려한 컨티뉴 시스템.

 죽어도 진행을 다시 해야할 뿐 캐릭터의 성장과 인벤토리의 아이템은 남아있음.

-----

단점

- 떨어지는 파밍 재미.

 장비류 아이템의 숫자가 너무나 적은 듯하고, 그나마도 고만고만해서 사실상 뭘 끼워줘도 별 차이가 없음. 10시간이 넘도록 에픽 등급 이상의 아이템을 구경해본 건 캠페인 완료 보상 혹은 잠금 해제 캐릭터가 기본적으로 들고 있는 아이템 뿐.

- 제한적인 캐릭터 성장.

 레벨을 올려 두근거리는 마음으로 스킬을 찍으려고 보면 명중률에 보너스, 대미지에 보너스, 다른 종류의 무기 사용 가능... 이런 것 뿐이고 보통 스킬이라고 하면 생각나는 '액티브 스킬'은 전무함.

- 캠페인의 호흡 조절 실패.

 첫 번째 캠페인을 끝내고 가벼운 마음으로 두 번째 캠페인을 시작해 플레이하다보면.. 도대체가 끝나질 않음. 첫 번째 캠페인이 맵 하나에서 끝났으니, 두 번째도 하나에서 끝나던가 많아야 두 개면 끝날 거라는 생각이 드는데, 뜬금없이 세 개를 넘어가버림. 인카운터도 다양하지 않고, 전투가 특출나게 재미있는 것도 아니다보니 두 번째 캠페인에서 벌써 쉽게 지루해짐.

- 의미가 없는 수준의 난이도 커스터마이징.

 적 체력 증가, 시작 시 보유 탄환 감소 두 가지인데, 처음부터 체력 증가 만땅, 탄환 감소 만땅 주고 시작했음에도 크게 어렵다는 느낌을 받지 못함. 한 대 때릴 거 두 대 때리면 되고, 탄환이 부족한 적은 없었던 듯.

- 부족한 전략성.

 장비 종류에 따른 스킬 차이 외에 캐릭터가 가진 스킬따윈 없기 때문에 전략이랄 게 딱히 없음. 적이 모여있는 것도 아니라서 전투가 크게 어렵지도 않고 쉽게 지루해짐.

-----

별점 3점드립니다.

★★★☆☆

author: {'steamid': '76561198105611352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1573909159}
review:
Gutted that I paid full price for this, wish I'd refunded it as soon as I saw the gameplay. I was suckered in by the FTL/roguelike mechanic and the Indiana Jones aesthetic, but there are serious problems with it:

- The game is a series of "tactical" battles, but the tactical choices are essentially non-existent (should I shoot then move or move then shoot?), and so the battles are grindingly dull. The gameplay is so limited that it feels like one of those dire 90s educational titles that looked like a game but didn't feel like one.

- The retro aesthetic is accompanied by excruciating retro load times. Something has gone badly wrong with the programming of this game; it takes minutes to load, and every screen transition takes several seconds, even just bringing up dialog boxes.

- On the plus side, the music is spot on.

This... program has clearly specifically set out to draw comparisons with FTL, which was always ambitious, but with the lack of execution it just looks laughable - and it would have been a better idea to start with a concept for an actual game, or at least come up with one at some point along the way.
