author: {'steamid': '76561197962433566', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1555095726}
review:
Overall i really liked the vision of Pathway, I truly did.

Pros:
Graphic feel
First 3hours when the game is still unknown
Music!!

Cons:
Extremely repetetive
Characters and weapons are very bland and boring
Difficulty is really easy, the enemy is dumb and can be cheesed super hard
Skill trees might as well not be there (It,s only small bonusses)

I expected a bit more out of pathway, but what you see in the trailer is what you get, and nothing more which is sad. If the characters had more abilities and development, and if the weapon ranks actually mattered, it would be awesome! After playing for a few hours you just want to rush to the end of the stage, no reason to go explore.

Fun game for a limited time, but adding more "content" by redoing the same things is not content

author: {'steamid': '76561198080535056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1634124457}
review:
[h1] Vorwort [/h1]

Folgendes wird rein aus meiner Erinnerung stammen. Ich habe mir beim Spielen nichts aufgeschrieben, daher wird wohlmöglich nicht alles hundertprozentig richtig sein, was ich in der folgenden Review schreibe. Dazu wird es denke ich keine wirkliche Struktur geben. Ich werde einfach nach und nach das wiedergeben, was mir in den Kopf kommt. Wenn jemand einen Fehler entdeckt bitte ich darum mir diesen zu nennen, damit ich es berichtigen kann. Es wird sich hierbei zwar nicht um eine komplett objektive Review handeln, allerdings würde ich mir wünschen, sollte ich gewisse Fakten verdrehen, oder falsch auflisten, dass ich berichtigt werde. Ich möchte diesem Spiel und den Entwicklern kein Unrecht tun. Ich bedanke mich bereits im Voraus.

[h1] Review [/h1]

Pathway beschreibt sich selbst als ein Strategie-RPG. Das zuvor entwickelte und auf Steam veröffentliche Spiel seitens der Entwickler Robotality beschreibt sich ebenfalls als solches. Das heißt die Entwickler kennen diese Genremischung bereits ganz gut. Ich bin auch guter Dinge, dass dieser Entwickler weitere dieser Spiele entwickeln wird, da ich solche Spiele in dieser Qualität bisher nicht finden konnte. So viel schon mal im Voraus.

Zu Beginn hat man eine kleine Auswahl von "Söldnern", die alle ihre eigenen Fähigkeiten und Stats besitzen. Die meisten bevorzugen einen einzigen Waffentyp, wie z.B. Sturmgewehre. Anfangs stehen einem noch nicht alle Charaktere zur Verfügung, da man die meisten erst freischalten muss. Freigeschaltet werden sie meist durch die Erfüllung von gewissen Aufgaben/Herausforderungen. Das beste Beispiel, was mir spontan einfällt ist "Töte 100 Nazis!". Es gibt auch Herausforderungen, die einem gewisse Items geben, wie z.B. Schmerzmittel zum Heilen deiner Leute.

Jede Mission wird in Form einer "Akte" gezeigt. In dieser hat die Möglichkeit die genaue Beschreibung zu lesen und den Schwierigkeitsgrad sowie die Startmenge an Munition und Treibstoff einzustellen.

Zu Beginn jeder Mission kann man 2 Charaktere auswählen, die den Auftrag beginnen sollen. Im Laufe der Missionen kann man noch 2 weitere mitnehmen, allerdings muss man diese erst finden. Meist sind sie Gefangene der Nazis und man muss ihn/sie dann befreien. Wie bereits erwähnt hat jeder Charakter seine bevorzugte Waffe und eine gewisse Fähigkeit oder Eigenschaft, die in gewissen Situationen hilfreich sein kann und einem das Leben erleichtert. Man wählt also 2 Charaktere aus und man kommt daraufhin in eine Art "Loadout-Menü". Hier kann man seine ausgewählten Helden weiter ausrüsten, sollte man noch weitere passende Ausrüstungsgegenstände besitzen. Dies ist zu Beginn aber nicht der Fall. Ich persönlich mag die Mischung aus dem Baron und Jackson. Sie ergänzen sich ziemlich gut und stellen ein ziemlich effektives Team dar. Vor allem bei den ersten beiden Missionen. Allerdings möchte ich hier niemanden beeinflussen, sollte sich jemand nach dem Lesen dieser Review zum Kauf entscheiden. Ich empfehle wirklich nach und nach alle Mischungen auszuprobieren bis ihr der Meinung seid, die für euch Richtige gefunden zu haben. Nachdem man sich nun entschieden hat startet man sofort ins "Gefecht". Jede Mission beginnt mit einem Eröffnungstext -und bild. Der Text wird auf Englisch von einer tiefen und ruhigen Stimme erzählerisch gesprochen.

Grafisch ist das Spiel ein Meisterwerk, zumindest für mich persönlich. Wunderschöne Pixelgrafik mit guten Animationen und wunderschönen Lichteffekten. Man bekommt zumindest schon mal was zum gucken. Die Overworld sowie die Kampfmaps sind toll gestaltet und einfach schön anzusehen, sei es nun am sonnigen Mittag, in der kalten Nacht, innerhalb eines dunklen Tempels, oder eines Dorfes. Ich finde alles spielt wunderbar zusammen und sorgt für stimmende Atmosphäre, je nach Mission.

Nach dem vorher erwähnten Eröffnungstext startet man also meist in einem Dorf. Charaktere sind putzmunter, Benzin und Munition sind voll. Man startet also ins Abenteuer. Es gibt viele Punkte zu bereisen bevor man sein Ziel erreicht. Wie das genau aussieht kann man im letzten Screenshot oben sehen. Jeder Punkt verbraucht 1x Benzin. Wenn dieses aufgebraucht ist müssen deine Helden zu Fuß gehen, was sie auf dauer schnell auslaugt und Lebenspunkte kostet. Also sollte man immer dafür sorgen, dass genug Sprit übrig bleibt damit man sein Ziel erreichen kann. Um das zu bewerkstelligen gibt es z.B. gewisse "Encounters", in denen man beispielsweise ein Nazilager entdeckt. Man kann nun entscheiden, ob man angreift oder weiterfährt. Es gibt allerdings auch Händler auf der Karte verstreut, die man allerdings erstmal erreichen muss. Bei diesen kann man meist sein Benzin -und Munitionsvorrat aufstocken. Im allgemeinen erinnert mich das Gameplay auf der Overworld sehr an "The Dwarves" sollte das jemanden etwas sagen.

Klingt soweit einfach, nicht? Mag zwar sein, ist es aber nicht. Denn auf deinem Weg wirst oft auf Gegner treffen, die dir keine Chance auf Rückzug geben. Das heißt also töten oder getötet werden. Wenn ich eine Sache über dieses Spiel weiß, dann das es dir keine Fehler verzeiht. Ein einziger Fehler kann dich die gesamte Mission kosten und das heißt Neustart. Daher hier eine [b] WARNUNG! [/b] Dieses Spiel wird einen herausfordern. Man muss Geduld und Leidensfähigkeit beweisen um durch die Missionen zu kommen. Man muss oft die Mission neustarten und hoffen, dass es besser wird. Man muss nach und nach lernen, wie man gewisse Situationen am Besten handhabt, was, wie gesagt, einiges an Geduld in Anspruch nimmt. Allerdings und das ist wirklich wichtig, da ich es in anderen Reviews gelesen habe: Dieses Spiel wird trotz seines Schwierigkeitsgrades niemals unfair! Es gibt einem immer beim Start einer Mission die Möglichkeit die Gegnerstärke einzustellen und die Menge an Munition und Benzin zu Beginn. Es wird Kämpfe geben, die man nicht gewinnen kann. Aber das liegt daran, dass man vorher entweder zu offensiv, oder zu verschwenderisch war. Man muss wirklich jeden seiner Züge überdenken. Man muss überdenken welchen Weg man fährt. Kostet dieser Weg, oder dieser Weg mehr Sprit und gibt es auf diesem Weg einen Händler und bei dem anderen nicht? Und sollte es wirklich ausweglos erscheinen muss man entweder trotzdem versuchen, oder einfach neustarten. Das Spiel bestraft dich nicht dafür die Gegnerstärke zu senken. Alles bleibt beim Alten. Du hast also die Möglichkeit es auf deinen Spielstil anzupassen.

Das Gameplay innerhalb der Kämpfe erinnert mich persönlich sehr an Fire Emblem. Andere vergleichen es auch mit XCOM, was ich allerdings nicht bestätigen kann, da ich es nie gespielt habe. Ich werde allerdings nicht genauer darauf eingehen, da ich der Meinung bin, dass man es sich wirklich selbst ansehen sollte. Ich könnte hier wirklich ins Detail gehen, aber es würde nichts nützen, da jeder der Kämpfe wirklich einzigartig abläuft. Die KI macht ihren Job stellenweise außergewöhnlich gut und haut dir richtig eine rein, wenn du nicht aufpasst. Das muss man wirklich selbst erleben um es zu verstehen. Ich hoffe man nimmt mir das nicht übel.

Im großen und ganzen bin ich vor allem Fan vom Setting. Es erinnert sehr an Indiana Jones und seine Abenteuer. Wüste, alte Tempel, Nazis, Zombies und Kulte geben einen wirklich eine nette Reise. 

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Pathway stellt für mich das perfekte Spiel für zwischendurch sowie für viele gefüllte Stunden in einer Session dar. Ich persönlich bin eigentlich kein Freund von Rundenstrategie, aber dieses Spiel sorgt mit seinem Setting und der Atmosphäre auch für mich für ein spannendes und vor allem spaßiges Erlebnis, jedes Mal wenn ich es starte. Ich freue mich wirklich auf weitere Spiele aus dem Hause Robotality und wünsche den Entwicklern und allen anderen Beteiligten viel Erfolg mit diesem und den nächsten Spielen.

Danke für's Lesen dieser Review und viel Spaß mit dem Spiel, solltest du dich entschieden haben es zu kaufen.

PS: Kauft das Spiel bitte auf Steam, oder GOG. Nicht bei Keysellern. Danke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045597380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1571911164}
review:
Fun game, i enjoy the theme and concept of the game. Its a Indiana Jones game with mix of XCOM , FTL and RPG element.

Pros: Good art, nice story and overall fun. 

Cons: Repetitive gameplay , Game little buggy and unable to reset your skill tree. 

Overall expect 15-20 hours of gameplay . If you enjoy FTL like games then you should get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035638200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1555229859}
review:
La figure était millénaire, impassible dans les ténèbres, et le regard invincible dans la mort.
Et sur le piédestal il y a ces mots :
"Mon nom est Ozymandias, Roi des Rois.
Voyez mon œuvre, ô puissants, et désespérez !" 
Puis la figure impassible rejoignit brutalement le sol.
_ iiii voilà, Sidi Joséstar, ci la momie di pharaon. Mis ?! Vos zavez l'ir diçû, sidi.
_Je désespère carrément , Advil ! Regarde-ça, le puissant pharaon. Pour une puissante arme contre les vampires, il ressemble plus à une poupée constipée. Et puis pourquoi tu prends cet accent aussi raciste ?
_Ben, c'est compris dans le forfait exotique, mais si vous voulez, j'arrête...
_Ah, non, surtout pas ! Tu le fais très bien !
_Hey, merci ! C'est...euh, ci qui, vos voyez, li pharaon, il i un pi mort alors.
_Mais, Advil ! Depuis que ces idiots ont ouvert [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QQzBxtaz7aM]le sarcophage en direct à la télévision[url] , le monde entier est maudit! Imtothep a commencé sa besogne ! Le temps nous est compté ! Encore heureux que le temps qu'il bouffe toute l'Asie, on gagnera un an ou deux. Espérons que la population américaine le fasse crever du diabète. Mais qu'est-ce que tu fabriques ?!

_c'est aussi dans le forfait ! A chaque fois que vous monologuez, je pique le plus de trucs possibles et j'active les pièges involontairement...
_Advil !
_Ah, pardon ! Biii, ci dans li forfait...
_ c'est mieux !
Et Advil laissa délibérément une statue s'enfoncer, activant sous eux une trappe aux serpents.
[h1]Die Abenteurer der verlorenen Zeit:[/h1]
Dans une Europe infestée de nazis jusqu'au Maroc, vous incarnez un aventurier et sa clique au service de la justice et du monde libre, tel un Bob Denard des années 30. Débarassé de toute ambiguité morale dans mon entreprise, je fonçais dans le désert plus armé qu'un représentant de la NRA. Malheureusement, mon plaisir tourna court. Le jeu contient une dose "survie": vous avez sur la carte un nombre limité de déplacement numéroté par votre essence. Chaque étape de la carte vous propose un "event" qui vous permettra de recharger les armes, l'essence et parfois le matériel. Malheuresement ces events sont répétitifs et occasionne davantage une perte de temps qu'un réel dépaysement. Même s'il justifie une occasion de récupérer XP et scalps, vous aurez plus à perdre qu'à réellement gagner. Plus dramatique, rien ne vous oblige a suivre/subir l'event, et vous pouvez clôturer un chapitre en 10 minutes juste en roulant jusqu'à destination. Si Indiana avait su ça...

[i]_ Je n'arrive pas à croire que je suis tombé bêtement dans cette fosse que tu as grande ouverte ! Excellent travail, Advil !
_oofff, ci troua fois rien, sidi.
_et le sacrifice de ton bras ne sera pas inutile..Regarde cette belle statuette de mec a tête de pieuvre que l'on a trouvé !
_en parlant de ça, sidi, les plaies, elles commencent à enfler.
_hm ! Tu as raison. Il faut que l'on te vienne en aide.
Un peu plus loin derrière les dunes s'élevèrent des clameurs. 
_ HEIL H. ! HEIL H. ! HEIL H. !
_ Ji crois pâs qui ci soit di gens tri sympathiques...
_Tu vois le mal partout, Advil ! C'est de l'anglais ! Sans doute des américains ! Des gens très sympathiques tu vas voir ! HI, GUYS ! HIIIIIIIII !

_Je te l'avais bien dit, Advil ! Ils t'ont même filé des vêtements. Le noir et la casquette  te vont très bien! Tu as la classe européenne.
_woui. I li têtes di mort, ci jouli.
_ Tu as l'air d'un pirate, ahah ! Ce monsieur Hubert Commandant est vraiment un type extra. D'ailleurs, il veut me montrer les plans d'un site pour nous aider dans notre lutte. Je crois que c'est dans cette salle...
[un gars en marcel cogne un autre, ficelé sur une chaise]AcH! AcH! AcH! Alors, le FranSSais ! Ta MarSSeillaise, tu la chante moins bien sans tes dents ! Euh.. Bonchour ! Fous déSSirez ?
_Pardon. Nous nous sommes trompés de salle. Continuez ce que vous faisiez, vous le faîtes très bien. [fermant la porte]Tu as raison,Advol ! Je commence à douter de nos alliés. Ce type siffle les s comme les serpents sifflaient sur nos têtes.
_Ci une allitération, sidi ?
_ « Aberration », Advil. On dit une « aberration ». 
_ci vol dites.
Profitant de la nuit et d'une clarté sélénienne, Joséstar s'évadait, espérant qu'Advol aurait la même idée. Un projecteur l'éblouit alors violemment.
_ Ach ! Fous nous quitter si prestement, Herr Choséstar ?
_ Hubert!
_ Foui!  « Hubert » !Mais appelez-moi Hans ! Cette statuette est la pièce maîtresse de notre quête, et fous, fous alliez nous l'enlefer?!Mais nous n'aurions rien su, sans fotre défoué ami...
_Advil !
_Che ne choue aux definettes!Laissez-moi finir mes phrases !
_j'aurais dû me douter que tu étais un traître, Advil ! Ton regarde perfide ! Que tu rotes à chaque repas ! Ta façon de hurler à chaque mariage comme si on te marchait sur les...
_I toua, té quoi ? I toua, hein?A monopoliser li capital di PIB d'un pays industrialisé, générant di bénéfices sil li dos des travailleurs i...
_ t'as vraiment pas de race !
_Ah non ! je veux bien être un salaud, mais je suis un professionnel ! Je déteste les insultes gratuites!Si vous ne vouliez pas de trahison, fallait lire le contrat et cocher la clause ! AAAh !!!
Advil s'affaise, une balle dans la jambe.
_ça fa ? On fous dérange pas trop ?Bien !Fous fenez avec nous, Herr Choséstar, pour assister à l'étape final de notre plan. PARCE QUE C'EST NOTRE PROCHET! HEIL H. !

les troupes : HEIL H. !HEIL H. !HEIL H. !
_Mais, c'était pour évident ! Ce besoin d'uniformiser la société ! Cette obsession pour l'épuration ethnique ! Ce besoin de contrôler les populations et ce culte de la personnalité ! les gars, vous seriez pas des... communistes ?!
_NEIN ![/i]

[h1]Rifkrieg II: Das Imperium schlägt zurück: [/h1]
Immense déception également: les combats. Faute d'une IA pourtante intelligente (et pourtant ce sont des nazis), l'action peut devenir rapidement frustrante, tant les combats sont mous. L'ennemi tendra toujours à vous encercler mais aura aussi tendance à peu agir s'il est hors-champ, laissant place à de long jeu de cache-cache.
Le jeu aura son intérêt mais je n'attendrais 3 patches.


[i]Comme par évidence, le plan ignoble échoua, et comme les soldats étaient trop occupés à regarder ce qu'ils les tuaient plutôt que de fuir, Joséstar se lança à la poursuite de Hans pour récupérer la statuette. Celui-ci s'échappa via un bateau.
_Il temps de mettre un terme à tes plans, sale nazi !
_Comment ? Un nazi ? Tout de suite les grands mots !
_Mais...
_Che fous connaît, fous, les héros ! Ah!Nein ! Ein allemand ! Balance lui ton point Godwin dans la face !
_Enfin, voyons !
_Nous sommes en 1936 ! Nous n'afons rien fait de mal ! Laissez-nous une chance !
_Mais, ces chants, ces appels au Fuhrer !
_C'est confifial !
_Ces costumes noirs ! Ces têtes de mort !
_C'est une mode !
_Je suis désolé !
_Ach ! C'est mieux !
_Sincèrement, je suis confus.
_Foilà ce que c'est de fifre afec des préchugés...
_Mais dites-moi, vous essayez tout de même bien de conquérir le monde ?
_Foui, pourquoi ?
[PAN!]
Soudain surgit dela banquette arrière et comme par magie Advil, vêtu en bédouin.
_Advil ? Je savais que tu ne me le laisserais pas tomber ! Bravo pour avoir saboter leur incantations !
_Ah, nan, le contrat, il a fini quand vous m'avez insulté.{ramassant un papier où se lisait l'incantation]et leur plan a foiré tout seul. Il ya eu une chiure de mouche, ça a changé la lecture du mot. Au lieu de lire « dieu » ils ont lu « pamplemousse ». 
_ on dit « sciure » Advil. Donne moi ton contrat, je te rembauche au triple de ton salaire.
_ji prend li commandes di navire, sidi.
_Parfait ! Profites-en pour nous mener dans un pays qui soit enfin civilisé. Et regarde moi tout ces documents secrets en allemand. Il y aura bien quelqu'un qui saura quoi en faire ! Quel est le port le plus proche ?
_Marseille, sidi.
_Des Français,hm ? Je suis sûr que ces gens-là seront prêt à collaborer...

Et c'est ainsi, en direction du soleil couchant, le bateau mis le cap sur de nouvelles aventures.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062963289', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1555079926}
review:
On the first look, the game seems cool both visually and gameplay wise. But the combat is really shallow and the adventure is too much RNG (and again, no depth). Played the game for an hour and then refunded.

Outside of healing tools and armor repair (AFAIK you can buy them only during the mission not before or after), fuel and ammo (which you can buy, but is really expensive and you have no indication on how much will you approximately need), you cannot prepare at all for what awaits you. Or rather, there is no game interaction that can change anything. Sure, the characters have non-combat uses (e.g. Medic, Daredevil), but getting the events they are connected to is pure RNG. 

Oh, and there is hardly any content. Yes, you can repeat the adventures over and over, but the game got repetetive even after the very first mission.

If you want XCOM like combat, look elsewhere. This one is not great.

If you want exploration game, get "The Curious Expedition". Much, much better game with more depth, character, conent and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995257330', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1670165817}
review:
Hmmm... I see some of the points that were made by the negative reviews as being legit, but my experience with Pathway has been quite enjoyable through the 4th adventure, and I can understand when a company releases a game with a limited scope and vision. Pathway is a fair amount of fun for the price, and I'm not even completely through the game.

My only fear is that the game won't be opened up for modding because the production company wants to sell DLC. This is backward thinking; if a game is good but short, a modding community fosters long term interest and further boosts sales (Darkest Dungeon, Rimworld). Here's to hoping Steam Workshop makes its way to Pathway, kid.

Edit on April 16th REGARDING BUGS:
During a fight (after about 16 hours of gameplay) against nazis I ran into a bug that instantly crashed the game when the AI's turn started. This was the first bug I had encountered, and since it was clear that this was a new release, I sent a short email to Chucklefish support describing the event. Within 30 minutes a nice guy in the support team had responded and told me that they're releasing a new patch to fix this type of problem. Less than an hour later the patch was out, the bug was gone, and I could continue.
 
So yes, Pathway is a game with an intentionally limited scope that isn't designed to be a 70$ blockbuster, but it's quite good as is, and I would definitely trust the developers and production for future products.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968613932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1570697023}
review:
Ob der vielen negativen Reviews war ich skeptisch und wollte das Spiel erst zurückgeben.

Da das Artdesign, der Sound und die Musik so übermäßig gut gelungen sind, zögerte ich noch.
Jedem muss klar sein, dass man hier kein dickes Taktik- Spiel vorfindet, was die Gefechte angeht.
Trotzdem machen die Gefechte einfach Spaß weil sie sich gut anhören, gut aussehen und eine Spur Taktik erfordern.
Sie halten nicht lange auf aber man kann trotzdem jederzeit verlieren. Also spannend, schön und kurzweilig.

Die Entscheidungen die man sonst trifft haben maßgeblich damit zutun ob man in der Mission weiter vorankommt.

Beispiel: Ich wog ab, einen Trupp Nazis mit meinen geschwächten Söldnern anzugreifen, in der Hoffnung, dass ich 1 Einheit Benzin finde, die mir fehlt um die Mission abzuschließen. Andererseits könnte ich meinen letzten Söldner im Kampf verlieren und könnte die Mission dadurch auch nicht abschließen. 
Ich entschloss mich für den Angriff und gewann den Kampf knapp. 
Zu meiner Überraschung  befreite ich einen Gefangenen den ich auch noch zu meinem Team hinzufügen konnte! (permanent)
Benzin fand ich auch und konnte die Mission locker abschließen.
Die Entscheidungen die man hier trifft sind meiner Meinung nach noch spannender als die in FTL.

Der Wiederspielwert ist ziemlich hoch. Man muss sich das etwas wie bei "Into the Breach" vorstellen.
Man sollte die einzelnen Geschichten öfter durchspielen, wird stärker und findet neue Sachen.
Habe die erste Mission jetzt zum 4. Mal gespielt und jede Reise verlief anders. 
Jedes Mal muss neu taktiert werden und Entscheidungen getroffen werden. 
Das hat jeden Durchlauf spannend gemacht. Der Weg ist das Ziel. 

Als 75er Jahrgang PC Gamer, ist dieses Spiel ein must-have für mich.
Ich könnte mich außerdem spontan an kein Spiel erinnern, welches die epischen, alten "Kindheits-LucasArts-Indiana Jones-Adventure-Gefühle" so in mir erzeugen wie Pathway.

Der Preis ist völlig angemessen. Es gibt hier Steam Errungenschaften und sogar Cloud- Unterstützung!
Von mir eine klare Empfehlung.
Danke für das Spiel, lang' lebe das PC gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006388177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1555861945}
review:
Eigentlich ist Pathway genau das richtige Spiel für zwischendurch.
Ein rogue-like Spielprinzip, die Jagd nach besserem Loot und ein kurzweiliges Vergnügen für immer mal wieder zwischendurch. Dazu das coole "Indiana Jones" Setting.
Leider fehlt dem Spiel aber die Abwechslung.
So hat man die Wahl zwischen 16 Charakteren, wovon man 2 mit zur Expedition nehmen kann (sofern man alle freigeschaltet bekommt), aber alleine ihre Fähigkeiten sind zu limitiert, als das man es hier wirklich mit unterschiedlichen Typen ala "Jagged Alliance" zu tun bekommt.
Es gibt nämlich nur eine Handvoll Waffen und Rüstungstypen, sowie ein paar Perks, wodurch die Unterscheidung der Charaktere sehr limitiert ist.
Auch durch das Aufleveln bekommt man keine wirkliche Abgrenzung, so dass die Chars am Ende recht austauschbar wirken. Hier würden zusätzliche Waffen und Fähigkeiten Wunder wirken.

Hinzu kommt die sehr limitierte Anzahl an Feinden. 
So hat man es im Spiel nur mit "Nazis" und "Zombies bzw. Kultisten" zu tun, wobei jede Fraktion gerade mal 8 unterschiedliche Gegnertypen zu bieten hat (die jedoch noch unterschiedlich stark auftreten können). 
Nach knapp 7 Stunden wiederholen sich diese schon zu stark - es fehlt einfach die Abwechslung in Form neuer Gegner oder Bosse (die es gar nicht gibt) bzw. die Überraschung neuer Gegnertypen, die vielleicht andere  Fähigkeiten mitbringen könnten.

Auch die Karten sind zu generisch und ohne Vielfalt. Es sind keine Zufallskarten, sondern wohl von Hand gebaute, so dass diese sich auch sehr schnell wiederholen und zudem viel zu klein sind, so dass die Planung in Form von Strategie leider sehr flach ist bzw. gänzlich entfällt, da die Bewegungsreichweite der Figuren in einem Zug die halbe Karte umfasst.

Das Kampfsystem ist sehr oberflächlich und bietet für ein rundenbasiertes Kampfsystem viel zu wenig Möglichkeiten. Jeder Char kann gerade mal ein bis zwei Spezialaktionen ausführen, die an limitierte Aktionspunkte gebunden sind - das wars.
Deckung gibt es; die wird aber aufgrund der kleinen Karten in Verbindung mit hoher Bewegungsreichweite der Gegner meistens umgangen und ist somit nur rudimentär nutzbar.
 
Natürlich macht die Jagd auf zufallsgenerierten Loot viel Spaß, aber die angeblichen 400+ Events (laut Steampage) sind wohl weit übertrieben. Ich bin mittlerweile auf der dritten von 5 Karten und die Events wiederholen sich ständig, so dass man diese mittlerweile nur uninteressiert wegklickt. Sehr schade!

Auch bestehen die Regionen leider nur aus dem Grafikset "Wüstenlandschaften". Hier hätte ich mir Dschungel, Karibik o.ä. zur Abwechslung gewünscht.

Insgesamt macht Pathway zwar Spaß, aber durch die leider nur oberflächlichen Kämpfe und vor allem die geringe Gegnervielfalt in Verbindung mit immer den gleichen Zufallsereignissen wäre hier noch mehr Feinschliff nötig gewesen, um es zu einem Kleinod wie FTL werden zu lassen.
Vielleicht kommt da noch was seitens der Devs.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198024885430', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1653883630}
review: Pathway is a fun and casual strategy game. It adds charm to FTL's map travel and random story bits. Pathway's combat is watered down for sure, though that works out well and seems intentional. It is not without flaws, but at the price and obvious developer commitment I easily recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038612909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1632086975}
review:
This game is fun and has the feel of the adventure games I played when I was a kid, but with better controls, a more intuitive interface, and wayyyy more replay value. It's also cool to see this setting come back in a game that's as well done as this one is. 

My only plea would be to not remove death/blood gfx/sfx. An option to turn them off is good, but good because it allows you to choose what you want in your game instead of the choice being made for you. (Possibly the wrong choice, depending on your perspective.)

All in all 8/10 would get mauled by German shepherds again

author: {'steamid': '76561197993954974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1642863831}
review:
Just completed it.

Pros - Indiana Jones-setting, variety of encounters, challenging, puzzle-like combat, good length (for £10), lots of scope for extra content if reasonably priced.

Cons - If you need the tactical depth of classic XCom or Close Combat then this will be too shallow for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080173564', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1561631747}
review:
游戏的想法还是很不错的，有点像好奇探险队。

败笔完全在战斗模式，作为类xcom回合制，连监视（架点）的行动都没有，非常不合理。
而且敌人完全开的是全图，不存在潜行的可能性。即使剧情说的是你突袭战斗，完全感受不到区别，开局就往你脸上走

在战斗模式有大改之前不推荐
developer_response:
Hi 温柔的男人像海洋,

with our new update, we have indeed reworked major elements of our combat system.

We added 18 new special combat abilities, many of whom can be used for crowd control, for example warning shots (enemies can‘t move within the surveilled area), or crippling shot (enemy moves with a harsh penalty). 

We also added different battle modes – it now makes a vital difference wether you ambush an enemy or are ambushed yourselves...

If you should find the time to take another look at our current version of Pathway, you might find combats in our game more enjoyable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080229112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1555288391}
review:
Hello,
This game has terrible camera control and does not work well with a dual monitor. Streaming it on discord for my friends is also very rough. However, the game does have great graphics and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972339311', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1581627157}
review:
C'est beau mais c'est chiant à en mourir ~~ 
On nous donne une tripotée de stats pour au final des persos qui se ressemblent tous. Ca ne sert à rien de réfléchir à une stratégie à partir du moment où avec 4 persos ( quand on en a 4 ...) et 4 attaques  on est sûr de perdre de la vie quand il y a 6 ennemis... 
Le système de combat est franchement très limité et ..... c'était un peu la seule chose à faire. L'univers en revanche est au poil, c'est très beau et ces ambiances de ruines donnent envie de vraiment s'investir. 
Globalement quand on est à 4.6h de jeu comme moi et que 5 des 16 persos sont déjà au niveau maximum et que tous les "déblocables" du-dit "roguelike" sont débloqués on sent que ça craint un peu. Sérieusement je ne sais même pas comment je vais terminer le chapitre 5 avec si peu de flexibilité dans mes choix car le jeu devient de plus en plus dur sans forcément nous donner des outils supplémentaires. 

Acheter le jeu? A attendre de lourdes MAJ pour étoffer un peu le tout en terme de gameplay ou une bonne promo steam ( au moins 50%)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969006522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1555285534}
review:
Just refunded the game; tragically shallow strategic depth with a weak gameplay loop. A real shame as Chucklefish published titles usually deliver, but this game just isn't fun.

A great art style isn't enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989741113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1651369585}
review: Its a fun game. There's enough content for a few hours of enjoyment. The scenarios begin to be reused, to the point where you will recognize them all, but overall I do recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961494405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1555192486}
review: I play pretty much every new XCOM/FTL clone and this game was disappointing. The art was nice, but the combat is poor, leveling is not impactful and the core gameplay loop wasn't satisfying. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993644657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1555302962}
review:
Pathway is a fine diversion but I'm not sure if it's as good as the sum of its parts.

Pros:
Excellent sprites and animations.
Excellent music that really captures the John Williams vibe.
Fun setting, reasonably diverse characters.
A few cool combat tricks, like line-of-sight visibility.

Cons:
The branching map has too many dead ends, a lot of the map just feels like there's no value in exploring it, because you're just going to run out of gas and die.
The chance-based encounter options don't really seem to have much/any positive outcomes. Unless you consider getting into more fights a positive outcome.
Still a bit rough around the edges: some of the events refer to female characters as he/his; mousing over a knife offers a comparison with a character's gun, etc.
This game feels slow, even from someone who enjoys a lot of turn-based tactics games.
Enemies and characters don't feel particularly diverse, and the combat isn't so very fun that I find myself wanting to keep getting into fights.
The amount of killing you end up having to engage in to keep your jeep from running out of gas detracts from the Indiana Jones aesthetic. While it works less well here than in XCOM.
The unlock system for new characters is connected to achievements, which shifts the experience from the game to the metagame. You know you won't unlock a character organically in your adventure--they'll just magically become available after bleeding out X enemies or killing Y Nazis, etc.

Overall this game isn't  bad for its price, but I'm not sure it really rises above the competition, and makes me keen to try reinstalling FTL or Renowned Explorers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122540982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1680990322}

review: Gostei do jogo me lembrou final fantasy tactics, so que ele e bem mais dificio no começo para intender a mecanica e tambem e a utilizaçao dos recurços mais depois fica bem mais facil e A falta da traduçao em portugues tambem dificulta imersão na historia fora isso top de jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011806848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1555082336}
review: Also had high expectations based on the artwork.. The actual gameplay is boring, and there really is not much strategy.. It is no XCOM.. bummed because the project had such potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031266742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1555530390}
review:
As an avid XCOM player, I was keen to give this one a go. While it's not as smooth as the aforementioned in some respects, it offers some refreshing angles and its own tactical elements. So I'd certainly recommend it to those who enjoy a good RPG, with some tactical elements.

The first thing I noticed is that this also crosses into the good old Indiana Jones, with a set of very atmospheric art works. The non-combat phases of the game are actually much more like an adventure/RPG, travelling through the desert in a jeep and exploring various paths. This is unlike XCOM, which requires you to build a basic "economy" to generate income.

What I like about Pathway:
+ Fairly intuitive battle (tactics) phase, with familiar dynamics, though a few differences to XCOM (see below).
+ Short, fun battles
+ In addition to low and high cover, there are also walls, which give you complete protection, but also limit your visibility.
+ Hovering the mouse above an enemy shows their attack range, and pressing tab shows how far they can move.
+ I can shoot and THEN move (definitely a plus over XCOM in my eyes).

Of course there are some things that could be improved as well (and hopefully will?):
- A few times I have "misclicked", and there doesn't seem a way to go back - at least I haven't yet figured out if there is a save / load function! I'm getting better at clicking in the right place though...
- The 2D-ish graphics can make it hard to work out the topography (cover, line of sight) of the battlefield. (Though enemies are helpfully highlighted in red if I can hit them, see below).
- I can't see the boundaries of the battlefield, other than by not being able to move there (the red lines in XCOM are helpful).

I'd also like to share some tips, which took me a while to work out (maybe obvious to others?):
-> When moving a character, opponents who are within weapon range of the new location are highlighted in red.
-> While there is no general "overwatch" function, a sniper can ambush, which is the same thing. Really helpful against those pesky attack dogs!
-> If you have no repair kit, changing into a new armour between battles does the trick (switch the depleted armour back after an oasis rest, and have another day's rest to repair the second one, too).

It's not an XCOM clone, but I don't think it's meant to be either. More adventure than strategy; short bursts rather than lengthy missions. Overall, it's a fun little game that I look forward to playing for a fair few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149845228', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1571427705}
review:
Unfortunately, I regret buying this game.
It looks promising at first, but as soon as you get past refund-time you will realize how empty it really is.
On the other hand, the devs seem to be working hard to make this a good game, so I expect to be able to come back here in a few months and change this review to a positive one.

[h1] PROs:[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Nice graphics
    [*] Indiana Jones-like atmosphere
    [*] Decent variety of characters (both allied and enemies) and items
    [*] There's a bit of room to create new strategies when approaching the enemy
[/list]
[h1] CONs:[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Too few sprites for enemies: they are good, but not enough - I'd expect at least some more poses for when they die.
  [*] Too few maps. I played the game for about 10 hours and I already start noticing the maps are always the same.
    [*] Poor sound effects: you'll always hear the same sounds, and that gets boring quickly.
    [*] All adventures are the same: you can barely tweak difficulty and resources - there are random events, but they are extremely limited to the point you can see the same exact event twice in the span of a few movements along the map. Most events have just two or three outcomes, which doesn't help.
    [*] Zero variety during actual combat: kill, go to cover/use perk, repeat. The objective is always the same: kill all enemies on screen. They could have at least implemented some "Escape" or "Interact with this important item" mechanics... it's 2019, not 1996.
    [*] There is absolutely no feeling of progression: you get a better gun which deals more damage? Enemies will be just strong enough to perfectly counter this. Leveling up? Same thing, a level 4 adventurer will still get 40 damage and die when being bitten by a dog.
    [*] Heavy RNG involved. You can easily get a streak of events that force you to lose fuel, then have to choose between going on foot and failing your adventure, or retreat and fail your adventure by doing so.
    [*] The maps are very wide, but empty. You only have a few known events to use as directions, but they are so far apart that it's basically pointless to try any planning.
[/list]

[h1] *** THOU SHALT BE JUDGED ***[/h1]
In my opinion, this game tried being two things: an RPG with a vast world of events and possibilities, and a rogue-lite with simple but intriguing combat. The developers, however, failed perfectly at both things.
The game gets boring quickly, there is no real reason to improve the party, and new armors/weapons don't really matter that much. I suggest they add AT LEAST about one hundred more random events, each with at least five or six possible outcomes depending on party members, and more combat objectives. I'll throw a few suggestions: killing a particular enemy (officers), leaving the map by reaching a vehicle or the border, interacting with an object (by simply reaching it and controlling the spot for a turn or two), defending an area for a few turns from waves of enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983934874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1615468058}
review:
XCOM meets Indy Jones in this suprisingly good game, that  you just want to play. It's rougelite, so you're going to die. On th e other hand dying does not really  hurt much, as the character just need to spend a "day" in hospital to recover. Is could use more variety, and content, but hopefully developers provide that in the updates and/or DLC. 
With a pricetag like that, it's a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023592259', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1571103278}
review:
Después de unas 10 horas de juego y 3 de 5 campañas superadas, puedo decir que estoy totalmente satisfecho con este juego. Sin ser una obra maestra es todo lo que esperaba.  Tiene muchas mecánicas en común con FTL y cualquier juego de estrategia por turnos, aunque por el momento sean algo simples, es bastante divertido las primeras horas.

Quizás el punto más flaco del juego en si es que para la cantidad de contenido que tiene como para hacerlo rejugable (Personajes secretos, loot, logros, etc.), se puede tornar muy repetitivo después de unas cuantas partidas.

A mí en lo personal me viene divirtiendo mucho y seguramente le meta unas cuantas horas más.  Si los desarrolladores le siguen metiendo laburo con actualizaciones, parches e incluso algún que otro DLC con otros mapas como dijeron, tiene potencial para convertirse en un gran juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122011774', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1555637685}
review: Juegazo con un precioso pixel art que me tiene enamorado. Cantidad de eventos y diferentes personajes que desbloquean acciones nuevas en diferentes eventos gracias a sus habilidades. Combate táctico sencillo, pero que a mi por lo menos no me ha llegado a aburrir todavía. Una ambientación muy de Indiana Jones, cosa que me encanta. Muy muy recomendado. La única pega que le pongo es la del idioma. Y aunque el ingles lo entiendo bastante bien, en castellano estaría mil veces mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986246389', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1555441253}
review:
This game is really fun once you understand how it's supposed to work and you unlock some characters.
I think people got it wrong: it's not a XCOM copy, it's a rogue lite which is more based on decision making than tactics.
It's in between "Out There" and "FTL" but in a Indiana Jones setting.

At this price it's a good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111778458', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1570683668}
review:
================新评测====================
今天玩通了一遍，最后就打到了2件紫色衣服 3件金色近战武器（2把神器菜刀几乎一刀切，1把尼泊尔造型）下面修改下评测

游戏中规中矩，轻度roguelike +战棋回合策略（策略轻微）选择路线前进

敌人也比较固定：纳粹 or 邪教  都有1~3等级强度的敌人外形（具体就不说哪些）

游戏设定，AOE技能会误伤友军（敌人也是）

队友有很多选择，刚开始我选的是散弹枪+狙击手（勇气技能狙击可以打断敌人 移动or攻击）
后来刷出了金色菜刀+金色尼泊尔  我认命了 用了红发女汉子 （应该是女的把?!）+船长 

一些TIPS:

选项：有些选项灰暗  需要特定队友 例如我上面说的女汉子  力量！

死亡：在游戏战斗中，队友死亡会有一个回合读条，如果不及时加血就会死亡。队友死亡后，系统会给你一只安慰狗。。是的狗

招募队员：招募队员有3种情况，1打敌人 可加入 ；2 需要500块雇佣；3 需要250（好像是这么多）

资源：游戏中子弹携带是有上限的，油很重要 时刻保持油量，如果耗尽了 还是放弃游戏吧。继续前行会开始扣血。

武器：武器需要有该特性才能装备，手榴弹啊，针线包啊，医疗包啊！

站位：尽量躲在全隐蔽 or 几乎全隐蔽的地方；全隐蔽位置会影响远程武器技能的使用！

注意的敌人：纳粹指挥官（给某一个队友多一次输出）  祭祀（会复活死去的人）  狗（能跑很远）  生化人（有个会自爆的）  邪教徒（有个会远程的很伤，还有个幽灵一样的固定不动 打不打都无所谓 ，技能会命中你的人会不能移动，如果场景只剩下它 会自动结束）

S/L?：强退  再继续游戏能重新开始当前战局，敌人位置也会变化（看个人意愿）

============不足============

游戏节奏很慢很慢，最后一个关卡我打了1小时半。。

武器掉率 还是看脸（虽然我掉了3把金色近战，但是我一把紫色枪都没打出何况金色）

策略性不足，不管伏击 被伏击 都差不多。。

有时候不小心点错 跑错位置不能重来。。

事件重复性高，不同选择结果变化不是很大。

英文不是很懂 希望能尽快更新官中 后面更新能给出些变化
plz Chinese!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045752743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1556876137}
review:
グラフィックに釣られました。
ムービーのとおり、ターン制のRPGっぽいゲームです。
ステージを繰り返し遊ぶタイプで、自キャラのレベル・装備・お金が引継ぎ要素です。
ステージは💀1を何回かと💀2を一回やりました。💀5まであるみたい。
💀１：サクサク進んで40～50分くらい。戦闘とか逃げずに全部やった場合。
💀２：マップが３つあるので💀1の3倍くらいかかる。
後半どんだけ長いのか想像したらこの辺でもういいかなって思いました。

思ってたより成長要素が少なく、繰り返しで強化されるのは微々たるものです。
ローグライクなリセットされる強化要素はほぼ無く、
ランダムイベントでバフが付くくらい。（ランダムでポジティブかネガティブなバフが付きます。

戦闘は慣れるまでは難しかったが、距離感とか裏取りムーブに慣れたあたりで新鮮味が無くなっていきます。
レベルが上がっても、装備が良くなってもずーっと同じです。
全然強くならないなら引き継ぐ意味無いよね。

ストーリーはいいのかもしれないけどほぼ読み飛ばしてるので分からない。
どちらにしろ戦闘のマンネリ化が早く繰り返しプレイするのは疲れる。
あまりおすすめはしないです。日本語化されて半額なら買ってもいいんじゃないかな。


と、ここまで書いてから Our Plans For Pathway て記事読みました。
やっぱストーリー重視で戦闘はカジュアルにしたいみたいですね。
遊べる部分がつまんないのはどうにかして欲しいね。
別にシビアな駆け引きがしたいわけでは無いけど、1面でおなか一杯な戦闘は足枷でしかない。
FTLとかに学んで欲しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019803684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1702419673}
review: Very good game! If the Bitmap Brothers in their heyday would have created a lighthearted turn-based strategy game, the result would be pretty much Pathway :) The graphics and music is wonderful, the combat is fun, and the rewards addictive. You can go back to easier adventures to level up characters and earn items, and even when you loose, the characters will still progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016152260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1555618448}
review:
seeing as other reviews are rather..unfair. lets ballance that:
is it worth the moeny they ask for it? YES.
-is it perfect? NO
-are they working on it? YES!
-Would it be easy enough to make it 600% better with some skill rebalancing and some minor pollish so it might be worth double the price then? HELL YES.

most reviews give this a bad review because they expect a 30 bucks game. but its half that. so adjust expectations.

for the devs: please keep working at this game, it could be so much better with just slightly more ..well blatantly said xcommy-ness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032153758', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1555645070}
review: A "casual strategy" game.  Maybe not the kind you play all weekend, but for an hour at time in between doing laundry, that sort of thing.  I would recommend it for anyone that likes FTL and wants a change of setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006354326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1555054531}
review:
I had high expectations after reading articles leading up to the release of Pathway in which the game was compared to FTL & XCom, two games I've spent hundreds of hours playing. That comparison mixed with the fantastic setting & art style meant I picked up the game on launch.

After playing it though I requested a refund. There's a lot of potential here but the game feels like it's held back at the moment, mostly due to the boring combat. I'll keep an eye on the game to see how it improves but at the moment there's better roguelikes on Steam to invest your time in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092182539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1555378436}
review:
I was hesitant with it having mixed reviews but it's quite fun. Is it worth $16? Maybe not for some people, it feels a little light on the content in my opinion. But I would recommend it to my friends who enjoy tactics games like XCOM and FTL. 

You get to keep all the items you collect, it's sort of how you continue to upgrade your explorers, outside of going directly to shops. Your explorers level up overtime and keep the levels. You can see the enemy movement range and attack range by inspecting them. Honestly, it's really a great little game to pass the time while I wait for the next XCOM, Phoenix Point, or FTL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138603364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1661742886}
review: kinda boring and empty unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998696138', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1555217274}
review: X-Com-lite + Indiana Jones + FTL + Curious Expedition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048498273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1555196270}
review:
I've given it a fair shake, but I'm pretty much done with Pathway unless the devs at Robotality commit to a total overhaul. 

In depth reasons are below but the **TL;DR** is this: The core conceit of Pathway is good, but I'd say there is neither enough content, nor depth to justify the purchase and several poor design decisions cripple the experience. 

First, the good stuff: The idea of doing an Adventure Serial Indiana Jones-like FTL-like is a good concept and I'm glad someone else made an attempt at it. The lo-fi early SNES graphics are nice and bright, and the music (what little of it there is) is good too. It makes a good first impression with its first adventure too. But that's pretty much it.

The biggest flaw is that the core scenario you'll be playing - turn-based tactical battles - are dreadfully shallow and boring. Your characters have far too few options they can perform per turn, and genre standard functionality is relegated to "special ability" status. 

In XCOM for example, every soldier can sprint, hunker down, or prepare an interrupting overwatch attack on the enemy's turn. All of those abilities are present in Pathway, but they cost a resource and are limited entirely to a character's weapon/armor loadout. So only a person with a Sniper Rifle can do an overwatch attack, only a person in heavy armor can hunker down, only a person in light armor can sprint, etc. Combined with the fact that, despite all of the core weapons being firearms, you can't even make an attack outside of a gun's proscribed range, and you have MANY turns where a character can literally do nothing other than stick a thumb up their butt, and you can't really do much with your characters to plan tactically other than put them into defensible positions. This is aggravated by the inability to cancel a move order, which means you can easily misjudge or misclick a move and have a character with a gun who can't even attempt a shot at an enemy because they're one tile outside of a magical range box even though this is not how bullets work. 

Collected, this means the combat portion of the game is incredibly shallow and you've really only got one core strategy - keep your team grouped up, find a semi-defensible corner and double attack one enemy per turn that you can get into range until they're all dead (occasionally using special abilities or grenades to speed the process up). Do this and you'll win every battle in the game no problem. There is no ability to set up counter-attacks, extremely limited ability to set up traps, and little in the way of setting up an active defense - basic swarming will work every time along with some kiting for zombie enemies. 

And as this is the CORE activity in the game, comprising probably 75% plus of what you'll be doing, this is a major problem (oh, and the "next turn" button that ends your *team's* whole turn, rather than being in the right hand corner of your screen as standard in most turn-based games, is in your character's command list instead, which will lead to you losing turns early on until you break your habits). 

But even on the exploration map there are just unfathomably poor choices. Campsites where you can perform a party full-heal, for example, are map locations rather than a resource, so they're both abuseable when you find them, and can spawn in horrible zero utility locations. In my second adventure, two camp sites spawned right at the start and nowhere else on the map, which meant they were completely pointless since you start at full health. There is no risk/reward on this mechanic, just pure RNG, which considering the importance of this kind of mechanic (when do you expend your party wide full-heal on a longer campaign map?) is simply ill-conceived. 

Worse there is no mission variation. Literally every encounter consists of a brief introduction text that presents a small number of options that either win the encounter completely (if you have the appropriate key skill with a character or get a good RNG roll) or you go through some dialogue until you get into a fight, or nothing happens. So far, after over 100 fights, not a single one presented an alternate objective, like "hold this point," "protect this VIP," "plant this bomb" or "survive 10 enemy waves." It's always just a slightly different layout of the battle map and a slightly different layout/amount of enemies. Kill them all and win. There are no dialogue tree encounters with a correct path to success I've found, and the only skills that matter in success/failure are the permanent instant win "personality" skills. There aren't even any multi-battle situations I've encountered (I'm guessing the final mission probably has one, but even adventure/chapter finales don't do this

Character development and progression is poorly thought out too. You have extremely constrained upgrade paths that have you making permanent choices on development (no re-spec is available between adventures) and only consist of extremely incremental stat boosts or unlocking a new weapon/armor type. You won't see much payoff from the increments until a character is mostly or fully leveled and the hard 1 weapon, 1 item limit per character means having more flexibility in terms of equipment usage is mostly useless (other than swapping in undamaged armor between battles). Upgrades to your jeep are also terrible since they're extremely expensive and VERY incremental. Meanwhile, you can't even buy items in preparation for an adventure at all! So once you get comfortable with defeating the weak AI, you're going to start building up a pile of mostly useless cash pretty quickly.

And to top it all off, there is exactly one generalized setting for the game: the MENA desert, and two sets of enemy forces, Nazis and Zombies (called cultists, but actual cultists among these Mobs are rare even when it says you get attacked by a horde of cultists). Combined with the lacking encounter variety, it gets tiresome very quickly, especially since the 2nd adventure is actually rather long at 3 full maps to traverse. By the time you've done adventure 2 you've seen the bulk of the game's content, which is a bit ridiculous considering the premise -even if you only count the good Indy movies, Dr. Jones goes to the South American jungle, Downtown Hong Kong, The Indian wilderness, Venice catacombs, a Germanic Castle and a whole bunch of connecting locations in between fighting Nazis in the desert for the bulk of only Raiders and the last Act of the Last Crusade. The source material they're aping is far more diverse than this.

So all told, I'm really not sure how this came out in this state. The game needs a core redesign on a lot of fundamental aspects, and it needs a LOT more art and content if it's going to be successful at creating the experience it's seemingly wanting to do. If you want to see a similar concept done well, I'm going to have recommend the game Renowned Explorers instead. It's more lighthearted, but it's got far more depth and much more variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996822273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1555801504}
review:
Pathway is a dope game, and an example of how procedural generation can still be engrossing and take direction. The game plays like a less tedious more fluid fire emblem style of combat; but against classic enemies and in a fun and romantic moment in history - WWII North Africa. It is challenging in its needs even in easy mode due to the random factoring of landscape in combat locations. I just enjoy this game a lot, because it learns from the past and has potential moving forward. Lets talk about that.

As it stands, the game does need a little bit more variation and length to really flesh out a full 16 dollar pricepoint - but here is the thing - I need to stand by chucklefish because chucklefish does right by me.  For every dollar I've put into chucklefish, I've gotten 10 hours of gameplay. I simply can't say that for bethesda, or EA, or Ubisoft. When triple A titles fall short with speedy production over and over, this independent game studio gives me gold. I feel the need to play this through while a sixty dollar titles hardly engage me for 30 hours. Therefore, I trust when they say they are listening and will add to this title and support the community for an appropriate amount of time. Cheers, Chucklefish, thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001465023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1615060403}
review:
This game is so much fun. I love nearly every thing about it. The characters, skills, weapons, drops, etc are all engaging. The stories are strictly to the point a lot like the content the game owes a lot to... Indiana Jones. All in all the developer released a product you can tell they are passionate about. 

The difficulty is up there but if you find yourself stuck you can lower it. As you unlock new skills and characters you find you can get through obstacles better.

There is some repetition but the game has tremendous value at this price I think and the repetition was easy for me since i was leveling my characters with the same encounters. 

I am really looking forward to what the developers have in store for future adventures and DLC. This is a fresh fun and exciting new game. Buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070455100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1634525787}
review:
O jogo é muito divertido. Fazia muito tempo que eu não encontrava um game que me desse vontade de passar horas e horas jogando, descobrindo novos lugares, inimigos, melhorando os personagens, ...
Os gráficos em pixel art são excepcionais, a jogabilidade é bem simples e gostosa.
Existem alguns pequenos problemas que, de verdade, não chegam a estragar a experiência e os produtores estão super comprometidos com o jogo e lançando atualizações com melhorias e correções que os jogadores apontam.
Se você curte esse tipo de game com um clima mais inocente de aventura e descobrimento e não é chato pra caralho, super "gamerzinho" você vai gostar desse jogo cara.
E reiterando que o jogo é lindo. Quem curte pixel art vai ficar felizão com o visual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007020675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1554998061}
review:
Нарисовано красиво. И на мой взгляд это единственный плюс.
Игра по геймплею чистейшая мобилка.
Тактика потеряна, враги персонажей видят через стены, в темноте и без проблем знают кто есть кто и ломятся на самого слабого всей толпой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020685126', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1555366143}
review:
I want to give this game a positive review as the only thing that brings the whole thing down is the distinct lack of depth.
Mostly in terms of combat and a characters progression. As far as combat is concerned the developers said this was intentional which is disappointing because in a turn based tactical game the whole experience is underpinned by how tactical you can be on your turns and in pathway: not very.

The time it takes you to plan your moves is very short because there is fundamentally very little you can do. There are no CC components, no stuns, no fancy manoeuvres. You can shoot, move, use a “special action” (usually shoot better), and use one “utility item” heal or grenade, sometimes you also have a take less damage action. Each member of your up to 4 team can take 2 actions per turn. This is usually simply shoot and move occasionally heal I’ve had no need to use a grenade in my total playtime so far.

Due to the lack of positioning skills or CC skills (non of either) combat boils down to which enemy can you alpha strike while taking as little damage as possible making for a rinse and repeat style of combat. It’s a shame because this is exactly the same problem their previous game had too little combat depth and too little meaningful character progression.  
It’s just bizarre because they have chosen a style of game with high entry requirements namely turn based combat. In which people can very reasonably expect some level of planning and thought to take place in order for them to comfortably carry out their turn. They subsequently put together a game that is by all accounts very well made but lacking in depth and then charge a fair price for the game. £12 is a very fair price for what is here.  

The problem is that what is here is kind of a shadow of what could be here and based on the reviews it seems that allot of people where expecting more and im quite confident said people would have been happy to pay more to have gotten more.

Just some ideas that would have added interesting depth off the top of my head:
*destructible cover 
*mines 
*more status effects 
*stealth
*ability to perform ambushes
*higher tier weapons provide additional skills eg, ricochet, knockback, stun, through shot, ignore armour, inflict bleeding, fear effects.
*option to attempt to retreat (not always available for sure) 
*mounted guns 
*additional enemy types daemons for example.
*differnt mission types rather than just kill everything over and over again 
*weapon upgrade system
*different ammo types

Robotality is very good at what they do and they have done a stand up job here all things considered but I don’t think they have taken any risks with this game and consequently it dose just feel a little bland. I really pain over saying these things and you really have offered up the game at a very fair price. But ultimately when the market is oversaturated you do need to take risks. I hope you double down on what you’ve got here because what you’ve got so far is very good, but it still feels like a foundation for an excellent game instead of an excellent game. 

I hope it all comes together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028197194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1619161965}
review:
It's a cool game for it's price. Can provide a few fun hours of gameplay

The downside is it gets old quickly. On the second and third campaigns you realize it's all the same, and you've already unlock max fuel and ammo and (as far as I know) have nothing left to do with your money

Still, nice game for $15

author: {'steamid': '76561198014931470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1608999061}
review:
Das Spiel macht an sich Spaß, ist nett gemacht und ist eigentlich ein guter Zeitvertreib...
Jedoch sind einige Designentscheidungen der Entwickler für mich nicht nachvollziehbar, machen mich verrückt und sind äußerst frustrierend, weshalb ich nach zwei-drei Stunden für mich entschieden habe, dass ich mir das nicht mehr weiter antue bevor ich noch anfange nervtötend für minimale Vorteile zu grinden.
Ich habe zwei screenshots hochgeladen. Auf einem sieht man das Ende eines Zufallsevents nachdem ich die Option mit dem Arzt-skill ausgewählt hatte. Anstatt, dass ich "nichts mehr tun könnte" für das Kamel, hätte ich als Arzt vielleicht herausfinden können, dass das Kamel gar nicht krank war, sondern trächtig ist und ihre Wehen hat. Nachdem ich bei der Geburt geholfen habe, gibt mir der Besitzer aus Dankbarkeit ein Item, Benzin was er eigentlich verkaufen wollte oder zumindest 50$ oder sonstwas. Solche Ereignisse bei denen man einen seiner skills verwenden kann (weil sie erst  überhaupt und *dann* auch noch *passend* auftauchen müssen im event) sind ohnehin schon super selten (stelle ich mir zumindest so vor). Warum sind die dann manchmal total nutzlos?
Das Spiel ist voll von solchen Sachen und nachdem ich nicht schnell genug auf die nur sehr kurz gezeigten Erfolgsbelohnungen geklickt habe und mir klar wurde, dass sie mir verloren gehen falls das passiert... Schluss... hab keinen Bock mehr!

Trotz ziemlich großer Gewissensbisse, ist das Spiel eigentlich okay und kann es gerade so noch weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067969799', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1555255060}

All of this makes the game feel so nice to play, love it <3 + The developers are super nice and works with the community(I'm coming from Linux so that the developers is listening to the community is super important for me)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894575', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1555252743}
review:
[b]This game is just poorly designed; would only recommend for 75% off.[/b]

Pathway gives you an interesting enough start with character choices, a board game type map, and turned based grid combat that will likely push you over your 2 hour grace period. In that time I noticed that the games interface was lacking and functionality child-like but the fact that I could save and comeback mid mission made me stick with it a bit longer.  No aspect of this game is very well designed though the overall game concept could have been very  fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993305060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1555185827}
review: Won the first mission the first time trying . Combat is too simple and easy after you know what to do. I didn't lose anyone during my playtime.  Not really any tactical options during combat and skills are very limited. You may enjoy this game  if you only play 30 mins at the time.  For the price it isn't too bad, but was hoping for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025038000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1580729956}
review: There are a few flaws in the game's present form (the encounters incorrectly appearing multiple times on a  given map, for instance), but this doesn't detract form the charming graphics, cute story moments, and general fun of the game. I will probably hold off on finishing my run until the devs role out a few more of their fixes, but given how resoonsive they are, this shouldn't take long

author: {'steamid': '76561198027153259', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1555858858}
review: Shares a lot of DNA with Renowned Explorers, but doesn't quite rise to the same level of complexity. That said, fans of turn-based tactics and "Raiders of the Lost Ark" may lose a week here. Don't expect much by way of RPG elements apart from experience points and a few unlockable upgrades. Choices within a given mission are very limited. At most you will have four options, usually fewer (e.g. Fight, Attempt to Sneak, Special (depends on party makeup), Withdraw).

author: {'steamid': '76561197964781955', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1555954635}
review:
Pathway ist ein Rundenbasierendes Taktik Spiel ähnlich Xcom mit Indiana Jones der letzte Kreuzzug Flair.
Das Spielprinzip bleibt immer gleich nur die Level werden immer anspruchsvoller. Diese sind zufallsgeneriert und erschaffen so immer ein anderes Erlebnis. Ihr müsst mit euren Resourcen haushalten und euch taktischen Herausforderungen stellen. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad kann individuell angepasst werden z.B. schwächere Gegner oder mehr Resourcen sowie Tag\Nachtmodus.

Die Charaktere haben alle unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten welche auch gelevelt werden können. 

Mir macht das Spiel sehr viel Spaß vor allem durch seinen lustigen Erzählstil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162927702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1652697561}
review: This game is very fun and have played it a lot already though my only complaint is that the zombie/cult battles are just not fun for me. The graphics are very well done and the game is easy to run. I think it’s awesome that you can change the difficulty and I would love more characters and quests in future updates. Overall I give a 8.5/10 and if you are not sure on getting it just do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038160325', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1555353551}
review: It's like FTL with turn based combat. Very great looking style, nice gameplay. I'm really looking forward to the addition of controller support.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966657026', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1570744519}
review:
I bought this game as soon as I read its description : "a mix of X-com and FTL" ? no brainer, take my wallet.


Few hours later... I'm disapointed. Combat is boring, enemies are dumb and repetitive. Nothing even close with X-Com or FTL : options are very limited, you start with two chars, no vehicule customization,  few talents..

Events are also quite repetitive, way less interesting than in FTL.

You have to repeat the same map to level your chars up. 

Game was fun for two hours, I am now already pushing it aside, with some regrets. Lot of potential, so under-developed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967717648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1640058122}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122721506', 'num_games_owned': 1639, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1555222574}
review:
[quote] 加入[url=https://www.2p.com/]2P萤火虫[/url]，和我们一起用热爱点亮游戏之光[/quote]

[h1]冒险与事件[/h1]

《Pathway》是一款像素风格的冒险游戏，玩家可以组建自己的小队去大沙漠荒野之中进行冒险。在选定好队员和目标后，会随机生成一张网格状的地点图，玩家能控制小车在地图之中行进。对于地图中的每一个地点，玩家在经过的时候都会触发这个地点对应的特殊事件，这些千奇百怪的特殊事件是游戏中的最大乐趣。

这些事件之所以有趣，不仅是因为其丰富多彩，更在于玩家有着很多选择。采取不同的策略和方法往往能在同一个事件之中得到截然不同的结果。而这些事件中的选择并不是玩家可以任意选取的，很多方法的选项需要特定的人物特性。在《Pathway》的世界里，每一个小队成员不仅仅是战斗中的一名士兵，更是有着属于自己的背景和性格，而这些背景和性格又决定了他们的行动方式。在发现敌人之后，有的成员会直接的发起攻击，有的成员会小心翼翼地躲开，也有的成员会偷偷摸摸地潜入伏击。

在组建小队之时，不同的小队成员不仅影响了战斗时的实力变化，更影响了冒险过程的策略方针，这使得冒险之旅更有魅力。另外，随着冒险时间的增长，当玩家达成某些成就之后，能解锁更多的人物，而新的人物可能会带来新的选项，这种期待感也是游戏的魅力之一。

由于游戏的最大卖点就在于多变的事件，所以事件的有趣程度与游戏的有趣程度直接相关。目前来看，这款游戏还需要进一步的完善，其主要原因在于事件还不够丰富，随着游玩时间的增长，事件的重复率也会越来越高，因此游戏的魅力也逐渐下降了。除此之外，没有中文也使得中国玩家较难领略到游戏的魅力。

[h1]战斗与数值[/h1]

在冒险过程之中，自然也逃离不开战斗，而《Pathway》的战斗部分只能说的上是勉强合格。游戏采用了回合制战棋的战斗模式，其具体特色十分相似于经典的幽浮（XCOM）系列。在战斗部分，有两个十分关键的设定，那就是掩体和视野。在游戏里，掩体分为半身掩体、全身掩体和墙壁，掩体在远程对射时带给玩家巨大的防御加成，帮助角色躲避敌方的枪械攻击。作为幽浮（XCOM）系列中的经典设计，掩体机制无疑是非常具有策略性的优秀机制。但就我个人而言，我觉得这款游戏在掩体机制上显得有些瑕疵。其主要问题在于射程过短，很多时候枪械的射程是不如角色的移动力的。于是，在玩家能射击到敌人的距离上，敌人甚至可以直接移动到玩家的侧面，从而绕开掩体攻击到玩家。除此之外，虽然也可以采用攻击后移动的方式来避免上述问题，但较小的地图和不太主动的敌人经常会让玩家无法发挥这一策略。

相比于掩体设计，个人觉得视野设计更加出色。在游戏之中，有着非常严格的视野设定，当一名敌人不在小队成员的视野之中时，玩家甚至不能看到这名敌人的具体位置。这种硬核的视野设定为战斗带来了一定的策略性，玩家需要更精细地调整位置来寻觅敌人。当然，这种复杂的视野机制也可能会对休闲玩家造成一定困扰，这点就要看具体需求了。

当然，游戏里的战斗机制本身并没有太大问题，其缺点主要在于变化太少。不同于幽浮（XCOM）系列中的炫酷技能，《Pathway》中角色的升级往往只会影响到一些数值上的变化（比如准确率上升、伤害上升、亦或者是暴击率上升）。这就使得前中后期的战斗过程基本没有变化，只是数值又低到高而已。不仅如此，战斗时地图和敌人的重复率也很高，这就使得玩家容易对重复的战斗过程感到枯燥。而游戏之中的战斗环节是十分频繁的，这就导致玩家会觉得游戏有些无聊了。

最后，再说一下游戏里关于数值的两个机制。一个是继承机制，玩家在冒险过程中收获的经验、装备、物品和金钱都是可以完整继承下来的，即使冒险失败也只是对应的冒险家需要修养而已，所以难度上并不苛刻。另一是平衡机制，在我看来，战斗方面的平衡机制问题不大，但冒险方面的平衡机制稍有问题，其主要原因在于汽油数量。在冒险过程之中，玩家的每一次移动都会消耗一桶汽油，但汽油的获取是一个十分随机的事情，玩家基本不能通过自己的选择影响到汽油的获取（如果是血量低或者子弹少，玩家可以通过减少战斗次数或者在战斗中更加谨慎小心来进行一定程度的调节）。这种完全看运气的平衡很容易因为脸黑而出现问题，个人觉得需要做一定的改善（增加更多可以通过玩家的选择来获取汽油的方法）。

更多游戏推荐请关注[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/17173firefly]2P萤火虫[/url]以及[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31716674]2P萤火虫鉴赏家[/url]

review:
전투 자체가 너무 불합리한거 같음. 

엑스컴2 전투나 애드 뜨는건 ㄹㅇ 합리적이라고 느끼게 해주는 게임.


걍 적 AI들이 개돌뛰어서 플레이어 족치면 그냥 끝나는거 같은데...? 

엑스컴처럼 안전하게 경계하면서 진행하기도 어렵고 (경계는 특정 무기를 들고 포인트를 사용해야 일시적으로 가능)

그렇다고 AI처럼 무작정 개돌뛰기도 애매함.


생각없이 전투를 디자인하면 어떻게 되는지 보여주는 게임.


게임성 자체는 참 좋은데 아쉬움

author: {'steamid': '76561198038309299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1570741236}
review:
indy ! indy ! mayday! mayday!
j'ai des zombis poilus nazis qui veulent me bouffer! et plus une goutte de gazoil dans le reservoir! 

argl! 

bon, ca ressemble plus à une Beta version qu'autre chose, mais il y a du gros potentiel dans ce jeu quand meme.
la direction artistique est au poil musique, son, animation, pixel art ,c'est  zoli tout plein et on sent presque l'odeur des chameaux derrière son dos . très joli traduction française, c'est assez rare pour être souligner. 

mais
mais 
mais 
le gros mais 

 oui , il y a vraiment mieux à faire au niveau tactique. avec des cases etrangement innacessible, et largement l'espace d'implementer un peu de variétés  dans les combats tactiques, qui manque cruellement de sel.. le systême de cover est perfectible, un peu de furtivité ferait pas de mal.  
C'est dommage , parce qu'en l'état , la répétivité des combats casse un peu l'immersion, alors que ça pourrait justement rajouter ce petit truc qui fait qu'on se prend vraiment pour le dr jones. 

pouce en haut, parce que je suis sur que les dev vont nous améliorer tout ça ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198004877053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1587857054}
review:
This game is very fun, albeit taking some time to get used to. By "some time", I mean you're gonna die and fail your first attempts at it, and it's normal.

Basically, this game has some rogue-like (or rogue-lite, I never remember which is which) elements to its progression. You're gonna die, and each time you'll get stronger. You need to find the character combo that works for your kind of strategy, and that probably won't happen on your first run. And then, of course, since events are generated randomly, luck will have its say to your adventure. I had one run where I didn't find any fuel for the car, ran out of gas in the middle of the desert, died because walking in the deserts damages HP and I was already low. Bad luck happens.

But overall, the game is pretty fun. Strategically, once you get the hang of your movements, the enemies movements, and the cover system, it's fairly straightforward. Anything not behind cover has a 100% chance to be hit, so sometimes the best way to eliminate a foe is to bum-rush them and use the knife... But be wary of you cover relative to other enemies when you end your movement. And in most cases, you can chose not to engage in combat at all. Sure, you'll miss this sweet, sweet loot chance, but you'll also save on ammo, medkit and repair kits. It's up to you to weigh your ressources, your will for XP, and your interest in completing the whole adventure vs character progression at the possible cost of the final victory. Or who knows, maybe you'll just win it all.

Story-wise, you have 5 different adventures that form a whole story, and each of them is different as each spot you travel to will be selected randomly from a pool of events. So, while some of them will eventually repeat, it's not all predictable, the resolution depends on who is in your team as each character has their own way to manage a situation (and sometimes no way at all). Some events will have a pure chance result, meaning the same thing may resolve differently depending on RNG.

Basically, this isn't a game you beat in one sitting with pure skill. Strategic skills go a long way, but chance is an integral part of the game. If you can't bear a game where you might do everything right and still lose one attempt because of bad luck, don't play this game. If you enjoy an overall sense of progression over multiple attempts, and experimenting with various strategic combinations, then you're probably going to love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974739210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1563632357}
