author: {'steamid': '76561197995382211', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 3894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1573325957}
review:
For $16, you're paying for outstanding pixel art, and great nostalgia for 1930s pulp adventure (or just Indiana Jones, which was itself aiming at nostalgia for 1930s pulp adventure).  Don't expect much else about the game to knock your socks off.  

Music and flavor text are passable but lackluster.  In a game where 85% of playtime is spent in combat and the rest is a series of text-based scripted events, there's a lot of room for the writing and music to shine - but then they don't.

A large number of characters to unlock might seem to promise good variety and depth of progression, but unfortunately that's not the case.  A good deal of effort and cleverness went into the high-concept design work behind this cast of characters but it doesn't translate into the mechanics of the game.  In that sense, the characters pretty much just amount to rearrangements of the same handful of weapon preferences and auxiliary skills.  Even as they increase in levels, the progression menu mostly consists of very basic upgrades to things like weapon damage or crit chance, or maybe improved armor rating or healing skills.  In other words, there's zero flavor or characterization happening in this pillar of the game.  Another big missed opportunity, especially considering each character can only go up to level 6.  How hard would it have been to inject something more imaginative here?

And then I suppose I should say a word or two about the combat, but again, I don't find too much noteworthy about it.  Other reviewers here on Steam will tell you it's repetitive and lacking in variety.  While that's true, I'm not too sore about the combat in this game.  All things considered, I think it's a fairly competent attempt.  I remember moments of definite enjoyment as well as moments of bitter frustration.  Perhaps if the other pillars of the game offered more, I might recommend the devs just decrease the amount of battles in each campaign to cut down on repetition fatigue.  But I can't say that, because combat is pretty much all this game has going for it, gameplay-wise.

Pathway is long on presentation and style, but short on substance and variety.

You'll notice I recommended this game despite some pretty glaring flaws.  To sum up my reaction:  I'm impressed.  Pathway is ambitious and stylish.  It succeeded in sparking my imagination about how future games might approach this kind of challenge.  To attempt to meld pulp adventure trappings with looter/rogue-lite structural elements and squad tactics combat was a bold move, and I feel the team at Robotality achieved a good degree of success despite a few shortcomings.

base score: 7/10
+.5 for style
+.3 for reasonable price point
+.7 for creative gumption
final score: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100955117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1555025245}
review:
Seems interesting at first glance, but gets repetitive very quickly. The RPG elements are minimal, combat is basic XCOM-lite fare that seems to be a popular go-to option when developers can't think of an interesting system themselves. Besides the theme and artwork, it's not really providing anything unique.

I would suggest a game like Renowned Explorers before picking this up; that does a much better job of what Pathway attempts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032602954', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1555252775}
review: The Jeep is loaded with ammo and petrol. You and your comrade stare into the vast desert knowing that if the nazis or supernatural varmits don't get you running out of gas under the hot sun in the middle of no where will kill you. Its not all bad tho, treasure awaits those you can find it. You will pick up friends along the way as you race against the nazis to find treasure and keep ancient weapons of doom out of their evil hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095920403', 'num_games_owned': 6059, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1555131408}
review:
[quote][url=https://www.gimmgimm.com/]叽咪叽咪，每天都好玩！[/url]
喜欢的话欢迎[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/27162873/]关注叽咪叽咪鉴赏家[/url]

[b]叽咪叽咪，用爱发电[/b]

[h1]前言[/h1]
老实说之前我期待了《pathway》很久。我对于呵呵鱼发行的像素游戏一向颇有好感，从星露谷到starbound再到wargroove，他们从未让人失望过。这次的《pathway》我也是一早就加入了愿望单静待游戏发售。然而实际体验下来，整体表现着实有些一言难尽。

[h1]非常出色的美术风格[/h1]
相信《pathway》第一眼的一定是这出色的美术风格了。从2014年开始开发的本作，在美术上下了大量的功夫，无论是场景上的各种小细节还是剧情时的像素画都非常的精美。尤其值得一提的是光影运用，《pathway》在像素游戏中绝对是属于顶级的那一拨，非常好的烘托出了游戏的整体氛围，展现出了斯皮尔伯格式经典冒险片的种种元素。仅仅是美术风格，《pathway》就足够吸引人去尝试一下。但或许是制作组对于美术雕琢的太久，因此在其他方面就有不少的缺陷了，这也是让我有感到非常遗憾的事情。不过好在游戏本身的框架很好，后续还有扭转的余地。

[h1]游戏难度颇高但可调[/h1]
《pathway》提供了总计五个难度的选择，一上来后续难度是锁定的。但玩家即使是选择默认的简单难度，游戏也并不简单。一方面是跑图资源的限制——跑图比较类似于《Curious Expedition 奇妙探险队》，玩家驾驶着一辆小吉普沿着自定的路线前往旗标终点，每跑一格就会消耗相应的汽油资源，同时会触发相应的事件，有可能获得武器、装备、药品，也有可能损失血量，还有可能触发战斗。另一方面就是上述战斗的难度了，玩家选择默认的简单难度都可能被打成狗，不过好在游戏即使是简单难度中还有调整的空间，玩家可以自主设置怪物的血量等等细节，来选择自己合适的游戏方式。基本上最低档位中玩家就可以感受到“印第安纳·琼斯”一击毙命的爽快感了。

[h1]有些别扭的战斗体验[/h1]
[b]（1）地图和视野表现都很奇怪[/b]
《pathway》的战斗操作应该算是我玩过的最别扭的SRPG了。游戏不支持通过鼠标的移动来查看地图，玩家需要配合WASD键将光标在地图上移动才能实现。在战斗过程中，远距离的敌方单位是没有视野隐藏着的，需要玩家走到近前才能看到。本作并没有战争迷雾这种东西，因此在战斗中就会有很搞笑的表现，比如在敌人向我方靠过来的时候，经常会是隐身→现形→隐身这样的循环，视觉感观上就有些怪怪的。
[b]（2）人物在战斗中同质化严重[/b]
在《pathway》中，每一轮游戏只能选择特定的两个人物出战，所以属于玩家这方面值得研究的策略并不多。战斗角色的差异性并不大，而治疗、修理角色这种基本上不了场——最简单难度中基本以秒敌人为主不需要治疗和修理，而高难度中敌人攻高血厚又像是开了作弊器一样的不断来包围你，治疗、修理这种小脆皮完全没用。一模一样的人物玩上几轮就没意思了，虽然游戏有人物等级和技能树这种设定，但实际体验下来比较鸡肋，对战局影响不是很大。装备系统倒是挺有趣的，但枪械间也比较同质化，二服装提供的护甲也就是额外血条而已。

[h1]重复度较高的游戏过程[/h1]
在体验了《pathway》数小时后，我突然感觉哪里有些不对劲。为什么我碰到的事件都是大同小异差不多的？为什么敌人配置基本上都是几个远程杂兵加上几条狗？为什么地图来来回回就这一张连出生点都不带随机的？种种问题让本作的体验不算好，在商店中的评价也是一路走低来到70%以下的好评率。“重复度高”、“游戏迅速变得无聊”是玩家给与差评的主要理由。确实，在我的体验下来，玩上几轮后就完全没有什么新东西可以体验了，目前版本更像是一个内容偏少的EA版本，作为正式版发售的话是不够的。
另外一点，游戏的养成要素比如提升角色等级和解锁新人物也并不能吸引玩家长时间游玩。比如想要解锁新人物要求颇高——想要解锁他们需要玩家不断的重复刷刷刷的过程，比如消灭多少个敌人这种，但本作的刷刷刷又实在让人感到无聊，这就陷入了死循环，让大部分玩家甚至没有耐心玩到5小时以上就迅速厌烦了。另外由于中文暂未更新，所以在游戏过程中，中国玩家可能还存在语言的障碍，无法自由的享受享受剧情文本的乐趣。

[h1]总结[/h1]
《pathway》的美术风格非常赞，但在战斗上有些别扭，在玩法上也有些不足，重复度较高。玩家在游玩数小时后容易产生厌烦感。不过官方表示已听取玩家意见，会在后续进行内容上的更新，并且游戏很快将支持中文语言，能够无障碍的读懂剧情相信也能够让中国玩家获得更多的乐趣，所以还是值得期待一下本作的未来表现的。
[b]综合评分：7/10[/b]
[b]推荐人群：对像素风热爱的玩家、对重复游戏有较高耐受度的玩家[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007386342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1618744488}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961730993', 'num_games_owned': 1035, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1557432645}
review:
I see a lot of people comparing this to FTL and complaining about how simple this game is.
JUST like FTL, this is a game that you should play while doing other things.

For example, working from home, watching cartoons, watching anything else.

FTL was simple and slow too, but if you sit and stare at it then of course you'll get bored.
This game is fun, and strategic enough.
I'm excited to get a larger party, and vary the weapons around.

I dig it.



tl:dr
this game does not require your full attention, just like FTL.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996220817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1664058830}
review:
Bardzo miła taktyczna turówka z elementami RPG i roguelike. Troszkę podobna do X-COM, troszkę do Jagged Alliance, ale zdecydowanie prostsza i nie wymagająca dużego doświadczenia w tego typu grach - bardziej casualowe podejście do tematu, ale bardzo udane.

Rozgrywka podzielona jest na "przygody" (póki co dostępnych jest 5 przygód), a te podzielone są na losowo wygenerowane mapy z dziesiątkami losowych zdarzeń. Śmierć postaci nie boli za bardzo - powoduje tylko, że postać musi odczekać w "szpitalu" - tzn nie może brać udział w następnej przygodzie. Z czasem postacie zdobywają doświadczenie i rosną w siłę (nawet jeśli próba skończyła się śmiercią całej drużyny, co zdarza się regularnie), a więc kolejne próby są łatwiejsze (ale można podkręcić sobie trudność, jeśli jest za łatwo).

Zarówno oprawa graficzna jak i muzyczna jest bardzo miła dla oka, a losowe zdarzenia opatrzone są "animacjami", które urozmaicają rozgrywkę. 

Świat gry jest kapitalny - trochę pulpy w stylu Indiany Jones'a, trochę elementów nadprzyrodzonych z lekką domieszką Stargate'a, aczkolwiek sama fabuła jest zdawkowa. Obecnie nie pojawia się za dużo gier osadzonych w podobnej scenerii, więc tak czy siak - to trochę odświeżające.

Jeśli ktoś spodziewa się bardzo poważnej i głębokiej strategii, to raczej nie w tym tytule (jeśli ktoś chce, niech potraktuje to jako wadę). Drobnym problemem może być liczba losowych zdarzeń - z czasem zaczynają się powtarzać (choć po 6 godzinach nadal regularnie trafiałem na nowe, których nie widziałem wcześniej).

Może wydawać się, że 5 przygód to za mało, ale niekoniecznie (druga przygoda jest 3-4 razy dłuższa od pierwszej).

Support od twórców gry jest, póki co, kapitalny - codziennie patch poprawiający różne drobne błędy (choć mnie osobiście żaden bug jeszcze nie ugryzł).

Gra na Linuksie działa idealnie :)

[edit]
17 kwietnia developerzy po cichu spatchowali grę - od razu zaczęły mi się pojawiać zdarzenia, których wcześniej nie widziałem :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008597343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1555178510}
review:
You know I was waiting for this game for a while, and it just isn't very good.  There is no depth to the combat which makes all of the events irrelevant.


Great idea, poor execution.  If the combat was engaging there would be a reason to play.  This makes leveling different characters not interesting, which makes progression pointless.  Story is kinda cool and the art is good but I would refund if I was under 2 hours.


Guess its cheaper than a movie (I'll prob have 6-8 non-afk hours by the time I uninstall it) but this game is a hard pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968216056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1556730353}
review:
Excellent roguelike game, beautiful 16-bit graphic style, nice soundtrack, good gameplay. 

It reminds me of FTL, frustrating in the beginning, but so rewarding in the long run. It has a decent learning curve, especially with the combat part.

You need some patience with this game, you will die a lot in the beginning. but in this roguelike you cannot only keep the XP of your squad, but also the equipment in a next game. You will feel stronger and better equipped after a few runs and the scenario(s) get better to handle.

It keeps me coming back for "one more try, maybe with this loadout and those team-members, i could win this scenario" 

I only wish they made games likes these on the old 16-bit computers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992985282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1586426024}
review: Combines the best of Renowned Explorers and FTL with good and quick turn-based battles. It really hits the spot on the light-yet-interesting scale. Not as deep as other games, but the persistence of the characters makes replaying the adventures feel good. So far it feels like very good value for money -- but with a really good artstyle and sound design that does not feel cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964352654', 'num_games_owned': 3110, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1555260322}
review:
This game seems like it would be right up my alley, but I find it more tedious than fun. Character progression feels like a huge grind for very little reward and interesting progression. Oh boy, I got one more agility! I do more damage but it still takes two hits to kill anything! Woopee! The combat system is like XCOM, but I find the enemies and environments repetitive and boring. Loot you find seems like crap 90% of the time.

I actually hate when I have to do combat because it's so boring and takes forever. I really wish there were a way to speed up enemy turns, especially when fighting zombies who come in large hordes but have very uninteresting turns complete with groans that mirror my inner thoughts. Due to line of sight and how far enemies can move, combat takes even longer because you're forced to proceed cautiously and have enemies come to you rather than seeking them out. I'm pretty sure enemies cheat with line of sight as well. They'll come out of no where and seem to have known exactly where you are. You're forced to run away all the time, otherwise cover is useless. Enemies have such large movement ranges they can just move behind you unless you keep them at max movement range (aka run away from them).

There appears to be 5 scenarios to play through. I've only made it to the second so far. I almost beat it but failed on the last mission. The jump in length from the first scenario to the second is huge. The first scenario just has one map you have to traverse through. The second has three. I dread the third through fifth if they keep getting longer and longer.

And that's really the problem with this game. For how simplistic it is, it's too long and tedious to play. The game either needs more depth or they need to cut the grind down, make combat faster, and reduce how long the scenarios are. As it is, your game is overstaying its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173511311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1555246352}
review:
기본적인 게임 소개 영상입니다. https://youtu.be/C1E6rK1f8Eo
첫 스테이지에서 비교적 짧은 볼륨이라 느꼈지만 2번째 스테이지로 넘어가니 생각보다 긴 호흡의 스테이지라 느껴졌습니다.
연료에 제한이 있기때문에 루트를 비교적 잘 짜야하며 도전과제들을 통해 추가캐릭터들을 해금하는 방식도 좋은 것 같습니다.
하지만 전략이 크게 필요한지는 아직 잘 모르겠습니다. 또한 엄폐물들은 생각보다 직관적이지 않아 간혹 잘못 이동하게되는 경우가 발생합니다. 하다못해 이동은 중간에 취소가 가능하거나 했으면 좋겠네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993248610', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1583539895}
review:
If on the fence from reviews jump water is nice. This genre always get the lack of depth crew. Everything can't be FTL and invent a new genre. These games are 16$ the price of a 2hr movie, its not an excuse its a fact. Starting 5th mode now 11 hr in. I've won all my matches on normal besides first mode (died).

Very cool rogue-like here. FLT map with easy mode x-com tactics. I actually really like the easy mode x-com, allows it to lean more towards the resource side of things instead of fights. This game has 5 modes unlocking after you beat the prior, I just beat 2nd mode. It really is a shameless throw back to Indiana Jones and i love it. At 16$ we need to reward people making games like this, at this price. Pick it up you won't waste a single cent if you are a rogue-like fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017208158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1555042601}
review:
Great concept and idea, but can not recommend it currently.
The combat is just not tactical and leveling up doesn't feel like you are getting much stronger.
developer_response:
Hi Fakesmiles,

we added many new features with our current update, e.g. 18 new combat abilities that bring many new aspects and options into the way our battles work. Each character starts with one of these. 

When they level up, characters now gain more combat abilities, providing each one with a distinct combination of abilities and making the level-up process more interesting overall.

We also added many new combat arenas and three new combat modes to provide our battles with more variety.

So if you want to see for yourself how Pathway has improved since the last time you played it, now would be a good opportunity!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056752220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1555326056}
review:

There is COMBAT. Not complex, just tough enough to feel the danger of the ADVENTURE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969216406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1555085780}
review:
I was hoping I would love this FTL-like Nazi killing game. Alas, it just never quite clicks.

The combat is extremely repetitive: you'll see the same 4 or 5 setups over and over again -- even within the same chapter it starts to get samey. The weapons and special abilities never really open up the tactical possibility space the way XCOM 2 does, which means that you'll find yourself playing most combat scenarios in exactly the same way.

There's a bit of story but it sports some fairly uninspiring writing, especially compared to stuff like Cultist Simulator or Sunless Skies, which packs a lot more interesting stuff into a similar narrative form.

It looks beautiful but the intricate pixel art style is sometimes a drawback all its own: it can be easy to overlook enemies or confuse a useless decoration for a bit of cover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284489809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1570943870}
review:
因為喜歡這類美術風格加上拿到折價券就買了
目前玩了近十小時，五個任務裡破了三個，但已經開始感受到遊戲重複性過高的問題

首先大地圖上各個點雖然號稱隨機性高，但結果變化性少，大概不出什麼都沒有、進戰鬥、拿到物品、補血/扣血/buff/debuff等等這幾種
前期我還會看一看事件內容再下決定，後來就懶得看了直接選，反正有看沒看沒差，事件結果用骰的

再來佔遊戲很大比重的戰鬥部分
這遊戲戰鬥最主要概念就是想辦法找掩蔽物躲後面轟敵人這樣而已，可操作的變化很少
而地圖場景雖然各式各樣很豐富，卻幾乎沒有互動性也沒有獨特性(在地下墳墓打殭屍跟在小村莊裡打德軍沒什麼不同)，導致戰鬥打了幾場之後馬上就流程化
然而遊戲設計是你走個幾格幾乎就一定會遇到戰鬥，頻繁的戰鬥配上變化低的系統，作業感立刻就出來了
而且如果是要練角色或是屯補品打後面高難度關，就有需要重複打前面關卡，新鮮感↓ 作業感↑↑

目前來說作為簡單打發時間的小品還可以，但如果開發後續能補上更多的內容才會更值得推薦

author: {'steamid': '76561198016148921', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1555183587}
review: Super enjoyed this game! It doesn't have deep tactics and customizing heroes is pretty slim, but the charm and price made it worth it. The story is very Indiana Jones - it feels like playing a Saturday morning cartoon. Relax, enjoy the ride, and it has something to give you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835444188', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1611439134}
review: I enjoy this game immensely, it's like a very chilled out FTL mixed with a very chilled out Renowned explorers set in the world of Indiana Jones and has the most adorable pixel graphics. Some have complained about a lack of depth in both combat and story, but i think that's a little unfair: The story certainly has more to it than FTL, with multiple campaigns comprised of several episodes each,.. yeah they aren't hyper real or involved, but it just isn't that type of game. Combat-wise it isn't the deepest game but then as the devs have said it isn't meant to be and personally I find the combat fun, relaxing and just right for the kind of game it is... Full X-com style heavy strategic combat as some have unfairly complained it doesn't have would weigh the game down and take too-long in between adventure segments and such criticism is a bit like having a go at FTL for not being a hybrid of Elite Dangerous and Mass effect. The variety of events suffers a little sometimes but devs are addressing that issue as well as others. The music is nice and very Indiana Jones, the game-play is easy to grasp, simple and addictive and the overall package is very slick, very cute and very fun, with lots of rogue-lite unlocks that make the game easier and fun and plenty of secrets to be uncovered. I'd heartily recommend it to fans of FTL and/or Renowned Explorers and to anybody wanting a nice little game that isn't to heavy and intense, but isn't just a casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098517709', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1583000815}
review:
A nice game, that unfortunatly gets a little bit repetitive after a while. It´s easy to get into, you can easily adjust difficulty if you want a more casual experience and the amount of heroes allows for quite a bit of replayablity value. 
Wether you want to pass some time in between bigger games/real life duties or want to spent hours in a fun little adventure game - you won´t be disappointed by this game.
Since the game is still in the early stages of its life span we can expect future updates that add more content and fix some of the issues like the repetitive nature of the game and some pathfinding issues with certain enemies. 
Is it worth the 14€? Yeah I´d say it is, since the game is much larger than you might think, especially if you replay missions in order to see everything the game has to offer. Hopefully some of the games minor issues get fixed and more content will be added in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979954157', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1645548444}
review:
Absolutely brilliant game, no it hasn't got the polish or complexity of xcom, of course it doesn't, its an indie/budget gem!

One thing I will say - I love the music, but it does get tired quickly. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wb-HZypAaAo&list=PL6AA97B1A94ED0128&index=7

This is an indiana jones film playlist, whack it on in the background and turn in game music off - it elevates the game even more! - please someone make a mod to include the music in the game!! If you liked halfway, you have probably bought this game already - if you like xcom and roguelikes - buy this now, after two days solid play im only on chapter 3

author: {'steamid': '76561198035447761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1556550199}
review:
Overall I feel like this has the makings of a good game, but it's not quite there yet. It's enjoyable, but even after 5 hours I can see it getting a little repetitive already. The gameplay is FTL meets XCOM, both of which I love, and I would love to see a good implementation of a mix of the two, but as it stands it's still lacking.

There are some things that I noticed that could use improving:
[list]
[*] First off, the [b]BIG[/b] bug that I noticed: Even when enemies are hidden due to being out of the line-of-sight, you can still tell where they are because the cursor changes when you move over the spot where they're hiding. That's a huge bug, as it makes the fog of war essentially useless if you're within movement range.
[*] Some aspects of combat aren't adequately explained. Explosive barrels aren't mentioned anywhere except for a random tip that pops up on a loading screen. Plus, I still don't understand what determines gun damage. Your weapon gives a range (e.g. 31-37 damage), and I would assume that means that a RNG determines your damage within that range; that's fine. But why then if the range is 31-37, do I sometimes roll something like 24? My impression is that cover only affects hit%, not damage. It makes the game more unpredictable and frustrating if you don't know at least what minimum damage you're going to do if the shot connects. Or if that's the intended behavior, it should be explained somewhere.
[*] This is a tiny polish thing, but often times the pop-up screens take too long to come up. Like for example, at the end of a battle when you kill the last enemy, the screen focuses on your next character as if you still have moves left to make. It's only after a delay that the victory screen comes up. The same problem occurs after returning to the main map, where you start looking around, and only then does the reward screen pop up.
[*] Resting at a camp site only replenishes the armor that you're currently wearing, but you can also repair all of the armor in your jeep storage just by equipping it and resting multiple times. It's a bunch of unnecessary clicks, why not just make resting restore all the armor in your jeep anyway?
[*] [i]Any[/i] time you can see an enemy, you should be able to press TAB to see their move range. Right now it's implemented so that it's only if you can fire on an enemy that you can do that, which doesn't make any sense... usually when I want to see their move range it's because I want to stay far away from them (often outside my own firing range.) Plus, when you mouse over the enemy portraits at the bottom of the screen, the tooltip says "hold tab for move range", but holding tab doesn't actually do anything.

I'm still giving this a positive review, because I think it has potential, but I would like to see the developers further improve upon what they have already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992736140', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1555553269}
review: Pathway felt like an expertly assembled appetizer platter.  The combination of some of my favorite elements from FTL and tactic RPGs is intriguing, and the pixel art is probably the best I have seen in memory.  Perhaps it's due to the fantastic promises and packaging, I found myself wishing for more in-depth story-telling with the amazing animated cutscenes, or more in-depth combat with what felt like the beginning of a really satisfying system.  I hope to see a sequel or content packs that fully push the potential of this delicious set-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022799677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1555108416}
review:
Очень ждал игру, а оказалась просто неинтересная. Карта состоящая из рандомных ивентов и бои. Все. 

Бой -- упрощение xcom'а. при чем, очень дурацкое. Ты можешь за ход 1 раз переместиться на Х квадратов и 1 раз выстрелить. В любом порядке. При чем, нет системы спринтов (когда ты можешь потратить оба действия на очень дальнюю пробежку, но не стрелять). Убежать от кого-то невозможно (т.к. у него тоже в ходе есть ровно столько же бега).

author: {'steamid': '76561198151839964', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1599225405}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198017684401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1557350977}
review:
Bought it for about 10€ (got a small discount because I owned some other game, or just because I'm very handsome, I dunno).

+ Nice looking 2D / pixel art, whether it's characters, items or backgrounds.
+ Good music fitting for the Indiana Jones-esque theme and with folk flair.
+ Obviously gets a bonus if you like pulp adventure like Indiana Jones, the Mummy etc... it's very well in the theme and works fine.
+ Grinding is optional and honestly not particularly frustrating, and super rare loot is as ridiculously strong as it is rare, so that's good.
+ Lots of different characters with different specs. There's a clear tier-list, but there's a lot of choice so you can play differently with every new team.
+ Not a terribly long game but for what it is, its price, and its looks/feel, it's a decent length.
+ Strategic battles akin to a turn-based Commando, or to a certain extent, yes, I'm sorry I'm gonna mention it like a goddamn scrub, XCOM. They work well, get really challenging with time and are partly randomly generated. So ye, cool.
+ You can edit a scenario's difficulties (fuel & ammo ; enemy violence) before starting them, in case you want to challenge yourself more or just go for a more casual run.

- Not that many scenarii, let's be honest (5 levels/worlds, most of them having around 3 sub-levels/parts to them) so you can potentially rush through the game pretty quickly if you're not a completionist.
- Semi-randomized events are cool but you usually just skip them and go directly for their effects after reading them once.
- Rogue-like means randomization, and fuel drops (what you need to advance in a level) are randomized, so it can happen that you're just shit out of luck and can't really move forward anymore.
- There are a few bugs here and there :D
- UI isn't always great in fights. Lines of Sights (especially when covering behind a full wall) are often "difficult to anticipate", if you catch my drift, and the interface to see how far an enemy can move/attack is very primitive and often unusable.

Would recommend. It's a small game for less than 15€, so don't expect something groundbreaking and bugfree.
With some technical issues and a rather poor management of LoS/enemy action visibility, which is somewhat of a pain for tactical players, the game is still very charming with its appearence, flavour text (there's a lot of it), fun pulp-y campaigns (nazis looking for godly artifacts, cultists wanting to revive an evil pharaoh...), music and possibilities, whether it is the cast of 20-ish characters to use, rogue-like level generations, tactical combat and some character customization.

Nice experience, I'm enjoying it. Would recommend. 8/10 too much sand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137515792', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1555278515}
review: In it's current state Pathway lacks the depth and complexity in combat as XCOM and many other comparable turn based strategy games. That being said the look of the game, the deeply engaging worldbuilding and narrative, and the variety of characters and items that the player comes across all serve as viable strong suits that could easily set this game beyond the threshold to become a truly great indie title in the future.
developer_response:
Hi Conmaan,

it took us 6 months of blood, sweat and tears, but three weeks ago we finally released our update 1.1! 

Our main goal was to enhance Pathway‘s combat experience. To achieve this, we added 18 new combat abilities, three different combat modes, and many new battle arenas. We tweaked the enemy AI and added many quality of life features like an option to respec skill trees or an upgrade option for the characters‘ jeep storage.

Our post-update player feedback tells us that players like what we did – but maybe you would like to take a look for yourself to see if we changed Pathway for the better?

author: {'steamid': '76561198090618399', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1560588328}
review:
如果Pathway还在EA兴许还值得一个好评，可是它已经正式发行了，作为小品级像素类indie game卖得还不便宜。
艺术风格确实值得称赞，但那也是Pathway唯一值得称赞的方面了。
机制内容实在是太浅尝辄止了。
以下不打剧透了（但其实最多玩3个小时就能感觉得出来）
可以这么总结：在随机生成路径的地图上随便点一个节点有五种可能：休息点、少量宝藏、战斗、商人、随机事件、什么都没有。
1 全员回复HP AR或者只回复AR 没了
2 从一点点钱、燃料、弹药、最垃圾的武器装备里挑点破烂给你 没了
3 不管你是进了沙漠还是神庙还是敌人埋伏还是埋伏敌人 战斗就是在大概3种敌人中随机生成3-8个分散在地图上随机位置 打完得到2 没了
4 商人随机刷2-3个装备其中2个是破烂 和2-3种补给品 顺带收破烂 爱买不买 没了
5 碰到一个要冒险的事选择去冒险还是绕开（绕开那你还玩什么roguelike?)冒险后某个成员获得一个辣鸡BUFF或者掉血 或者得到2 或者得到3 又或者什么都没有 没了
6 你碰到了一群羊 你碰到了一只秃鹫 你碰到了一群扎着帐篷的当地傻屌 他们和你打了个招呼 没了
装备大概就是有个品质之分 灰白蓝紫不知道有没有橙 每上升一个品质比前一种高2点伤害 或者1点射程 或者1发弹夹容量 或者暴击率  或者几点护甲 没了
哦另外还有招募队友和任务终点 那就是打一个强化版的3 再得到一个强化版的2 没了
这游戏5个任务看上去能打个12个小时但你玩到3个小时之后就不会想看剧情了 也太无聊了
讲真觉得这钱花得很不值但也懒得退款了
不想写了 这评测到这里 没了

author: {'steamid': '76561198197595133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1619887538}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961002812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1555106436}
review:
DISCLAIMER: I gave this game 2 hours of a chance but I was bored 30 minutes in. I kept waiting for the game to get better but it only got worse.

Does Kotaku play the games it reviews? The art is awesome but the game lacks depth. The combat tactics are the same for basically every map. Get behind something and shoot. The variations of this was sometimes you have a knife for melee and sometimes you have grenades. 

The individual scenarios repeat way too often and I noticed it 30 minutes into the game. As in I've played this exact random encounter 3 times already.  The only thing this game does right is the art work.

Did you come to enjoy a great story? There basically is none as each campaign has a short 5 sentence intro. The 1st campaign example *X guy is missing, we better go find him" 

This coulda been a great game but it isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014765526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1555127545}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966768849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1556025223}
review:
Have been looking for a game like this for ages. XCOM-style tactical combat with JRPG-style character stats. It reminds me of RE:IS (Renowned Explorers: International Society), and they share many similarities. I only buy games with positive reviews, so I'm glad I got this hidden gem (with a lot of potential) early. 

That said, I really wish there was more, in-depth content. There are only 5 scenarios which seem pretty similar to each other. There is a charm in its simplicity for combat, but like many reviews have said, it does get old and boring pretty fast. Skill trees are interesting but pretty generic. Randomly generated routes usually discourage you from taking side routes and make you go straight to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972610844', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1984, 'last_played': 1570895441}
review:
For a $15 game, I'm finding the game to be quite enjoyable.  The combat is fairly simplistic right now, but it has enough variety to keep me entertained, and I wasn't really expecting an XCOM level of complexity at that price point.  There is plenty of room for improvement, especially around enemy variety, so we'll see what the devs can come up with.  The overland map play is about what you'd expect if you've ever played FTL.  All in all, it's a fun little game, and I feel comfortable recommending it.

A few suggestions for the devs....

Add some more jeep upgrade options - like a radar for displaying the type of events in adjacent spots on the map to help with route planning.  Or a GPS that would allow you to go back to a previous spot for 1 fuel, etc...

Add a way to buy ammo and fuel in the mission planning phase.  The jeep capacity upgrades are nice, but you never come close to filling them up in a typical run-through.  It also gives you a reason to spend the money you accumulate after missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128013143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1555043758}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978433300', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1555091876}
review: Seems like a cool concept; I love roguelikes that have alternating world map and strategy phases. But quickly became repetitive and too reliant upon RNG. You may or may not get essential items like fuel and medkits and armor repair kits along the way which can end a campaign quickly. This can be tolerated in a roguelike to an extent but due to the lack of variety among the missions and fights and the overworld events, it quickly becomes annoying. Also what is up with the font and why is it so bad? It looks like using an LCD monitor on the wrong resolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998364699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1555103794}
review:
This is not a bad game.  The visuals and combat play look amazing.  
A turn based style game with a bit of an RPG element to it as you go from point A to Point Z.  it's sort of like how you would play FTL, traversing the map going from point to point and encountering the random events.  

It's failing for me was the poor focus on the story.  there wasn't enough there too really draw my attention or keep me interested.  Without a focus to the story, the game felt tedious pointless.  There IS a story, it's a parody to the Indiana Jones movies, using Nazis and undead.  

The characters are pretty straight forward: Each one has a unique ability and flaw.  As well as set traits for using gear and weapons throughout the mission.  They can level up too improve their stats.
But without any story focus there's nothing too keep you interested in either them or the world.  

Overall, wait for discount.  
Not a bad game, but there's not enough there too keep you interested in what's going on.
developer_response:
Hi SavageShark,

we reworked large parts of Pathway with our recent update 1.1.

While we added many new features like for example 18 new combat abilities or a dozen unique artefacts, we also felt that our stories needed more content to make them work well. 

So we added many more story elements to flesh out the plot while travelling overland. We also added many flavor episodes that try to capture the cultural and historical background of the regions visited by the characters. It now should feel different wether you are driving through morrocco or through the nubian stone desert.

All in all, we think that we now tell our stories better than we did back in april. 

Players seem to like what we have done with our recent update. Maybe you find the time to take a look at the changes and tell us what you think?

author: {'steamid': '76561198027509299', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1582820615}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058774598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1555331472}
review:
This is a pixelated X-Com type game mixed with FTL roguelike elements. I love the WWII Middle Eastern/North Africa setting. It really takes me back to Indiana Jones and Casablanca. The music is really good, as well. 

It's not totally a roguelike because you don't do hard restarts. When you fail missions, you keep your character's XP and level ups, along with the equipment left in your jeep, and some money leftover that you can use to help with the next mission (more gas, more ammo, etc.) There's 5 or 6 missions right now. I'm not sure what'll happen at the end or how replayable the game will be. So far it's not too difficult, so I could see the appeal in upping difficulty. 

But for a $15 game, I'm really very happy with it. I'm not even half way done yet, so I'm sure it'll give me 15-20+ hours of gameplay at the least. That might be a turnoff to some who are used to the massive replay value of games like FTL. I don't mind though, I could see going back and upping the difficulty. It's a very simple, easy to put down and pick up, game. That being said, I think if you're looking for a game with more complexity, this probably isn't for you. I like the art and the gameplay well enough, but the combat is pretty repetitive, which is a majority of the complaints. I play it a lot when I'm inbetween other games or waiting for friends to pick a game, so it's just something I do that's much more chill than FTL. But FTL is a superior game by a long shot. 

I'd give it a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195891607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1631731386}
review: This game is definitely in its early stages. i still love it though! its a lot of fun, and interesting. i love the art style, and the majority of the gameplay. some of the major issues i have with it so far are all in combat. i have not ever played Xcom before, but what i can tell, this games combat pales in comparison. also, it kinda bugs me that theres a LOS of your party, but no fog of war. its a little confusing to see the whole map under the same light but many enemies are just invisible. over all, its a fun game and has a lot of potential. i just hope they dont abandon it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168935789', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1585845464}
review: I wish there is an update in the future that gives players an option to change the pixel fonts to normal ones. They just too blurry to read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257491940', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1555696912}
review:
It's a beautiful game with a great soundtrack. The game mechanics and balancing is where it lacks. All you do is click on a map and you go into turn based combat. Repeat this times 100. There is no depth at all. It feels like something that could have been made in a 24h game jam.

I was expecting more of a adventure game with some puzzles and a rich story (with a bit of combat mixed in). In that way I was disappointed, so maybe I just had wrong expectations. After one hour of gameplay I felt fed up, but I did complete the game and I feel I gave it a fair chance.

The sole reason I'll give this a positive rating is for the aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007252808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1555169205}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025500356', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1592822996}
review:
Superficially looks like an amazing, Indiana Jones-themed, more combat focused Renowned Explorer International Society (which is one of my favourite game of all time). Think of it as REIS with cover-based turn-based combat.  Sadly, on further scrutiny, it shows that it's quite shallower than it looks in first glance. And roguelike is one of my favourite genre, but the permanence this game decide to pick rubs in in the wrong way (basically, if you screw in one mission you might get screwed in all further mission). Still, the pulp-fiction theme, visual, and art, is amazing though, so I still recommend it.

This game makes me realise how subtle the difference between a technically competent game and an actually amazing game. I must admit though, for what its worth, the game is quite fun on what it does. Not all games have to be hundred-hours masterpieces.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010122800', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1564975300}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042193043', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1578507400}
review:
As a huge fan of turn based strategy games like Fire Emblem and Final Fantasy Tactics, I was immediately enamored by Pathway.
This game makes no effort to hide its homage to Indiana Jones Raiders of the Lost Ark, and even references it at many opportunities.
If you're a fan of both, don't hesitate to get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069398320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1555158802}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090515719', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1555162200}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197993404402', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1555293712}
review: Looks like a great game on its face, but crumbles once you dive into the actual combat mechanics. Despite being labeled as a strategy RPG, the lack of being able to move twice in a turn or setup overwatch traps for your enemies leaves you with little strategic options. Could've been a great game but sadly is only mediocre at best

author: {'steamid': '76561197968995967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1555689186}
review:
Think FTL-lite meets XCOM-ultralite + Indiana Jones theme. The game is rather simple, so unless you enjoy this particular mix it might get tedious. Personally I enjoy it, but don't expect something grand - I personally play in small sessions of 10 minutes to half an hour.

Way too many dogs die at your hands, so beware if you adore the critters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049944902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1614899017}
review:
Inhalt:
Vorwort
Story/Kontext
Gameplay
Musik/Grafik
Preis/Leistung
Endbewertung

Vorwort:

Ich persönlich genieße Rogue-likes sehr und man könnte sagen, dass wir uns gerade in einer Hochzeit der Rogue-likes befinden. Beinahe alle paar Wochen kommt eins raus und die meisten sind relativ mittelmäßig. Nur ein paar wenige können sich signifikant von den anderen abheben. Slay the Spire durch das core gameplay, Dead cells wegen der Schwierigkeit, Death road to canada druch Humor und so weiter. Für mich ist dieses herausstechende Merkmal am wichtigsten bei Rogue-likes. Mit diesen Worten, beginnen wir nun mit meinem Review für Pathway. 

Story/Kontext:

Wir befinden uns Ende der 30er mitten im Indiana Jones Territorium, sprich Nazis, Untote und okkulte Gegenstände galore. Für Leute, die ein solches Setting genießen, wird dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall den ein oder anderen Nostalgie Kick übrig haben. Das Worldbuilding ist sehr charmant mit Grafiken und Dialogen untermalt, sodass man sich praktisch sofort in die Welt einfühlen kann. Die fortlaufende Story ist, wenn auch nicht sehr originell, mit ein paar Wendungen und Intrigen keinesfalls Langweilig. Man muss sich jedoch auf ein wenig Lese-arbeit einlassen. 

Die Rogue-like Aspekte des Spiels wirken jedoch ein wenig kontraproduktiv im Kontext der Story. Man wird immer wieder im Story Verlauf gestoppt, da man durch den Tod der ganzen Party sein Abenteuer neu starten muss. Und das kann schon öfter mal passieren. 

Alles in allem gebe ich der Story eine solide 6/10. Geschmackvoll umgesetzt, nur hin uns wieder ein wenig zäh, wegen den Rogue-like Elementen.

Gameplay:

Das Herz und die Seele eines jeden Rogue-likes. Und hier muss ich mich jetzt ein wenig den anderen Reviews anschließen, in der Aussage das es nicht das aller tiefste Core-Gameplay zu bieten hat. Es errinert mich Stark an dieses Mario Xcom für Switch. Kingdom Battle war glaub ich der Name. Es spielt sich Praktisch wie ein Xcom light, sprich rundenbasierte Kämpfe, jede Figur kann zwei verschiedene Skills ausführen, einmal Bewegung einmal Angriff. Und von dieser Formel wird nicht all zu viel abgewichen. Die bunten Charaktere, aus welchen man sich am Anfang seine Expeditionsgruppe erstellt, kommen zwar mit ihren eigenen Fähigkeiten und Skills, im Kampf steuern sie sich jedoch relativ gleich. Es geht mehr um das voraussehen der Gegner und Risk-management. Letztendlich jedoch hängt vieles von RNGsus ab. Die Trefferwahrscheinlichkeiten bewegen sich von 15% bis 100%, je nach Deckung. Außerdem spielt da noch die Genauigkeit der Waffe mit rein. Die Details sind aber eigentlich nicht so wichtig, wenn man auf das Micro-Managment seiner Truppe achtet. Es gilt, alle so gut es geht am leben zu erhalten. 

Außerhalb eines Kampfes spielt es sich ähnlich wie Death Road to Canada. Man kann auf einer Karte von Punkt zu Punkt reisen und es finden zufällige Events statt. Manche sind nicht interagierbar, bei manchen gibt es die simple Wahl zwischen Kämpfen und abhauen, manche jedoch haben Talentspezifische Entscheidungen und auch Risk-management. Verfolge ich jetzt die Nazis? Oder berühre ich das glühende Artefakt in der tiefe eines alten Grabes? Und so weiter. Es werden zwar regelmäßig Events recycelt, aber es werden genug "besondere" Events eingestreut das sich so schnell keine Langeweile einstellt. Auf der Reise muss man zum Glück lediglich auf Benzin achten. Kein nerviges Essen und Trinken sammeln und keine Charaktere die einfach verhungern oder so.

Die RPG-Elemente sind sehr light, das höchste der Gefühle ist sich zwischen zwei oder drei Skills einen auszusuchen im Skilltree. Hardcore RPGler werden hier nicht auf ihre Kosten kommen. Alle, die Hardcore RPGs sowieso nicht besonders genießen, werden hier ihren Spaß haben. Kein besonderes Stat-micromanagement oder sonstiges. Die Waffen und Ausrüstungsgegenstände sind auch recht straight forward. Einfach immer die stärkste Auswählen.

Zusammengefasst gebe ich dem Gameplay ebenfalls eine 6/10. Kompetent ausgeführt, hebt sich aber nicht besonders ab. 

Musik/Grafik:

Hier kann das Spiel jetzt mal ein paar Punkte bei mir sammeln. Die Pixel-art ist fantastisch. Alles Szenen sind visuell interessant und auch alle Text-Sequenzen werden von einer Animation begleitet. Die Musik ist ebenfalls sehr stimmig und übermittelt die richtige Atmosphäre. Es gibt zusätzlich wenig zu sagen, außer dass mir die Wasser-Animationen und die Übernachtungs-Sequenz besonders gefallen hat. Das Voice-Acting am Anfang und Ende einer jeden Mission ist auch ein netter Touch. 

Für mich eine klare 8/10. Jeder der Pixel-art verträgt wird sich hieran nicht sattsehen können.

Preis/Leistung:

Hier kommt jetzt der Knackpunkt, woher auch mein Daumen nach Oben kommt. Dieses Spiel kostet lediglich knapp über 10 Euro, bei der Zeit dieses Reviews, und ich habe bereits einige Stunden in Pathway gesteckt. Ich habe auch vor nochmal wenigstens dieselbe Zeit reinzustecken um alles zu erforschen. Und für den Preis eines Kinotickets kann man meiner Meinung nach nicht mehr Verlangen. Ein charmanter, kleine Zeitkiller. 

9/10, für flat 10 Euro gäb's ne 10, aber irgendwie muss man ja überleben.

Endbewertung:

Alles in allem denke ich immer recht positiv wenn ich an Pathway denke. Wenn ich nochmal mein Review lese klingt vieles Recht negativ, aber auch nur sobald man genauer darüber nachdenkt. Pathway hat nun mal das Problem immer mit Titanen des Rogue-like Genres  verglichen zu werden und da stinkt es leider etwas ab. Man sollte aber nicht die grandiose Pixel-art und die charmante Story einfach auslassen. In dieser Hinsicht können wenige Rogue-likes Pathway das Wasser reichen.

Meine Finale Wertung ist eine 7/10. Es gibt schlechtere Finanzielle Entscheidungen die man treffen kann und ich denke jeder der einen 10er übrig hat kann sich dieses Spiel ohne Probleme geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079957148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1555342988}
review:
A casual turn based game for people wanting to do a quick run that doesn't stress you out (Even though sometimes you will fail and die). 

Pros:

- A host of characters that encourage different approaches to gameplay.
- Beautiful art style and OST
- Well executed Oregon Trail-esque resource management.

Cons:

- Characters could be fleshed out more. (More flavour text as you progress for example) 
- AI can be dumb sometimes. 

To me this is a nostalgic game close to being really polished. I see so much potential in it, from the lore and different story paths it can take, to new characters and locations. A few updates will make this a solid game that is well worth the price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046718266', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1555156138}
review:
Слишком однообразно и неинтересно. В сражениях вообще какой-то хаос творится. Это ни разу не XCOM или что-то похожее. Очень примитивно.

Ожидал куда большего. После часа игры становится просто скучно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984779545', 'num_games_owned': 1122, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1570886377}
review:
купил на хайпе от трейлера, и разочаровался

- нету возможности переделать ход (мисклики случаются)
- нету возможность перекачать персонажа (выбрал одному персонажу навык стрельбы енерго оружием, а оно оказалось ОЧЕНЬ плохим оружием)
- нету возможности сделать игру быстрее (причина по которой мне даркест данжен непонравилась)
- сражатся с врагами нету смысла, за бой получаешь вещи на продажу и редко новое оружие, за деньги почти нечего покупать, играть просто не интересно

П.С. прошёл пока 2 миссии, играть буду, но если б была возможность, я б хотел вернуть деньги

author: {'steamid': '76561198000066565', 'num_games_owned': 1413, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1555120145}
review:
[h1] 첫인상과는 다르게 할수록 안타까운 게임[/h1]

친구놈이 그랬습니다. FTL, XCOM, 인디아나 존스를 섞고 도트를 끼얹은 갓겜이 나온다고...
하지만 양파 없는 짜장, 오징어 빠진 짬뽕을 짬짜면 그릇에 담았는데 그릇이 깨진 느낌입니다.

FTL을 기대한 사람, XCOM을 기대한 사람, 인디아나 존스를 기대한 사람 모두 실망할 겁니다.

FTL을 기대한 사람은 기름이 떨어지면 게임을 포기하거나 말라죽는 선택지 앞에서 좌절할 겁니다.

XCOM을 기대한 사람은 적의 단순 무식한 AI와 싸울수록 누적되는 부조리함에 치를 떨 겁니다.

인디아나 존스를 기대한 사람은 반복되는 인카운터와 영어에 좌절하겠죠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052987756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1555259273}
review:
A pretty fun game overall.  I think a lot of the negative reviews are due to players not understanding the combat system which, in my opinion, says more about the fault of the player than the game.  The combat is designed around movement and flanking (as all games of this type should be) while a lot of players seem to just want to sit there with a sniper rifle and take pot shots round after round.

Simple, well-done pixel graphics.  The fights that occur as you move through the world map may seem repetitive to some but I think they're quick enough to not get in the way or become an annoyance, especially since there's enough strategy in them to make you plan and think not just for the best way to win the fight but also about which resources you have to use in the process.  To me, that shows good fundamental, underlying design and the game can only get better as more content and adventures are added.

Tip for new players: hold TAB over enemies you have in your current line of sight.  It shows their movement range and is very important for avoiding being flanked and to deny enemies cover since Nazis will always try to get into cover (as should you!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198000388907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1572050150}
review:
+ Looks great and has character.
- Simple and repetitive.
developer_response:
Hi God_Boy,

before we started work on our current update for Pathway, we listened attentively to what the players‘ feedback told us.

Thus, countering both the game‘s inherent monotony and its lack of complexity became our major goal. With our recent update 1.1 we added many new features and reworked several key gameplay mechanics to achieve just that:

We added 18 new combat abilities, reworked our events and created many more battle arenas. We also added three different battle modes to give combat more variety.

To make the character progression more attractive, we extensively overhauled our skilltrees, reworked our item system and added new unique artefacts.

Our recent player feedback is quite positive. It seems as if we have achieved at least some of our goals. If this sounds interesting to you, feel invited to our new Pathway 1.1!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075754470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1555150872}
review:
I kinda liked this game and played it to the last adventure.
Good looting system and simple roundbased tactical combat and ZOMBIES!:)
Thing is, that this game has gamebreaking bugs.
In the last adventure I occured an offensive battle which I could not finish. I reloaded it 4 times and yet it still crashed in the AI round everytime I try.
developer_response: Hey, we fixed a lot of crashes and technical issues since release. Also, we added many new features recently. If the game still does not work please contact us at "hello@robotality.com" so that we can try to sort out your issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960463271', 'num_games_owned': 1564, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1555150111}
review: Its a competent game with good 2d pixel-art and impressive lighting.  It wears its influences on its sleeve, which is fine.  While it certainly doesn't bring much new to the genre(s) it does them all well.  overall I'd give it a 7 out of 10, a solid, above average turn based strategy RPG game with decent replayablity.  If they add more content later or give us mod tools then i could bump it up to a solid 8/10.  If you're into turn based tactics/RPGs like XCOM or FTL then I can definitely recommend it to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004037069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1555146527}
{'steamid': '76561197988375476', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1555229267}
review:
이틀 정도 플레이해본 결과 일단 재밌습니다.
고전 게임 감성에 슬레이 더 스파이어처럼 가고 싶은 골라서 상황이 랜덤으로 진행되는 방식이라 보시면 됩니다.

장점
1. 로그 라이트: 본인 캐릭터들이 전멸하면 게임이 끝나게 되지만, 획득했던 아이템이나 경험치 등은 유지됩니다. 
2. 난이도 커스터마이징: 에피소드별로 난이도를 커스터마이즈 할 수 있게 되어있습니다. 적들의 능력치를 깎거나 늘릴 수도 있고, 처음 시작할 때 자원량 조절 등을 할 수 있습니다. 
3. 다양한 캐릭터와 아이템: 어찌보면 다양한게 당연한 요소일 수 있지만, 기본 제공되는 6종의 캐릭터 외에 조건을 달성하면 10명의 캐릭터를 추가로 이용할 수 있고, 각 캐릭터마다 스킬 트리 혹은 사용할 수 있는 장비(아이템)가 다릅니다.
4. 자동 저장: 한 에피소드를 천천히 돌면 플레이타임이 적지 않게 걸리는 편인데, 잠깐 하고 꺼도 저장이 돼서 다음에 이어하기 좋은 것 같습니다. 인카운터 도중에 나가도 저장이 되는지는 아직 모르겠지만요.
5. BGM: 주관적이지만 게임 분위기랑 잘 어울리는 것 같네요.


단점
1. 기습 없는 전투: 스토리상 적들이 나를 발견하지 못했다면서 막상 전투에 들어가면 다짜고짜 싸우게 됩니다.
사거리나 범위는 무기마다 정해져 있지만 시야 개념이 없어서 잠복하거나 기습하는 요소가 없어서 다소 반복적인 느낌이 듭니다.
2. 그다지 필요 없는 범위 스킬: 가로 3칸 혹은 전방위 샷건 버스트 등 범위 공격 스킬을 가진 캐릭터들이 몇몇 있는데 전투를 진행하다 보면 생각보다 스킬 범위 안에 적 2명이 들어오는 일이 거의 없습니다. 턴제 게임치고 대부분 많은 칸을 이동할 수 있어서 뭉칠 일이 적은 것 같네요.
3. 한글 지원 X: 어차피 전투가 절반인 게임이라 스토리 진행에 크게 문제가 되진 않습니다만 조금 아쉬운 부분이네요.

아직 많은 플레이는 못해봤지만 제 값은 하는 게임이라고 생각합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121933749', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1559214850}
review: cute art style and setting but game becomes repetitive and i keep seeing the same events multiple times. would of been nice if they added more to this game but can't recommend in the current lacking state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003085966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1555242959}
review:
Coming from someone who has enjoyed and completed 4 of the 5 campaigns:

Fantastic game for those who likes a combination of -
FTL: random event nodes with good story telling and pixel art.
XCOM: similar tactical combat but don't expect to play it the same way - you will need to learn the individual characters and the enemy behaviour.
Indiana Jones: the themes for the 5 campaigns in the game. Each campaign features different maps (some up to 3 maps in a single campaign).

The game certainly has its flaws; events aren't as random as one may expect (though the devs have said its a bug), combat isn't as complex as XCOM and game can be extremely punishing. However this is partly due to the way progression works in the game - unlike other roguelikes you keep the items and money you get for future runs, allowing you to unlock and upgrade your characters through multiple runs and save up for a future run that you want to succeed with. 

The devs are also very communicative so I am looking forward to further changes and content. Price point is decent for what you get.

Definitely worth a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973128352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1555086574}
review: 차후 업데이트가 더 있을지 모르겠지만 현재 느낌은 플레이에 깊이가 생각보다 얕습니다. 각 요소가 기능적으로는 잘 작동하지만 그 표면적인 부분이 전부입니다. 즐긴 시간이 짧지만 더 해봐도 큰 차이는 없을거 같네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000781188', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1555100544}
review:
This game is a well polished roguelike. Had to be tagged as such, it's straight misleading.
Cover system works well ONLY for the enemy. Which is an odd decision to be honest.
In order to move around the map, you need to find gas canisters which is very sparse to come around.
Randomized loot table is poor. Killing 2-3 enemies gives you nothing to fortify your next step (at least at early stages).
No option to safely travel on foot (otherwise your team dies).
Story nodes are repetitive and a bit uninteresting.
Other than these, game looks very promising.
developer_response:
Hi _HGH_,

We recently released a significant free update to Pathway with "Adventurers Wanted". I think quite a few of the issues you had with the game have been addressed in this update.

We've reworked the loot system completely. There are more events and combat has received significant reworks.

Hope you can check it out and give the game another chance :) We'd love to hear what you think!

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561197997673144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1567314503}
review:
I don't hate Pathway, but it feels unfinished. It's sorely lacking in depth and polish. The UI is bad. The AI is bad. Load times are weirdly long for such a simple game. And yes, there are many bugs.

I'm hoping that these issues will eventually be addressed through patches, but this game needed a few more months in the oven. You only have one chance to make a first impression and all that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258036637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1570644741}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065309932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1559972762}
review:
I don’t normally review a game till I have at least 10 hours in the game.  However, that doesn’t seem to be the standard with most of the reviews, and a lot of them seem grossly unfair and ill-informed.  So here are my initial impressions of the game.

If you like rogue like grind/progression in the spirit of FTL, The Curious Expedition, Renowned Explorers, or Lovecrat’s Untold Stories, you’re probably going to enjoy this game quite a bit.  

The options are very customizable, and it seems like many of the negative reviews didn’t bother to open the options menu before complaining about design choices that were just a click away…
The gameplay is challenging but customizable, the pacing and progression is spot on, the RPG elements are interesting without being cumbersome, the music/sound effects match the game well, and the story is engaging as it can be while allowing for randomness that is required in a rogue-like for replay ability.

My only negative comment is that like all rogue-like, the RNG can be a bit well random, and can screw you over even if you didn’t make any mistakes.  However, the game is kinder than most roguelike’s because it lets you keep your character progression, items, and money into the next playthrough, if you didn’t die and just gave up.

Overall, for 15bucks, its very enjoyable, especially if your nostalgic for that old school Indiana Jones via lucas arts setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057350282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1555034467}
review:
Sadly this game is way too basic for my tastes.

I went in thinking this was a FTL/X-Com hybrid. Technically yes it is just that, but unlike those games this is very bland with no real tactical strategy or depth to it's game play at all. I got bored way too fast. I cannot recommend it in it's current state.

AI is a bit dumb sometimes though.

I don't really get why so many don't like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975495440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1610102550}
review:
Aside from the inconvenient bugs that come with a launch & the very, very sus history of this developer plaguing this new title, the actual game itself isn't that good.

It has moments of greatness that ultimately can't hold back the very threshold of this game not being good.

In spite of the game not being good, the dev does a very good job to cater to autistic players. I'm not sure if you, the reader, realizes that there are some very, very special players who can't distinguish between digital, fake dogs and real dogs. Their feeble little minds and fragile bloated hearts just can't simply distinguish between the two and thus we have "Dog Friendly Mode"

This is no joke! If you're offended by dogs being killed in a digital environment, this game IS FOR YOU! I swear to God I can't make this up. Check the patch notes and you'll see it. Or don't, because you really, really shouldn't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054484436', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1652977153}
review:
I'm particularly new to this type of gameplay. My only past experience is with FTL, and that was a lot of fun, this has the same vibe to it. If you're interested in FTL, you'll enjoy this world war 2 FTL-like game. It's really interesting to see how well my runs go, they can go easy peasy, die in the first few levels, or anywhere in the middle.

The combat is great, if a little lack-luster, although Robotality did mention it wasn't a deep combat system, but it's still fun nonetheless. It challenges me to minimize the harm to me, and maximize the damage dealt, but it also makes each mistake a disasterous one.

The variety is a bit lack-luster once you get a couple runs in, but it seems the devs have addressed that, and are working on fixing it, so at the moment, it's not as diverse as it could be. Despite that, it still surprises me every now and then.

Lastly, and the biggest thing I love about this besides the art style, the progression, unlike FTL, each loss results in improvements for each character selected, they earn XP per event, and have their own skill tree. It's great to know that with each loss, I'll only have a better chance at winning rather than just summing it up entirely to RNG and knowledge/experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088468956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1658094568}
review:
玩了快十几个小时来谈谈感受吧
——————————————————
首先感谢Robotality公司带来的这款xcom类游戏，其次这款游戏刚刚发售已经更新了几次热修到了1.0.7可见厂商还是在努力完善游戏的，值得欣慰。（看样子是要每天更下去？）

——————[h1] 【优········点】[/h1]—————
[h1] [b]1.画面与音乐明显是这款像素游戏最大出彩之处。[/b][/h1]
印第安纳琼斯系列主题像素风格，险恶的沙漠+悠扬的上个世纪音乐，
很容易让玩家深陷其中无法自拔。UNITY插件渲染出的光影效果令人大呼完美。

[h1] [b]2.贴心的上手设计，让每个类型的玩家都有自己的选择。[/b][/h1]
游戏在开局前可以拨动☠和۵符号来设定这次旅行的怪物或己方强度。
让对这类游戏有些苦手的玩家有了更多选择，也让想体会刺激的玩家有的挑战的欲望。

[h1][b]3.多样且有趣的事件随机系统。[/b][/h1]
游戏应该是设计了许多随机事件，打散在了路上每一个落脚点上，
并且类似地牢游戏那样每次开局路线和事件随机让探索变得更加未知有趣，
当然这样的设计有利有弊的还有些许的不足之处后面会提到。

[h1][b]4.多样的人物角色，有趣的类跑团似的人物功能设定。[/b][/h1]
这款游戏玩起来有点跑团的意味，每个角色除了不同的战斗性能外还有特色的人物特性。
每个事件如果想要触发更有趣或者意想不到的效果就需要这样的特性。
举个例子：
路上遇到了纳粹的送油车，如果你的队伍里有主角印第安纳琼斯，不对，是那个杰克嗯哼…
就可以选择跳上车追击。
如果你在与纳粹对峙时队伍里有语言大师或者官方学者，就可以交涉让他们交出人质甚至若无其事的通过关卡。
当然这么做有利有弊，可能因此你拿不到物资。

[h1][b]5.有意思的掩体攻击方式[/b][/h1]
也不清楚这算不算优点，这款游戏除了武器概率学以外就是掩体了。
游戏分两种掩体，一种是半封闭墙体和遮挡物，一种是全封闭墙体。
半封闭墙体也分高低性能的，标识是个盾牌图标。
全封闭的是砖头图标。人物躲在后面要射击时候会有特殊的探身动作。
利用好掩体的话可以做到扭转战局。

——————[h1]【缺········点】[/h1]—————
[h1][b]1.令人疑惑的光影和视野设定。[/b][/h1]
我觉得这是这款游戏最匪夷所思的地方。
我知道制作者希望以光影或者视野角度来设定人物发现敌人的可能性。
但是明显做的很微妙。
有时这些敌人明明在灯光下或者就要到玩家面前了还是看不见人影，
而有些明明站着很远地方的敌人却被玩家发现了，
敢情这游戏人物都是远视眼么……

[h1][b]2.石油和弹药设定有些太随机。[/b][/h1]
这个问题在初期尤为致命，即便有时候你小心翼翼规划石油，
还有一定几率会半路没油，导致只能步行或者放弃。
要知道这个游戏里没所谓食粮设定，步行就是直接扣血。
这对物资紧缺的冒险者来说相当致命，被敌人打死也就算了，没汽油就被耗死了这…
当然也可以选择半路撤回。
此外关于[b]开局花1000游戏币加资源上限问题[/b]
这个设定很蛋疼，它是设置你的资源上限也就是你开局要是脸黑你那一千甚至几千就打水漂了
极度不实用。
为什么不是花钱给开局基本资源？

[h1][b]3.随机事件储备似乎没有那么大。[/b][/h1]
毫不夸张的说，这游戏是以随机事件构筑起来的。
但是玩了几遍以后觉得随机事件并没有想象中那么多，
经常遇到重复的。
久而久之就觉得套路被摸清了，那选择啥的就变得机械了。
希望以后能够增加更多事件来解决这个问题，
[b]或者让一样的选择会触发更多不同的效果我觉得玩起来会更有意思[/b]

[h1][b]4.人物技能似乎设计得不太丰富，加点太死板[/b][/h1]
虽然有这么多人物和特性，但是本身加点却蛮单调的。
而且目前不知道是不是我玩的不够精细，貌似人物加点不可逆。
希望能有类似洗点道具，或者开局前选择人物加点的功能吧。

——————[h1]算不上诀窍的诀窍[/h1]——————
因为每次战斗开始敌人布局都不一样，所以遇到敌人分布很猥琐的情况
可以利用退出到标题画面重新读进游戏
也就是重新开始战斗让敌人布局改变做到降低难度的目的
当然这招也可以用在人快死玩了退出重新开始。

——————[h1]想到什么就会继续更新意见[/h1]——————

##希望能够加入一个仓库系统。将每次完成整个冒险后的道具可以储存在里面。
这样不会造成一些物品的浪费。
因为我带了几个角色，这些物品他们不能用，
可要是万一下一局我想换个人用呢？
这就造成了道具浪费的问题。##

##敌人种类似乎有点单一。目前就遇到纳粹头头，医疗兵，喷子兵和狙击兵，就是主角有哪些类型人物，纳粹这里是对应的。僵尸有邪教头头与手下，僵尸定人怪，普通僵尸，僵尸自爆怪 希望有所增加（看了下图鉴，貌似大体上也就这么多敌人了……另外定人的僵尸你不打它打败别的僵尸也能通关，可以节省子弹）##

##地图优势除了掩体就是类似炸药桶的油罐了。不过也觉得有点单一了。既然是个戳穿邪教阴谋的游戏是否可以加入类似献祭瓶，击碎有特殊效果，不靠近就发觉不了的陷阱什么的。
而且敌人似乎很傻，我站在油罐边上都不击碎油罐打击我，这真的是不择手段的党卫兵么…##
————————————————
开发者表示会陆续增加新的内容，期待更多的更新吧。游戏还是蛮好玩的。
但是内容还是觉得太单薄了，期待增加啊。
Thanks for watching
————————————————
半年了，终于更新中文了……还能说啥？吹爆

author: {'steamid': '76561197997948851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1555168105}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008721053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1559954705}
review:
I've been looking for this. A game of exploration, adventure and story. The game play can get repetitive but that's the nature of the genre, if you're not into similar scenarios or replaying the same mission (albeit with different outcomes and branches) then this isn't for you.

What I get out of it is a great game to waste some time. The exploration uses resources, but can pay rewards. Combat is risky, but required to keep moving. The story is good enough to keep me interested. The art is what I've come to expect from Chucklefish, I suppose pleasant is the best word for it. The music sometimes blends nicely into the background, other times moves forward to be heard.

My daughter loves reading the stories for each location. We vote on what to do next as a family. A bit of explaining about what Nazis are to the kids (6 and 5), and cartoony violence if you're not into letting  your kids see that then probably stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023072339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1555183970}
