author: {'steamid': '76561198047225671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1654656060}
review: This is a fun survival & combat game very much in the style of Fallout 1 & 2 with a much better movement interface. One review I read said that it was an Indiana Jones-inspired game, and it absolutely is that. I died once and then succeed on my second try of the first adventure. I'll be back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964159468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1591939600}
review: A bit too simple and repetitive for my liking.  Too few skills, too few tactical options, too few reasons to care about which weapons or characters you're using, too few enemy types, and far too many UI shortcomings for such a simple game.  It doesn't help that it's so similar to much better games like Renowned Explorers, FTL, and XCOM.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980528435', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1697494393}
review:
I've played about 15 hours so far. I'm enjoying myself. It's a little repetitive. I think  they could make the random events a little better or a bit more random. However, if I'm asking myself if it was worth the $16. Yes.

There is a lot of potential for the game to improve over time as well. The base game play is very solid.

My game has crashed two or three times on the same battle so there appear to be some bugs. The game does save fairly often though so I didn't lose progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005073576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1556643663}
review: Enjoyable game.  Fun occult nazi Indiana Jones style setting. Combat is not super complex, but there is enough there to entertain.  Very FTL like progression within the campaign chapters.  I like that character progression is persistent and you aren't punished harshly for total mission failure or character death.  You are punished by RNGesus from time to time, but that's half the fun.  If you never forgot to buy enough ammo 10 spots back, forcing you to bonzai charge through a couple nazi ambushes armed only with fists and one guy with a knife, what are you doing with your life?

author: {'steamid': '76561198047024713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1710113542}
review:
Like a lot of people reviewing this game I was seduced by the elements it promises to bring together, but ultimately found the game lacking in fun. I will happily change my review after some updates if things are improved, but there is some significant improvement that needs to be had. 

Recommendations:
- Combat isn't fun because it isn't sufficiently strategic. Some sneaking elements could be very enjoyable. Perhaps have rifles and shotguns create noise that alerts enemies, while pistols cause less damage but make less noise, and knives make no noise at all, but require melee range.
- Different armor types should have advantages and disadvantages. Why would you ever wear light armor if you could wear heavy armor? Maybe heavy armor adds great defense, but slows your move speed? Maybe light armor soaks less damage but allows you to move quickly and provides an evasion bonus? Maybe different armor weights can add different numbers of additional inventory slots?
- The preset characters aren't especially interesting. Perhaps allow players to create a single custom character they can run through the campaign with, and the others now serve as teammates to that one. Since no story is really told about the preset characters, we don't really care about them. But a character of your own making could be something you grow invested in.
- Leveling up is insufficiently rewarding and the items you can buy at stores or find on enemies do not do enough to help you progress through the game. I found myself skipping combat because earning experience wasn't worth it, and earning money and drops wasn't worth it. Balancing risk and reward in a game is good, but if the risk is never worth the reward then the game isn't worth playing.

I'm excited to see how the game improves going forward. Good luck with future developments guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972068818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1583559344}
review:
Combat is a little simplistic, but the music and art are top notch making the experience more enjoyable with a mixture of random events. The leveling system with its perks is not something I would say is done well.  It seems weird not leveling a stat then picking a perk/distributing skill points. Characters feel less unique and customized. I feel like it would make more sense to take base units and by levelign them create our perfect version of that person. I do have a question about how turns are decided. It always seems like every enemy gets a turn every round while only 1 of my team regardless of the size gets to move?

I give it a 3.5/5 and if the leveling system a long with the combat ai being improved I'd give it a 5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366814025', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1557153092}
review: 死了几次之后，赚了几千块钱，然后到商店收集护甲，针线包，血包，合理利用营地，发现这个游戏简单难度并不难（滑稽）。发现那个白胡子老头猛啊，一刀一个。第二难度能带四个人，过关妥妥的，运气好还能无伤。

author: {'steamid': '76561198014672635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1555046740}
review:
Unfortunately this game lacks depth :(

After the beating the first adventure, I was hoping to find another level of combat or itemization in adventure 2 but sadly there was none to be had. Weapon upgrades are lackluster and sparse, and there is ONE character who can use a medkit early on which means 2/3 of your adventures will be without a healer every time.

Combat abilities are uninteresting albeit a few, such as the shotgun blast, and combat as a whole revolves around baiting the enemy who will run madly at you.

There is a lot to be wanted here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979563122', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1555118853}
review: I'm really enjoying this so far (played about four more hours on partner's account), and I gotta say I'm a little perplexed by the negative reviews some people are posting. I think the game hits a great sweet spot between depth and accessibility - it has a great pulp charm and I love the distinct adventure setup versus one general map in FTL or other games like it. Overall, this is just what I was looking for and I'd really recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038557396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1555132000}
review:
[b]Extremely repetitive.[/b]

[list]
[*]Combat is tedious and a chore, with no planning or thought involved. Enemies target players at random, ignoring wounded people/shooting into heavy cover. It's the main time consumer of the game, and it's all fluff. 
[*]All character talents are linear and boring. Why would I ever choose improved crit damage over hit chance? No flavor.
[*] Boasts replayability, but only has 5 levels. No reason to go back and complete older levels.
[*] No customization. In FTL, you can get different loadouts on your ship with weaponry/upgrades based on your encounters. In this, all upgrades are just flat damage increases. Boring.
[/list]

I usually like to finish my games, but I might not even bother with this one. Disappointing, since the art style/concept/setting looked good. Would refund if I didn't hit the 2 hour mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963910021', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1555012199}
review: Looks good at first but combat is too shallow and very repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025196500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1555157776}
review: "Nazis.  I hate these guys."  The Indiana Jones pixel adventure was a good idea.  The difficulty, permadeath, limited resources, etc. also good.  Unfortunately the game becomes very bland and repetitive within a short while, and I find myself wanting to complete this long quest just for the sake of getting my money's worth rather than because I am enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031704654', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1555644875}
review:
Pathway is quite an interesting game and definitely worth the money. Its like a cross between FTL, XCOM and Indiana Jones, except you're not being chased and you're fighting Nazi's (so a win win).
For me, there are only 3 downsides:
1. The UI feels a bit clunky.
2. In a lot of games pressing escape is used cancel an action like aiming, but not in this game. Pressing escape always opens the menu.
3. The game is a bit slow on an older system.
Other than that, this is a well polished game with interesting mechanics and it feels like it'll be one of those games that I'll come back to play every once in a while. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058537502', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1555050678}
review: I played this game due to really being a fan of renowned explorer another rpg game mixed with chose your own adventure. I was extremely hyped until I played a couple hours of it to only be extremely bored not to mention it gets repetitive fast. Just xcom gameplay slapped with a polish of an interesting idea. Shame they didn't actually put any effort into this was really interested by the idea.﻿

author: {'steamid': '76561198042525243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1555187949}
review: This game is a mix of FTL and XCOM, its got the travel and random events of FTL but the combat of XCOM but much more fast paced and less tactical allowing for quick battle that last less than 10 minutes at the longest allowing for more time spent travelling and encountering random events that while there are many and are varied, carry mystery to what the hell is going on in this desert and what are the Germans doing. Basically its a good game and has replayability and is fun, combined with some good pixel art and you get to kill Nazi's, what more could you want?

author: {'steamid': '76561198142099129', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1555362448}
review:
[h1]“Fortune and glory, kid. Fortune and glory.”[/h1]

As most stated too, the game feels repetitive. From the encounters to the OST, it becomes monotone so quickly, you feel like you have beat the game even if you only finished the second mission. The whole Indiana Jones vibe dies so quickly I think it is faster than Indiana shooting that arabian swordmaster instead of swordfighting him due to diarrhea swarming the filming crew at that time.

The AI is boring. The generation of encounters/events are predictable. I mostly saw no difference when I use adventurer perks instead of a normal choice. Probabilty of hit chance is sometimes so stupid that even if you are facing the Kraut a tile away the chance is below 30% (Cross fingers for XCOM). I would like some bossfights with unique loots. And even for the normal events, the loot should be satisfactory, not some broken plateware with a sum of 80 bucks. To summerize, I simply cannot understand the people naming this game a top notch indie game for arcade strategy. It is not even close to a great game. Yet. 

Despite all the negativity, you now wonder why is this a thumbs up. It's simply because it has huge potential. From the musics to the enemy types and equpiment used, even the randomness of the events can be adjusted and I know they will be since it is Chcuklefish behind all this. Honestly, I like the game despite all the lacking content towards it simply because I like the overall theme. Hence, if you have the little money and like indie games with easy-learn mechanics and turn-based strategy, I would recommened or rather want you to invest this little game for the devs so that they can make this rough gem a diamond.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995082126', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1555104611}
review:
I was extremely excited for this title. I love the Indiana Jones theme, I love XCOM-like combat, and I love FTL. Honestly, it would have been fine if perhaps 1/3 of those were lacking, but really the only thing this game has going is its theme.

The combat is bland, repetitive, and simply not engaging enough to warrant sitting through the uninspired writing that the random events present. Most overworld events are boring and unforgettable.

It genuinely pains me to have to get a refund for this game; the premise was so promising, but the execution simply failed to deliver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026269677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1647362944}
review:
Спасибо вам за эту игру, ребята. И за Halfway тоже.))) Эта игра навеяла мне воспоминания о тех днях, когда я пересматривал Индиану Джонса раз за разом. 
   Я не вижу недостатков в этой игре, если честно. Не знаю... видимо я не эксперт. Единственное... может немного ускорить анимацию полёта пули и сделать события немного "поглубже",  в больше этапов и с разным результатом.
   А в целом - всё великолепно. Если и дальше будете её шлифовать и добавлять, то я буду играть в неё вечно. Успехов вам !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059404987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1581975192}
review:
I dont get all these bad comments... for fucking 14€ i got so much more fun during my first 7 hours than from a lot of AAA titles...  Will i continue playing? - Yes! Will i play hundreds of hours? -probably not.
But for fucking 14 bucks you get so much more fun than from 4 beers for the same price... :D

This game is not super deep, or super hard, or super balanced but it simply is fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121261963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1555003384}
review:
If you are expecting an FTL-style game, something like Renowned Explorers or The Curious Expedition... then keep looking. Pathway is not it.

Pathway is fine. It's not bad. But it's something closer to X-Com lite than to most Roguelites. It's an RPG game, in the classical "Final Fantasy Tactics" sense. Combat is fine, movement is interesting and cover works. You get nifty abilities and stuff. Not the deepest ever, but it was enough for me. Everything outside the combat itself was just too plain too keep me hooked. I expected a Roguelike experience and this wasn't it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159426787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1555355608}
review: I bought this game when it came out so i can record it and i have to say i love this game. I have never played a game like this and I love it. If you like Indiana Jones you will like this game. 100% Recommend you play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005154483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1571721979}
review:
If X-Com had ever received a GBA port, I suspect it would've played like Pathway. 

The Pixel art is fantastic, Robotality should certainly be commended for this and the soundtrack; all of it gives a very "Pulp Era" adventure feel that you'd have to have a heart of freakin' stone to not find even a little bit charming.

The actual turn base combat isn't very deep--you can take that as good or bad and that's going to be up to personal opinions.  Coming from the very first X-Com to the remake, Battle Brothers and Final Fantasy Tactics, I hadn't expected too much depth in that department but honestly, it functions well enough to be entertaining (and very often times frustrating).

My biggest critique comes down to some of the map design--while the pixel art is a treat to look at, some of it get's a little muddled in the indoor areas and you really need to make sure you pay attention to your mouse cursor when selecting your positions because if it just "looks like" cover, it probably isn't. 

The events are enjoyable though some repeat a bit in the beginning I did find in the second campaign I was receiving more variety.  This isn't a game meant to be played out in a "long war" style though, so keep that in mind when you sit down with it. 

Overall, for what I got and paid, I'm quite pleased with this.  I hope it does well enough to warrant an expansion of some sorts cause I would love to see this go to other places!  Combating blood Gods in South America, A Yeti filled expedition in Napal, the possibilities are really endless!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006575324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1580580152}
review:
Pathway is charming and has a lot of good ideas, but stumbles in its execution.

The vast majority of the game is spent in turn-based tactical combat. This is a major selling point for me, I adore turn based tactical combat. I'm particularly fond of seeing that format translated to unorthodox settings so an Indiana Jones turn based tactical game makes my heart sing.

But here's the rub, the combat isn't very fun. There are only a few enemy types and they don't really force you to change your strategy at all. In a few hours of playing every engagement has been the same strategy - pick an enemy, have all your guys shoot at him till he's dead, then move onto the next one.

Turn based tactics games need really varied abilities and equipment to be interesting. Disables, control effects, specialized damage, ETC. This game has a lot of items that let you do damage in different shapes, but most of the time you just move and shoot. That's a fine backbone, but it really starts to get old after a few hours.

Similarly, while the game advertises over 400 events, in just a few hours I'm seeing repeats all the time. There isn't really that sense of something new around the corner.

I'm gonna put a little more time into Pathway because I love its concept, but its a shallow game which makes it impossible to recommend for $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968076117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1597969075}
review:
Also nach dem spielen von zwei Missionen kann ich die Frustrierung nicht nachvollziehen die bei einigen aufkommt. 
Das Spiel läuft einwandfrei ohne Abstürze und Fehler und sonstige Macken auf meinem Rechner. 
Es ist ein knuddelig angehauchtes Retro-Spiel das ein witziges Konzept hat. 
Allerdings muss man sagen das man diese Art von Spiel mögen muss. 
Stetig von neuem immer die selben Missionen spielen .... um sich zu steigern im Level und um bessere Komponenten zu bekommen um weiter voran zu kommen im Spiel .... das muss man schon mögen. 
Wem das Prinzip Spaß bringt ist bei dem Preis in meinen Augen nicht schlecht bedient. 
Wobei für meinen Geschmack auch 9,99 Euro angebrachter gewesen wären. 
Dennoch sehe ich hier keinen Grund für einen Verriss des Spiels. 
Für mich ist es ein klarer Daumen hoch oder ... alternativ ... gar kein Review machen. 
Aber Daumen runter kann ich nicht nachvollziehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016026827', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1555093604}
review:
[b]5/10[/b] (v 1.0.4)
[b][i]"Not an expedition for the curious."[/i][/b]
Pathway is a rogue-like adventure game with some few rpg elements and a heavy focus on (simple!) turn based combat. I can't agree with the (maybe very young) people that say this is like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/212680/FTL_Faster_Than_Light/]FTL[/url] & [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/200510/XCOM_Enemy_Unknown/]X-COM[/url]. It has some simplistic features of both of them - yes, but it doesn't get anywhere near them! Also you don't explore caves or catacombs with traps & treassure by yourself, but that's what [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710568756]Indiana Jones[/url] is all about. The region maps as well as the combat areas are small and only a lil' bit "procedural" generated. And there are only 5 relatively short (1-2 hrs) non-connected [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710551102]adventures[/url] in total. At least you can choose [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710561644]16 adventureres[/url] (10 unlockable) with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710560549]different skills[/url], where 2 or more build up your team. I really had the hopes that Pathway would be an improved version of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/358130/Curious_Expedition/][b]The Curious Expedition[/b][/url], with improved visuals, more gameplay and character bonding - but it isn't! If the content, variety, depth and gameplay [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/546430/announcements/detail/3463740364506628095]improves[/url] I'll give it another chance.

[u]Pros:[/u]
+ very good narrator
+ good controls
+ good sound
+ good pixel visuals
+ okay gameplay
+ 4K optimized/compatible 

[u]Cons:[/u]
- too simple
- feels repetetive
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710582254]small map size[/url]
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710558722]no real exploring[/url]
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710551102]5 short adventures[/url] 
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710558295]small combat areas[/url]
- missing atmosphere
- no character bonding
- no real urge to explore
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710559710]management is too simple[/url]
- missing amount of content
- missing complexity & depth
- [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1710552510]narrator speaks only 5 texts[/url]
- no steam workshop

[u]Verdict:[/u]
Stay/Go with [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/358130/Curious_Expedition/]The Curious Expedition[/url]! =>[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/weeddrunken/recommended/358130]review[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198066367884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1644164221}
review: I really like this game. Its pretty much an Indiana Jones themed FTL, where the encounters are turn based tactics battles. The art is amazing, and the gameplay is satisfyingly difficult. If you like turn based tactics or rogue likes you'll probably enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319159178', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1555260731}
review:
게임적으로 설명하면 FTL+엑스컴

어떤 느낌이냐고 물으신다면 인디아나 존스 나찌 버전이라고 말하고 싶습니다

맵이동은fTL과 완전 유사하게 한칸씩 진행할 때마다 연료가 줄어들고 랜덤하게 이벤트가 발생됩니다 

전투는 엑스컴 방식처럼 턴제이고 감나빗 확률이 있는데 

에이아이가 생각보다 좋진 않습니다 은엄폐해서 쏘는것보다 개돌을 좋아하는 친구들이 많아요 

FTL 엑스컴 두 갓겜이 적당히 열화버전으로 섞여있다고 생각하시면 됩니다

언어의 압박이 많으니 한글화를 기다려보시는 것도 좋은 선택이 되겠습니다 

그래도 요즘처럼 턴제게임이 메마른 시기에 참 좋은 게임이네요

author: {'steamid': '76561198019230891', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1555028275}
review:
While Pathway has succeeded in creating a beautiful world, I feel like the ball was dropped when it came to creating an enjoyable turn based strategy experience. Check out a more complete review here, or continue reading:

https://youtu.be/Ifj8svtHAcU

Basically, Pathway boasts a rogue-lite level of replay-ability through randomly generated worlds and stories. However, it doesn't take more than a play-through or two to begin encountering repeating stories and even repeating encounters.

For the first hour or two, the game was actually great, combat was interesting and there were a lot of strategies and approaches to learn about. Largely because there isn't a tutorial, you have to read everything in your codex. This isn't really a negative, it's just atypical.

The negatives come with the lack of diversity in combat. There are only a handful of variations on enemies, and since battles seem to be largely randomly generated as well, the difficulty curve is lacking.

When I look at a turn based strategy game, I want battles to challenge me, I want to know that there is an approach, or a variety of approaches that I can come up with to get through a specific mission. Pathways RNG approach to turn-based combat removes the ability to create engaging, challenging and enjoyable battles.

By the time I made it to the third adventure, I felt like every fight was a carbon copy of the previous fight. 

In its current state, I can't recommend Pathway. It's possible that balancing could be improved, battle generation could be improved, and more content could be added. The game COULD be good, there are just a lot of kinks to work out in the current state of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049084805', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1556806152}
review:
Esta muy bien, me gusta el concepto de runs que tiene cada aventura, que puedas ir subiendo de nivel los personajes y el combate sin ser complejo es divertido y tiene su dificultad. Además el pixel art esta de 10. Me está gustando mucho, y por el precio me parece excelente. 

Si te llama la atención dale una oportunidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962318911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1555381671}
review: Delivers exactly what you would expect of an indie FTL/XCOM fusion.  Great theme, charming graphics, very clear-cut combat/strategy system, perfect price-point.  Love it!

review: Biran evvel starbound tarzında oyunlar görmek istiyoruz ChuckleFish.Her ne kadar 400+ event olsada bir süre sonra kendini tekrara bağlıyor Hoş ChuckleFish bünyesine sağlam oyunlar barındırırdı ama bu olmamış malesef Android oyunları gibi olmuş Bi elmaslarımız eksik okadar :)) Ha..Nintendo içinde çıkacak bu oyun HandHell  için uygun olur.WarGrove oyunu da bunun gibi şişirme oyunlardan biri Bu da balon olup uçtu gitti.Eleştiri olmazsa Başarı olmaz Arkadaş Sen terraria'ya Starbound la çelme takmış firmasın ve üsrüne de koymusun yetmemiş Bir dev olan StarDevValley le efsanere imza atmışsın Ben Bu şekilde birbirine benzeyen oyunları sevmiyor ve desteklemiyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132626983', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 3292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1701019885}
review: Après trois mois, j'ai racheté le jeu de nouveau, le concept me plaisait  malgré ma première évaluation négative, et je pense ne pas avoir pris le temps de vraiment l'essayer et de me plonger dans l'histoire, j'aimais bien l'ambiance, les nazis, la recherche de trésors, l'aventure, je reviens donc sur cette première évaluation ayant compris beaucoup mieux le fonctionnement, c'est bon petit jeu d'aventure, sans prise de tête que je recommande,  la seule chose que je peux regretter c'est les temps de chargement et de surtout bien réfléchir à son itinéraire avec le carburant ++++ du pétrole s'il vous plait.......

author: {'steamid': '76561198063224643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1555009068}
review: I bought this game but then refunded it. The UI is quite terrible. There are no mouse-over hints. In battle you are told a certain move will cost you 2 bravery points. But I couldn't find / work out how many I actually had. Basic UI controls like using the mouse wheel to scroll, pressing Esc to back out of a menu, didn't work. The whole thing was pretty unintuitive. And for a game that depends on UI so heavily I just couldn't keep playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259141342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1685953933}
review:
[spoiler] Found a dog friend, she is amazing, I love her more than my human character. Second mission, dies horribly in a zombie explosion, :'(	[/spoiler]

For anyone wondering I think it's true that the combat is simple while still enjoyable, still wish they add more stuff combat wise like more enemies and/or gameplay in the future.

The map and random event are so far amazing. Been playing around five hours now and not even once I felt like they needed more, also a lot of them have a different branching if you have certain character.

The way character lvl up is nice cuz you get to build they're trees in subsequent games.

The way you win stuff for achieve certain thing seems tombe nice also, make the game easier the couple first time your playing.

So much more ... It's maybe early to say anything but this game have a very good start in my mind to be a amazing game, I would say it's "just" really good right know tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984636376', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1555018289}
review: I wanted to like this game. Graphics are pretty cool, music is okay, but the gameplay is extremely shallow. After completing one story I didn't feel like playing it ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028955300', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1555087124}
review:
I absolutely adore theese kind of games but smack some jam on my buttcheeks and call me a cupcake if this is not the most boring shit I played in the last 2-3 years.

The gameplay gets repetitive FAST.
You quickly realize the the best weapons are shotguns and knives, gameplay becomes trivial. I found myself just running next to enemies and attacking in pretty much every battle encounter.
And oh boy is there a lot of those encounters. Its basically 80% of your playtime.
My favourite thing in theese games is having a team member have a perk which will let me have a special option in some random dialogue window, which will give me some pogchamp rewards, but everytime the rewards are garbage, not even once did I feel hyped when getting items, the loot system feels stale and unrewarding.

the art is nice though, the music is too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028032209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1555086010}
review:
ได้เวลารีวิว หลักจากตอนแรกกะรีฟัน แต่พอเล่นไปสักพักติดยาวเฉย

เกมนี้เป็นแนว rouge-like ที่ตอนแรกดูเหมือนระบบต่อสู้จะคล้าย xcom นะ แต่ไปๆมาๆก็ไม่ใช่ซะทีเดียว

PATHWAY เป็นเกม turn based RPG Rouge-Like

ซึ่งตีมเรื่องเราจะอยู่ในช่วง สงครามโลกครั้งที่2ณตะวันออกกลางซึ่งเราจะเป็นนักสำรวจที่มาหานสมบัติ ซึ่งให้นึกถึงอินเดียน่าโจนส์นั่นแหละ
แต่เราจะไม่ได้เล่นแค่ตัวละครเดียวจะมีตัวครหลากเหลายให้เลือกซึ่งแต่ละตัวจะมีความสามารถที่แตกต่างกันไป

พูดถึงการนำเสนอ ไม่คิดว่าเกม rouge-like จะสามารถทำให้เราอินได้กับการไปเจออีเว้นอะไรตามทางที่สุ่มมาได้ ซึ่งเกมส่วนใหญ่เราจะข้ามๆไม่ค่อยอ่านเท่าไหร่ แต่พอเกมนี้ การเล่าเรื่องของแต่ละอีเว้นที่เราเจอมันน่าสนใจ และมีทางเลือกให้เราได้เลือกว่าจะไปต่อหรือพอแค่นั้นซึ่งก็อยู่ที่เราว่าจะยอมเสี่ยงมั้ย ซึ่งมันก็เหมือนเกม rouge-like ทั่วไปนั่นแหละ แต่อย่างที่เราบอกตอนมันเล่าเรื่องในอีเว้นนั่้นแหละที่มันทำให้น่าสนใจและลุ้นตาม ตัวละครบางตัวสามารถผ่านอีเว้นนั้นได้โดยไม่เสียเลือดเนื้ออะไรเลยก็มี อย่างเช่นบารอนที่เป็นคนเยรมัน ซึ่งบางครั้งเค้าจะเค้าไปตีเนียนกับเหล่าทหารนาซีทำให้เราไม่ต้องต่อสู้เลย
มาถึงเรื่องเกมเพย์ ตัวเกมจะให้เราเดินทางเป็นจุดๆไปซึ่งการเดินทางแต่ละจุดต้องใช้น้ำมันในการเดินทาง ถ้าหมดก็ซวย ไปต่อได้นะ แต่ลำบากแน่นอน ในการเดินทางไปแต่ละจุดเราสามารถกลับมาจุดที่เคยผ่านไปได้ด้วย แต่ก็มีข้อจำกัดเรื่องน้ำมันนี่แหละ ซึ่งบางทีเราก็ต้องวางแผนการเดินทางกันดีๆ

เรื่องการต่อสู้ เกมจะเป็น turn based คล้ายๆ xcom มีความคล้ายมากเพราะมีระบบที่กำบังที่มีผลต่อการโดนยิงของเราและศัตรูด้วย เรื่องAI ศัตรูตอนใกล้ตายบางที่เค้าจะหนีไปหลบด้วยยิ่งถ้าเล่นไปหลังๆจะมีการโอบล้อมเรา เรียกว่าค่อนข้างฉลาดเลยทีเดียว

โดยรวมเป็เกมที่ฆ่าเวลาได้ดีมากเกมหนึ่ง และมีความยากเรื่องจัดการทรัพยากรในระดับหนึ่ง มีอีเว้นที่น่าสนใจ ถึงตอนนี้จะยังไม่เยอะเท่าไหร่ก็เถอะใครที่อยากลองหา rouge-like อะไรใหม่ๆก็ลองซื้อกันได้ราคาก็โอเคอยู่

author: {'steamid': '76561198142337499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1555180551}
review:
画面和音乐都十分出色，也容易上手的像素风游戏。
但是打完第二章节我觉得好累啊，走最短路线都打了三小时。。战斗重复度略有点高，而且调敌人血量为最低到最后都有点应付不来。第三章节刚开始就有点吃不消了，收集到的武器和护甲质量太低。
比较新颖的是人物等级，道具和金钱是一直继承下去的，这使得全部章节更像是连起来的一个完整的故事，所以讲道理刷刷刷最后肯定可以通关，已经感觉有点肝疼。
（ps：武器命中概率真的玄学，可以气死人，最好要尽快了解概率和掩体的关系）
（pps：英语看得也好累）

author: {'steamid': '76561198367522879', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1556802848}
review: Chucklefish è sempre una garanzia, questi editori negli ultimi anni hanno proposto capolavori Indie sviluppati da diversi Team come Starbound, Stardew Valley e Wargroove per citarne alcuni e anche con questo Pathway sembrano aver fatto centro, gioco di strategia turn based\rpg in stile pixelloso che dalle prime battute sembra molto ben realizzato, certo non aspettatevi la profondità di un X-Com o simile ma si lascia giocare veramente bene, unica pecca è che al momento manca la localizzazione in italiano ma si sa che prima o poi qualche buon samaritano o gli stessi sviluppatori provvederanno a far uscire la traduzione. 14 Euro è probabilmente il prezzo giusto per questo ennesimo gioiellino indie, per chi è affezionato a i vecchi e cari pixel è da avere in libreria, Chucklefish continua imperterrita la sua marcia proponendo giochi Indie ai massimi livelli, buon game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010773876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1555075716}
review: 简单试了一下，游戏感觉需要一点策略，但是策略性并不是太强，主要就是考虑走位输出的问题。优点在于规则简单，地图生成还算让人想探索。问题也有不少，如键鼠操作时候视角切换很麻烦，没有操作预览对新手根本无法知道在哪里能够用什么能力，也没有全图观察难以找到合适的站位。只能说应该能是个好游戏，如果游戏内容足够且进一步优化玩家回合的操作的话。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027297781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1586995149}
review:
Edit: I'm actually pleased to be writing this: the developers have made a significant number of improvements to the game. Combat feels a little bit more varied because of skills and weapon enhancements, the random events are more varied (and I actually get to use skills from time to time), and there's some lore and backstory. This actually feels like the game I wanted. I'm hoping they keep going, because they have a good platform here.

I'm genuinely on the fence with this game. I've had fun playing it so far, but I'm only on the third campaign and I'm already starting to feel like I've most of the game and what it can throw at me. I'm a sucker for pulp adventures in general, as well as anything where I can shoot Nazis, so on the one hand I'm drawn to it, but on the other hand I'm aware that my enjoyment of the setting also likely blinds me to gameplay issues.

What works with this game? The art. It's nice and retro-looking, which works doubly well if you consider that a lot of 1930s pulp adventure was written in the '80s. The music isn't bad, and the character variety seems nice. Combat is fun and easy to jump into, and requires a balance of risk-taking in order to quickly off enemies as well as strategy to keep from being overwhelmed. The battles are dynamic and snappy, which makes them fun in the short-term. I like most of the music, too.

The story is light, to be honest, though I wouldn't say by itself it's any lighter than FTL: if you just pay attention to the main scripted events in that game, the story is pretty paper-thin. I did feel like I uncovered more in FTL though by paying attention to the random dialogue and narrative as I just bounced from node to node in that game. In Pathway, I haven't really seen that kind of background exposition that slowly fleshes out and enriches the game world. Maybe I missed it, but even your characters are missing interesting bios: they get about ten words describing who they are, and that's it. It would have been worth having fewer characters if you felt like there was more difference between them. 

It also takes these very interesting and exotic locales...and does nothing with them. They're backdrops, nothing more. No history, really marginal lore, no meaningful interactions with people living there. And speaking from a cultural perspective, it manages to flatten all of these locales into the same place. It's both culturally insensitive and lazy writing, and I guess it succeeds in evoking earlier culturally insensitive depictions of North and East Africa. I'm not exactly going to congratulate them for that.

In terms of gameplay, the problem is that while the game's combat and characters are good at the start of the game, they don't really scale very much. To compare this game to XCOM, in XCOM your characters get progressively better abilities as the game goes on, and so do the enemies. That creates new tactics to allow combat to unfold differently. That doesn't really happen here. Your characters do level up and increase abilities, but a lot of it is locked behind passive damage increases or movement increases, so your basic combat gameplay doesn't really change (especially because enemies scale, too). There aren't the kinds of environmental hazards you had in FTL that might change up gameplay, either. Nor are there a wide variety of ways to fight: pistol vs shotgun vs sniper rifle vs assault rifle just isn't different enough to create wide varieties of gameplay, especially when your enemies basically fight the same way that you do. Some of the abilities are flat useless: I've gotten the assault rifle ability lined up once in seventeen hours of gameplay. Don't get me wrong, it can be difficult, and that's a good thing because then combat gets more interesting, or when you're at the tail end of a campaign and low on ammo and you do have to weigh whether ambushing some Germans is worth your time. However, most fights are very, very samey. It's just not varied enough.

One of the game's selling points, like FTL, was that there was supposed to be an incredible amount of variety in every campaign. Superficially, that seems there, but I haven't encountered enough variety in encounters to make that feel true. For one thing, the choices aren't especially meaningful because you aren't sacrificing resources on the chance of gaining more, or even making difficult decisions, because most boil down to "get in another fight." In one encounter, I found a wounded camel and healed it, but I don't think it used any of my painkillers, and I didn't get much for doing so. A lot of the encounters are fights, too, and because combat is pretty repetitive, campaigns don't seem like they'll be *that* different from game to game. It's not like there are side quest chains the way there were in FTL where you not only balanced risk vs reward, but also wild new equipment. There are supposed to be all of these unique and interesting encounters, but I'm having trouble finding them.

Money doesn't feel useful because you can't buy stuff between missions (forcing you to grind the early stuff to stock up on medicine) and the upgrades you can buy for your jeep are marginal. Every now and then you stumble on a merchant carrying advanced gear, but it's both random and infrequent.

And lastly, there isn't a whole lot of gameplay style, either. Your characters have different perks that they can access in certain situations, but they come up somewhat infrequently and don't ever affect combat. So again, in terms of replayability, your campaigns will basically look the same; there isn't a lot of content that's restricted to certain play styles, so the replay value is marginal.

Did I have fun with this game? In bursts, but I'm a sucker for the look and feel of it, and it's worn very thin even for somebody in love with the setting. In terms of genre, it doesn't successfully simplify XCOM and keep the fights interesting, and it doesn't emulate FTL's variety of encounters. Without more depth, I'm not sure I would recommend to other people. Maybe they'll keep adding more features, because the basic engine here works and could be a much deeper game. It's just not quite there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030706547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1555117676}
review:
People have been making the Xcom + FTL comparison and while I think it is valid, the game also sacrifices some depth to get there. The combat feels shallow at first, but does actually have a lot of nuance once you get the hang of it. Your characters are not Rambo and you have to really plan both your distance and paths through combat encounters. 

All in all, I think the game is great and for the price point you're getting a lot. I am someone who has spent hundreds of hours in games like FTL, Battle Brothers, Darkest Dungeon and other challenging rogue-like games, and while Pathway is likely not going to be a title where I crest 100 hours, I am pleased with the game and Robotality is a great team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165224594', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1555070789}

author: {'steamid': '76561198809786248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1587195493}
review:
I got really disappointed straight after getting into combat.  This is totally different from Xcom. I think even 'This is the Police' did far better than Pathway.  The combat is not fun at all. Enemies just run straight toward you and shoot, no matter you're hiding behind obstacles or not. What's worse, you can't kill them with one shot so I all you can do is shoot back and run far away to another obstacle. I had a high expectation on this game and now I found out that all the previews and cut-screens are just a joke.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

After few months of fixes, the game is now pretty interesting and replayable.
I would like to thank the devs for not giving up this game.
The game is now a mixture of RPG, Strategy and Turn-based System.
Even buying the game with full price is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961168784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1555058595}
review:
It looks nice and the idea seems like fun, but it's just shallower than it seems like it should be. The game's five missions consist of a randomly generated graph of mission nodes connected by roads. Some nodes are marked, but usually you don't know what sort of thing will be in a node until you travel to it. Might be flavor text, or a store, or loot, or combat, or another party member. The differentiating factor between missions is how big the map is, the kinds of enemies you fight, and the all-too-sparse mission dialog. The missions themselves don't seem to change between runs (at least mission 1 doesn't, which I've replayed at least 5 times).

Combat is turn based, but unpolished. Unlike X-Com, which stops you if you run into view of a previously unseen enemy, this game will happily let you waste your move running past a baddie to end up in a location where you have no chance of attacking first. Overwatch is restricted to sniper rifles, and the game's UI offers no movement confirmation, making it very easy to accidentally move a character when you were trying to click on someone else.

The game looks nice. The atmosphere is great, but the game is just.. I feel like it needed a lot more time. I'd recommend giving this a pass for 3-6 months and/or picking it up on sale. Let the developers work through the bugs and polish the game so desperately needs. There's a fun game in this, but it feels lacking in content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154621304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1577746573}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960572781', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1555017550}
review:
Quel dommage.

Le jeu avait tout pour être génial. Une DA au top, un univers vraiment intéressant à exploiter, les composantes RPG, la narration... tout ça est vraiment très cool.

Sauf que, le système de combat n'est pas intéressant. Le système de cover ne sert pas à grand chose quand les ennemis peuvent traverser la moitié de la map en un tour de jeu. La stratégie devient alors inexistante... 

J'espère qu'ils tenteront d'améliorer cette partie, je pense qu'un équilibrage est possible et que tout n'est pas perdu, mais en attendant j'ai demandé un refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003462851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1644189041}
review:
Tengo sensaciones encontradas con Pathway: es un buen juego, de eso no hay duda. He jugado poco, pero considero que lo suficiente como para comprobar que hay suficientes eventos aleatorios como para no encontrarse con lo mismo una y otra vez. Los personajes están muy bien definidos y tienen el carisma necesario para sumergirte de lleno en el juego. Aún así mi gran pero radica en el combate. Un combate que se me antoja muy plano y en el que apenas hay margen de error, por lo que tienes que calcular al milímetro lo que tienes que hacer. Da la sensación de que, al querer "casualizarlo" lo han simplificado tanto que, teniendo A y B como opciones tácticas si eliges la incorrecta el juego te castiga de forma inmisericorde. Tal vez tenga esa sensación debido a que aún me encuentro en un momento temprano, pero algo me dice que no mejorará mucho más. Aún así, por el precio y el resto del juego, lo recomiendo. Ojalá lo traduzcan al español, eso si.

Cambio la reseña a negativo porque en 2018 el desarrollador dijo que estaban barajando implementar más idiomas pero nunca más se supo. Pues nada, habemus negativo  y un futuro cliente menos. Y tan amigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073340857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1555036180}
review:
I'm very disappointed with this product and Chucklefish.

The game promises depth and delivers none.
I would have overlooked the awfully simplistic campaign gameplay if the combat was good, but it's not :
TL;DR - Xcom combat with dull abilities, less upgrades and [b]no spotting mechanic[/b].
You travel from point to point on the map and get random generated events the consequences of which are out of your control. Every scenario is a 50/50 gamble whether you get spotted or not or whether or not you get a positive outcome from exploration.
After 3 hours of playing most of the events started repeating.
There's no point in placing your characters behind cover, because the AI would just run around them and shoot them. The only actual strategy you can use is move all of your characters as far back as possible after taking a shot, so the enemies are forced to walk up to them and shoot them while they're in cover, abusing their movement range.
There's no alert mechanic - the enemies are alerted as soon as you start the battle and they're hidden so long as they're not inside any of the characters' view range.

Nothing in this game seems to have any depth and gets boring very quickly.
I can't be bothered to continue and judging by most of the reviews - at best you'll get 10h of playtime before you get bored yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080732257', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1555055700}
review:
[h1] A Wasted Opportunity [/h1]

[b]Summary [/b]
A very beautiful SLG game hindered by poor gameplay design.

[b]Pros[/b]

[b]Graphics[/b] are stunning, needless to say. When you camp the day night cycle is fun to watch. There are little things happening here and there on the world map: smoking coming out chimneys, your team walking off the jeep as a dot, shadows dancing. It's nice to see devs putting a lot of work into making sprites. Last time I saw something like this was Legend of Mana on PS1.

[b]Cons[/b]

[b]Tactical aspect[/b] 
In which there is little to none. It's a jumble of mechanics that were not well thought out before being implemented. Say Hp and Damage. Okay so there are stats on each character, including enemies. Except they don't do anything because all skills just do damage and no other mechanic. There is no crowd control. No buffs/debuffs. This is worsened by the fact that units have massive grid movement. A dog can run across the entire map and attack on the same turn... and so can you. This makes ranged quite useless. And what is point of directional cover (half or full like XCOM), when enemies can walk like 10 grids, jump over the wall, land behind you and shoot you in the butt? The same carelessness in design can be seen in the world map. Ammo and fuel are expended, and if you run out of fuel it pretty much means it's over. There is nothing you can do to gain oil actively, except fight every encounter. The weapon designs are bad. Pistols and knives are the only good ones because they can one-shot something. The AI is bad and only knows how to zerg, or stay completely motionless in fog of war. The point is - The game isn't tactical. I'm not really "playing" it, my decisions mean nothing except pulling my units close to enemies, attack them, move my chess piece closer to the end node. Period.

Many things are nonsensical. Two slot inventory. If you hold a nade you can't hold heals. Armor. Not different to just HP. Sprinting. Comon we already walk like infinite tiles per turn. Rifles and Snipers. Their actives are jokes and both have no difference in damage. DoTs. Bleed, as if walking and stabbing people aren't OP enough. No cancelling walking command. Totally stupid. Brave points. To cast spells but the defensive abilities are OP as heck. Stats. What do they even do. Quirks and its interactions. Totally random. I used "weak against Nazi" dude on the Nazis and I find zero difference. 1000 per +1 fuel/ammo upgrade. The cap isn't the problem 99% of the time, it's going to 0. 

None of this makes any sense. Most of these mechanics could be thrown out of the game without much interference (Maybe even the whole combat system). It might've been better for them to just make an Oregon Trail like game that is text based.

[b]Plot[/b] 
The disappointment on my face when I finally rescued the dude after numerous tries. The story was just a few sentences. See this is the part where, if it was done better, could have saved the game. Say if you made combat a lot easier, but spent considerable time crafting the immersion, the story, and graphics... we would have a visual-novel type game at hand. It will be equally enjoyable. Yet it isn't. Item descriptions are bland and uninteresting, just to be turned into cash. Even surprise events were boring. Doctor heals camel. Okay. What about some descriptive details? How was the camel sick? How did it get "visually better after a short while"? Going through the desert, what kind of scenery are there? Is it miles and miles of scorching sand and mountainous dunes? Our friend, how was he being tortured and what for? What conditions was he being held in? Why are the Nazis so damn polite? There were some writing, but it mainly just pushed you towards the gameplay part of Pathway, which is terrible. On regular difficulty, you're compelled to kill everything along the way for a chance at fuel drops anyway. This is the blue balls feeling of playing a video game, it's got something to start with and nothing to finish you off.

[b]Conclusion[/b]  
Pathway has some of best pixel graphics I've seen, but the gameplay isn't there to justify it. It isn't tactical, it's just unreasonably hard. There is no counterplay to the war of attrition that is going on when you go through the chess board. The combat is yawn-inducing, and so is the story I'm sorry to say. Every game is a triad of graphics - gameplay - story, and this time two were thrown in the ditch. I'm not going to rant about music that stuff's optional.

Skip this one if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067408799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1577318387}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020192691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1555009882}
review:
It's a lovely looking game, but the combat is just... way too boring. And given how big of a portion it is in this type of game, it's just not very fun, it feels like a chore getting into combat to be honest. Even the character skill trees are too basic, it's nothing like X-Com where the abilites you choose are quite unique for each class, here it's basically just some stat modifications.

Get Into The Breach instead if you're looking for a turn based game with smaller encounters that last 5-10 minutes or XCOM if you want bigger battles which can last from 20-60+ minutes. Both are superior in most regards than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978629433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1555041341}
review:
Boring. Bland. Tedious.

Three words I use to describe this turn-based tactics game. As you and your team start out on their adventure, after crossing one, two, three, six, ten, twenty, thirty-five nodes across each meaningless map, you soon find the desert to be a bland and boring place. The main focus of this game--its combat--quickly becomes repetitive ... and beyond that, there is nothing else to do. The events are underwhelming, uninteresting, and irrelevant. And the combat itself has you wishing to exit the game after your fifteenth or twentieth fight. There are no real tactics involved; no strategy; no sense of accomplishment; no challenge or reward. The enemies are predictable, the A.I. stupid and redundant. The actual game play is turn-based tactics at its lowest, most bare-bones form.

When you have games like Shadowrun, Divinity, X-Com, and a personal favorite of mine, Invisible Inc. available to play, I have no idea why you would want to play this game unless you're utterly bored. And even then, this game will lull you in a more disinterested state than when you booted it up for some (in name only) rogue-like "adventure." As I continued plodding into my second hour, I zoned out and imagined playing one of the other titles I listed. Why? Because they are each mountains more entertaining than this paltry little sand dune.

Thanks but no thanks. Refund forthcoming; I'll reserve my almighty $$$ for something more engaging and fulfilling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027885884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1576471880}
review: Amazing. I really liked FTL but the fight mechanics didn't grip me. This game adds fun tactics style combat to FTL with an engaging setting and unique setting. The gear grind is fun and the rogue-lite elements make new starts more promising. I was shocked after the 2nd mission that I still had 3 to go because there was so much content in just that one. Combat isn't too punishing to make you wary of it if you are feeling strong but taking an unneeded fight could easily lose you a character. Almost everything I loved about slay the spire is here in a new setting with more cohesive progression. Beautiful art, writing and music complete the package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965123579', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1615774962}
review:
Everyone is describing this game as FTL meets XCOM, and that is very accurate. If you enjoy either of those games, you should check out this one as well.

This game also does a great job of capturing the feeling of an Indiana Jones film. You've got pulpy adventurers, shoot-outs with Nazis in the desert, exploring lost ruins, and a VERY John Williams-inspired score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1557393503}
review:
[h1]Pathway gives a good first impression, but its flaws are quickly uncovered [/h1]

Pathway is an exploration/turn-based ‘strategy’ game developed by Robotality. Essentially you lead explorers on expeditions across Africa and the Middle East, shooting Nazis (and some less than living foes as well) and collecting loot. Pathway’s gorgeous visual and initial few scenes had me pretty impressed, but it didn’t take long to realize just how shallow this game is.

[h1]Positives: [/h1]
[list][*]The art for Pathway is really fantastic. It seems Chucklefish only publish the best when it comes to the pixel art side of things. The animations aren’t fantastic, but it’s not a huge issue.

[*]There are a wide variety of explorers available, each with positive and negative attributes. You start out with six to choose from and then more are unlocked by doing certain things while you play (such as revive x number of characters). Each character also has their own skill tree, and their xp and skills carry over across expeditions.

[*]Loot also carries over (as long as you don’t die) which means you might find stuff during an expedition that you can use for a specific character on your next one. You’ll occasionally find merchants who you can buy/sell to, of course their prices are significantly inflated. [/list]

[h1]Negatives: [/h1]
[list][*]I’m only on my second expedition, which I haven’t even finished, and the scenarios are already repetitive. There’s one particular scenario I’ve seen three times already, and even if you’re not seeing the same scenario each time, they’re just so painfully similar. I’ve seen several variations of ‘you stumbled across a German, he sped away in his car, do you want to chase him?’ I shouldn’t be seeing this much repetition already, and it makes me concerned that there’s little replay value here. This is really the thing that kills the game for me, it’s just so samey that I’ve already lost my desire to keep playing.

[*]The tactical combat is so shallow. Initially I was quite pleased that it was basically simplified XCOM, but I quickly realized that it’s just too shallow. There’s a basic cover system and all of your explorers have one main weapon and a backup weapon (such as a knife or grenade) or some kind of equipment such as a medkit. You essentially just run between cover and shoot enemies, it never really felt like there was any real strategy to it. The chance to hit an enemy is always 100% if they’re not in cover; trees don’t count as cover; you can never deal enough damage to kill a regular enemy in one turn (you can kill dogs or zombies in one turn though); the AI often makes really stupid decisions such as running away with full health and not attacking; only snipers have overwatch abilities. The combat just isn’t up to scratch and you spend a fairly major chunk of the game in the combat. 

[*]There’s no undo or move confirm option in the combat. I frequently moved my characters during combat entirely by accident, or misclicked and they ended up on the wrong spot and out of range of enemies. There are some good arguments against having an undo button, so at the very least I would have liked it to require two clicks to confirm a movement like you see in XCOM.

[*]I have not found the story compelling at all, in fact I’m not entirely sure what the story is. The first expedition is clearly about rescuing a character, but I guess I missed what the second expedition was about. Either way, the scenarios themselves in game are also pretty lacklustre. The writing is mediocre at best and I never really felt a sense of urgency or danger when deciding what to do like FTL made me feel. 

[*]There are only two adjustments you can make to the difficulty of the game: enemy health/enemy damage output; starting fuel and ammunition. I feel like changing these doesn't make a satisfying difference, I mean I don't think making enemies bullet sponges makes it harder, just more frustrating. [/list]

[h1]Verdict: [/h1]

I was initially impressed by Pathway, but that quickly gave way to disappointment. Shallow gameplay and the repetitive feeling of the game really spoil what could have been. I apologize to those I initially recommend this too. Having played more, I've lost most of my desire to continue with it and I certainly wouldn't recommend buying it.

If you found this review helpful, please consider following my curator page: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33633486/]Kemo's Corner.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000088094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1572746157}
review:
It keeps you interested just long enough to where you go past the point when you've played too long and now you can't return it. I'm four hours in and I'm starting to notice all the games flaws.

It's cute and the theme is great but it just lacks the depth for the price it's selling for.
Sure you could replay levels and grind your way through everything till you beat the game but there's not much strategy or depth here. Lower the price and I'll change my review to a positive.

Edit on 10/22/19 . The game has improved a lot with the updates and patches. Thanks so much. I could easily recommend it now. It's not perfect but it's better, play on normal difficulty the first time and build up . It's good but it could be better. But for the price it's good enough now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001320462', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1555040364}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008685947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1555037938}
review:
I completed the first adventure and did every battle I came across and did as many nodes as I could after that I requested a refund. Why? Because there isnt much too the game. The game is FTL and XCOM merged together with roguelike qualities which would be great if each had depth. Lemme break down my run and how the gameplay works and maybe I'll be alittle clearer.

You start off at adventure 1 and you can select between 6-7 characters with assorted traits, perks and weapon skills and you can see the rest of the character roster and how to unlock them roughly like 10 more characters which sounds nice until you realize there is only around 6 skill check perks and 6-7 weapon skills shared among all the characters. The traits give + or - % damage to X mob type. Ex Qualms -15% to nazi. I selected Jackson and Baron for my run who had daredevil and trickery as their perks respectively. The game opens to a map like FTL where you hop along nodes and an event plays out. The game boasts 400 events which may sound like a lot but it isn't I ran into a repeat in my only run. Some events play off your characters perk and typically give you a favorable outcome. Events for my run were either nothing, a fight, or free loot. Fights in this game are basically a 2d Xcom. Since a fought everything I quickly realized the knife is absurdly strong, at least for the first adventure. I ran around one shotting most enemies. If you take damage you can heal it either with items you pick up or at camps on the adventure map. I reached the end point with 1k in cash and another 1500 in valuables and 15 fuel and I assume plenty of ammo since I didnt use it. 

I get that the first mission is suppose to be super easy so I'm not docking points for it. It took me an hour to do adventure one, but that was me doing literally everything I could. There is only 5 adventures total. Unless each adventure doubles in length your looking at 5-6h playtime if your going slow which is abysmal for an 18$ game. Technically there is "replayablity" with different characters but I'm betting you still have the same last mission in each which leaves your characters only good for the events in between.

There is a roguelike element in keeping the gear you acquired which means little. Your characters can also level up. Character levels only appear to go to 5 and do boring things like bump crit chance with X weapon or increase X stat by 1.

TLDR. The game has all the right elements but each one of them is too shallow to be notable. Not much length to it as well. If you're going to get it, buy it on sale for 7$ or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989680857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1670310633}
review:
The game is not that great. For a tactics rogue game. Already bored in about an hour. Might be because I have done this crap but you can really feel it off the bat. Characters are not interesting and most of them you have to unlock and die or beat the game to play. Weapons are just like characters never been bored and thats more too the loot system and hierarchy and the amount of the same or stuff you get and can't ever equip, and stores don't accomplish much in helping that. Once doing that your will feel the boredom. The A.I trash. The U.I is annoying + the pacing of combat. The mechanics are absolutely horrible for a Tactics RPG especially rogue exploration. Pretentious ass FUEL and the horrible procedural generation. The narrations at the beginning is a giant tease to something that just instantly dulls out, and hell it start to feel browserish.

Best thing this game has is that your blowing Nazis heads off and of course the Pixel art which I feel is Chucklesfish only strength at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004980101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1573957860}
review: Need more strategy, this is too simple

author: {'steamid': '76561197985026520', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1621900766}
review:
Mid Weight strategy with a great Indiana Jones / Action Serial theme. Awesome framework for future patches, plenty of opportunity for the devs to keep the game fresh with regular updates and new encounters!

Even out of the box its quite good now, very much a push your luck type crawl where balancing the danger of encounters against the necessity of rewards and supplies feels really tuned. Make sure you keep an eye on that ammo and buy fuel whenever you can, youre gonna need reserves of both!

The strategic depth of the game is accessible and fun, but is a bit on the shallow side,  though that isnt really a bad thing. Find flanks, make sure you use cover, keep your armor repaired and dont let yourself get rushed, any Xcom vet is going to feel right at home.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984263201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1618878120}
review:
The learning curve is steep. I managed to complete the first adventure after 5 tries, at ~30 minutes per try, needless to say it kept me busy for a couple hours. The visuals are nice but I am a bit disappointed by the lack of animations in the "cutscenes".
Overall, it seems to be worth it's price tag so far. I am enjoying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000764124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1570762558}
review:
Two heroes drive into the desert to save their captured friend.
One dies in battle along the way.
The other gets depressed and doesn't know if he can go on living.
A friendly dog appears and cheers up the surviving hero.
The two continue across the desert.
Upon finding the captured friend a battle ensues, and the second hero dies.
The dog valiantly defeats the remaining enemies and rescues the captured friend.
"Glad to know a man has friends, but what took you so long?" the rescued friend says to the dog.
The two ride off into the sunset.

10/10 would play again

author: {'steamid': '76561198063831608', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1555034876}
review:
Strong pixel-art visuals but overall uninteresting. Tactical gameplay without depth & challenge - you always play first in combat, main (only) mechanic is taking cover, "skill trees" are a joke, IA unsurprisingly is pretty dumb, only difficulty adjusting option is increasing enemy damage and hp, bland weapon choices with common/rare/epic MMO grades ... It gets repetitive very fast. I also really dislike how you don't have access to characters sheets in combat. Combined with the fact that the dmg you're about to make on a specific npc isn't displayed, I found myself confused at the nonlethal damage my character had just done because of a perk. No decision backtracking whatsoever either anywhere to compensate for it.

I at least expected a good atmosphere & immersion but even that is lacking. You go from one spot to another without caring, seeing the same visuals & few events over and over again. Said events don't seem to have any balance either. I've earned twice more from a random basic loot event than from one where I used a perk to get access to a "hard" zombies fight in a tomb (2 fuels and 130$ reward, amazing).

The non-returning point for me is that rapidly, you don't see any reason to bother taking the optional fights. During the last part of the second aventure, I found myself skipping them because I had enough fuel to get to the end and knew I wouldn't get anything worth, useful or necessary from them. For a roguelite this is pretty bad. The decision-making, be it on the map or in combat, is very poor.

The game is cheap but I would still not recommend it, considering the way better alternatives out there.
